entries.title: Alpha
entries.description:
Alpha Is a game which evolves itself as you play it.

The first level is Alpha, a game devoid of art, placeholder graphics and a sea of cornflower blue.

The second level is Beta, simple graphics along with some MS Painted background skills (or lack of).

The final level is Evolution, You must see off the invasion and follow it up by destroying the mothership to save earth.



I did run out of time with it, only a couple of bugs I could find and didn't have time to put in the audio. I also had plans to make it available through a browser using JSIL. I might post a link up later if i can work out this JSIL malarky, just to make the game easier to play (I'd rather play a browser based game than download something and i'm sure you would too).


Hope you guys enjoy it :)

Biovolve is a simple game where you have to evolve your character to overcome certain obstacles.

entries.title: blob
entries.description:
Requires WebGL. Tested with firefox and chrome with HD5850, GTX670, GTX560 and Quadro4000.

The submission (goanna.cs.rmit.edu.au/~pknowles/blob-submit/) had some bugs, which didn't appear on my 660, so I've put together a "post-compo version" which should give an idea of what the game was meant to be.

== The Game ==
You are red. Only red blobs can be moved by you.
The aim: to eat food (green), reproduce and attack blue, becoming the dominant blobs!
Larger red/blue blobs will destroy smaller red/blue blobs.
Eating a green blob will duplicate the eater, with size deviation - evolution :)
You must balance eating and attacking (to cull your smaller blobs), encouraging evolution of larger red blobs.
The game ends when you lose too many blobs or destroy a significant portion of blue blobs.

Sorry to those of you without the hardware to run this. I built the game around my interest in GL shaders. The game itself runs almost entirely on the GPU and can happily handle blobs on the order of one million.

== Controls ==
Left drag to move red blobs. You "draw" force.
Scroll to zoom (not entirely necessary).
Right drag to pan.

== Tech Details ==
Each level is randomized at launch with perlin noise. I compute a signed distance field for collision detection with the level. Blobs move with a fragment shader, writing to a double buffered a floating point texture. Interaction is achieved by additively drawing density, velocity etc on to a texture which other blobs can read (These can be viewed by pressing tilde "~"). I count the number of remaining blobs similarly to mipmapping before reading a very small texture back to the CPU. The blobs are rendered by raycasting a density texture, similarly to parallax mapping, applying transmittance and environment mapping.

entries.title: Defense Of The Space Station Guardian
entries.description:
All work completed by me, of course. Following theme, enemies evolve after checking out the stats of the 'helper' bots spawned around space station in middle. Though not listed, upgrades cost 25 funds each.

[Edit] Sorry for the delay everyone!!!!! Work sucks and took me some time to get back to coding. I've done a bug fix that deals with the 25/5 bug, keeps the spawn rate to at lowest 1 per second, and adjusts the amounts you receive for helper upgrades. I'm going to be doing a deluxe version with the company I work for, Jacob's Ladder Entertainment. I'll keep you guys posted!

entries.title: Evolution Assault
entries.description:
Evolution Assault is a tactics-style game where your units evolve on the field of battle.  Every time your units reach 10 XP, they can choose to level up and get stronger, or evolve into a new unit.  

There is no AI, unfortunately.  The enemy units just sort of stand lifeless as you assault them.  I never wrote an AI before so I focused on what I knew during the 48 hour compo, and ran out of time before I could even attempt any AI instructions.  But you can still attack them (or yourself - a true tactics game never disallows you from killing yourself!) to gain XP.

Unfortunately, I didn't complete data for many of the planned units within the 48 hours, but the game IS "moddable" - you can edit data/Units.xml to add units that will automatically be linked and loaded with the appropriate resources.  Not too hard to figure out if you're actually that motivated.

The game is in a very basic state.  This is my first LD and I DEFINITELY overplanned for how long the code took to get going.  Not to mention I had never worked in this library before!  Lots of fun though, and definitely a good learning experience for next time.

entries.title: LD48 Lavalution
entries.description: Hello, folks! This is my first time entering the Ludum Dare Game Jam, but I think I did faily well (maybe)! I made a survival game where the point is to stay above the sea of lava, using your CPT Force Gun v12. This gun conveniently landed directly next to you after the obscure catastrophe that befell the world just as this game started, and is ready to get you to safety (note: you cannot escape!). Â Anyway, here's download links and a web player: Beware of bugs, I've already found one myself! Mouse and WASD controls, left click once to fire, left click again to let go. When attached to something the ball that comes out of your gun  will pull you towards it. You're gonna have to adapt to some quite interesting situations to get a good score! entries.title: Micro2Mega
entries.description:
Micro2Mega is a fun game, where you get to experience evolution--through an imaginary time-portal. Collect DNA, but beware of the evil DNA!

NOTES: I have used a personal code library (that may have contained code snippets from throughout the web) for the game. The game uses jQuery, and the source is packaged with jQuery.

entries.title: Mutant Hover Kittens
entries.description:
Dangerous hover kittens have disturbed the peace of your beloved home planet! To be able to live on your old and tranquil kitten live, you decide to show these gene raiding bastards who is the one and only cat without legs (who needs them anyway, if you can just levitate).

If you are on Mac or Linux, leave me a comment! I will port the game with JSIL to the web in the next day (and create a installer). When I am finished, I will leave a comment on your entry (and of course rate your entry).

entries.title: Mutate? Exterminate!
entries.description:
Mutate? Exterminate! is an arena based schmup style game, where the enemies evolve/mutate with each other, sharing their genetic traits (including colour). 

There are three types of enemies, Red, Green and Blue. Enemies with strong colour channels (visible in their appearance) will receive attacking abilities matching that colour. These attacks stack, so yellow enemies (strong in red and green) will have both the red and green attacks. Enemies that are strong in all 3 colour channels are known as "PureBred" (White in appearance) and will have all 3 of the attacks, making them the most dangerous. Essentially, Bright enemies are genetically superior, Dull enemies are genetically inferior.

You can receive a power up called "The Devolver" (bad revolver pun intended). This gun comes in the three colours, and will be automatically applied to your attacks for a short amount of time. Attacks with The Devolver will remove genetic traits from enemies, for example, a Red Devolver will remove the red colouration from enemies, and thus weakening them.

Goal:
The goal of the game is to survive as long as possible, to get the best score!

Controls:
W,A,S,D to move.
Left Click to shoot.
Right click to use a bomb.


Note for download: The zip file is password protected as it contains an executable for the installer (sorry). The password is: ludumdare24
Also, sorry for the file size, the game is only about 4mb, but I had to include the DirectX redistributable with the installer.

For those wondering, Immortal Games is the indie studio I am co-founder of. I wrote the engine being used, which is written in C++ with lua scripting support and a DirectX11 renderer. This game was made on my own for a bit of fun. I wanted to go in the compo, not the Jam, but unfortunately the engine is our companies proprietary property.

entries.title: Obsolete Upgrade
entries.description:
You play as an old out-dated computer. Tired of never being used you decide that it is time...to evolve!

Arrow Keys or WASD to move/jump
Space- shoot floppys

entries.title: Omega Architecture
entries.description:
Omega Architecture is a science-fiction base-planning and general strategy game. 

You were launched to Mars, your original mission being to study microbes believed to be in hibernation underneath the polar ice caps.  

However, contact with Earth ceased abruptly. You have no idea what's happening there. To make matters worse, in 500,000 years an asteroid will most likely impact Mars and destroy everything on the surface, including you.

You must evolve life from tiny microbes into sentient beings capable of doing something to avoid the impact and sending you home.

Note: in order to win, make sure species in your ecosystem survive long enough to evolve and that there is enough breed variety for evolution to occur. To access Ecosystem screen, press "e" or click the second button in the lower left part of the screen.

entries.title: Sandevo - The Evolutionary Sandbox
entries.description:
The game was not finished, and I had problems creating a build that would work in any other computer, so I HOPE it works (My first time with LWJL + Slick.. it was fun! :)  ).

This is about playing with evolution, the creatures haves some parameters and needs that randomly evolve each time they reproduce. Its ALL RANDOM, the only way you can influence is by changing the environment. 
The AI is scripted, and remain constant through the generations.


When finished, this game should be about surviving in a pretty random world by tilting the evolution your way> You can do that by killing off the agressive creeps, letting only the passive ones reproduce, or by modifying the environment, build fences to force evolution on specific species (works!), plant vegetation (works), etc.
(you can do this things on this version, but there is no reward or goal)

This thing here has ALL the features minus:
-Sound
-Animations
-Tile merging
-At least 30 creature frames
-A freaking GOAL

But I found it fun to play while angry.

Controls (I am releasing it with all the debug controls)
WASD   -   Move
1-6    -   Simulation Speed (important)
X      -   Place plant ou cursor location
Z      -   Place Fence on mouse cursor location
Mouse Right   -   Remove Fence on cursor location
Mouse Left (HOLD AND SWING)    -    ATTACK
O       -    Add Herbivore
P       -    Add Carnivore

And this name is temporary, since it wont be a sandbox when finished.

PS: The creeps may look the same, but that is because I had no time to make enough skins, the parameters may be VERY different.

(THIS LINK is for a windows version WITHOUT executable, double click the jar 
http://www.pcnogueira.com.br/jogos/sandevo/sandevo_Win_noExec.zip  )

entries.title: Space Amoebas
entries.description:
INSTRUCTIONS IN A NUTSHELL: Collect Purple Power-ups and Swallow enemies.

WORKS BEST IN GOOGLE CHROME (possibly Safari too)

This LD, I cast down the proverbial shackles of C++ and OpenGL. I decided to try my hand at making a game in javascript using the HTML5 canvas and so, 'Space Amoebas' was born.

My apologies if it plays badly in your browser of choice. Chrome and Safari simply have the fastest JS interpreters (Although I haven't tested in Safari yet).

Please remember to post a comment when you rate so I know to give your game a go too!

Technologies: JS, HTML5, CSS, Fruity Loops, Photoshop

entries.title: Vivere
entries.description:
Vivere is a small HTML/JavaScript based web "game" without much purpose. It contains small creatures, they mate and have children that have a small chance of mutating. Their DNA is constructed of red, green and blue colouring alleles so their offspring inherit their colours.

There isn't much to do but to watch and perhaps experiment. Enjoy.

Created using the JawsJS library. Tested in Chrome, Firefox and Safari on OS X 10.7.4. Including console errors when reporting bugs is appreciated.

entries.title: A story of Evolution
entries.description: The story of Love, evolution and color!

entries.title: Acts of August: Introspective
entries.description:
One small part of a larger project, Acts of August, for JamPony Productions.

Without the other parts to the story this game lacks context, so be sure to check out the comic and short film!

Controls for this game are arrow keys, or the left thumb stick of an Xbox 360 controller. Find your way around Morgan's mind, gathering thoughs, and uncovering the type of person she is. This is an experimental idea trying to bring different types of story telling together. The theme fits in as a span across the entire project and it's story.

entries.title: Adapt or Die!
entries.description:
IF YOU HAVE ANY PROBLEMS WITH ANY BUILD, PLEASE LET ME KNOW:

your OS (including 64 or 32 bit info);
your Java version(java -version);
if you know how to, the console output.

Thank you :)

OBS: The game is still buggy when changing level (sometimes entities are kept from the past level, or you spawn inside a tile and get stuck).

There you go! Had a ton of problems on the end trying to build it (first time using slick, and lwjgl applets ain't easy).

You WILL need Java SE 7 installed to run the applet. And probably, the x86 version of it too, since slick won't run on a 64-bit JVM.

Controls: LARROW and RARROW to move, SPACE to Jump, hold SHIFT to run.

You may not notice, but the meaning I gave to the theme is in there: Every time you die, you evolve and receive some resistance to the type of damage that killed you. When you change level, that resets. I wanted to add a score based off of that, but didn't have time.

But I finished something! If you look at the source and the resources, you will see that I had much more planned (one mob, background music, title screen, and so on...). But man, it's just 48h, and I didn't have all the weekend free :(. But I think I improved, so it counted!

Let me know if the applet works, I'm still not sure.

Besides that, if you find any bug or any map that is super hard, please let me know, I didn't have that much time to test it.

I think thats about it.

entries.title: Aniee
entries.description:
Aniee - A Non-interactive Evolutionary Experience.

This is a non-interactive game that we are already playing. This game is about you trying to figuring out what the heck is going on.

WARNING: Please don't rate it, I'm not expecting ratings, but if you have an interpretation, I'd like to hear about it in the comments section.

entries.title: Beyond Darkness
entries.description:
Unfortunately we ran out of time...

Initially it was supposed to be a Golden Axe style game where by through trial and error & dying you evolve into various stages of a shadow demon until you can fight your way through.

There are 3 levels but we didn't have time to implement level transitions or a lot of the attack types. There isn't even a health meter.

With more time it could have been better. :)

P.S... Press right-CTRL to punch :)

entries.title: Blob's Gotta Eat
entries.description:
My first group effort for Ludum Dare. We started off with the initial idea of a game based on an alien that would eat people to evolve into a more powerful lifeform, and in the end we cut the evolution side of things due to lack of time. Nonetheless, we ended up with a fun (IMHO) little stealth-puzzle game.

Use furniture and walls for cover as you sneak up on the enemies and then lunge for the kill. The Blob will glow and make a noise when you're close enough to eat enemies. If an enemy sees you, then you need to get into cover before they shoot you. Different coloured enemies have different behaviour.

entries.title: Cat Evolution!
entries.description:
Cat Evolution! A Cellular Automaton War Evolution God Strategy Game

My first LD Game!

Features!
-Procedural Music
-Natural selection decides which cats survive and which traits evolve
-Crisp, high fidelity graphics
-A plot! (technically)
-Monoliths which guide evolution and empower cats
-Death ray to cull the weak cats of your tribe
-Enough power to act as a (very) minor god
-Leveling system with 6 monoliths and higher stats

Instructions are in game.

Only your level is saved and it may or may not work.


----------------This Part is Added Post Compo----------------
IMPORTANT NOTE: Though the game is hopefully fun to play even without instructions, it's hard to understand. Some things I've noticed are confusing from the comments are examined below.

Appearence changes according to stats. Images can be found in the instructions
Monoliths give bonuses which can be found in the instructions
Playing the game once before reading instructions might be a good idea
Killing inferior cats (to stop them from making weak children) is necessary for optimal play and it helps quite a bit, but you can get pretty far just from grinding.

entries.title: Catching Life
entries.description:
This is a small arcade / puzzle mix I came up with for my first ever Ludum Dare 48. 

The game is XNA 4.0 and Windows only unfortunately. Sorry about that :(

Please read the HOW TO PLAY.txt for instructions, but here is a small rundown:

(ARROW KEYS) Select solar system. You should start selecting the one with a planet with a small aura around it
Tap (W) or (SPACE) quickly to evolve the planet. Once fully evolved, a rocket will automatically start traveling to the closest Planet.
Use (D) and (A) to spin planets clockwise / counter-clockwise.  
Try getting a rocket to travel to the wormhole before the time runs out

Enjoy! :)

*UPDATE 2* I realized that it might be difficult to understand the concept in the beginning, so I added a short How To Play - Video to the links. 

*UPDATE* I re-packaged the installer of the game, so it should now run in English instead of German. The link is updated, but except the installer, the game is completely unchanged! Unfortunately due to the confusing nature of XNA I wasn't able to deploy a simple .exe file. Sorry :(

entries.title: CritterLab
entries.description:
This is a sandbox evolution sim. There is no objective except to mess with the critters' destiny :-) 

At the start a single critter is born, with genes shown on the right-hand Genome panel. You can play with the gene values & click on the map to spawn new species. You can interact with the map using the mouse: editing the terrain, smiting critters or editing their DNA.

Critters' survival is affected by a number of factors: genome (which influences behaviour & characteristics); environment (terrain, overpopulation & attacks from rival species) and YOU (if you so choose...)

I posted a lot more info on my compo blog: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/27/critterlab-play-guide-dynamics/. Have a look at that for a getting started guide, tips & tricks and details about the mechanics: what the genes do, the critters biology, how they interact with the environment and rival species.

Have fun!! ~berkano

entries.title: Darwin Dash
entries.description:
Darwin Dash is a procedurally generated sidescrolling shooter.

Play as the eponymous biologist as he researches the wildlife of a remote island and indeterminately blows things up!

A & D to walk, space to jump, click to shoot.
Don't let the water get above your head!

To install, simply extract the folder from the included zip file.

entries.title: Evolution
entries.description:
A brief history of evolution...

This is my second participation. 
code : java with PlayN
graphic : paint
music : http://tones.wolfram.com/generate/

entries.title: Evolution Is A Boring Theme
entries.description:
(May take a second to load)

Bored with the idea of Evolution as a theme, we've made a quiz based completely on Pokemon evolutions.

That may sound ridiculous, and it is, I can't believe we actually went through with what was essentially an off-hand joke, but this isn't your ordinary quiz game. First of all, it's not on Newgrounds. Second, you don't get porn when it's finished.

--SPOILERS--
The ending was a bit rushed, I took out most of the possibilities of missing the ending cause I had no satisfying end state. My original idea was to have a 100 question quiz that the player would slog through, but that quickly sounded like a horrible idea, both for me and you.

In the end, I wish I wouldn't have had Chinese on Friday. That was a bad decision.

entries.title: GiRL2501

a collaboration between John Sandoval, mooosh, Jack Sanders(BlueSweatshirt), and PostPre, of http://braingale.net

play as a smokin hot tsundere shoujou on her journey to teach a self-autonomous cyber lab AI what being sexy's really all about B)

entries.title: Good Morning World!
entries.description:
A one level bullet hell created for Ludum Dare. This is my first time doing this... I wish I had managed my time better. I wanted to have three levels but I could not manage that. Way too much time was spent on art when I could have been doing more productive things...

Controls:
Arrow Keys - Movement
Enter - Progress through screens
Z - Shoot
X - Bomb

You can download and play it here: http://moeroegames.com/BlogImages/GoodMorningWorld.zip

Sorry about that!

entries.title: Grow
entries.description:
Here is my submission for the evolution themed Ludum Dare Compo 48 hour game development contest #24.

'Grow' is a Flash game where you collect items to grow bigger and evolve while avoiding enemies which halt and reverse your evolution process.
I tried to give this game an kind of Atari style theme too it by making the game look like it is being projected from a TV screen and using very simple highly pixelized sprites and I think it turned out ok.

Have fun playing!

entries.title: Mystic Evolution Quest
entries.description:
You need Java to run this game.

This is a game about evolution, where you need to evolve to win. This is my first Ludum Dare Game, and unfortunately, i didn't make all i wanted in this game, but it is playable and fun.

entries.title: Psyco-Evolution
entries.description: A psyco-evolution game with a lot of color and movement.More info later.

entries.title: Schrodinger's Kittens
entries.description:
I do think the gameplay turned out to be relevant to the theme of Evolution... but, obviously, I was hoping that the theme would be "1000 Kittens", because I actually just really wanted to make this game for a while. Or I should say, explore this mechanic, and see where it went. It went somewhere interesting I think; I hope you enjoy it.

To play, press any key.

I might be disqualified because I didn't make the music myself, though it IS in the public domain. But I only spent 7-8 hours on this game all told, so no big loss if so.

Special thanks to:
Will Swannack

entries.title: Super Robocade
entries.description:
Super Robocade is an arcady retro platformer.
Your goal is to survive the endless onslaught of ever-evolving robots. To keep up with them you need destroy the automatons and salvage their parts to obtain their powers and get stronger.

This was my first ever participation in Ludum Dare, but I hope you still like my entry.
These past two days have been really fun and also really exhausting!
Any kind of feedback, bug reports and criticism is very welcome.

entries.title: Super-Human
entries.description:
Evolution has its ups and downs. It also has lots of mutations! You're Super-Human. A mutation made you this way. And now you can control objects with your mind. And it's your call to bring a smoother evolutional process!

Top-down action shooter where you can control your enemies (like that wololo guy from Age Of Empires 2) and fight them with themselves. Enjoy!

Made with Flash, using Flixel library with the wonderful free tool FlashDevelop.

entries.title: The Darwinizer
entries.description:
In this game you play a dino-hunting men called "The Darwinizer". He collects the genes, uses them to increase his strength or combines them among themselves.

Have a look at the HOW TO PLAY first (it's also in the download files):

http://www.stevencolling.com/downloads/ld24/How_To_Play.pdf

This is a XNA game.

Download and install Microsoft's .NET-framework 4.0 and the XNA-redistributable first:

http://www.microsoft.com/de-de/download/details.aspx?id=17718

http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

If you have problems running the linked game (e.g. playing on a laptop or something like that), try the following:

http://www.stevencolling.com/downloads/ld24/The_Darwinizer_reach.zip


Thank you for playing and giving feedback :)

Feel free to post your highscore in the comments below!

entries.title: The Origin
entries.description: Young Darwin attempts to discover the origin of Species.

entries.title: Wormelution
entries.description:
Made with Love2D. The game is about evolution, which is basically life, which is basically eat enough to find the best partner and have progeny. Your graphic card needs to support shaders and your machine shouldn't be to shabby in general. Have fun!

Controls: 
Arrow keys - Move around
Hold down Left Shift - Flirt/mate
Space - Dash
S - Statistics

If your Energy runs low you'll loose Health and can die. 

The Game easily gets out of Balance after some evolution cycles but well, it's a 48 hours game. Source code is a bigger mess than last time. Programming with classes isn't so bad after all ...

Okay, so, you are a orange cat that walk with arrow keys. You attack 133 blues cats(and get attacked) by running into these . You level up, and can upgrade by clicking the stats in the status screen which is available by pressing enter. 
You can also eat steaks, and walking up the stairs so that you can fight stronger ennemies . 

I didn't do a separate download for the source, because it's basically renaming the .love in a .zip.
If you want the source, then rename the ld24-133v1.love in a ld24-133v1.zip, then unzip it.

entries.title: Dawn of Dimension
entries.description:
Build a new world with your fellow LD'ers.  Toggle edit mode then choose tiles and place them.  Save to upload changes to the server.


Want to see the entire world? Generate a map here: http://selfsamegames.com/LD24/makemap.html

** You can't save changes to the first room, didn't want people starting inside a wall or anything **

POST COMPO VERSION:
Vastly improved physics, lots of bug fixes, arrow keys for movement, better screen transitions, two new powerups.  Post compo still uses the same world, vote on the original then play in the improved!

entries.title: Elefount 2: The Elementalution
entries.description:
Updated from previous early submission:

ELEFOuNT 2: The Elementalution is the jam product of Nice Mullet studios, the official unofficial name of the collection of David Gibson, Paul Hegel, and Simon Heath. Struggle to survive the elemental forces surrounding you, but know that they react to you too.

Game is in Unity3D, movement is on the arrow keys, X is fire, C switches weapon mode which doesn't do much now, but is still important, and V burns one of your weapon upgrades. The super moves this would enable don't exist, but it does allow you to change your powerup lineup.

The game is pretty unfinished, but is playable and many of the ideas we set out to impliment are there. I recommend using the earth element to see some nice boss art. Unfortunately a few bugs cropped up at the last moment that I was unable to kill, that keep some great art from Paul from being seen in the submission version. I feel terrible about this, so I put said art in screenshot 2. It doesn't appear in game in that form, but it should.

I know background scrolling is horridly broken, sorry.

entries.title: Evolization
entries.description:
Evolization is kind of a 'Civilization with evolution' game. Obviously it's very simple, but all the basic mechanics are there. It doesn't have any set goal, so you can go on playing as long as you like. As I didn't have time for very long test sessions during the LD, I'm interested in hearing how the game works on later generations.

Edit: Few instructions:
- You can scroll with the middle mouse button (usually the the mouse wheel)
- The green 'trees' are food. 
- The blue dots above the pieces are movement points, the red boxes are the hunger level. 
- Every generation (you can see turns left until the next generation in the top of the screen) each piece you have spawns an additional piece.

entries.title: EVOLUTION OF AN ORGANISM
entries.description:
This game was made using the free version of Game Maker by yoyogames.com using only content created in the 48 hour time period. I can't compose for my life, so the music was created in the music creation tool roc by avery. It's very short, only a few levels long. But in those levels you get to see a bunch of weird looking organisms compete for food and die if they don't get it. So that should be interesting. The source is a GM81 file which holds the completed game and can be used on any current version of Game Maker for Windows. I didn't write a journal this time, mainly because it was my first year, and secondly because I didn't do a thing in the first 24 hours and I scrambled to finish in the 24 I had left.So, in conclusion, I hope you enjoy the game!

edit: I have added music using an old program I once found. I also removed a thorn bush that takes you to the last level (used for my testing purposes) and the source code has been modified to mirror that

edit 2: a critical error with the last evolution of the blue organisms forced me to add a new object. I think that this will be the last update

entries.title: Evolvin Gen
entries.description:
Memorize the cells' pattern, and switch the color. The score is percentage of how many cells you switched. Total 15 evolution results. Need less than one minute to finish the play.

Control: mouse, left button only.

Bet you this's the simplest and shortest entry for this LD session.

POST-COMPO: fixed little bugs and better gameplay.

entries.title: evoxy
entries.description:
evoxy

A game about evolving a mysterious facetted "thing". Change his colors and behaviors by bringing the brightly colored meteors that fall from the sky to the altars. Surely it is susceptible to such generosity.

It's up to you to bend this "thing" to your will with the power of evolution!

WASD to move about.
E to "offer" meteor at altar.
SPACE to jump.

Note: There is no sound.
Note2: The webplayer has some annoying movement issues (stil playable!), I recommend getting the windows version though.

Please leave a comment and I hope you like it,
-Jerry

entries.title: Extreme Super Death Pit 3000
entries.description:
The player is positioned inside a crater and bombs are being rolled down at him (oh no!). The player must attempt to destroy the bombs with his particle beam gun, but it's malfunctioning! It keeps switching the type of damage done. 

This is an arcade style game in which the player is trying to attain a higher score than a previous run. Have fun!

-note- I used a free library called Terrain Toolkit in this project.

entries.title: Grow
entries.description:
Collect Cells and Grow! 

///please read///

"Sorry about the music I should have read the rules better, but now I know for the next time:)"

//Controls//

WASD to move
Left mouse to shoot (Later On)
mouse to control direction (Sorry for Crapiness)

if you have trouble playing it, you can download blender (FREE), and open the growtitle.blend file. Press P to start the game Engine.

This was my First LudumDare and I enjoyed it! I changed My Idea twice so I only had a couple of hours left to make this game. The source is included in the games zip folder.

 There was a couple of bugs that showed up after compiling but I don't have time to fix them, but if I can I will.

known Bugs include:
- Getting injured and no longer being able to defend yourself
- Exit screen and the next level screen, occasionally the mouse jumps off screen and cant be found.
- Rays don't always point where there supposed to.

    If you have blender on your computer you can open the GrowTitle.blend and avoid these bugs, and also run the game on different operating systems! 

Twitter: https://twitter.com/NormalAssociati

entries.title: Jumpers in Love
entries.description:
Goal:
Save 10 little jumpers by reaching the dark exit. Help them by selecting the best jumpers to create breeds strong enough to pass the obstacles.

How to play:
Click make them fall in love (click again to undo). Smaller heart indicates the rest period. Scroll with the arrow keys (or WASD). Simply hovering with your mouse will freeze it and change its direction when released (can help sometimes). Press 'space' to restart the level.

Tip: Crossing related individuals (=having similar colors) create less new mutations. Try to preserve some diversity, because an army of clones may be an evolutionary dead-end.

There is an in-game level editor!

See webpage for details (also genetic rules and debug hotkeys).

entries.title: Mech attack
entries.description: Attack the dragon and evolve to godliness! Also see if you can find the halo  easter egg.  Use arrow keys to move,space to shoot,left mouse to destroy blocks,right click to place blocks

entries.title: Pinbology
entries.description:
"It is ancient Earth, and in a pond filled with primordial ooze things have just come to life..."

PINBOLOGY attempts to faithfully mimic the components, mechanics, and physics of old electro-mechanical pinball machines while incorporating zones, combos, and special actions themed around evolution.

This game was made entirely before a livestream audience of 200-500 people. While I created all the art and program code myself, they provided invaluable moral support and inspiration, and I want to thank everyone who watched.  I can't wait for LD #25!!!

-------

INSTRUCTIONS (See in-game help for more information)

Flippers: Left/Right Arrows or CTRL
Plunger: Down Arrow or Space
Tilt: Up Arrow, Shift, or X (Careful, tilt too much and you'll lose a life!)

-------

SPECIALS/COMBOS

Extinction Event: Turn on the three lights at the top of the table to enable a mega-bonus in the gutter lanes.

Mutagenic Compound: Careful, hitting the purple drop target will activating the spinning disc!

Geographical Isolation: Climb the ramp to enter an area loaded with bonus points!

Breeding Ground: Exiting Geographical Isolation opens the gate to the Breeding Ground ball lock.

Survival of the Fittest: Lock three balls in the Breeding Ground to initiate a MULTI-BALL! (Each ball with have a color that diverges from the parent. The last ball standing locks in its color and becomes your new species!)

DNA: Hit the three DNA drop targets to cause a double-helix to appear on the board. Collect it for a huge bonus!

-------

FIXED: People reported a bug with with the flipper hitboxes.  They have been adjusted slightly, which should hopefully eliminate the issue of the ball passing through them.

entries.title: Primeval Labs
entries.description:
Requires XNA Game Studio 4.0 Framework Redist

"Primeval Laboratories" is a shootemup or "bullet hell" game in which you must fight sets of generated enemies.  However, each generation adapts and learns from the previous one, and the enemies continue to become more difficult through this process.

The biggest feature of the game is the procedural, genetic creation of the enemies. Every stat, behavior, and weapon is coded in a genome that is manipulated by a genetic algorithm to create the subsequent generation. Hopefully you will see many interesting and amusing generations as you play!

You can export enemies to a text file in the pause menu, then share them with others or breed them from the main menu.

In theory it plays better with an XBox controller, but that's completely untested.

Have fun!

entries.title: Radioactive Space Bunnies
entries.description:
Mad scientist has irradiated bunnies and fed them to his horde of mechanical space worms. The bunnies must breed to survive the gauntlet of the innermost depths of danger.

Zachary Murray
David Zimmermann
Music: Revolution Void: "Time Flux"

entries.title: Reckless Abandon
entries.description:
How far would you go to survive?
Would you abandon that which separates you from your enemy?
Retain your humanity, or embrace the singularity?

How long can you outrun your inevitable evolution?


Try to beat the developer high scores:
Nick P - 360
Nick W - 254
Nat - 135

Post your high score in the comments!



**PRO TIP**
If you're feeling overwhelmed, try sticking to head attacks at first.


Made in XNA.
Webified with JSIL.

BGM:  Deep Thought Process by Sycamore Drive
http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Sycamore_Drive/Sycamore_Drive/Deep_Thought_Process

entries.title: Robot wars
entries.description:
Not complete; will be working on it for the Jam as well.  :) 

However, it is certainly playable, but I have managed to get a few bugs out.  Also, no documentation.

entries.title: terravolve
entries.description:
Known issues:

Fixed issue with sound not playing.

If you are running as OS that is lower than Vista, you will get an error relating to missing d3d10 .dll files. Please make sure you are running Vista or greater with a d3d10 compatible graphics card. Sorry xp users!

There is a bug if you hold A&S that it heals and upgrades simultaneously. Do this if you want to cheat and get to the end, otherwise don't!

About:
terravolve was written with C++ and my own D3D10 engine library,which is still currently in development.
Feel free to butcher the source code, wear protection however for your own personal safety.

This was my first Lundum Dare and I have to say it's been an amazing experience. See you next year.

Any issues or questions, contact me via: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */


Game Summary:
terravolve is a game whereby the player must manage the technological advancement and health of continents on their planet to ensure the planet progresses through ages.

in terravolve the player must balance time and resource management to  avoid the destruction of the planet as the planets health gradually falls.

Can you evolve your planet beyond a space faring culture?
Do you have the skill and patience to succeed?

entries.title: The Cycle
entries.description: The Cycle is a western jrpg about the predator prey relationship between Cheetahs and Gazelles and the subtle evolutionary consequences. Play through three rounds for the first evolution.

entries.title: The Omnicide Genotype
entries.description:
Your collection of hell-beasts might be contaminated with the Omnicide Genotype. The disease makes them spit waves of death. Some of the beasts carry the disease without suffering from it, but they can pass them on to their children. Find all of the carriers and destroy them while saving the others.

Mouse click controls the crosshairs. Cull who you choose.

Made with the Love 2D engine and public library hump. 

INSTRUCTIONS:

Windows x86 version available (http://www.sendspace.com/file/qvo90t)
Unzip. Don't alter the folder contents. Just run Game.exe.


For the most RELIABLE results, install your choice of the Love 2D Engine version 0.71 or 0.72 from https://love2d.org/ and download the game in .love form (http://www.sendspace.com/file/pifn7r).  No doubt you will find other love 2D games for this jam too, so you've saved some time in the long run, maybe. 

I just realized that I developed the game in Love version 0.7___ and forgot to upgrade to 0.8.  This may explain all of my issues :/. Please use version 0.7___ of the engine, please. 



Windows 64 bit: I can't test this, but try downloading http://www.sendspace.com/file/ow1jnx and running TheOmnicideGenotype-64.exe. It is a crapshoot. 

Linux and Mac: download the love engine as specified above

For those wanting to know the theme connection: Evolution in a strict biological sense is the change of allele frequencies in a population.

entries.title: The Phoenix Rising
entries.description:
*** The Phoenix Rising *** 

 - Story driven game with focus on immersion
 - Controls that mimic real life (as good as it gets)
 - 5 full stages
 - Highly art driven
 - A fully and complete game, no content was cut out. So if you get stuck, keep trying because there is a proper end to it all

*** End Promo Text ***

NOTE: The game file is big (10mb) and I am currently hosting it on my dropbox. Will get a better hosting tomorrow.
NOTE2: Also, remember to click the flash, so it gets focus.


First time for me going solo with the compo entry. It was up and down, but mostly up. Thought I was going to cut out a lot of content, but I managed to get it all as I wanted =)

I did a take on survival of the fittest for the theme. So here is a small story for you to enjoy.

Half of the work was spent on the assets, half on coding.

Tools:
* Flixel
* Photoshop
* Wolfram tones
* Bxfr
* Audacity

Finally, if you liked my art, check out my all my other work at http://www.brassawiking.deviantart.com/gallery/

entries.title: The Tower with Traps in it
entries.description:
Team: Octoborg and Moops
Special Thanks: Talkhaus Fansubs

Controls: 
Arrow keys to move.
D to use shield/advance dialog.
Escape to skip dialog sequences.
Enter to pause/unpause.

Requires Java 1.6 or later.
If the game crashes immediately when starting, your graphics card may not be good enough. Sorry!

All characters appearing in this work are fictitious. Any resemblance to real persons, living or dead, is purely coincidental.

entries.title: Unstable Planet
entries.description:
That's it, my first Ludum Dare entry. I hope you'll like it.
It's a simple platformer with a little particularity: there is only one level that evolves and becomes 
more complex each time you complete it.

The level is procedurally generated so each game session will feature a new one.

You need OpenAL to launch the game. You can install it with the OALinst executable or launch the nosound version of the game.

Controls:
Left, Right arrow:	Move the character.
Space:			Jump.
Left Ctrl:		Fire.

Alternatively you can use A, D, W to control the character (or the corresponding keys if you don't have a qwerty keyboard) and Left Shift to fire.

entries.title: Vicariously
entries.description:
"In the end, all civilisations fall. But some are remembered."

In response to the 'Evolution' theme, I decided to explore the evolution of civilisations.

Enter Vicariously: a game where you cannot hope to survive, but you can hope that your legacy might remain.

In Vicariously, you step through a civilisation's history, 1000 years at a time. You can build technologies, colonise other planets, attack and trade. The game is curiously multiplayer: there is only ever one board, and unless there are none left, players play as civilisations either just colonised (ie asexual reproduction) or just conquered (ie sexual reproduction).

I'm hoping that this lends itself to an interesting evolution of the universe provided.

Made in django/html/javascript/lesscss.

Finally, this was my first time to really do any real web development, so there are almost certainly going to be bugs. Please let me know if there are any and I'll do what I can to fix them going forward.

entries.title: Young Earth Road Trip
entries.description:
Miguel is excited to learn about the new creationist museum, but is devastated to learn that local bus system doesn't travel there due to lack of demand.  He decides to convert his neighbors so they can pilgrimage to the museum together.

Update: links to post-compo version now

entries.title: Breuoakt
entries.description:
I was originally going to make a C64 game for the main competition, but unfortunately I screwed up something important and couldn't finish.

So, I threw this together in the last few hours on Monday for the jam, completely ignoring the theme.

It's not really finished and is missing a major feature I wanted to include, but it's playable and kind of fun.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Bubble Breeders
entries.description:
How to run:
Extract the .zip archive to an empty folder and then simply doubleclick the .jar file.
On a console:
java -Djava.library.path=./ -jar bubblebreeders.jar 
Make sure to have at least JRE 1.6 installed!

After accidently tripping over an old tree stump, you and your folk fall into a dark portal which led into a big dungeon full of evil red thingies that want to kill you. As you don't like being killed, you decide to search for the portal back. It has to be somewhere in this dungeon...and maybe you can find something else interesting too!

The dungeon is randomly generated on each startup. It might happen that your already spawn in the boss room (it should be rare, but still...). If you do, just restart.
Your race evolves into a stronger one as you progress and you can also upgrade your buildings and do some research for some nice special powers. In order to enter the dark portal room, you will need to get obsidian. But your normal pickaxe won't do! After the area around the portal is clear, you can enter it and - yay! you won.

There are more possible inventions than there are shown. They are randomly chosen on each start, so every game you play will be a bit different.
The rest should be self-explanatory.

Controls:
Any Mouse Button: use/mine/move
Q: open building menu
E: upgrade building (possible at evolution level 2)
R: open research menu (requires laboratory)
T: destroy (50 gold) or place bomb (requires bomb discovery or higher)
TAB: open status menu
Space: move camera to minions
Space x2: move camera to spawnpoint
W,A,S,D or arrow keys: move camera

Cheats for lazy people who only want to take a quick peek:
Press Backspace, enter one of these, press backspace again.
orgy - spawn 10 workers
bigorgy - spawn 50 workers
bankrob - +5000 gold
einstein - all discoveries
beholder - reveal map (will lag for a few seconds)
evolution - evolve into the next level of evolution

entries.title: Chaotic God
entries.description:
You are God. You need to hide dinosaur bones in the rock strata to fool the paleontologists into believing the Earth is more than 4000 years old. Because that's just the kind of God you are. Chaotic God. 

This is an HTML5 game. Works best in Chrome - I haven't tested anything else.

The link is to the uploaded, versioned game. You can see the git sha in the URL, corresponding to the version on github.

The source link points to where you can download the LD48 tagged source code (same version).

entries.title: Defend The Galaxy
entries.description:
Steer left and right with Z and X.
Fire with C.

I use my personal library hosted at:
http://majsokrafo.net/slib/slib-beta-0.6.js
http://www.mediafire.com/?0n8a4u3htsua938

The library is even included with the source as slib.js.
The code is in defendthegalaxy.js and index.html.

Warning! Ugly code!

entries.title: Devolution
entries.description: This was my first Dare and it was pretty fun!

entries.title: DGP: Space Lion
entries.description:
Hey everyone! Yoni (the programmer) here. Over the weekend (September 1) I released a bugfix version. The gameplay is the same, but lots of annoying physics bugs were fixed. You should play that one! If you want to rate based on what we had by the deadline, that version's available too. :)

The website is much improved too, check it out: http://www.yonispants.com/DGP

-------

Space, the year 2014. DGP Space Lion arrived at planet Shetty following a report on a stolen vehicle. Minutes after arriving, he realized his spacepolice car was missing, most likely stolen by one of the local low-lifes. Stranded on a foreign world, he must now search the entire planet for his ride and get back home, to file a report. It's a dangerous world out there, filled with Gnorlms and Knarxals, known to be highly adaptable to any kind of weapon used against them. May the gods have mercy on their souls.

The enemies evolve quickly, and before long they will resist all your attacks! Try alternating weapons to beat your opponents.

This game and its absolutely accurate physics were inspired by Bollywood cinema.

Controls:
Arrow keys - move
A - punch
S - kick
D - use weapon
Q - next weapon
E - previous weapon
F - toggle fullscreen

If you find the game too hard, enter the cheat code LION to get 99 lives, full health, all weapons and type a digit between 1 and 8 to skip to that level.

NEW! Updated website - the game soundtrack is now available for download!

CREDITS:

Yoni Rozenshein - Programming
Hagay Giller - Graphics
Lihi Karni - Animation, Additional Voices
Asaf Sagi - Voices, Assistant Animator, Dishes
Aviad Shamir - Story, Dialogue, Sound Effects, Additional Voices, Additional Dishes
Gal Raviv - Music, Additional Animation, Additional Voices
Uri Shomroni - Level Design, Additional Writing, Additional Animation, Additional Graphics, Dance Sequence, Additional Additions
Ido Cohen - Pizza, Beta Testing
Simon Shocket - Theme Song Vocalist, Additional Voices

links.label: Python Source - post-deadline bugfix version (it's awesome!)

entries.title: Dr. Ken and Dr. Ken
entries.description:
Dr. Ken and Dr. Ken - The action-story of ONE man fighting through time to evolve rabbits to save mankind. Dr. Ken will face all manner of danger from his polite, yet stoic dog, demonic fire rabbits, the blue screen of paradox and ultimately, HIMSELF.

N.B: WASD to move, LMB to fire, space to proceed dialogue

entries.title: EVE
entries.description:
It's a little incomplete, but it's definitely something the both of us can be proud of. We didn't get all the way done, but we did manage to get quite a lot completed! More than our last Ludum Dare, at least. 

We had some more concepts and emphasis planned on the theme, but hey! We got this far. Already we're looking forward to the next Ludum Dare.

WHAT DIDN'T GET FINISHED:
- Stations you can control your DNA in (change tail, hands, etc at will)
- More morphs/evolutions
- Make it more like a roguelike
- Music imported
- Better instruction on control

This is sort of a bittersweet ending to a 3 day long struggle, but we did learn a LOT of things for next time.


Controls:

Arrows - Move
Attack - C
Grab / Drop - V
Space - Select / Jump (if you had the ability)


Story:

Eve, a special creature from a far away planet has to make an emergency landing in a strange place. While her ship calls for help, she realizes she has little means of survival without the ability to adapt. So she scans the environment - what luck! This planet has breathable air! It has sustenance!

Using her natural ability to evolve her DNA and accommodate her environment, she wanders off, hoping to research and learn something about this world.

entries.title: Evo Space
entries.description:
Instructions on the title screen. 

It's survival of the fittest weapon - The longer you keep your weapons alive, the better they become.

Get to the end without losing all your lives!

Also you can move on the title screen to get to the tutorial (go right)

Couple things: the Z-Field let's you affect the movement of asteroids, turns enemy ships around, and deflects bullets. If it deflects a bullet, you can't use the Z-Field for a short time.




Works best in Chrome. Firefox works fine, but missing one nice webgl effect.

entries.title: evoCubes
entries.description:
evoCubes---------------------


As the gray cube you can eat both vegetables (grass or tree leaves) and other cubes, remember, you can eat only while moving.

When you are big enough, stand still, and you can create carnivorous cubes, herbivorous cubes or some grass.


You can either eat to evolve or do nothing and see what the other cubes do :P 

Controls

Right Mouse Button -> move the camera
Left Mouse Button -> move the cube
Mouse on left part of the screen-> show counters

entries.title: Evolution
entries.description:
Didn't quite make the deadline (partly because i got beaten knock out by some kind of flu) but still feel pretty satisfied with the result.

The idea I had was that by capturing enemies you can choose 1 of 3 abilities to improve whenever you enter the next level. this improvement doesn't only affect the ability of your player but will also adjust you appearance of your player. for example by growing a longer tail and various antennas or so.

Unfortunately I didn't have the time to create the other abilities (speed and control), so you automatically grow a longer tail giving you the ability to drop more anchors whenever you reach the next level.

Starting the game
---------------
Double click the 'LD24Evolution.jar' file OR use some sort of terminal/commandline, enter the LD24Evolution folder and type: 'java -jar LD24Evolution.jar'

Playing
------
You play the game by using the arrow buttons to move around and pressing spacebar to drop anchors. after 3 (or more) anchors the capture area will be closed and enemies killed. levels consist of 5 waves of enemies. You gain a longer tail by clearing levels.


Note
----
I didn't get around to testing on anything other than OS/X, so i hope it works on other platforms as well.

entries.title: Evolution in HELL
entries.description:
This is not only my first ever Ludum Dare entry, but it's my first time programming a game - it was great.

My idea was to create a sort of wave-based defense game, and your character is trying to work their way up the ranks of hell.

This was one of the best experiences I've had in a long time, and while I am incredibly tired, I feel like I couldn't have spent my weekend a better way than this.

Language: AS3
Library: Flixel
Art: Photoshop
Music: Free Music Archive

Object of the game: Kill demons without getting hit by the green blobs or getting pushed into the pit. If you shoot and kill enough demons you turn into a different demon.

entries.title: Evolution VS 1000 kittens
entries.description:
PLEASE PLAY THE POST-COMPO VERSION. IT REMOVES THE GRIND FROM THE GAME BY MAKING EVERYTHING CHEAPER. (It's genuinely fun now, I swear!)

My first Ludum Dare entry.

You control a race of dinosaurs, who are constantly attacked by the "Thousand Kittens". It's time to evolve and kill them once and for all, the save your race from extinction by to evil "Thousand Kittens".

WASD/ZQSD/Arrow keys to move, LMB or space to shoot. In control scheme 1, use the mouse to aim, in control scheme 2, use the K/L keys to rotate. Eat the dead kittens to  gain their DNA in order to upgrade yourself.
Press enter/escape/P to return to the upgrade screen when playing.

I hope you have fun playing it! :)

entries.title: Evu for life
entries.description: Adapt for life! Evu to live!

entries.title: Gene Binder
entries.description:
Can you figure out how to evolve correctly? Find out in this short game!

How to play:

The bottom 4 genes can combine with the genes in the pattern. Click on a gene on the bottom, then click on a gene in the pattern to see if they can combine. If it can, it'll switch to another gene. There is only one solution per puzzle.

Level Goal: 

The goal of each level is to first find out which gene is wrong, then swap it out with other genes until you get the gene that is supposed to go there.

entries.title: Lucas's Quest Backwards
entries.description:
Does evolution of mankind always go forward ? What about backwards and sideways ?
In the year 35 000 something, the humans have changed a lot. Lucas dreams about the humans from before and wishes he could live with them... 
... and why not be like them.

Lucas's Quest Backwards is a platformer game with a story about love, time travel and pursuit of the self.
There are 2 endings to discover !

[X], [UP] : jump
[C], [SPACE] : fire (if you have chosen the path of violence)

** This game includes kittens. **

Level design by Ygwee.

******************
Our twitter account : http://twitter.com/StormAlligator
Follow our projects on our website : http://stormalligator.com/

******************

entries.title: MatterSplatter
entries.description:
MatterSplatter - Fight to gather genetic material and reproduce a mutated offspring... Save the universe from the mysterious... Dark Orb...!!!

Side scrolling shooter with insemination and defecation gameplay systems!

But who is the Dark Orb...?

entries.title: Neural Nodes
entries.description:
This is Neural Nodes, my first LD entry. The game is a turn-based strategy and the goal is simply to capture all of the nodes on the board. You can transform your characters into one of two new forms by capturing a node. Many of the theme-related elements that were included in the original concept (e.g. different life forms evolving mid-battle and the environment itself changing) are missing due to a lack of time and the game suffers I think from not having been play tested enough as I spent most of my time just trying to get features up and running. The lack of audio is a disappointment but the deadline caught up with me. Instructions are include within the game and repeated below it on the HTML page if you need to refer to them.

Thanks for playing and congrats. to everyone who has finished and submitted an entry.

[EDIT] Armoured Life-forms cannot capture nodes (this is noted in the instructions but I'm repeating it here because a few people have had issues) and once you have transformed a life-form into an armoured unit then you can't turn it back. This is a known issue that I was unable to correct in the time limit, to play successfully you'll need to keep at least one life form in a normal or speed form. If I find the time to do a post-compo version then I'll add a 'revert' button to turn a unit back to a normal state or put a cap on the number of armour units. Sorry for any inconvenience caused, I just ran out of time :-/

entries.title: Oh my, a shooter with blocks!
entries.description:
Description:
Oh my, a shooter with blocks! is a shooter where the ships are constructed from basic building blocks. Each block has its own function, they come in four flavors:
-CORE (circle icon) only one per ship. if the block is destroyed the whole ship is destroyed.
-SHOOTER (triangle icon) shoots projectiles.
-ENGINE (square icon) increase the speed of the ship.
-NORMAL gives no abilities beside protecting other blocks.

The enemies are procedurally generated and evolve using a genetic algorithm. The goal is to beat has much generation as possible. After beating a generation the player is rewarded a new block to upgrade his ship.

Controls:
WASD to move
aim with mouse to shoot

Known bugs:
-If could happen that an enemy pop out of the game zone. In such case the level can't be completed. No way out of this except reloading the game and starting over. Sorry.
-Game load for a long time and nothing appears (reported by eyehawk). Most likely due to a Java version problem.
-Sometime ship tries to constantly go in one direction (reported by hgcummings).

entries.title: Pincers
entries.description:
PINCERS - Instructions

Use the mouse, arrow keys or WASD to guide your creature. Eat the red and blue pills to regain life and energy. Attack other creatures to destroy them. Evolve your creature by taking the remains of your enemy. Red improves life, green improves speed and blue improves attack strength. Energy is currently unused (didn't have time to add the skill system).

Press Escape to quit or restart the game. Press P to pause.


The game is programmed in Lua using the Love 0.8.0 game framework. Graphics were drawn with the Gimp. The in-game font is Victor-Pixel grabbed from http://www.dafont.com/victors-pixel-font.font. Sound effects were created with sfxr from http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html. I took inspiration from flOw http://interactive.usc.edu/projects/cloud/flowing/ and threw the progression system of an aRPG to the mix :)

Update: uploaded a new .zip for Windows which should fix a crash from Love with certain ATI cards (this AFAIK https://love2d.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=10104).

Update (Aug 28): Fixed a bug where the game would sometimes crash when the player died.

Linux users: running the Windows version through Wine works perfectly (although is a bit slow to start up). Otherwise download the .love file and run with Love 0.8.0 or later.

entries.title: Robo[R]Evolution
entries.description:
>The age of man has ended. Out in the bleak sits the
heart of the Machine, guarded by the whispering torrents of
sand. Here the war begins anew, a plot hatched by the lords
of this castle. A new breed of death is forged, something
smarter than its predecessors, something efficient. Adaptable.

>The Men know, and they flock to the heart. They come in
their caravans, in their flying machines, from near and
from far. Their fear compels them in vain; they know they
will not be returning to their ravaged homes. The reaper
is something they dare not fight, they've watched him
cradle the world in his arms. 

>They too, will be touched by him tonight; they march to
their ends with this truth in their minds. They can not
stop the revolution, and they will be replaced.

>This will be our finest hour. We are the rEvolution.

-----

CONTROLS:
W, A, S, D: MOVE
LEFT MOUSE: Shoot
PRESS RIGHT MOUSE: View Available Turret Locations OR Use Action Item
RELEASE RIGHT MOUSE: Place Turret
SHIFT: See Turret Energy
1, 2, 3 (or Q, E): Cycle Action Items

-----

Since I was running out of time, SOME features are missing (mainly the ending) so I'll be putting out a content update in a few weeks with cool new stuff! Also there's a mini-update with some bugfixes, I highly recommend playing it instead of 1.0!

CHANGELOG for 1.1:
-Fixed Story Advancing being WAY too slow (it advances every 10 waves)
-Fixed Battery Max Health being too high
-Implemented Shot Type upgrades every 10 waves not working
-Increased spread and patterns of later Shot Types
-Fixed default turrets not showing their particle effect
-Fixed Super Fillups giving INSANE amounts of Energy to turrets. (still might not work perfectly)
-Made turrets a bit more balanced by adjusting their energy amounts + firespeed
-Fixed Enemy progression
-Reduced amount of turrets given between waves
-You now start with two turrets again.
-Two regular turrets spawn naturally on the board now, to give the player a headstart
-Fixed crash upon item menu appearing if the player has maxed out stats
-If the player has maxed out stats, a 2nd action item becomes available instead of a stat item
-”Firepower” stat now works as it should
-Shots become larger as Firepower increases
-Adjusted enemy health
-Lowered maximum stats
-Added “Re-Roll” to Item Menu. lets you change the items available to you (you start with three)
-You get one bonus re-roll per evolution stage
-Rocket explosions are more dramatic
-Fixed depth issue with generator

entries.title: Selective Breeding
entries.description:
I started out to make a game that somewhat accurately models real-life genetics, but unfortunately I couldn't make a real game with this concept. I wanted it to be about adapting to a hostile, harsh environment, but I didn't know how to make it more interactive. So, eventually I just added enemies and a lot of shooting. It is playable, just not very fun. Also, I wanted to do music and sound FX for it, but I ran out of time. :-/

Here is a more in-depth description of the game, from its readme:
You control a group of mono-gendered organisms who must escape their hostile environment. You start off with 4 organisms. Each level you take control over them one by one. Your goal is to lead them to safety, symbolized by a waving flag. After each level you get the choice to breed your organisms. Once you've bred two organisms they will be replaced by two new ones, their children, whose genetic code will be a random blend of their parents' genes.
Passing on genes works like in real genetics. Every organism has two sets of their genes, one inherited from each parent.Genes have dominant and recessive variants, called alleles. Dominant alleles are written with a capital, recessive alleles with a lower-case letter. Dominant and recessive alleles provide different traits for the organism, for example a gene's dominant allele can cause the organism to grow smaller, while its recessive variant can cause the exact opposite - to grow bigger. If an organism has both the dominant and the recessive allele, the dominant will override the recessive one's effect.
The game includes two environments, selected at random: a cold one, covered in snow, and a hot one, covered in sand. Different genes provide protection against the heat and the cold, while other traits can cause the organism to be more vulnerable to the environmental effects. The hazards increase each level.
Surviving 5 levels wins the game.  If all 4 organisms die, the game is lost.

Controls in the game:
Cursors/WASD - Move
Space/Y/Z - Shoot

The game requires the .NET Framework 4 and the XNA Framework Redistributable 4.
You can download these from:

.NET Framework 4:
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851

XNA Framework Redistributable 4:
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Tribal Warfare
entries.description:
In Tribal Warfare, you lead your tribe to victory over the gremlins. However, your tribe is currently in the stone age, and is poorly equipped. Research new weapons, and evolve as a tribe. Its adapt or die!

Enjoy the evolving music too... I really like the way it turned out, so I added a soundtrack! Just play the songs on loop. 


Here is some clarification for the controls. Movement and selection uses standard RTS controls. To gather resources, click on the building for the resource. You are given one of each kind to start. To attack, just move your men into the vicinity of the gremlins. Tip: Make sure you don't become too technologically advanced, you might end up killing yourself in the process.

Soundtrack download available in the Web version.

I guess I should also mention... F11 activates fullscreen, but use at your own risk.

entries.title: Arcane Dungeons ( aka Evil Lord vs Angel for the salvation or perdition of a hero's soul)
entries.description:
So ok. 
This is the entry of Nathan Mitton ( [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ ) and me, Christina Neofotistou.

So. This is not very fun, because it's missing the A.I. Nathan was too tired to try.
I was also too tired to finish all the graphics.

But all in all, it's quasi-polished and we're happy we did it, and it's more than a proof of concept. You can still play it with a friend, if you don't peek over his cards, but it's not very practical.

Ok, this is a game where a Demon Lord and an Angel battle it out with cards. The Demon Lord tries to kill the hero in a tower defense fashion. The Angel tries to keep him alive long enough to reach the end of the level.

The Demon Lord's traps evolve when a trap card is reinforced with a secondary (and tertiary) effect. 

Evolution also comes into play in the way the angel's protections and level upgrades to the hero remain with the hero. It's the standard evolution of RPGs.

Finally, the very dungeon evolves during the course of the battle. Each time you play through the dungeon, the hero gets to experience a completely different adventure.



HOW TO PLAY. 

We tried to keep it super-simple.
The Demon Lord ("Keeper" of the dungeon) plays one of the trap cards (pit, crusher, rotating blades, spike, arrow trap) into one of the evil slots (the square with the double evil snake). The card summons a trap on the dungeon tile above it. The Keeper can play as many cards as his or her Mana will allow (your mana pool is the number on the top left corner of the game, next to the blue mana gem. The mana cost is at the bottom left of each card)

Once you have at least one trap in place, you can play an Upgrade(Evolution) card on it. This adds effects like mana steal or ice damage to your trap.

You then end your turn.

The Angel plays his/her own cards, which counter the Keeper's traps or make the hero more capable, in order to survive (extra strength etc).

After the Angel ends turn, the battle phase of the game is like this:

The hero explores the dungeon one tile at a time, encountering traps or magic potions. Each time he lands on something evil, he takes damage, each time he lands on something good he is healed or given a positive effect.

After all three tiles have been played out, the keeper starts again, and so on, until either the hero reaches the end of the dungeon (counted in steps, on the top right) in which case the Angel wins. Or the hero dies and the Keeper wins.

Not implemented:
- incidental music. I wrote it, but we didn't have time to implement the changes. So enjoy the static music track, it still took me half a day to finish.

- a different take on the gameplay, in which the hero walks only one square at a time, and the players only get to play one card. We wanted to check both versions to see which is more fun, but ran out of time.

- all the different card art. Turns out it's a huge job. I'm sorry :(

- the AI, obviously


So, this is our attempt. Enjoy, do PLEASE leave feedback on the gameplay, and check back for updated versions.


LD is the best!

Love,
Christina + Nathan


Tools used: Adobe Flash, Adobe Photoshop, Fruity Loops

entries.title: Besugo
entries.description:
In this game you are a seabream and you must kill smaller fishes to survive in the hard sea depths. 

Unfortunately, Linux version doesn't have sound yet. I'll have to dive into TinyOAL code to see if I can port it easily to Linux.

entries.title: evolving
entries.description:
I used Unity 3.5 free edition.  Code written in C#.  For
audio I used audacity, recording myself with my mic.  For images I used Gimp and Photoshop, cuz I only have Gimp on the laptop.  I used Maya for the star and moon models in the game.  I think that is pretty much it.  

I used code from a couple examples on the unity forums, I have the links in the source where I used it.  The code was how to do a fade with the GUI, and a basic example on jumping.  This is my first compo entry, so I believe it is okay to use code from forums.  If not let me know :)

entries.title: Evoroid
entries.description:
So I made this game and everything went perfectly until a bug came up 15 minutes before the deadline.
There is an overwhelming number of variables that need to be balanced in order to make the game work, and I wouldn't be able to do it even if I had another 24 hours, so the game may be very unbalanced.

Anyway the idea is that you are this robot, in a tiny world of similar robots. You have some random parts attached to you and other robots usually have more parts. When you die or run out time/fuel, you evolve, and gain either new parts or upgrades to your existing parts. If the game didn't break and I hadn't overslept I would have added bosses with special parts that would can only gain my killing them. 
The objective of the game is to survive as many levels as possible, as you only have limited lives but unlimited "refuels".
If you can actually survive the aggressive AI, then you will  evolve as planned, but when you die the game crashes.
I would have tracked you guys' statistics with Mochi, but apparently it broke the game even more and therefore the Kongregate version doesn't load, at least not for me.

Have fun!

EDIT:
I've fixed it and also made some slight balance changes and increased the size of the level.

entries.title: Feesh.
entries.description:
Eat smaller feesh to get bigger!
Avoid bigger feesh! 
Reproduce using pink feesh! 
Get the surprise ending! 

Follow me on Twitter @_Teejay5 
Thanks for playing. 

If you find that the game is terribly imbalanced, that's because I didn't have much time to playtest. lol, ENJOY! 

By the way, this is my first finished game.

entries.title: God Called in Sick Today
entries.description:
God called in sick today, so it looks like you're stuck with having to make life.

Ah well. No biggie.

Shape the world how you like. Have a play around. When you get the conditions right, life will evolve.

This game is a simple, relaxing puzzle game in which you maniplate the landscape and weather in an attempt to evolve intelligent life. Alternatively you can just make a world that looks and sounds nice, it's in your hands.

**
Compo version you can evolve as far as birds (fauna) and trees (flora). Control is the mouse.

I've searched for bugs for the last couple of hours and it seems good to me. However, I have been awake for a long time and have been drinking beer so I may have missed something.

Anyway, hope you enjoy playing God!!

Due to recent technological advancements you can now build brains for worms and evolve them directly from the browser. Connect neurons that match and build brains! When you cover all the area you get to see your creation.

(Hit Ctrl+U to view the source code)

See it as the evolution of SHODAN. :P And yeah, the game is a bit unfinished; there could be so much more stuff and so much less bugs. Sorry for that.

Jana Reinhardt (Graphics)

HTTP://WWW.RATKING.DE

entries.title: Maple
entries.description:
This game is incomplete but the core control mechanic is implemented. The concept is you are jury rigging your own control mechanisms as you build your ship out of parts you find. Currently there are no parts to add to your ship but you can re-arrange them and use button blocks to tie thrusters together. There is only one planet and no goal yet. As a personal challenge see if you can reach the edge of the stars and make your way back to the planet if you remember where it is.

DO NOT MAKE INFINITE LOOPS WITH BUTTONS (really, don't)

All feedback is appreciated.

Made using Ren'py.

"Hey there winner, wanna make all your dreams come true?  Of course you do but to do that you will need money, lots of it.  Choose a product and dominate that market but remember there are inherent dangers with each.  As your business evolves you will have the financial strength to use new and creative tactics to come out on top."

entries.description:
You have to eat prey, which in turn feed on red circles. They hide under black circles.
The AIs of the prey evolve through four or five stats.
To really see the evolution mechanism in action, set move speed to evolve on the menu screen and play a few rounds.
It's also interesting to set up various extreme conditions and see how they respond.

Good Luck!
