entries.title: Primordial Soup
entries.description:
Primordial Soup is (supposed to be) a multiplayer strategy game where you rapidly evolve various types of organisms in an attempt to dominate the environment.

It is kind of playable. We'll be doing some post-compo work to smooth out the kinks, and we'll make some official distributions. If you play from source you will need Python 2.7 and PyGame.

Thanks to everyone who watched and contributed! We'll be adding a credits screen once we finally eat something.

entries.title: Sheep Breeder
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare.  This entry was inspired by my wife, the sheep farmer.

Traits are handed down from the parents to the children.  Mean sheep tend to create more mean sheep.

Heavy sheep tend to create heavier sheep.  Weight is important in a market animal.  Heavy sheep also cost more to feed.

You have 15 year (15 generations) to breed the best you can.

Hit the ? for help and BG Music to turn the music on and off.

Oh and the x1->x2->x4->x8->x16->x32 change the speed when unpaused.

entries.title: Sheep goes to Space
entries.description:
Controls: arrow keys.

Sheep is tired of his sheep life, and wants to go to space to get some peace and quiet.

Made in roughly 6 or 7 hours.

entries.title: Star's Requiem
entries.description:
A 2D platform and space shooter game.
Unfortunately it's unfinished.. I can't conclude the story to explain the theme and explore the evolution of the characters.. but it's ok! :D

Also check these videos made in Saturday
Progress #1: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MtMpnA4aeNw
Progress #2: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LQSryBqOa8c

08/29 - I added a post-compo version. Includes correction in the text, skip button (space) for the cutscenes, made changes in the level 01 to be more easier, added  a level selection and changeg the shooting patterns of the enemies and the player.

entries.title: The Erebus and the Terror
entries.description:
This is a work of interactive fiction. In other words, no graphics and sounds, just text, like a novel. 

The Erebus and the Terror is a science fiction thriller set on the prospector ship Erebus. If you like reading science fiction stories or watching science fiction movies or playing survival horror games, you might enjoy it. 

The game was made with Inform 7. You can play it online with any computer, iOS device such as iPad or IPhone, Android phone or tablet, or pretty much anything with a CPU and a browser that has javascript.

Please let me know what you think. I am going to withhold providing the source code or any hints until the last day of voting. I really want to see if anyone can solve this one on their own without cheating.

I know it's hard to commit to the time and effort needed to play an IF game when most submitted games can be evaluated in a couple minutes. So play all the other games, with their exciting graphics and gameplay, and then later when things have died down and you feel like something meaty, come by and give this one a try!

entries.title: The Plane of Evolution
entries.description:
The world is de-evolutionizing. You are mass, and must survive this horror! Fight to survive, in this top down shooter. Fight off the things that have messed up our evolution. While picking up items and strategically choosing your next powerup.

http://sockmunkee.com

TRAILER!:D http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ttECMNHREM&feature=share&list=UUQ6oUdLZCYhJAaNCd4kUqLA

entries.title: Tiny Evolution Adventure
entries.description:
The Kongregate and Newgrounds versions are now improved post-compo versions. The Stencyl version is the original 48 Hour compo entry, please rate the game based on that version.

Post-compo improvements:
-Fixed bug that prevents level 2 exit from working sometimes.
-slightly adjusted controls and difficulty.
-Edited intro text.
-Bigger bite detection area.
-fixed level 3 parallax background.
-Added a counter to show how many critters need to be eaten.

--

Set on a evolutionary adventure where you must devour the weak and survive against 
the strong so you may evolve and reach the top of the food chain!

In this game, you must travel the stages and eat creatures that are smaller than you. After you have eaten
enough, you are ready to evolve and you need to find the stage exit to proceed to the next level. You need to eat around 20 creatures per level to evolve.

Use arrow keys to move and jump/swim
Use Space to bite.
Use P to pause
- and + to adjust volume
0 to mute/unmute
Esc to return to main menu

entries.title: Virus
entries.description:
Using Paper.js, with a bit of help from the examples.

Pretty unfinished. Just 3 more hours please? (:

entries.title: - EvoluTion -
entries.description:
This is a Html5 game built with Scirra's Construct 2 for Ludum Dare 24 "Evolution". Sound effects generated via sfxr, music generated via WolframTones. Kitty sound effect from AudioMicro free sound library.

----- o ----- o ----- o ----- o ----- o -----

Here it is, buggy but playable ! I strongly advice you to play the "Quick" class as the "Grab" system is still buggy as hell.  More levels were planned, but that's all I could come up with in two days, hope you'll enjoy anyway.

Move : directional arrows

Special ability : space

"Grab" class : Space to grab (very very close to a still floating item, except red bacteriae - only while not moving)

"Quick" class : Space to thrust (only while not moving)

Tip : Eat white cells to regenerate life, avoid red ones.

I planned to add more cell types, but oh well, maybe later.


PS : There's a secret 1000 kittens achievement hidden in the game - probably inachievable by human means though.

entries.title: A Matter of L and D
entries.description:
EXPERIENCE OPTIMIZED FOR THE WEB! The source package includes both builds.

Click on a creature to open up its character sheet. You can close it by right-clicking or clicking the X in the top-right corner. Be sure to name some creatures and follow them!

You can try to find out the optimal gene setup for a species by mutating single genes. Mutating a creature has its dangers though. Each gene ranges from A to D.

Strength - Improves your appetite

Dexterity - Makes you faster

Constitution - You'll live longer

Intelligence - Find food & mates faster

Wisdom - Avoid dangerous situations

Charisma - It's sexy time!
 
DISCLAIMER: PROCEED WITH CAUTION! A Matter of L and D is a horrifying tale of rape, incest, pedophilia and cannibalism.

entries.title: A Walk In The Park
entries.description:
--- Some clarifications: ------------------
- There is no "goal" to achieve in this game, this is more of a 3-minutes experience
- Just take a walk in the park with your dog, and let the story unfold
-------------------------------------------

Hello community!

For my third participation to a LudumDare, I decided to explore yet another genre.

After an action-platformer (LD22) and a puzzle-game (LD23), it was now time to make an attempt to create a moody experience for the player.

Since this is my first attempt to the genre, I would love to know what you think about it :) (also, leaving a comment will ensure that I play YOUR game. A win/win trade right?)

I used Flixel, my old synthesizer and audacity, and tons of dam... hem... tons of coffee!

Oh! Despite what your first impression could be, there is a link to evolution in this entry. I added a link explaining it, but please, play the game first!

I should also mention Jordan Magnusen and his game "Loneliness" (http://bit.ly/cfFfxM) as it was my main inspiration for this entry.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Apes vs Dinosaurs: Unnatural Selection
entries.description:
Nazis and dinosaurs meet Allied apes where tower defense meets card games.
The Nazis have gone back in time with their Nazi phone booths to send the dinosaurs against our evolutionary ancestors for some crazy Nazi reason!  You must help the apes defend their jungle with bananas and monkey poo against Nazi soldiers, velociraptors, and the evil Tyrannosaurus Reich.

IMPORTANT NOTE: 
The standalone link includes the exe and content folder. If it does not run, or gives some sort of XNA error, you MUST use the installer instead (or install XNA). This happens because you cannot run the application without the XNA dependencies, and if you do not have them the installer will get them for you.

This game plays like a standard TD, except that you place and upgrade towers with cards.  There are several types of cards, which determines the lower icon.

Lower icon:
-Wrench: Build tower/trap.  Play towers on open, non-path tiles. Play traps on the path.
-Arrow: Upgrade tower.  Play this on a tower you have built.
-Bolt: Affect enemies.  Play this anywhere on the map, it will affect all the enemies.

What the card does specifically is determined by the top icon.
Top icon:
Wrench cards build the following towers:
-Monkey Tree: good damage and rate of fire
-Peanut Gallery: faster but weaker
-Toilet Gibbon: slows down enemies
-Banana Cannanon: slow, powerful, and long-range
-Chimpanzer: good damage and rate of fire, hits enemies around target
Wrench cards also build the following traps:
-Thicket: slows enemies
-Pricker bush: damages enemies
-Pit trap: stuns an enemy
-Banana Bomb: does lots of damage to a single enemy
Arrow cards give the following upgrades:
-Monkey fist: damage
-Feather: rate of fire
-Reticule: range
-Fist/Feather/Reticule: All the upgrades of the previous three
-Toilet paper: Toilet Gibbon's slow ability
Bolt cards have the following effects:
-No-Nazi sign: damages all enemies
-Snowflake: slows all enemies

entries.title: Asteroid Worms
entries.description: You are placed in an asteroid field teeming with space worms. The worms are eating the asteroids to produce young, mutating and evolving as they reproduce. Your duty is to destroy as many of the worms as possible while you survive.

entries.title: Beyond Our Sacred Sun
entries.description:
Our sun has ventured near a black hole, which threatens to consume us. We must become a spacefaring race, the next step in our evolution!

----------------------------------------------------
Controls:
----------------------------------------------------
WASD/Arrow keys: Move camera
Hold space: Allow swiping with the left mouse button to move the camera.
Q: Map

----------------------------------------------------
This game was made during the last 4 hours of the LD compo timeframe, so it's very incomplete. I'll be making a blog post about why--it's a long story.

entries.title: Biotic
entries.description: I'm not sure if this is a game.

entries.title: Cave of Hungry Alien
entries.description:
Introduction:
You are a captain of alien spacecraft which guards ugly green monster lock down deep in asteroid cave. One day beast gets very hungry, like it is EVOLVING...

Controls:
Only mouse is used for control. Exit game with ESC.
Left mouse button for move and right to release the box.
Only one level, I hope more will be included in post-mortem.

Settings:
See settings.ini for game configuration. Note that to change resolution you must set desktop=0 (this forces desktop resolution).

For developers:
Game is written in C++/OpenGL/GLFW/Box2D
Zip file contains Windows executable and Source files. GLFW must be installed to compile under windows. I have used MinGW gcc but should work on other compilers as well.
Linux version contains prebuild executable for ubuntu. Note that libglfw_dev must be install to compile under linux.

entries.title: Darwin's Ghost vs. Science
entries.description: Darwin's ghost must rearrange fossils to test the faith of scientists.  Built with Impact (http://impactjs.com)

entries.title: Demonevolution
entries.description:
You play as a creature which aspires to become a demon.  Kill and eat all the minions in the dungeon to evolve toward your goal.  I hope you like it.

Genre: Roguelike

Controls:
Up, Down, Left, Right to move and attack
Comma key to wait a turn

Tools used:
Java with AWT and Swing.

entries.title: Evo Fight
entries.description:
Go nuts!

Update: Fixed Windows versions. Should now work without LOVE installed.

entries.title: Evolution of a Planet
entries.description:
Darn! I'm not finished! :-(
First I slipped in the Jam and then I still didn't make it. Just a few hours missing to being playable...argh, so close! I'll finish it tomorrow and upload a post-jam version.

Second Ludum Dara entry, this time from me alone. First time working with Pygame, which has been amazing!

The game: Your goal is it to recreate the evolution of the planet earth from it's early beginnings as boiling magma sphere to the evolution of life, humans and civilization.
You combine multiple Elements to unlock new ones. Just try it, it's easy!

PS: A lot of pictures are still missing, I did not have the time to create them for all elements)


Credits/Tools: 
- Coded from scratch with Python 3 + Pygame
- Graphics with Inkscape and Photoshop (with help from f-w with the title image, thanks!)
- Music generated with autotracker-bu
- Generated the standalone app with cx_freeze
- Title image is an adaption from here: http://www.flickr.com/photos/gsfc/7753691170/ (CC-by, NASA)
- The Font is "EB Garamond" from here: http://openfontlibrary.org/en/font/eb-garamond (OFL License)

Inspiration was this game: http://www.gamesgames.com/game/Alchemy-Evolution.html
Or actually another one which I played 1,5 years ago or so and can't remember the name.

PPS: I have no possibility of generating a standalone OS/X version of the game, as I don't own a Mac. The game uses Python 3 + Pygame, so if you have that installed, the source version will work fine. If you have, I'd love to hear from you. I'm still looking for someone to help me build the OS/X version.

entries.title: Explore, Evolve, Escape!
entries.description:
You are an evolutionary experiment. It's lonely in the lab. You yearn for freedom, but it won't come. Fortunately, you can make things easier for the next generation.

Gather DNA to gain new evolutions for your species, and one day you might escape. Arrow keys to move, S to kill yourself if you get stuck (I ran out of debugging time a bit too soon). There are multiple exits, and you're free to evolve however you see fit. Also, since you might ask, the music gets better as you progress.

entries.title: FOR THE darWIN
entries.description:
Charles Darwin must dig the soils of a Galapagos island looking for fossil evidence to prove his theory of evolution. Search for sequences of skulls and avoid your pundits. The more evidence of evolution you uncover, the bigger the points!

GO FOR THE darWIN!

CONTROLS: 
- Move / Jump / Dig: WASD
- Sequence Fossils: NUM PAD

HINT! Here are the correct skull sequences for both skull types:
http://cl.ly/image/392f371m1S3g

Programming / Design / Sound: Travis Chen (@travischen)
Art / Animation: Nolan Fabricius (@shiftlesshobo)

entries.title: Helix
entries.description:
This is a(n idea for a) game where you must evolve your DNA by getting more strings of DNA.

The game is not actually finished so there are no enemies. I don't know if I'll be able to improve it for the jam but I thought I would share what I have nevertheless.

entries.title: Kitty Breeder 2012
entries.description: * I added a Kongregate link. I spent some extra time to add leaderboard support but everything else is the same. *

entries.title: LudumDareEvolution
entries.description:
It is a fairly simple game. You have to become strong enough to beat the boss in level 5. If you are not strong enough to beat a level you can go back to the previous level to become stronger.
This game requires XNA 4.0 to run.

You can buy potions in the shop(Escape and then Shop)

Q: Quick melee attack
W: Medium ranged attack
E: Strong ranged attack
A: Use heal potion, heals 30%
S: Go in your super state, you deal 2x damage and take half damage
D: Use energy potion

entries.title: Mutate Now!
entries.description:
Here is my first entry for a Ludum Dare. 
I was too late for the regular competition (evolution takes a lot of time, right?), so I submitted it to the jam competition. 

It's not much of a game. 
It's more like a very short,slightly interactive cartoon/comic with minigame. But I had fun making it!
Winning isn't hard, nor losing, so try to do both at least once. 
Use the cursor keys.

(Edit) Allright it needs more instructions:  
Your enemy tries to kill all mutations (she doesn't like them). You can mutate normal lifeforms by touching them with your 'mutator'. If you have mutated all normal lifeforms, your enemy will give up for that time.
And yes, it is not always obvious which lifeforms are mutations.

The game looks at its best played in the standalone flash player.

By the way: I like that the scientist had his eyes closed at the moment I took the screenshot (typical).

(EDIT) I've also made a version with build-in help screen. You can press Esc for a popup screen with help. I'm not sure if it is within the rules so I posted it as an post-deadline update.

entries.title: Porte par le Vent
entries.description:
Porte par le Vent (*), a jam entry made with CraftStudio by over 10 people over the full 72 hours of Ludum Dare #24.

We hope you'll enjoy playing our game!

You'll need the XNA Framework Redistributable. If you don't have it installed already, you can get it at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

Controls: WASD to fly or left stick of your Xbox 360 controller.

There is no sound. Also, it's Windows-only for now, sorry!

Source project is online & available! Open up CraftStudio, click on the orange "Community Projects" button  and join the project named "Porte par le Vent".

You can get CraftStudio at http://craftstud.io/

Full run video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c54DKbZ5xKM (you might want to play the game instead though!)

Our awesome and handsome team members: pixelboy, farfadet, bilou84, Ether, DarkBren, rosalie, Mattht, elisee, Erwan0fil, Boubouldelaine, Canardu57 (and a few others who lend a hand!)


(*) The word Porte is supposed to have an acute accent at the end but the entry form doesn't like them.

entries.title: Rise of the Morbels
entries.description:
If the web link doesn't work for some reason, download the backup, unzip it, and open game.html.

Watch the entire evolution of a species from single-celled organisms through intelligent life, through the eyes of a hapless terraformer. This game is a little too slow-paced. If you've had enough of the current stage, press F1 to skip it.

Chrome is preferred. Firefox is okay, but it has some problems with the audio. Sorry if you can't understand the voiceover, it's my first time recording stuff!

entries.title: Selectra
entries.description:
Play as an alien Amazonian goddess that uses her super natural powers of reproduction to face down her rival god Belemnon. Complete with boss fight!

Post compo update:
You can now skip the mating sequence by right clicking the mouse.

entries.title: Static
entries.description:
Hello, thank you for coming, and I hope you enjoy my first LD compo game: Static.

The goal is simple: Create a work of art using a tv with random static as your canvas and remote control buttons as your tools. 

Static is all about seeing how ideas, creativity, and chaos come together in a primordial ooze that provides a basis from which art evolves.

Static: Create, Evolve, Enjoy!

The controls are all in game, but the basics are:

Mouse - apply tool (left - positive, right - negative)
Shift - switch tool
Mousewheel or Up/Down arrows - increase/decrease tool size

TO PLAY:
Simply download the .jar file and run it in java. That's it!

Please let me know what you think/how it could be improved and especially if there are any bugs you find. Also, please feel free to share your art and achievements in the comments section! 

Resizing: Static can be resized; the tv frame will disappear, but everything still works!

NOW ON THE INTERWEB!!! (Use Chrome for best experience; Java will ask you for permission to run, and you have to click okay; I'm sorry, but I don't know anyway around that inconvenience. Java Plug-in JRE 7 is tested and works. IcedTea will not work (sorry fellow penguinz)).

Achievements:

1) Artiste - Make an image using at least 3 different color sets.
2) Classiciste - Make a black-and-white image.
3) Moderniste - Make an image using the "All Colors" color set.
4) Hidden Message - Broadcast a hidden message to a friend using static.
5) Time Master - Make an animation using the fast-forward,rewind and pause tools.

License:
All assets and screenshots are under CC BY-NC-SA 3.0, and all code is public domain. Whatever you make with the game, you are free to use in any way you wish, as long you credit me and this game (a la CC BY 3.0).

Credits:
Thanks to Github, Eclipse, LibGDX, MuseScore, Audacity, GIMP, my family, Mitch and Mary, and everyone who helped to make this possible, including the entire LD Community, and especially fpMiguel who helped a wayward soul on irc. 
Special thanks to Thotep for his tutorial on LibGDX and applets, which made the new web version possible (http://www.thesecretpie.com/2011/05/being-like-minecraft-or-how-to-run-your.html)

entries.title: Unnatural Selection
entries.description:
The idea behind "Unnatural Selection", was that in the near future, those without money would be forced to fight for their lives in a spectator sport. With inspiration from the Hunger Games, politics, and the NES classic "Shatterhand", I was aiming to create a deadly arena that is constantly evolving.

Every 30-60 seconds, an alarm sounds, and you must return to the safe room. Once there, the outside will explode, and the arena will morph into a new, more powerful form. If you don't make it back in time, you die (or would had I finished). 

I unfortunately didn't get to implementing attacks or health, as the core mechanics took a long time to create, and I'm no artist, so that was taxing. All in all, I feel the project came out AMAZING for what I usually do in 48 hours, and I can't wait to carry on with this project and launch it for Halloween.

As far the the theme goes, the idea was a play on "Natural Selection". Additionally, the goal would be to evolve your skills faster than the growing arena, by collecting credit orbs which could be spent on upgrades. I didn't get that far, so for now, the evolution simply lies in the arena, and the play on Natural Selection.

Platform - Flash / AS3

Libraries / Frameworks - FlashPunk, My Personal Platformer BolierPlate Code (included).

Graphics - Can't believe I did that good. Photoshop, and practicing my pixel art. 1000x better than my norm.

Music - Composed during the competition using My Korg X-50 and Sonar 6 LE

entries.title: ANT FIGHT CLUB
entries.description:
Part of the game is figuring out what chemicals to bath your ant species in to get better, but what they do is unknown at the start. All you know is that the chemicals destroy part of the population of that colony. You also have to be careful not to kill off your ants by over-evolving, depleting their colony strength to extinction. Look for subtle differences in the ants at the menu screen to determine colony strength.

I added the random button in the challenge screen that creates a new enemy to play. This is just useful to level up your ants so you can take on the "hero" scientists.

This is my first LD48. I've been working on a port of FlashPunk for Android for the last few months and I used it for this.

entries.title: Antvolution
entries.description:
Linux and android builds coming soon (also ios and osx sometime)
This is my project, I couldn't implement everything I wanted but still this is it, an ant farm where you control have to survive from wild bugs

Its inspired by dwarf fortress but much simpler and with graphics :)

About the game:
All the ants (except the queen) perform all tasks (the nearest task), it will go outside not caring about the risks, so you have to take that in mind, if the ant is doing no job and you select an enemy to attack that ant will attack it and if there are jobs to be done attacking will be the priority, the top priorities will be sleep, eat and drink, if the ant can't eat or drink it will die

There are some tasks on the game:
1.- Dig, they will dig a tunnel
2.- Breed, they will grab eggs and bring them to breed zone (if there is no breed zone or if there is no space on it, it will carry the egg until there is an available breed zone)
3.- Food, it will take the food to the food zone (including food outside)
4.- Drink, it will take water to the drink zone (including rain)
5.- Attack, they will attack an outsider bug until it dies or you deselect/select another bug

The ants, if they are doing no job (not attacking or picking things from the outside) will search safeness in the inside of the colony

Game instructions:
The game has some buttons, they make the ants perform actions and set zones for stuff
1.- Pause - will pause / unpause the game
2.- Dig - Marks a zone to be dig (2 clicks, click 1 will make the start of the box, click 2 will set the end of the box)
3.- Breed Zone - Creates a breed zone where ants will put the eggs and eggs will hatch (2 clicks, click 1 will make the start of the box, click 2 will set the end of the box)
4.- Food Zone - Creates a zone where ants will put the food on a safe place (they will not eat on the outside) (2 clicks, click 1 will make the start of the box, click 2 will set the end of the box)
5.- Drink Zone - Creates a zone where ants will put the water on a safe place (they will not drink on the outside) (2 clicks, click 1 will make the start of the box, click 2 will set the end of the box)
6 - Attack - Will make all the ants with no job attack the bug (click on attack  then - cancel to deactivate an attack) (Click on the enemy bug to attack)

Features not implemented:
- Enemy bugs change colors on their evolution level (dynamically)
- You can set jobs to the ants (so they will not perform all the tasks)
- Tree enemies (enemies that will live and attack on the trees
- Mushroom farm
- Remove zone
- Heal/Hospital Zone
- Resting Zone

Bugs: A looooooot

Well I hope you enjoy the game :)

Final note: I have decided that I'm going to develop a new a complete post-compo version of the game as soon I have some time!

entries.title: Collect the Goo!
entries.description:
Instructions:

Collect the goo!  

Use the arrows or W, A, S, D keys to move and spacebar to jump.  

Visit an Evolve Station after you collect enough Evolutionary Goo.  

With each evolution, your dinosaur gains new abilities and gets bigger and stronger.

entries.title: EVO-001
entries.description:
EVO-001 is an old-school space shooter made in Game Maker. Unfortunately, the game ended up having little to do with the theme 'evolution'. 

My original idea was for a game where the enemies register player behavior and alter their actions accordingly, based on player weapon usage and location preference on the screen. As time began to run out, I had to make the decision between failing the Dare yet again or cutting these 'evolutionary' gameplay aspects completely from the game.

I chose the latter. Hopefully I'm not disqualified!

Default keyboard: Z/X - Fire. C - Change weapon. Arrows - Move.
360 Gamepad: X/A - Fire. Y/B - Change Weapon. LStick - Move.

The gamepad doesn't work in the title menu, but it does work in-game! If you have a 360 gamepad I suggest you use it!

entries.title: Hungry Flies
entries.description:
# Hungry Flies

Mommy has just baked a strawberry cake and it's cooling by the kitchen window. Suddenly, hungry flies appear to eat it, but  they are smart and can quickly evolve and learn how to escape from the bubbles. It's up to you to blow them up before they eat all your yummy cake.


## Controls

- Mouse Move: Move bubble gun towards the flies
- Left Mouse Click: Fire
- Right Mouse Click: Explode

## Development Notes

My intention was to place a kitchen window as background image and to place a cake by the windowsill, so the flies could come through the window and eat the cake, as the name of the game says. However, the short time would not let me do it.

I took the theme to the letter and the evolution is in the behavior of the flies, i.e. their behavior evolves as the time passes by.

NOTE: Google Chrome or Firefox is strongly recommended!

## Contact

* Email: renato.ppontes at gmail dot com
* Site: http://inf.ufrgs.br/~rppereira
* Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/renato.ppontes

Maybe next time I should shoot for something bigger, but I was just happy to have a nice little game at the end of this one. Look forward to the next LD and hope I am able to participate again!

entries.title: Mutation Flight
entries.description:
CONTROLS
========
Movement: WASD/ZQSD/Arrows
Shoot: Space (when available)
Burst: Enter (when available)

Look out for the prompts on the walls at the top and bottom of the screen. And selecting an heir means clicking on one of the eeny-weeny triangles that are birthed in that moment.


Mutation Flight is an arcade-style shooter casting the player as an evolving abstract organism able to self-replicate. Through gene mutations guide the ill-fated dynasty through an ever-more dangerous landscape of peril! 

Created in Flash using AS3 with Flixel, art in Gimp, sound with bfxr, music with FL Studio.

entries.title: Slime Slayer
entries.description:
This game is called slime slayer, you are a soldier who's been tasked with clearing out the dungeons of all the dormant slimes. Unfortunately, the second you walk through the door they all wake up, and start reproducing like crazy. Convenient that, isn't it...

Kill them all as quickly as you can before they outnumber you. You attack by walking into them, they can attack you when they walk into you. Your health is the number in the top right, the max amount of damage you can do in one hit is the number below it and your speed is the number below that (all 3 are in green). Click on any slime and the same set of stats will appear in the same order for that slime (in red).
The two blue numbers are to do with when you can upgrade. The top one is your total kills, the bottom one is your target. Whenever your total is above your target, click on one of your stats to upgrade it. Upgrading health will increase your max health by 5 and give you max health. Use your upgrades wisely, they become harder to get as the game goes on.

Finally the two black numbers at the bottom are the current level (top), and the best level you've reached in this session.

Sorry about the rubbish UI, I'm never very good at that stuff.

A final warning, child slimes are often much more dangerous than their parents...

(In retrospect, this needed a lot more balancing, but I still think it's fun! Level 20 is more or less peak difficulty for the record, though in theory it gets harder right up to level 150).

entries.title: Survival of the Leggiest

entries.title: Those Stupid Aliens
entries.description:
Top-down shooter where the stupid and weak aliens get replaced with smarter and more successful aliens as you destroy them.

I've been around for a long time, but I've only had a handful of successful (read: submitted) entries. This one I originally started for the compo, but I ran out of time and didn't want to submit an incomplete game. With the extra 24 hours was able to bring it to a satisfactory state.

The aliens start off in a more or less random state. The successful aliens get their 'DNA' recorded and used for future waves, weeding out the unsuccessful aliens and increasing the difficulty.

Check out my journal for the postmortem.

entries.title: Unnatural Selection

entries.title: Abstract Legends
entries.description:
Attempted to simplify a complex game like DotA or LoL as much as possible while still retaining some resemblance. Stripped out a whole bunch of features, and tried to keep the most basic elements. 

The result was a single, 6-cell lane with 2 heroes fighting to take down each other's thrones in a turn based fashion. 

Please take it for a spin. You can level up/evolve different parts of your body - hands will increase your damage, eyes will increase your attack range, body increases your toughness and HP regen, brains will increase your mana regen, and evolving your feet will increase your dodge chance.

It's in PHP (yeah... I know. I'm so sorry). I've uploaded a copy here for testing:
http://www.frozenlizardstudios.com/ludumdare/

Conclusion:
It was a really interesting exercise. I still think the resulting 'simplified' version is still too complex. 

Also, building in the rules and the mechanics is one thing. Tweaking the simplified form till it becomes fun as well is another thing altogether. I wish I had more time to do that.
Still, I had a great time rushing through my first Ludum Dare compo! Thanks for organizing this! :)

entries.title: Angry Fish
entries.description:
Angry Fish is a game where you (a fish) has to cross the ocean. You are attacked by bigger fish, but you can eat smaller fish. The more fish you grow, the bigger you are and the more fish you can eat.

You can choose to stay small and sneak through the bigger fish alive or to eat lots of fish and then eat the bigger fish to make your way through the ocean. It's up to you, you can cross the ocean big or small. You might have to adapt to the environment, after all this is Evolution.

It was made with Lua and LOVE. I made Mac OS and Windows builds.

Libraries used:
www.love2d.org
http://github.com/Kadoba/Advanced-Tiled-Loader

For GNU/Linux users, source is recommended. Just download the .LOVE and run it with "love angryfish.love" on the terminal. For this, you need LOVE installed. Try "sudo apt-get install love" if you are running Ubuntu or any Debian-based distribution.

-------------------------
IMPORTANT NOTES
-------------------------
Everytime you die/lose you have to restart the game (close/open). Unfortunately, I didn't have time to write my game structure in a way that made it possible to play again in the same process.

Mac OS X users can probably try: http://munchor.57o9.org/up/love.app.zip

entries.title: Battle Arena Evolution!
entries.description:
Battle Arena Evolution, presesnted by mkv25.net games. Ludum Dare 24 Competition Entry - Theme: Evolution.

If you have Haxe NME, it should build for cpp and mobile. Exploring those options shortly.

entries.title: Cellular
entries.description: So here's my little entry, rushed so bad towards the end so a lot wasn't added that i wanted added. Survive through 3 generations to be victorious. Smell upgrade is best for the second run. Hope it works okay, and have fun.

entries.title: Darwin's Survival of the Fittest Extravaganza 2: Survive Harder
entries.description:
----------------------------------------
Controls:

WASD to move
Left / Right Arrows to use hammer
Space to jump
----------------------------------------

The goal of the game is to see how long you can survive the hoard of enemies while the level 'evolves' (see what I really thought of the theme in my postmortem) to become more difficult.

This entry was extremely last minute, but I plan to spend some time polishing it over the judging period.

entries.title: DNA
entries.description:
To finish game you must collect all of the yellow thing on the (quite big) map.
Extract DNA from creatures using DNA extractor to evolute (upgrade) your skills.
Jellyfishes increases your swimming skill.
Ducks increases your air breathing and walking skill.
Frogs increases your jumping skill.
Pigeons increases your flying skill.
If you stuck (what can happen) checkout gameplay video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pqwbe-Ofp9c

entries.title: HumanTECH
entries.description:
I developed this game on OSX and was running into lots of issues towards the end with audio.  I never resolved everything, so just a heads up for OSX users.  Sorry about that.

I am a LOT more satisfied with this game than my first entry.  I was much more relaxed during the process, made better planning and time management decisions, and slept according to a planned schedule.  As a result I typed about twice as many lines of code as in LD23 and much less error-prone code.

Everyone always asks if I'd like to continue a project after LD.  Its appealing in one sense -- I like the theme and mechanics of this game, but I'm appalled at how messy the code gets so quickly.  I think if I was ever going to "build upon" a LD entry it would be a rewrite.

Thanks to my brother for testing and letting me use his windows laptop basically on demand.  And getting me stumptown coffee.

Enjoy HumanTECH!!

entries.title: Infestation
entries.description:
Infestation is a fairly simple overhead shooter with enemies that evolve based on your actions.  The longer they stay alive, the more likely subsequent enemies are to share their traits.  Stay alive as long as you can and try to get the highest score!

There are 3 different weapons to use (Minigun, Laser, and Rockets) depending on the situation you find yourself in.  There are also 4 enemy traits: Health (green), Speed (purple), Intelligence (red), and Swarming.  The last one splits an enemy into multiple enemies each with a fraction of the total health.

Its kind of difficult to tell, but new waves of enemies are generated based on the enemies that are currently alive.  So if lots of fast enemies are still alive, the next wave will contain even faster enemies.

I had a lot of fun at my first Ludum Dare.  It was pretty hectic, but I think I made a pretty fun game with more polish than I was expecting for such a short development time.  Hope you enjoy playing!

entries.title: life, undeath
entries.description:
zombies.

survive.

the city in quarantine. you are the only survivor.
your rescue team arrives in three days.
different zombie traits give them strengths against your weapons.
be mindful of which zombies you kill... each night, those that survive create zombies with similar powers.

controls:
WAD : move, jump
S : hold to interact
space: fire
1, 2: select weapon
X : next message

entries.title: Magistrate
entries.description: A town building simulation. Place many buildings, grow your town, and defend against bandit raiders.

entries.title: Moore's Game
entries.description:
Please use Chrome or Chromium if you have a slow machine (Firefox and Safari should also work, but may be slower).

I'm pretty sure IE9 won't work, sorry... It's all hand-written JavaScript, no nice libraries...

I ran out of time at the end (maybe not surprisingly) - so, there's no polish at all, and some stuff is really just badly done. Also: no audio. I hope you can still enjoy it!

This was my first Ludum Dare - I had so much fun! I'll be doing that again, for sure! :-D

entries.title: My Apartment
entries.description:
A game about the process of making a game within a small time limit.

Don't forget to share your score.

entries.title: Name
entries.description: Original? OFC IT IS

entries.title: Our FIRST Game, MiW
entries.description:
Well, we tried to do our best, but this is our first "game", we spend many hours with simple things...
We will work to make this game better and better, it was a great experience for us...thank you Ludum Dare. The next one will be so much better.

entries.title: Radiation Man
entries.description:
Radiation Man is infected with a rapidly-advancing form of radiation poisoning.  He needs water pick-ups to reduce it temporarily.

However, he can pick up stable mutations that grant him extra powers! (... in some future version)

For now, his goal is to pick up the mutation devices and evolve before the poisoning kills him.

Watch out for the radioactive jumping robots.

It all makes sense, honestly...
(but probably would've made more sense with a bit more time)
----------------------------------------------

This requires WebGL.  I've tested it on Chrome, and all looks fine; it does also seem to run on Firefox, but it's a bit slower on that on my machine.  I'd like to have had a chance to test it more thoroughly on different machines, but there you go.

There's not much depth to the game, I know - but it's given me some ideas and experience for next time.  As it's my first serious WebGL and JavaScript experience, I think it worked out OK :)  (however - apologies to anyone who looks for the pretty random code structure... was learning as I was going, to a fair extent!)

Thanks once again to increpare (Bfxr) and Greasemonkey (Autotracker) for their stellar work and contribution to the community.

-----------------------------------
Edit 2012/9/3: Thanks for the constructive feedback.  I've made a couple of quick fixes, and here's a small post-compo update with some nicer gravity, buffered sounds, and no ability to collect things after death :)
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/478847/radiationman3/radiationman.html
-----------------------------------
Edit 2012/8/27: I fixed a typo that caused lots of errors, and potentially crashes, in Firefox.  It's a change of four characters only - nothing more.  I've updated the link to point to the changed version.  Here's the original submitted version, for the record:
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/478847/radiationman/radiationman.html

entries.title: Run and Transform
entries.description:
NOTE : 
 - If game doesn't run, try getting the .love and opening it with LOVE (love2d.org, tons of LD48 are made with it anyway), I'm sorry but I didn't seem able to package it correctly :D
 - if someone launch the Mac OS build succefully or not, please tell me. I have no way to test it! Thanks :)

This is a simple run and escape game, with the possibility to transform yourself.
Without any surprise, I didn't have the time to include half of the features I wanted but whatever, this is my first Ludum Dare and first game I release, so I'm still proud of it :)

The game is short, but I hope it will be challenging.

It's been made using LOVE (love2d.org) with some libraries (hump, AnAL and tween.lua)

Have fun!

PS : to get the sources, rename .love to .zip.

Edit : Made a small update because it used F1, F2, F3 keys which are not usable on some keyboard. Now it allows 1,2,3 and C,V,B

Edit bis : it seems that sometimes, the game freeze on a white screen at launch. I wouldn't call it "normal", but if you just wait, game should start and run fine.

Edit bisbis : I made a post compo made of tweaks to make it more playable, get it here : http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/29/post-compos-tweaks/ (these tweaks has been made OUTSIDE of the 48h, the real compo is on this page.)

entries.title: Snake Evolves
entries.description:
This is the game for the "Evolution" themed competition. And it tells about game evolution.

The controls are standart - arrow keys.

entries.title: Space Mayham
entries.description:
CONTROLS
* Use WASD to move the ship. 
* Left mouse shoots primary gun 
* Right mouse fires homing missiles.

** KNOWN ISSUES AND WORKAROUNDS **
The game crashes if you use a low powered graphics card. Switching to a more powerful graphics card solves the problem.

Enemies can drop powerups. One powerup will improve your primary gun (firerate and bullets in single shot after four upgrades) and the other will improve your homing missiles (tracking and amount).

Every 30 seconds a new wave of enemies will spawn making your life misserable and each wave will be stronger than the previous one. If you kill the last enemy a new group of enemies will appear arround you. There are two enemies: Gunner (which shoots the blue bullet) and Hunter (which shoots homing missile).

*Requirements*
- Windows Vista or 7 (Windows XP and Windows 8 might work but are untested).
- x86 (32 bit) or x64 (64 bit) machine
- OpenGL 2.0 graphics card. 

*Updates*
2012-08-27 23:22 - Updated the internal name of the game and installer.
2012-08-28 23:50 - Updated the description on the site based on the feedback of others (thanks guys!) and added the timelapse.
2012-08-30 00:30 - Added a bug entry form and requirements

entries.title: SPECIES
entries.description: Humans have evolved into 2 separate species. The aggressive, dominant species are keeping the good natured species imprisoned underground working for them. You lead the rebellion!

entries.title: StarwingZ
entries.description:
StarwingZ is a racing game in the spirit of Star Roads, WipeOut and F-Zero; race along constantly 'evolving', intertwining tracks that rough up your journey with deadly walls and life-saving jump powerups.

The .zip contains an HTML that runs the game; I could only test it in Safari and Firefox so far (and Firefox is missing out on the soundtrack), so let me know how it works for you. Thanks!

If it fails to run, please give the Web version a try - sometimes browser security prohibits web pages from using files from the local harddrive, but is fine with files from the internet :)

entries.title: Treevolution
entries.description:
Story:

According to a forgotten ancient legend, 10 million years ago there were only 7 things.
The 7 things were:
Fish. Yarn. Buttons. Communism. Magic. Hats.

This was an odd legend.

From these 7 things, humanity evolved. And so did lots of other things...

Nobody knows for sure, but one popular opinion states that people grew on trees.

Your challenge is to outsmart evolution. Combine elements to grow trees, and evolve humans before 10,000 BC.

Notes:

Game play should be pretty self explanatory.  Easy to figure out the rules, really difficult to win.

Here is a spoiler to get you started:
hat + magic = rabbit



Credits:
For how to generate dynamic trees: http://algorithmicbotany.org/papers/abop/abop-ch1.pdf

Music is by Edward Grieg, thanks to Kevin Macleod.

entries.title: uni.bb
entries.description: uni.bb was made for the 24th Ludum Dare 48 hour competition by Harry Roy (Ligh7z). It was made 30-45 minutes shortly before the closing period of the competition. It is an extremely short text based game that has the player create the universe from several commands and objects.

entries.title: Zombie Scientists Had Too Much Kitten
entries.description:
Et Voila  !

Story :

An unknown Shadow Agent has implented K-pop augmented kittens in every Zombie Scientists from the Center Brain of Planet Mars. As a result all mega-neural-computers of said Scientists have started manufacturing a new weapon of mass destruction : the Random Evolution Bomb. These devices, dropped on our planet, randomize evolution of all animals within their range, effectively creating monstruous hybrids.

Of course, your hot girlfriend is the key to saving the world : here genetic code holds the identity of the shadow agent and the map to the Zombie Scientists weapon factries is tatooed somewhere on her body. Cut through the army of randomly evolved monsters and reach her to save the world !

Of course, you are naked.

Good luck. Kisses.


- on the map screen,just wait for the bombs to fall
- on the next screen, fight the hybrids with direction keys and space

I'm ashamed.

entries.title: the Evolution from zx81
entries.description:
The point of the game is to race on the ladder of the evolution... You against the chameleon.
Jump with Spacebar
Run fast with arrows- right or left.
Do not fall down, fight!
... or would you prefer to live in the terrarium on the planet ruled by the Chameleonus Sapiens, and to wash their shoes?!!!


//edit 
1. You can only die on the lowest level, as a bacteria, when you reborn, you'll hear the Bach "music".
2. The shark doesn't kill but paralyses for a moment. 
3. Every new hole is made by yourself at the momeent of getting your character on the higher level of evolution. Evolve in such moments that it will be easier for you to play.

entries.title: Adaption
entries.description:
I have no right to call this game my own. This game is your game. It evolves into what you want it to become.

That is, assuming you want it to be one of four distinct and pre-chosen genres.

Yes, that's right. This game is four games in one, although they all branch off the same beginning. Depending on how you try and control the game, the game will adapt to, in a way, fit that control scheme, mimicking how evolution is in direct response to the surroundings the subject is dealing with. In other words, the game is a creature, and you are its environment.

I suppose the goal is to try and find all the evolutionary paths, some harder to find or beat then others, and win at them. So do that. (Hopefully, you can beat all of them this time. Don't worry, I've tested it more than Empty. Meaning I've tested it.)

entries.title: Adventures of Hermanni
entries.description:
This is a small 3D-platformer with puzzle elements. Try to finish it! 
Walkthrough:
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/60485425/LudumDare/aohWalkthrough.PNG

Engine: Unity
Graphics: Wings 3D, Paint.NET and GIMP
Sound effects: http://www.bfxr.net/
Music: with a python script by Ben "GreaseMonkey" Russell http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/13/if-you-find-it-hard-to-make-music-read-this/

entries.title: AntWars
entries.description:
You control an ant colony. Get food and evolve those ants!

Keys: q, w, e, a, s and d will make 'new' ants stats better, stronger and faster in exchange for food . Space bar will create a new ant for 5 food units.

Use your mouse to select and command those ants!

Conclusion on this project:
I started a bit late (timezones) and didn't get any ideas for the first 12 hours of this jam. so t-36 h and no idea.
Then I came up with the idea of ants fighting from hive to another. Made some concept arts and it turned out to be quite an awesome idea. I started to implement basic functionality and realized that this is going to be too big. After that I tried to simplify this as much as possible, and after that simplification it turned to quite poor game :(, basic idea is still awesome - sidescrolling RTS with dynamic environment - but this can't be done in this time. So the lesson of this story. Plan and reason more before furious coding.

entries.title: Arctic Upgrade
entries.description:
An eskimo wakes up after feeling the earth shaking. He then goes outside to find out what happened.


-A puzzle platformer with a ability gimmick.


-Made in 72h for Ludum Dare.


-NES graphics and chiptunes.


-A secret ending! 

(Controls explained in-game)

entries.title: Bachelor Bee alpha release
entries.description:
The idea of the game is that as a young strapping bachelor bee, you need to spruce up your garden to attract a beautiful young queen bee.

To do this, you fly around collecting pollen from flowers, and spreading them to other flowers, which reproduce, with traits from both parents.  The difference between doing well and doing great is spending the time to maximize the quality of flowers bred.

This is an alpha release, please let me know if it runs okay on your system.  More to come tomorrow evening.  Windows and OSX binaries are included, no installer needed.  Unzip and run.

entries.title: Blobolution
entries.description:
made within 48hrs for the Ludum Dare.

movement is explained in the picture below.

EDIT: 29/09/12 | updated the links after migrating the files over to another server | thanks to sorceress :D

All of the links are portable binary's, just extract and run :)

entries.title: Breeding Cubes
entries.description:
You are a cube that likes cubes.
Find other cubes and make baby cubes, because babies only gets what best in their parents.
Babies are stronger than you, so take their lead and defeat hordes of enemies as well as the world's greatest challenges !

(This my first game, so I didn't had time to put sound in it.)

entries.title: Bugs
entries.description:
This game should be easy to figure out (Especially if you read the help screen!) except on spider mode where you press space to remove tiles, place spiderwebs, and harvest flies from spiderwebs.

To run the jarfile, open up whatever command interpreter you have on your system, cd to where the jarfile is, and run "java -jar bugs.jar".

If you get a "Failed to load Main-Class manifest attribute from ...", redownload it. I got lazy and used the same jarfile for the program and the applet. I exported the applet without any manifest to save some space, which causes errors when trying to run as an application. I uploaded a new version containing the manifest, so it should work now
When posting errors, please post in the following format:
Applet or jarfile?
Copy-paste entire output (The command you run would be helpful too)

entries.title: Cytosine
entries.description:
The space invaders are back, and this time, they're evolving!

A browser game in JavaScript using WebGL and HTML5 audio. Requires a recent Firefox, Chrome or Safari version.

Click the "How it works" link if you're curious what's happening behind the scenes.

entries.title: Do the Evolution, baby!
entries.description:
DESCRIPTION:
In the role of a evil multinational you must force some little creature to evolve to follow the actual food market trend. 
Every creature have his own dna string that changes due to casual mutation, adaptation to the environment, crossing-over between parents chromosomes. 

HOW TO PLAY:
Click to the creatures to view their stats and to slaughter them. 
Click to the lateral menu icons to give them food and to change the ambient. 
And remember to follow the market trend to gain more money.


EDIT:
fixed a crash bug

IMPORTANT INFO:

- you win if you reach more than $ 40.000


- how pressure/temperature/radioactive waste works:
if you place the radioactive waste in a cell
with some kind of atmospheric conditions, you force the
creature that goes in that cell to mutate depending on:
rain(high pressure): tentacles
ondulate waves(low pressure): chicken legs
snow(cold): moustaches
cloud(hot): horn

entries.title: Dinosaur Survival Bash!!
entries.description:
story:
======
this is a game about natural selection!
(which is the prime force behind evolution as we all know)

you play one of many little creatures, hoping to evolve into a fullgrown badass, firebreathing dinosaur!

it's survival of the fittest! kill the other - evolve!

you have to evolve into the highest form and kill all other puny competitors to win the game.

have fun!

controls:
=========
wasd: move around
mouse1: attack
q: fireball (later on)
e: sprint (later on)

notes:
======
originally I planned a lot more but as you might have experienced yourself - time is rather short. I wanted to include random mutation as well (being the other important part of evolution) to have some actual evolution going on in the game. however - that system turned out much too complex and I had to scratch it :(
(same goes for music ... I suck at composing)

entries.title: Evolve and Conquer
entries.description:
Evolve and Conquer, a 48 hour strategy game.
My Friend and i only had 48 hours of our 72 hour allotment, Our Sunday unfortunately was taken up by a Charity event.

Instructions are cycled around in-game before you start the game.

----Instructions----
wasd to move the game camera around.
click the hands in the menu to cycle through the playable maps.
Click an amoeba and move it to a water, ice or lava pool to evolve into the respective elements unit. Bring an evolved unit back to your (or their) spawn point to split the advanced unit into 2 normal units. Both you and the AI move on the same turn and the AIs plans are viewable by you so plan accordingly. Space ends your turn as does the green play button. The red x will clear the path of the unit you've currently got selected.
F1 To toggle full screen
----Post-Compo Instructions----
Hold shift to speed the game camera up.
some more anti-ouch code to prevent getting stuck in obstacles.
When clicking past your move allowance for a unit the path to the maximum possible move is created instead of the game giving you the virtual finger.
2 new maps to play with.

The aim of the game is to eliminate the other player.

Please note that the XNA Framework is a required download for the game to work. If the game fails to start please confirm you have XNA Framework 4.0 installed in Add/Remove Programs.

If you've had the time to mess with the map editor and made something great, Let me know and upload the file somewhere and i might add it to the distributed version. :)

entries.title: GAME
entries.description:
This game is called quite generically GAME it is a representation of the early days of video games.

You play as the lonely Paddle competing with its own kind for survival. From catching rain drops, to tossing balls around. Paddle changes from one form to different forms depending on its environment. 

This is also an experiment of using minimal(no) text to express what one needs to do, by using generic games I am sure it will be easy for gamers to pick and play this game. Although I feel this will alienate non-gamers, this is a safe compromise though because the audience who play these games don't fall into the latter category. 

Just a heads up to everyone the keyboards directional keys (up, down, left, right) are the only buttons that will work with this game.

Tools used are Visual C++ 2010, OpenGL, GLUT, GLEW, DevIL, and BFSX. DevIL is only included because i thought i was going to add images but I decided not to.

entries.title: Glider Drop
entries.description:
A very quick game I did up today that combines elements of Conway's Life and Tetris. 

There's only one kind of block in this version, and that's the glider.  

Keep as many blocks on the board you can alive.

There's not much to it as I only made it just today. There's no sound effects or other blocks or gameplays twists in this version... just what it says on the tin.

[EDIT] Known bug on Mac version: if you have Spaces installed, using the Ctrl key to rotate might accidentally cause you to switch desktops. Will fix this in a post-compo build. For now, just use RShift to rotate on Mac to avoid this.

[POST COMPO]
I noticed that when I play other people's games, they play mine, and a lot of the feedback I've been getting seemed like low-hanging fruits, so I spent a few hours this weekend making an improved version. Feel free to give this one a try after you've played and rated the jam version. 

Windows: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/19025642/LD24/post-compo/GDrop-Windows.zip
Mac: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/19025642/LD24/post-compo/GDrop-Mac.app.zip
Linux 32-bit: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/19025642/LD24/post-compo/gdrop-linux-32.tar.gz
Linux 64-bit: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/19025642/LD24/post-compo/gdrop-linux-64.tar.gz

- Changed the control setup to position the point where the blocks are falling to at the mouse position, so long as that's on the board. This allows for much more precise control than with the keyboard
- Eliminated counter-clockwise rotation, as it didn't seem to be adding much on top of clockwise rotation, and..
- Replaced that with a tetris-style quick-drop mechanic
- Mapped both the rotate and quick drop actions to the mouse right and left buttons, respectively. So everything is on the mouse.
- Slowed down the pace of the auto drop
- Added a stable square-block configuration, because sometimes you just want to put a block of live squares in the middle of the board
- Made the drop shadow translucent


Thank you all for all of your feedback!

entries.title: Goovolu
entries.description:
Action/arcade game made in blender game engine. Blobs of goo "evolve" over the course of a couple minutes. Your job is to survive.

Two game modes: Survivor, and Killer. In survivor, you can only run. In killer you can fight back. Try to survive as long as possible.

It's very easy for about the first minute of so until the final evolution emerges to fight alongside it's kin.

Controls:

WASD to move
Mouse to aim
Left click to attack (Killer game mode only)

Source files are in blender 2.64 test version 2.

entries.title: Guidance
entries.description:
This is a game of guiding your population of dudes through a simple world you create to evolve them to jump higher and run faster (and that's about it :p)

All instructions in game. Best run in 16:10 or 16:9 in full screen.

Made completely by myself - used some textures found on google and music and sound found on free-to-use resource sites

entries.title: Megavolve
entries.description:
Your gun evolves as you progress depending on how you play!

Controls:
Arrows - move
Z/Y - jump
X - shoot
R - suicide

Play a couple times and you might get different weapons!

The 1.1 version removes the debug command left in by accident, lets up also jump, and should fix the boss bugs.

entries.title: Pulled Out
entries.description: I Pulled Out (probably should of been in Jam)

entries.title: rEvolution
entries.description:
Sadly I didn't have enough time to add all of the features I wanted to.

I was planning to have the 'attackers' change over time, i.e. become more sophisticated, change in appearance, perhaps use some tactics. Sadly I didn't have enough time because this was my first time using FlashPunk (You'll see that the video is about 50% tutorial).
I also planned to make 'upgradeable' defences/weapons (Over time you'll be able to 'research' better tech.

There is a missing part in the video where I remembered that I couldn't borrow the Windows XP background.

Hopefully next time I'll be more comfortable with flash!

--------

The making of:
http://youtu.be/izbEnuN7y5c

entries.title: This Is Totally About Evolution
entries.description:
Run away from bats. It's about evolution. Really.

Suggested emulator is Mednafen: http://mednafen.sourceforge.net/releases/

Default key mappings for that are: WASD = arrows, numpad 123 = ABC.

C is jump, B is fire. I think.

EDIT: Silly me, forgot to mention a licence. I release this game into the public domain, source and all.

entries.title: Virus Hunter
entries.description:
- VIRUS HUNTER -
Evolve, or you will die. 
(Google Chrome Recommended)
(HTML5/JavaScript)

Features: 
16 million different DNA strands
16 million different Enemies
20 levels of non-stop action!

You are the Virus Hunter, a bio-mechanical organism sent into the blood-stream to eliminate all threats. Your job is to kill viruses, use their DNA against them, and eliminate the ultimate threat within. Evolve, or you will die.

entries.title: Xelution - Game of Time
entries.description:
Yeah,
this was my first Ludum Dare and it was nice.
I had a few time problems at the end but it was funny.
There are some bugs in my game but i had not time to fix them.

Hope you will enjoy!

entries.title: Assimilator
entries.description:
You are supposedly a silly, boring, ordinary nanobot created by Dr. Steve in an experiment on Evolution.
But you know you're not ordinary! Others randomly mutate and evolve while you pick the better options. Work your way through generation after generation, adapting to dominate as you go. Show Dr. Steve what evolution is all about and prove that you're not "ordinary!"

Controls given in help menus before gameplay (press Enter on intro menu)

============
BUG REPORTS!
============
I'm keeping a list of bugs to look into/fix, so if you bump into one that affects the game in any way, please report it! If possible, include when it happened and what you were doing, browser and OS :)

=======
UPDATES
=======
Sep. 2nd -- Introduced a new help screen with a different font so as to provide better game instruction and better readability, fixed ability selection so you can only select abilities you have unlocked, fixed enemies not spawning on retry after player death.

- Jonno

entries.title: Evo Smash
entries.description:
*Edit: Added a version of my game that you shouldn't have to install I believe. *

We present to you Evo Smash, our second Ludum Game Jam entry.

Take control of a species and lead your warriors to victory. Gather food by defeating enemies to create more creatures and use DNA obtained from fallen comrades to strengthen and evolve your species.


Sorry to those without Windows, but again we made our game with XNA as it was the only language we have any experience with. You can download XNA for Windows here. 
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

Download and extract the .rar file and run setup.exe

We hope you have as much fun playing it as we had making it. :)

entries.title: Evolution Stew
entries.description:
Evolution Stew! Gather up as many items as you can and throw them into the DNA Extraction Pool.

Items that are rare or take effort to get are worth more points! After the time limit is done, you can check out the horrible freak of genetic engineering that you've created and see a simple description of some of its traits, based on the DNA you gave it (in this world, even inanimate objects like chairs and phones have DNA).

Some items are best used on other items. For a simple example, try using cat food on a kitten! There are a few more combinations and a combination will always yield more points than if you used both items separately.

I want to add a lot more items and combos (and maybe more level area) during the jam, so if you have any humorous ideas for items or combos tell me in the comments!

Made entirely in HTML5+JS. No third-party libraries.

It should definitely work in Chrome, Opera, and Firefox (perhaps with some audio issues in Firefox). It probably won't work in IE or Safari.

entries.title: EvolutionWar
entries.description:
So here is my entry!

It is a strategy game, where you don't control your units.
You can make workers who will gather ressources and attackers who will get directly to the enemy base.

The main point is that you can tweak their genome.

This is done with the three columns to the right.
The right most column represents your current genome.
The left column represents the pool from which you can pick modificators you want.
The result is represented at the middle.

The pool appears progressively and you can make any change you want before it is reset.

When it disapears, you pass a generation and the new units you will build will use the new genome.



It may be a little confusing... so just give it a try... or two...




Some details:

- workers will die after a time equivalent to a generation.
- when generation increases, workers will have more difficulties to gather ressources
- when generation increases, modificators gets more powerful.


that's all i can think of right now! Have fun!



Updates:

- IA tries to defend itself
- Attackers can be spawned only after a while
- Units in the build queue can be cancelled
- WorkSpeed reworked a little
- Added the sources!

entries.title: EvoWorld
entries.description:
Summary:
World with simple evolution modeling. Watch randomly generated species, observe which seem to be the most successful

* Click on/near a creature to view its stats
* Generate new species with the new species button, see which survive to breed 
* Generate new terrain with the new terrain button if you get tired of the landscape.
Note: Terrain generation takes a few seconds, be patient

Stats:
  *TypeA, TypeB, TypeC: The creature's type represented by 3 numbers. These are converted to colors for display

  *Health/Max: When health reaches 0, creature dies. Initially based on size.

  *Food/Max: Goes down over time based on hunger, recovers based on digest when creature encounters food. If food goes below 0 health starts decreasing.

  *Water/Max: Goes down over time, recovers when creature encounters water.

  *Age/Max: Begins at 0, increases until it reaches max and creature dies.

  *Drown/Max: Increases when creature encounters deep water, if it reaches max creature dies

  *Decay/Max: Increases after death, when it reaches max the creature disappears completely

  *Size: Base stat used to determine many other stats

  *Speed: Maximum movement speed

  *Aware: How often per second, on average, the creature checks its surroundings

  *Sight: The maximum distance at which the creature is aware of other creatures

  *Wander: How far the creature will wander away from its algorithmically determined destination

  *Heal: Rate of health regeneration when well fed and watered

  *Digest: Ability to digest grass

  *Hunger: Rate at which food is consumed

  *Social: Maximum distance creature tries to maintain with allies (lower means closer packed groups)

  *Wary: Minimum distance creature tries to maintain with enemies

  *Fear: Threshold of type difference to identify creature as enemy

  *FearRnd: Randomization of fear on each check

  *Swim: Ability to traverse water

  *Climb: Ability to move up slopes

  *Breed: Chance to reproduce each second

  *Mutate: Drift of stats with each generation (higher mutate values decrease chance of successful birth)


Post-Mortem

My original concept was to make an entire ecology of randomly generated species with recursive stats and random mutations which eventually would cause species to differentiate. Basically, faithfully reproducing the mechanisms of evolution in a game. On top of this, I planned to either cast the player as a curator/hunter, who would hunt the animals for food and also try to cull them or lead them in order to produce a healthy balance of animal populations.

Obviously, I didn't completely achieve those goals.

I did, however, make a pretty good start, particularly considering the complexity of the idea (NEVER AGAIN) and the constraints of Ludum Dare.

So here's what IS in the game:

Random terrain generation: Creates height-map, populates it with water and grass

Random species generation: Creates stats within boundaries defined in code

Eating/drinking: I didn't have time to program meat consumption, so they all consume grass. If they don't encounter water soon enough they will start to die.

Species breeding: When two animals of the same species meet, there is a chance they will breed. This produces a third animal with a slight mutation

Species AI: Very simple, animals perceive each other and react. They will run towards allies and away from enemies based on their stat parameters. Species don't differentiate terrain at all, so be prepared to watch them drown themselves a lot and wander far away from food for no good reason.

entries.title: Growing Tree
entries.description:
Unfortunately I didn't have the whole 48 hours to work on it, so this is a very unpolished game, i apologize for that.

This is the first time i did Ludum dare , and also this is my first actual game :) , so you might not like it, but anyway I'm looking for your feedback, and wish you all best luck!

About Game:

I tried to make the player a growing arm of a tree, and water flows through it. You can use arrows to turn around the arm (don't keep pressed , press multiple times instead, as if there are paths), so you can avoid collision with blocks and enemies. As time passes, player will encounter with (in order) Fires, Bacterias, Bugs,Axe, Bombs and UFOs. 
I am not an artist to that is what i could do. But i hope gameplay is interesting, and will inspire people to do such games. 

My Tools:

Unity3d 3.4.2 (Basic)
sfxr
Musagi023
Paint.Net
Microsoft Visual C# 2010 Express
Blender 

Happy LD24!!

entries.title: Artificial Selection

I thought this was going to be a good game, but I give up. Sucking at art and lack of practice makes games suck, so I'm just going to keep learning and trying to draw until next LD and hopefully I'll have a decent game.
This is one of the first games I've ever made, aswell, I've made a warmup game for this LD and that's about it.

The game:

You can shoot(Arrow Keys) and move around(WASD). The only gameplay happens when you die, which is when you gain a random mutation. That's the evolution of it, wow.

If you do the Konami Code, you get a speed boost, shot speed boost and a damage boost. I was going to keep that a secret but it's not really worth it :P

Sorry for not being able to make an Applet, I'll try to make one next time so it's easier to play my monstrosity.

entries.title: Caveman Speak
entries.description:
Caveman Speak is about evolving language to the point it can be used by a community of cavemen to effectively accomplish goals.

You start out by trying to get various cavemen to complete simple assigned tasks. Each time a task is finished, the language evolves and more complicated tasks are given.

Ultimately, you use your stronger and clearly evolved language to more effectively hunt prey.

entries.title: Cows VS Wolves
entries.description:
COWS VS WOLVES

Darwin said the fittest survives, show those wolves that the strongest doesn't mean the fittest !

Lead your army of smart and beautiful cows and vanquish those silly wolves !

The goal is, at each level, to gather every part of DNA on the map. Each part of DNA allow you to improve your species and to make your cows stronger and gorgeous !

You first chose where to use your first 10 points of dna to start your species, then the game begin. There's also bonus stars that you can collect. When you've gathered 10 of them, you gain a bonus DNA point !

You can't attack wolves but you can defend yourselves. Put some DNA points in defenses to grow powerful horns and outnumber them by breeding new cows.

Each turn (press ENTER to end the turn) all your cows regain there Action Points and can move again, and they produce food, in proportion of their remaining action points. Staying in grass allow them to build strong food ressources and to go on expedition in the dirt, when there's no food and where they can starve and die quickly ! Also a well fed cow is a more resillient cow against wolves.

- Put points in Speed to have move Action Point per turn.
- Put points in Food Production to eat the grass faster and make more personnal food supply quickly.
- Put points in Food Consomation to have more starving resistant cows, that consume less food per turn.
- Put points in Defense to get bigger and bigger horn that retaliate damages to wolves when they attack your cows.
- Put points in Evade to lower the distances where wolves can see your cows.

Important - the remaining stats are not currently implemented and therefore are useless : Food cap, Temperature tolerance (also IMPORTANT : this one gives your cows a santa hat when 10 points are reached :-), Breed time, Starting specimens (I fixed it to 2 for this "release".

HOW TO PLAY
At the begining of the level you've 2 cows to place on the map. Press space then click. The rest of the manipulation is pretty intuitive. Still :

Cows produce food each turn, in function of the soil and in function of their own eating skill.
They store this food in their stomach but meanwhile they consume a part of it each turn. The more they are evolved in food consomation, the less they consume. A starving cow that has no remaining food ressource dies sadly.
A male and a female can breed a calf when they're both full of food. It consumes half of their ressources and put them out of action point until the end of the turn. Calf are cute and also defensless, wolves eat them instantly. Calves grow after 10 turns.
You can't attack wolves but you can eventually defeat them with a high defense skill. You can also blowk them with braves cow that will sacrifice to help the other ones to continue further on the map.


Notes : All made in XNA C# with visual studio 10. All sprites made by me with paint.net. The whole stuff is terribly incomplete, still I'm a bit proud of it : some parts are finished and there's 'something playable'. I hope I'm going to continue this : real levels, more ressources, more rules, component (temperature etc.), more enemies, a MENU and a decent interface, etc.
I started with a WAY wider idea about stuff evolving in environement, I quicky had to reduce the stuff to 1/2 main actors and I think I lost a lot about "Evolution", but there's still some part of it.

You need to guide the evolution of these cute fellas through disasters including; famine, meteor showers, mean predator kittens and cooties!
