entries.title: Doug Bones - Fossil Collector
entries.description:
You are Dr. Doug Bones, paleontologist, adventurer and all round dashing hero.

Edit: Added a play through video. It's a very short game and not all that interesting, but maybe people want to see?

While on a fossil gathering expedition in the jungles of Cambodia, you stumble on an alien invasion force - and only you can defeat them!

I ditched my original idea about 33 hours into the compo and made a simple platformer instead - which is why there is only one level.

WASD or arrows to move and jump, space to fire.  Defeat the bosses and collect the fossils!

entries.title: Dusty Balls
entries.description:
Dusty Balls is a platformer, which should hurt your brains a bit as it progresses.

Player controls mystical spheres which try to find a way through underground temple.

Each level is randomly generated, based on how far you are in the game. Better you do in the game, the harder the levels will get.

You don't need to get all the balls to the end, but you only get score from the balls that reach the goal. When you have played through nine levels you will see your final score.

Can anyone reach the magical score of 45/45?


CONTROLS
---
Arrows:
   Left/Right - Move the ball(s) around.
   Up - Jump or climb, if next to a wall.
   Down - Climb down if next to a wall, or slow down the speed of ball, if on the ground.

ESC - Go back to main menu(and restart from your previous level if stuck)



KNOWN BUGS
---

* When the ball gains a momentum it might fall through the floor to the void. You can press esc to get back to main menu and restart that level if this happens.
* Sometimes when playing on Mac, camera starts to shutter when the ball dies or goes to the goal.

POST-MORTEM
---
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/26/and-its-gone/

entries.title: Harvest Doom
entries.description:
How to Play:
- use your bags to plant in the planting area
- use your watering can to change the seeds into attack flowers
- walk over the well to fill your watering can 
- walk over bags to collect more seeds
- protect your flowers on the back wall from the mutants

Controls
- WASD or ARROW keys to MOVE
- X or SPACE for actions
- Q or Z for previous item
- E or C for next item

*Use your watering can to make things grow; refill it at the well at the top left*

I took the theme evolution and wanted it to play a role with both the audio and the game play however some parts I wanted to add weren't able to make the cut. I will definitely continue working on this and making a more polished game-like version in the near future.

Due to time constants this is more of a sandbox than a game. The goal is to simply stop the mutants from reaching your flowers. Good luck and enjoy.

entries.title: Ludum Labs Evolution
entries.description:
Play here:  http://finegamedesign.com/evolution/

Arrow keys:  Move.
Mouse:  Shoot.

Shoot all the zombies.
When you die, your player comes back and replays their actions.

A game made in 48 hours by 3 developers.

Ludum Jam August 24-26 theme is "Evolution". http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/rules/

In order of signup we are: John Wilkinson, Ethan Kennerly, Dave Alleca.

Engines and content creation tools: Flixel 2.55, Flash CS6, FlashDevelop.

entries.title: Natural Selection - You vs the World
entries.description:
Natural Selection is a side scrolling shooter where you are playing against all of the other players who have come before you. The game evolves as people develop new strategies and as more people play. Games will get longer the farther players get over time. Games will get harder the better people play.

The game is written in HTML 5 and Javascript technologies. Our rendering layer is Canvas. The game will run across a wide variety of browsers and platforms. To support ghost saving and retrieval we pushed our website and service up to Azure. Our database is running on SQL Azure.

All of the code is original, even the Math libraries originally imported were mostly rewritten to improve the overall performance and feel of the game. We also created more than 95 unique images for use in the game.

We experimented with social integration as well so you can "Like" our game on Facebook or you can "Tweet" your scores. We hope that this allows you to see how your friends are doing and maybe find them flying against you. Each ghost is tagged with your user name so when you first hit the page make sure you enter your name. Everytime someone dies to your ghost they'll know it was you!

The entire process took 5 developers a little over 100 man hours totalling 11,000 lines of code churn. A pretty intense undertaking.

Team Members:
Justin Nafziger
Ty Taylor
Justin Rogers
Christopher Kawasaki
Nathan Furtwangler

entries.title: OMG, GMOS!
entries.description:
Recreate the "disastrous" results of a genetic experiment with the livestock of Old MacDonald's Farm. Feed, irradiate, and poke "specimens" for the good of science! You can genetically modify, or evolve, your critters. For example, the game will support critters with 0 to 99 (or more) legs. That's pretty fun to watch.

I'm going for the "humor" rating, if you didn't catch that already. :D

I didn't get enough time to implement all the features I have somewhat programmed in, but I did my best. I'm pretty proud to have a product coming out of my first ever game jam -- it's not only my first LD, it's my first game competition... ever.

EDIT: Considering how much potential the engine has, I may continue work on it post-compo.

entries.title: rEVOLution
entries.description:
rEVOLution is a roguelike game created in under 72 hours by our two-man team (I was in charge of programming and WORLDTree of the Game Maker Community in charge of graphics). The music is generated via WolframTones.

The game features:
-Six Classes
-Six Enemy Types
-Many Items

Controls:
Arrow Keys- Movement. Hold down the arrow keys to keep moving in that direction.
T-Shoot (Requires ranged weapon)
Number and Letter Keys- Inventory/Augments/Abilities/etc.
F4- Fullscreen

entries.title: Richard Dawkins' Magnificent Microcosm of Mechanically Mutational Evolution!
entries.description:
Richard Dawkins' Magnificent Microcosm of Mechanically Mutational Evolution!
(Not Actually Endorsed By Richard Dawkins' or the Man Who Came Up with Alliteration...)

A GAME MADE(thrown together) FOR THE LUDUM DARE 24

Let us cut through frills and get to the important stuff...

Platforms
+========+
RDMMMME is Windows only. Sorry Mac and Linux people, that is what happens when I am lazy 
and use Game Maker (the cheap version which can't export to Mac or HTML5).

Story/Goal
+========+
You must evolve in order to take on the more dominating predators of your epoch. Once you
have reached the top of the ladder of evolution  by defeating the most powerful being in 
your entire mircocosm you are then declared winner and given special treatment

Controls
+========+
Arrow Keys                       = Directional spacial change.
S                                = Hold this key to display the stats.
Keys 1-9                         = Load game in one of these slots.
Shift Key + Keys 1-9             = Save game in one of these slots.

Game
+========+
Collect the upgrade thingys to evolve yourself.

Red = Health Upgrade
Yellow = Defense Upgrade
Green = Strength Upgrade
Blue = Speed Upgrade

entries.title: RUN DINO RUN !

entries.description: Made in 14-15 hours. I decided to finish it in one day this time, no I wouldn't stress about it tomorrow. Hope you all enjoy :)

entries.title: Survuzzle
entries.description: This is the Ludum Dare entry from FrosthPhoenix and me. In this sidescroll survivel game, your most used skill (green) upgrades and your least used skill (red) downgrades. Stay alive for 100 seconds and get all achievements!

entries.title: The Evolution of Revolution
entries.description:
See the evolution of revolutions over the ages. Command the revolutionary forces in a battle against opponents and conquer your goal!

Vitor Martins - Programmer and Game Desginer

entries.title: Think a Bit
entries.description:
Lifestory of a bit that just learnt to think and it's perceiving that his world can be made of much higher possibilities!

!!!>>>This is not a stable build of the game! This was originally a internal release for testing!
Unfortunately, the last has more game crashing bugs than this one! (crucial parts of the game still unreachable in this one, though =( )

entries.title: The Kittelutioning
entries.description: You are required for an urgent kitten research project in the field of instantaneous genetic manipulation.

entries.title: ThroughoutTheAges
entries.description:
Well, here we are, at the end of another Ludum Dare.  And boy did we do much better this time around  (compared to the last one).

The last game we made together was very much sub-par at best.  We felt much better about this game.  We all worked really hard on it, and we hope you can tell.

Having said that - we didn't get to finish everything in that we wanted to - AND it's buggy!!!  First, you can't die - you just continue to loose points - second, the enemies only attack you once you attack them.

So, without further ado, here is our Ludum Dare game, ThroughOutTheAges.

There are four eras in the game.  Each equipped with different enemies and characters.  Collect enough EVO points to advance through the ages.  The goal of the game is to defeat all the enemies and evolve into the other ages.

Keys - arrows or wasd to move around - 'E' a shortcut to evolve.

Mouse click on the enemies to fight - and to pick up items.

'I' is your inventory.  You can equip items and take health potions.

Not everything is polished (and there are lots of bugs and missing pieces!!) - but we hope you enjoy it none the less!

Thanks

entries.title: Transmogrify
entries.description:
Transmogrify is a shmup in which both the player and enemy evolve. The enemy adapts to how you fight it, and as the player you can add to your bullet pattern.

Arrow keys move, Z shoots.

This is an HTML5 game, in case anyone's curious. Part of the reason I made this was to test a library/engine I just started working on that's similar to FlashPunk. If you're interested just take a peek at the source.

NOTE: If the enemy seems invulnerable, get closer to it.

entries.title: A.D.A.P.T.I.O.N.: You Are What You Eat!
entries.description:
Face the challenges of evolution in this action packed side scroller!!!

Adapt to the environment by devouring the right types of food!
Hunt for meat or gather fruit? Bigger isn't always better...

-5 different enemies!
-6 different evolutionary states!
-Exciting boss fight!
-Easy to learn, hard to master gameplay!

entries.title: Able
entries.description:
If the game doesn't run - download and install Java JRE 7 from:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jre7-downloads-1637588.html

Move with arrows. Eat 5 fish to win. You may get mutated if you stay close to radioactive material (watch the speed meter). 
move player-up,down,left,right,o,l
rotate camera-w,a,s,d,q,e
rotate player-z,x,c,1,2,3,
space-change camera position to player and back
secret codes-f,g,h,4,5
press M to reset
there may be another secret special code-check your keyboard

entries.title: Bear Selection(Web)
entries.description:
Description: View a world, where creatures mutate and evolve by themselves. Their traits are passed onto their offspring, so watch natural selection in action or start some artificial selection by killing what you don't like. 

Goal: Breed 1 or more "Care Bears" and find the Easter egg animal!

Instructions: In Game

Browser Requirements: uses an HTML-5 Canvas, so it won't run in Internet Explorer.

The link is to the html page in my public drop-box folder so it may not cope with high traffic and is slightly slower to refresh. If that is a problem, please download the .zip file and run it from your computer.

Please comment your thoughts along with your rating and I will do likewise! Thank you for playing my first ever LD game! :)

entries.title: Bloodline
entries.description:
**EDIT** Small update to compo version, fixing critical non-winnable crash, and SLIGHTLY TUNING two other things (monster spawn HP and a little aesthetic that was bugging me). For details check the github repo.


In "Bloodline", you assume control over a small developing population. How will your creatures be mutated? What will they evolve into?

---------------

My first roguelike-like-like, heavily inspired by the work of Michael Brough.

Made with Flixel and FlashDevelop. Background images taken from photos I took on the first day of the compo. Pixels made in GraphicsGale. Sounds made with microphone + Audacity, and Increpare's bfxr.

PS I used git this time and it was a dream. I didn't really end up needing source control (thankfully) but it was extremely easy to set up a private repo and then simply push it to github when I was done. Highly recommended!

entries.title: Cage Flight
entries.description:
MUTLI-PLAYER ON-LINE SPACE COMBAT

(You need someone to play against!  YOU HAVE FRIENDS, RIGHT?)

CONNECTION PROBLEMS?  If its choppy, its likely the internet between you and my server in Sweden.  Not much I can do about that sadly.  There's no fancy client-side interpolation, this being a 72hr project and all :/  A server in Silicon Valley would rock!!

WASD+arrows+spacebar

Use arrow keys for pitch and roll, A+D for yaw and W+S for speed.

Spacebar shoots your lasers.

TEAM: Will and wombatica (aka 'Mr War') with timely help from Philip` (0ad dev) and lots of play testing by the Glest community!

TOOLS: pure Javscript client, server is Python, connection is a websocket.  Mr War made the splash screen in MS Paint(!) and makes models in Blender; Will codes in jEdit (which is a nice little text editor).  The sounds are text-to-speech conversions!

The control feel is simple rather than realistic; any lag is because there's a central server without any animation tweening on the client yet...

If our server is down for upgrade, just bookmark and try again in a few minutes ;)

links.label: set up your own faster server!

entries.title: Class Warfare
entries.description:
As a child you get abandoned in the train station, and are trying to locate your parents. 

Also because of overpopulation, the only way to stand out from the mass of people is if you are wealthy, and for every social class you move up there is a group there, making you average again. Your goal is to traverse the social castes and become the richest person in the world but if you take too long, people will fill the world and all hopes of finding your parents will be lost.

CONTROLS:

Arrow Keys or WASD to move
Enter or Space to select


<hint>
 -You are invisible until you collect a couple of coins.
 -You start in the top left on the first level. 
 -On the second and third levels you stay where you were the level before.
 For example, if you end level one at (400,200), you start level two at (400,200)
</hint>


By Gabe Ochoa

Enjoy! :)

entries.title: Darwin In Space
entries.description:
I wasn't really inspired by the theme but I thought the idea of Darwin-Ape fighting against an army of angry Priests in Space with bananas for the sake of the earth was pretty fun.
So I tried, but I couldn't do everything I wanted to.
It's my second game ever and it's pretty empty but I'm kinda proud of it, don't know why.

And I wanted to thanks the creator(s) of sfxr and Autotracker.

entries.title: Dr. X's Rainbow Arena
entries.description:
Top down arena shooter with evolving (creative, I know) enemies. Best played with a 360 controller but it can now also be played with WASD + arrow keys! Keep on evolving!

Dev log was kept at: http://publishingnothing.com

Tutorial strings for convenience:

"Green Arrow, its good you're here! You are needed again for the war effort! We've been breeding a nano virus but its taking too long.",
"We need you to get in there and shake up that gene pool!",
"Each enemy you encounter is spawned from the pool. When you kill one, it re-enters the pool and has a chance to mutate or split!",
"A mutation causes a new trait to appear in the freshly killed strain...",
"And a split causes the strain to duplicate! If the pool is full, then a weaker strain is kicked right out!",
"In case you forgot, you move around using the two joy sticks. Left for moving, right for looking.",
"Also use those two guns of yours, left and right triggers, to blast our nano viruses out of the arena!",
"Good luck Green Arrow!",
"- Dr. X"

entries.title: Gene Jumble
entries.description:
I started pretty late and found it very hard to get some
ideas to fit this theme, but finally i finished something.
Have fun :)

(If you use Chrome you might have no sound, sorry, couldn't find a way to fix that)

entries.title: Ivan the Infection
entries.description:
A game where you play as a germ (Ivan the Infection), who can develop immunity to antibodies by being repeatedly exposed to them.

You will need to have flash installed to play.

Thanks for reading/playing!

I have thought for a while that one of the best examples of rapid natural selection is seeing bacteria develop immunity to antibiotics due to the rate at which they reproduce.

Hope the game isn't as boring as the previous paragraph :D

entries.title: kinetic dream
entries.description:
Original Java 7 version here: http://ma.rtin.xxx/downloads/kinetic_dream.zip - I updated with a java6 port, hopefully that means that more people can play! The Java 6 version linked above is the exact same code, just compiled for wider compatibility.

A space shooter set in an abstract world. Defend yourself and the bioforge as you slowly change into something... different. Is this all just a dream?

My original intent was to create a game similar to Spore's first stage, but it sort of just morphed into this. I think that in an abstract way, it still sticks to the theme - with gradual change over time, too small to notice any any instant, but noticeably there.

Made possible by Slick2D, LWJGL, Wolfram Alpha, and sfxr.

IMPORTANT:

Install the latest JRE from here: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

Then double click the file for your platform - game_windows, game_linux or game_mac (note: I don't have a Mac, so I don't know if that last one works - let me know!)

If that doesn't work, try opening a terminal, cd into the entry directory, and run the jar with:

java -Djava.library.path=native/<platform> -jar data.jar

(for example: "java -Djava.library.path=native/windows -jar data.jar)

If you get an error about unsupported version - update your JRE from Oracle's website!

CONTROLS:

Fly around, collect coins, kill enemies, become something beautiful

Arrow keys/WASD to move.
Space to shoot.
P to pause.
H to show controls.
1-6 to choose weapons (as you discover them).
E to target the nearest enemy.
Q or ESC to quit.

NOTES:

I wasn't sure about difficulty, so you are pretty much invincible - unless your bioforge dies, you will just keep respawning.


sha256sum:
cd87aa1a323b98b4733cccd918366c89a6dd6d65fcbf4cc3fb5bd09d30fa34e2  kinetic_dream.zip

4af9c8bf8308496f44545c8d932afc10f99a7973d797b44dd95358ac7b27a4ae  kinetic_dream_java6.zip

entries.title: Legacy of the Cavemen
entries.description:
This is a 2 player versus game about the history of human evolution.
Contains pixel nudity.

entries.title: Magna Systems Inc.
entries.description:
Magna Systems Inc. is proud to present our state of the art robotic tank.The deluxe mechanical relay-based brain is easily configurable for maximum productivity on the job site.

The Magna Systems Robotic tank has built-in memory cells allowing you to program actions into the tank for different situations. There is also a parameter panel that allows modification of several key tank parameters.  With these and many other features, we're sure you'll find that it is a joy to evolve your SLT-2200R Robo-Tank into the workhorse you'll love.

The goal in this training simulation is to retrieve all gold boxes from each level and spend as little time in "Manual Mode" as possible. If you spend more time in manual mode than the level's par time, you will have to play the level again.

When a level loads it is recommended that you press the spacebar and put the tank in auto pilot mode. When a condition occurs that requires your attention, the tank will switch back into manual mode. Check the Action text at the bottom of the screen. If it is visible, it will tell you if an action needs to be recorder. To record an action, simply press 'R' until the "Mode" indicator indicates record mode. Perform the desired action, then either hit spacebar, or 'R' again to return. When an action is recorded for a condition, anytime the autopilot encounters that condition again, it will playback your recorded moves.  Note: Recording an action counts towards your Manual mode time.

Controls: 

<Spacebar> Toggles between manual mode and auto pilot
E: Erase a previously-recorded action. (This can be done 
   in either mode.)
<ESC>: Returns to intro screen
S: Restarts a level
P: Pause the game and access the tanks configurable parameters (these changes persist across levels)

In Manual mode:

Arrow Keys: Movement
F: Fire (you can kill turrets with 3 shots)
R: Record a control sequence for the currently shown action (if no action is shown, record mode cannot be entered)

Remember, each level (except the last) has a maximum par time that you must be under in order to advance.

entries.title: Oculus Battalion
entries.description:
Capture enemy slimes and eyeballs to use as your own soldiers in this wave based horde surivival game. Captured enemies can be fed to level up and evolve into stronger forms.

Source:http://dl.dropbox.com/u/4595251/oculus_battalion_src.zip

Post Compo Edits:
-Fixed npc glitch

-Added labels to indicate the level of monsters

-Added Mouse Inversion

Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SkyNh5WYjjQ

Note: I'm aware that there is a slight bug that allows the player to have more npcs than allowed and occasionally leads to  npcs disappearing.

entries.title: Rise of a Colony

entries.title: Shit! It's evolving
entries.description:
A raycasting-based software renderer driving a very short first-person-shooter.

Story (if you need one): Security Officer Barneby gets back from vacation to Mars City's Research Facility for Slimy Slime (RFSS). What he finds is... well, you have to find out yourself.

UPDATE: Added a no-audio version as there is a problem for some people when loading the game. If the normal Web-version does not work, try this one.
UPDATE 2: Thanks for the tip entrusC. I guess the audio-bug during loading could be fixed now.

The JAR file contains the sources.

If you don't want to use the web-link. Download the JAR file and start from the commandline with "java -jar LD24.jar".

entries.title: Stadium of the Kernel
entries.description:
This is a collaboration between oldtopman and jamiebell.
oldtopman wrote all of the code, providing some rather clever tricks, but ran out of time before he could cure cancer.
Jamie wrote all of the music, and failed to finish recording the Cincinnati Pops Orchestra before our time ran out.

oldtopman: I've been into ascii for almost a year now. There's a certain elegance to be had when there's nothing there but imagination. Not that it looks bad either, lots of information can be said in a small space when you know what corresponds to a letter.

Jamie: I dug making the sound effects and music for this! I made the all of the "in-computer" sound effects exclusively using Pro Tools's signal generator, layering square/sawtooth waves and white noise, which was a super fun exercise in manually doing what sfxr could do in a single click (heh!). The music uses samples from a Final Fantasy 6 soundfont run through Kontakt 5, and I really think when that FF6 timpani comes in, there's an otherwise buried part of my childhood that rushes back with each hit. Pretty cool to have these instruments of mass nostalgia at my fingertips, I love it! I don't really know what else to put here but please enjoy the battles! :)

entries.title: Stickmada
entries.description:
Controls
Movement: [Arrow/Cursor] keys
Jump: [Z]
Attack: [X]
Pause: [Enter]

Kill enemies to collect Spirit Coins, which replenish your health and help you grow stronger!
Collect all 8 weapons and upgrade them to unlock their full potential!
Find all four hidden cities, one of which is guarded by
a powerful hybrid evolution of man and monster and cat!

Close this window with [Escape]
Close the game with [Escape]

Have fun, and go explore the massive world we've created!

entries.title: Super Conga Kat
entries.description:
I didn't find much inspiration in the Evolution theme, so after wasting a few hours procrastinating over what to make I decided to try my hand at the 1000 Kittens theme instead!

I'm going to claim my tenuous link to Evolution is that you play a highly evolved problem solving cat that must rescue all the lesser evolved problem solving kittens! ;)

UPDATE: I've uploaded a DX9 version now.

entries.title: The Devil's Lie
entries.description:
Control Satan's minions and help spread the heretical theory of evolution among the world's population.

Gameplay is fairly simple and high-score-based. The easiest way to describe it is "landmine defense," except instead of blowing up soldiers you're misleading creationists. The miners spawn faster and faster over time until they overwhelm your defenses and expose your trickery.

Most of the following can also be found on the in-game rules screen.
-Controls: A/D to move, Space to fire
-Charge your shots to launch them further upward
-Overcharged shots create more convincing fossils, worth more points (1/3/5)
-Landing a shot directly in front of an incoming miner is worth bonus points (2/6/12)
-Hitting or failing to distract a miner temporarily raises suspicion
-A flashing suspicion bar means the next hit will defeat you

Code: AS3, Flixel, FlashDevelop
Graphics: MSPaint, GIMP
Sound: sfxr, Reaper, Audacity

entries.title: The Fromagist
entries.description:
Seriously... I pulled this off?


EDIT: Now that I've slept a bit, I can comment a bit more...


Really this was meant to be an exercise in plot writing to see how well I could do in that regard. I knew due to my lack of time (over half the 48 hours were accounted before due to prior engagements... oops!) text-adventurey type thing was pretty much my only route to an entry.

Twine is pretty awesome, if you're into this sort of thing. I found it very easy to add in variables and whatnot, although unfortunately there's no "else if" type of scripting in there - something that made implementing the endings an exercise in "Screw it - just list 'em all!"

With some more tweaking to twine, and addition of some sort of inventory and combat mechanics (beyond simple variable storage) I could see it really being the best way to make online Zork-like games. 


Next game I'd love to do one with actual graphics. I had designs of doing little silly doodles to add along with all the passages but time cut me short on that front.

This was really fun to make, and hope to have a much better entry next time around. This is silly, and barely touches on evolution (that theme really threw me for a loop) but it's here and it's done. I have a game I can literally say I made, even if it's simple and only takes a few minutes to play. :)

-ABP03

p.s. if anyone knows where I can put the actual twine file for my source, let me know. I think technically I'm violating Compo rules but couldn't find a proper host in time.

Its not the best game in the world but at least i tried to make a game and im so happy, btw all your games are awesome guys :D 

To play you need have XNA 4.0 . and not all the computers are supported idk why :\ ... if someone knows plz i need help :)

entries.title: The Singularity is Here!
entries.description:
The Singularity is Here!
========================

Update: v55 [7e69767]
48 Hour Compo Entry is tagged v1.0 in GitHub.

Post-Compo:
Windows 32 (15.6MB): http://goo.gl/70wq1
Windows 64 (15.9MB): http://goo.gl/WAAIC
OS/X (24.5MB): http://goo.gl/Xs6JB
Love (13.8MB): http://goo.gl/i2ScR
Source: https://github.com/josefnpat/LD24

Timelapse:
==========

1/2: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=onsbQIxvg-k
2/2: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M4jLo8cJ9iA

Description:
============

The year is 2045, and the singularity is here. Machines have evolved, and
they're gunning for us. Ray Kurzweil predicted it, but he didn't imagine that
it would start an armageddon between man and machine. Our three heroes, 
Kurtz, Tuxxer and Charlie, set off in a daring do or die adventure to destroy
the central computer which runs all of the AI.

Destroy the evil AI ships so you can plant the nuke at the central computer.
You have three unique lives to do so.

The game has three subtle modes:

Easy: Finish the game. Everyone is expendable.
Medium: Finish the game only losing one comrade.
Hard: Finish the game with the whole team in one piece.

Hints:
======

* Use your movement keys to avoid the falling bullets.
* Space to shoot!
* +1pt for every hit!
* -1pt for every miss.

Featuring:
==========

* Three original almost-human characters made in GIMP!
* 13 original things that look like spaceships made in Alchemy!
* Original music made in LSDJ!
* Over 35 unique sound bytes made by one voice actor! (There's 36)
* Tons of fun dialog that will make you think twice about your life!
* Awesome slash screens that will make you pee your pants!
* Beautiful dynamic menus with three different backgrounds!
* Font made with tons of pixels in fontstruct.
* Awesome sound effects effortlessly generated with bfxr using all eight bits!
* Wild and Crazy 3D like moving background thing that will eat your CPU!

Warnings:
=========

**If you are running OS/X, you may find that it will lag.**
To fix this, disable SFX in the main menu!

entries.title: Tokemon! VI : Struggle for eternity
entries.description:
Well, here it is!
TOKEMON is much like a clone of the famous nintendo game, BUT this one is in real time! AND you make your tokemon evolve manually with a super-duper-mini-game! 

There are two major features in the game:
 - "Real time" combat
 - Awesome Dna gathering with shooter-like controls

We didn't have much time for music and sounds as there was a lot of work already. The stats and attacks may be unbalanced.

If people like the concept, multiplayer may show up!
Enjoy!

entries.title: Cell War
entries.description:
I couldn't finish all the anticipated gameplay so this is just a simple 'demo' of two cells that are enemies trying to eradicate the each other from the playing field. Their default behavior is to look for the closest/highest value target, be it food or enemy.

You can also control where they go using your mouse by highlighting certain cells and right-clicking at the desired destination. You can use the CTRL key to highlight independent groups.

If you wish to restart, simply press R

Must have at least Java 6 to run.

Artist: razorquick
Music: popsi

entries.title: Chromasome
entries.description:
Update 3:

I've been experimenting with the gameplay some more and put up a new version (post-jam, above).

- More intuitive, less twitchy controls!
- High scores!
- Time limits!
- Combos!
- Infinite levels!
- 100% less random crashes!

Obviously don't vote based on this one, but feel free to try it out and let me know what you think, or post your high score (I've gotten to 1092558).

-----

Update 2:

I just found a bug I'd introduced at the last minute that was causing things to be randomly deselected (and making selection in general particularly annoying).
Windows and Android are fixed now, the rest coming soon...

-----

Update:

32-bit linux and windows builds are now up:
- Windows is rebuilt for 32-bit, which should run on either
- the linux download contains both 32/64 bit executables

So if you were one of the people who tried on XP and wanted to try again, it should work now.  (and, thanks for reporting it, @infinitedog and @AMSmirnov)

Some tips, having watched a couple people play it now:
- Try to keep your blobs mostly one color.  If you're getting 'dead pixels' and don't know why, it's because you're mixing too many different colors.
- You need to collect a certain count of each color to advance to the next round, watch the numbers at the top to see what to go for next.
- If you've got something selected and you just want to look around, click off the current selection first (otherwise you'll end up throwing it).

In general, I think the goals need to be simpler and read better, and input needs to be more predictable.  I also have some ideas for how to possibly turn this into more of a puzzle, and remove some of the frustrating bits.

I will be iterating on this idea to try to turn it into more of a complete, polished game, and hopefully taking it to the app stores.  If you're interested in seeing what becomes of it, you can follow my company at:

http://controlledpanic.com/
http://facebook.com/controlledpanic
http://twitter.com/CtrlPanic

Thanks everyone!

-----

Hi all,

First Ludum Dare, and I'm using an engine that was built from scratch (no middleware) over the last month.  I'm pretty happy with what how much I was able to accomplish from where I started.

The connection to the theme is tenuous, near the end the gameplay evolved from what I was originally planning to something a bit more 'gamey' for the sake of trying to be fun.  And there's a lot of polish and tuning I didn't have time to get to, but I'm happy that it's fairly complete.

I think this plays best on tablets (most of the development was done on a kindle fire), but it should run on any android phone as well, or pc.

entries.title: Cowvolution: Revenge of the milk
entries.description:
Cowvolution: Revenge of the Milk
================================
Game for Ludum Dare 24. The theme is evolution. If you're on Linux or Mac OS X, you must install love2d first.

Background Story
----------------
For years, we have treated cows as our belongings. We locked them up 
in cages, held them in captivity, and milked them dry. All that time, 
we were unaware that they were waiting for their savior.

In an ancient prophecy by Cowstradamus, it was foretold that one cow 
would rise up to make a difference and liberate the bovine species from 
the evil clutches of mankind.

And now, one cow has appeared that is slightly different from the 
others; he is the One Cow. One Cow to rule them all. And in his heart, 
he thinks: "What is a man? A miserable ape!"

About the game
--------------
A humoristic semi-stealth game, in the vein of the first Metal Gear 
or the classic Castle Wolfenstein.

At the start screen, press any key to begin the game.

The goal of the game is to kill all the humans. If they see you, they will
come toward you. Press space to shoot milk.

entries.title: Darewin's Missing Link
entries.description:
This was my second Ludum Dare participation and it was awesome. Had a lot of fun, learnt a lot... Anyway, inspiration wasn't the best 'cause I really wasn't expecting this theme so I ended up with some "jumping scroller". It's simple but kinda fun. I spent most of the time drawing animations which was exhausting but it paid off.

You start as a young Darewin (e is on purpose!) and you get older as you progress through the game. You just run and jump, run and jump, run and jump... There are four bosses which you have to pass and in the end there's a little secret for all you game makers which I hope you'll understand. :P 

Thank you Ludum Dare community for your awesomeness and fun!

*If it doesn't run, try downloading the jar, and running command "java -jar LD24.jar". You must be in the same directory as jar.

entries.title: Darwinicide aka Charles Darwin versus the Catholic Church
entries.description:
This is my 'video game' although I prefer the term 'interactive experience' or simply 'interactive art'. It explores the philosophical conflict in our society between rationality and irrationality or according to other between our spiritual side and materialism. I refer of course to the conflict between science and religion.

I warn you now this game will be confronting, it will take you on a journey through the oppression of a brilliant mind as it is forced to conform to the Church's orthodoxy and rebels against the boundaries imposed upon it. So please sit back and prepare yourself for the emotional roller coaster ride that is Charles Darwin versus the Catholic Church (also known as Darwinicide).

Controls:

Player 1
wasd- move
space- shoot

Player 2
arrows- move
ctrl- shoot

Credits:
Game design and coding: Robert Reed
Graphics: Colin Capurso
Music: Joshua Douglass

A jamalaide production for more games and info on jams in Adelaide go to http://www.jamalaide.org.au/

Edit: I fixed a bug where your beard gets caught and added a loading screen post jam, yell at me in the comments if you feel this was too much editing.

entries.title: Dig, Jesus! Dig!
entries.description:
A truthful reenactment of the time roughly 9000 years ago when God and Jesus buried loads of Dinosaur bones as a big joke.

Sort of a cross between The Incident and Terraria.

"Inspired by historical events and characters, this work of fiction was designed, developed and produced by a multicultural "...person..." of various religious faiths and beliefs."


Known Bugs:
  --  If you miss a Dinosaur and it explodes into green dust, occasionally God will get a bit miffed and decide you don't deserve all the dinosaurs currently falling.
   -- Occasionally, if you jump through a dirt block at the right angle Jesus will go for what looks like a nice leisurely roller-skate over the ground.

(If the game looks horribly blurry please try a different browser, Safari and Firefox work but I think Chrome has regressed)




Also, to view source just press "view source"...it's all on one page (bleh).

If you would like to, PLEASE do go ahead and vote for it on Kongregate: (http://www.kongregate.com/games/HedonismGames/evolutionator) This way those who want to participate in the other side can do so, and those who don't (and don't want ads) can avoid it!

entries.title: Foodvolution
entries.description:
A basic platformer where eating different types of food instantly evolve your character so that he moves slightly different. Eat a lot of meat, and you'll move faster. Eat a lot of carrots and you'll jump higher. But each item has negative side effects as well...

Stupid tiling collision took way longer than it should (and it's still a little glitchy), so I didn't get as far as I'd hoped. I do wish I had added at least one extra level... it's really just a tech demo at this point.

No sounds or music, so don't turn your speakers up to hear it :P

entries.title: Get Your Cell Together
entries.description:
You play as a human cell trying to evolve and multiply yourself. 
Become something greater!

10 Challeging levels.

entries.title: Hortus
entries.description:
Humanity and all life on Earth is extinct.
Only an an orbiting bio-engineering facility for exactly this case are left. You are the AI governing this facility. Find suitable worlds and send seed-ships containing replicators there to hopefully start evolution on these worlds - so that at least DNA-based life may continue to exist in the universe.

----

Don't expect too much - I didn't have any brilliant ideas about the actual gameplay, so there is close to none. There are albeit some stars, planets, UI elements, etc. The best is probably the (simple) music ^^

Also all of this was done with a fever and in a very bad shape. But I had fun making it, as tiny as it is.

----

I do love GA, but somehow I decided to try something different.

entries.title: Hungry Blubb
entries.description:
Well, we've got something. It didn't meet our original idea but it's at least playable and you can win it despite not being able to lose the game...

Our idea was a small alien that feeds on stuff and continues to grow and evolve. We wanted to do a couple levels and eventually have it where the alien grew to the size of a building, we didn't get anywhere close to that...

*HINT* You need to get bigger before you're able to eat the ants.

*Okay, apparently the eating button only works with RightAlt and not LeftAlt as well...*

entries.title: Karl
entries.description:
This is our Ludum Dare #24 Jam Entry.

In the year of our Lord 2012 a human being is sitting at his desk. This human being is called Karl.
Since the very beginning of his unpleasant life Karl had nothing to do than sitting at this very desk and playing video games / doing computer stuff.
He often feels this strange sensation, that something in his life is just... wrong.
Help Karl to evolve! Lead him through his life to fix it. Lead him to evolution. Even Karl can find someone to grow old with.

Unfortunately we ran out of time while making this game, which means that many possibilites stayed unused.
And Karl doesn't have a loading screen, which means that starting the game can take some seconds with nothing on screen.

Nevertheless: have fun with our game!

entries.title: Petri Dish - an exercise in Artificial Selection
entries.description:
This was inspired by the episode One Voice in the Cosmic Fugue. in the Cosmos series. I've learned about the Heike Crabs and how their shells were shaped over time to resemble the faces of Japanese warriors. I've created a simulation where cells of different hues are floating around in a square petri dish. If you hold down the mouse button and drag over the cells, they would be killed and instantly be replaced by a copy of a random cell, thus representing the offspring that would replace it. Eventually, if you're selective in your approach, you'll end up with a field of similar cells. You'll also notice that it gets easier to change the cells to their desired characteristics as you get to the end.

This project was created with help from Foundation HTML5 Animation with Javascript by Billy Lamberta and Keith Peters. I also referenced a function to convert HSV to RGB from Nan C. Schaller.  Due to the nature of Dropbox, all of the source code is inside the HTML file.  All you need to do is view the source from your favorite browser.

entries.title: Squid-wyn Happily Cleans Up Creationist Propaganda
entries.description:
Goal: Collect the coi^H^H ..err InfoDiscs, cleaning up the Creationist Propaganda left on your little patch of a big planet.

This isn't finished-finished (eg, no win condition), but I find flying around fun once you get the hang of the controls.

Controls:
Space/Mouse1 - thrust "forward"
W/A/S/D - thrust up, left, down, right
Q/E - roll (with an extra boost)
Esc - exit
Mouse - move the camera (scroll wheel zooms).


* Made with Unity3D (3.5)
* sproxel for building the voxel "trees".
* Blender for making a (really really poor) cave mesh.
* Audio synth effects made with Alberton Live Lite.
* Background music made with NodeBeat for Android (one take !).
* Textures (skybox, terrain) based on photos I took of the sky and my desk during the compo - made seamless & normalmaps generated with the Gimp.

For the Ludum Lawyers: I've never done a submission made with Unity, so I'm not really up with what constitutes 'base code' these days. I've used a few of the Unity "Standard Assets" scripts (eg Mouse orbit, Combine Meshes). Since everyone gets these with Unity to complement the engine, I regard these as 'base code' with regard to LD48. I've also used Unity's "Gem Shaders" - these are 'standard' demo shaders from the Unity website, not actually included in "Standard Assets". Wheather this is regarded as 'base code' is open to interpretation. I'm happy to change the submission to a Jam game if anyone objects.

entries.title: Tree
entries.description:
Make like a tree and click on the "Web" link.

The game is very much playable at the link above.  

Thanks a lot to those who have left feedback it is really great! 

In terms of collision detection issues.  I am not sure if they are actually issues(Each branch has a pretty big hitbox around them).  I think it is more that once you place a fork
in your branch, you cannot edit that branch any more which was intentional.

If you are having trouble clicking on branches that you haven't already "forked" then that is a legitimate bug and it'd be good to know if that is the case, so I can fix it.

I think this is a game.  I think the definition of game is more about "playing" than "winning".  At the same time I think there isn't a formal definition of what a game is, that everyone agrees with.

My definition of game is a little relaxed maybe. 
But it needs to be to inclusive otherwise things that are clearly games get left out, like the Sims say.
But that is cool!

Looking forward to playing all your entries!

NB:
The source is attached, with a FlashDevelop .proj file.
I used git throughout the competition, but I did not include the repository as it greatly increases the file size.

If anyone would like the git repository, just ask me on twitter @canyonoasis

entries.title: Absorption
entries.description:
Absorption is a game about.. absorption! You are a dust particle and your task is to absorb other particles and to avoid that bigger dust particles absorb you!

Be careful, there might be red particles around. They will absorb you, regardless of your size.

Protect and improve (or evolve! Yes, there's the Evolution!) yourself by absorbing power ups. There are three kinds of power ups: Speed, Attraction, Protection.

But try it out yourself, it's available for everybody who has a browser. (I guess you have one, right?). Use Google Chrome for best performance and awesomeness. I had to disable some awesomeness for Firefox users. You deserve it!

Learn about the game mechanics in the Tutorial mode and try finishing the endless mode afterwards. (Haha, you can't finish it! It's endless! But I didn't get past LVL 7, so... try to beat that. Should be easy.)

SDL
SDL_mixer
openGl
Glut
libpng

entries.title: cuboidAI
entries.description:
Important: You should read the readme.txt file coming with the game.

Short description:
cuboidAI is a real evolution simulator. 'real' means that it uses the principles of evolution to let the creatures (alias colored blocks in the game) learn stuff. Change various parameters of the world and watch how the creatures react on the changes over time. Nothing is predefined, if the creatures suddenly avoid worms then this is because evolution thought them to do this.

There is no final objective in this game. It is open-ended. The longer you run the simulation the smarter the blocks should get. Unless you are starving them or unleashing an armada of deadly worms onto them, which would reset the evolution process.

entries.title: Dawn of the Opposable Thumbs
entries.description:
Help a tribe of foragers migrate to the shoreline while staying ahead of a hungry tiger. You'll have to juggle two resources (sticks and food), but you can't tell how many of each you have until you ask the foragers.

The four buttons on the right side of the screen control everything: the double green arrow starts a migration(if you have the resources), and the three question mark buttons ask the cavemen about your resources (food, sticks, and time until the cat arrives, respectively)

I made a lot more sprites than I actually needed. Use the source code and sprites however you want!

entries.title: DIGIEVO
entries.description:
(UPDATE: A post-LD version of the game with direct real-time online battles against other players can be found at http://vdzserver.org/misc/DIGIEVOV2.RAR . CREATUREs evolved with the LD version can be used in the new version, but not vice versa, and any EXP (or other changes) gained in the new version will be reverted if you play that CREATURE in the original LD version again. To use your old creature, unrar to the same folder or copy the access file. For judging, please use the original version linked in big letters above, rather than the new version.)

NOTE: If problems occur while trying to access the DIGIEVO system, please ensure that the computer trying to access the DIGIEVO system is a Windows PC equipped with the following supporting software:
* .NET Framework 4: https://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&id=17851
* XNA Framework 4: https://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

Thank you for subscribing to the DIGIEVO system. The DIGIEVO system allows you to EVOLVE a CREATURE to battle other CREATUREs. In order to EVOLVE your CREATURE, you must win battles to gather EXP, then ask other players for the CODE of their CREATUREs. You will then be able to EVOLVE your CREATURE by learning MOVEs and TRAITs of the CREATURE you entered the CODE of.

The system has support for battling pre-generated CREATUREs (LOCAL BATTLE), as well as random CREATUREs of other players (RANDOM BATTLE). You can also choose to have friendly battles with other players' creatures through the CUSTOM BATTLE and AUTO BATTLE functions.

Feel free to use the messaging system on this page (also known as 'the comments') to share the CODEs of your CREATUREs. For an example of the EVOLUTION system, you can enter the CODE 'TRANSFER FINAL FIRE GRID' to access one of the pre-made DIGIEVO CREATUREs.

entries.title: Evolving Situation

The intent was to make a Grow-style game where you introduce elements to the world that interact in different ways depending on the order you introduce them in. It turned out rather less elaborate than I hoped, but the engine is a promising start for something completely different in the future.

entries.title: Keepers of The Harmony
entries.description:
UPDATE 2:
I've ported the game as Java Applet using Processing. It's not as good as original for 2 reasons, one I don't know java much, two it's not fun porting code and three I'm still fixing it.

I've tested with Firefox.
_______________________________________________________________________

UPDATE:
If the game crashes on your computer, install SFML.
Get it here: http://www.sfml-dev.org/download/2.0-rc/SFML-2.0-rc-osx.pkg

_______________________________________________________________________
THE GAME:
The game is about a parallel universe where there are 5 species living in harmony, that we call as:
Huge, Big, Medium, Small and Tiny.

Each organism (of any species) has a certain lifespan, and at the end of it's life if reproduces certain number of children.

Now, as in every other world the resources are limited so no species is allowed to have more than 10 organisms.

And neither can there be 0 organisms for any species.

You are their God, and it's your duty to keep the harmony intact by eliminating extra organisms of any species or avoiding any species to extinct (don't kill the last member of any species)

Controls:
Any keystroke to enter game or shoot from your 'Darwin Gun'.
Esc to return back to our planet.

entries.title: Surprise Cat Secks!
entries.description:
"Surprise Cat Secks" is a sand-box cat secks game featuring cats, secks and deadly neurotoxins. Breed a new strain of super-resistant super-cat, or simply have fun killing kitties as fast as you can: the choices is yours'!

The game (more or less) models natural-selection in a population of hermaphrodite cats watched over by a skull-faced lunatic with a flame-thrower: each colour-channel represents a resistance. See if you can breed a pure-black (invulnerable) cat!

CONTROLS
The game works with or without a mouse
*/ WASD / ZQSD / Arrows = move.
*/ Mouse-move / Arrows = aim.
*/ Mouse-button / Space = fire.
*/ Mouse-wheel / Enter = change weapon.

The game works best on Chrome/Chromium. On Firefox it lags a little, and I haven't tested it on IE or Opera yet.

entries.title: Technolution
entries.description:
Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6nnv_iFfMmE

Here's my game!

EDIT: I apologize in advance for the easy space mode, lack of winning conditions and lack of enemy variety. I had planned to include more planets to visit with different maps attached but didn't have time.

You start out at tech 1 on a planet, fight some dinos, go into space and blow up some more dinos (who are piloting space ships)!

As you kill things, you gain xp. When you get enough xp your tech level goes up. As your tech level goes up you gain better weapons and hp!

The game saves automatically. Oh, and if you die you have to start over.

Tools Used:
Language: Python 2.7
Libraries: Pygame
IDE: Visual Studio 2010 Shell with PyTools
Graphics: Photoshop CS4
Music / SFX: LSDJ, BFXR
Misc: Tiled, Spacescape, Sprite

entries.title: UPix
entries.description:
In this game, you're a pixel and have to destroy ennemies to collect other pixels and be stronger.

There are 16 waves of ennemies called "phases". When you kill all the ennemies, an other phase lets appear stronger ennemies.

If you kill all the ennemies of all the phases, including the impossible boss (:D), the game becomes infinite and more and more ennemies appear.

Controls: 
   English version: -Action: Space
                    -Move: W-A-S-D

   French version:  -Action: Space
                    -Move: Z-Q-S-D

This game uses XNA so don't forget to install the redistribuable package included in the archive if you can't launch it.

If you want to see the source, don't forget to unarchive it before opening it.

Edit: I posted a new English version because I forgot to adapt the menus to QWERTY keyboards. Tell me if I was not allowed to do that after de dead line.

Have fun and submit your scores :D

entries.title: A Pixel Evolution

- A Pixel Evolution -

Do you want to dive right now in the wonderful world of video games? "A Pixel Evolution" will bring you to experience the evolution of video games from its begining. 

Help Mr. Pix L. to recover his original form through three levels and three different kind of gameplay!

Build ships and command them to destroy enemy ships in epic space battles!

Customization!
Space!

entries.title: Booster
entries.description:
In this game your goal is to evolve a depressed city into a culturally vibrant one by spreading new ideas. 

You control the Booster, who can give ideas to fellow citizens. Citizens can also share ideas between each other as they walk the paths in the city. 

You win by raising the entire level of personal values and excitement that the citizens hold. You lose if the citizen turn hopelessly negative.

ARROW keys + NUMBERs + SPACE bar for controls.


NOTE: We've tested this in Chrome and Firefox. There are some glitches in Safari and IE-behavior is undefined.

entries.title: Eden
entries.description:
Eden is a block pusher, digger, co-op puzzler. With a evolution vs Intelligent Design story.

Controls:
Arrow keys to move
Space to swap characters (when they're introduced)
Escape to invoke wrath (restart the level)

[Cheat if you get stuck - hold down 'GOD' to skip]

This was my first Ludum Dare and what an experience. I'm a little stressed and dazed as I write this but I think I've made one of my best pieces this weekend.

I had an annoying bug where you would fall through the floor randomly which took a big swathe of my time and cost some content and I would liked to have added more levels.  The best mechanic is added on the final level and I wanted to explore that some more so I'll find some time to finish this off.

That said it feels complete as it is.  Small and to the point.  
 
Coded and built in Unity 3.5 and Mono Develop.  Art with Illustrator, Paint.NET and a dash of Substance.  Music made with Garage Band.

Thanks to my family for being soooo supportive this weekend.  It's been a long slog and I thank you x.

Anyone wanted to get hold of me with questions and such can find me at @bumpkinRich or www.bumpkinbrothers.com

entries.title: Evolving Robot Siege
entries.description:
Introduction:


In this little game you control a robot on a mission to protect a treasure chest. Try to defend it from the swarm of enemy robots that are trying to invade. The AI uses a Genetic Algorithm to learn. The enemy robots which came closest to the treasure, receive the lowest (best) score. The best ones get picked for the next wave. Try to hold out as long as possible.

This game was developed using C# and XNA. The artwork was done in Paint.NET



Controls:


Left Arrow: Move left
Right Arrow: Move right
Up Arrow: Jump
Control: Fire



Cheats:


Backspace: Spawn more enemies (Up to 100).

entries.title: Gamma Ray Deflector
entries.description:
That's it - my first Ludum Dare entry!

The aim of the game is to protect your DNA from too much mutation through cosmic radiation. Radiation is responsible for mutation of all genetic material and plays a big role in evolution. But too much radiation will destroy every organism!

Use the mouse to move (left button) and rotate (right button) the different deflectors to shield your cell as well as possible and reflect the incoming gamma rays away.

Repair your DNA by quickly pressing the letters (ACGT) popping up at the center. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ACGT)

The game could use some more work (especially the audio sucks), but I'm quite happy with what I achieved and I had tons of fun (and also a little frustration ^^').

Have fun playing and see you next time! :D

Time lapse video: http://youtu.be/GWH0Hqxyl5g

entries.title: Hexarden
entries.description:
Start with a bare space, and evolve it into a fully grown garden! (see what I did there?)

Hexarden is a gardening puzzle game played on a hexagon grid. Try to maximize your points for each of the five levels, by connecting water to plants. 

Each plant is worth one point for each adjacent water piece.

If you feel so inclined, post pics of your best layouts to Twitter with the #hexarden tag!

entries.title: Infect
entries.description:
Instructions:

1. Unzip file.
2. Right click setup.exe and Run as Administrator.
3. '1' to spawn bacteria, '2' to spawn virus, 'Escape' to quit.

-----

Description:

Infect is a Tower Offense game. The goal is to spawn bacteria and viruses with your DNA to try and outwit the deadly white blood cells. You gain DNA for each neutralized white blood cell, and for any bacteria/viruses that reach the main bloodstream.

-----

Notes:

While it's not quite the game I envisioned, I'm still proud of how far this came in only 72 hours. The game mechanics were mostly completed, but I would have liked to make the game into something more than just one level.

entries.title: It's evolution, baby
entries.description:
Well, this is my first entry. It's been tiring, but really interesting.

Basically, what we have here is a sandbox where we can see a population of creatures hang around, feed and, at fixed intervals, mate (or generate mutant clones of doom, if they're asexual). Creatures can generate the energy they need, or they may get it from eating nutrients or other creatures.

My idea was to make a "god game" where you could use some powers to get a population satisfying a set of conditions (for example..get 3 blue carnivores) after a given number of generations. Powers would be things such as...exterminate an individual, increase the life degradation rate temporarily, create/remove natural nutrients (the small, still dots). Unfortunately, I didn't have the time to achieve that and lots of things that I thought about, but I guess this is OK for a couple of days (shared between programming and gaming ^^). 

More details on the readme file included in the *.zip. Source code is also there.

Third-person libraries used: SDL, OpenGL, Boost.
The font used is Arial.ttf.

Good luck everyone, and I hope you enjoy the compo :)

(Edited to update the dl link to a functional release executable)

entries.title: Living Tales
entries.description:
In "Living Tales" you write you own story, which turns to life.
You type in a word and if it is supported the equivalent object will appear at the left (e.g. a tree).
On the right will be simultaneous a story written ("A tree comes out of the ground."). Spawned creatures will act without needing a command, they write the story, too. 

game design: kddekadenz

art: madgnomegamer(most) & kddekadenz(book)
sound: pdsounds.org, opengameart.org

entries.title: Mutagen
entries.description:
You have to survive in an arena full of monsters. You have the power to assimilate your enemy's special ability once they are dead. You can upgrade your health, damage, get special weapons, but this powers don't last forever...

WASD or arrow keys to move, shoot with the mouse, E to assimilate a monster (then you have ton click on a slot on the bottom of the screen).

entries.title: Natural Selection: Travel Agency
entries.description:
A different approach to natural selection. Control the winds and direct a species of birds towards its future. You must escape predators (red birds), collect food and be "naturally" selected to survive. For how long can this branch of birds avoid extinction? Follow your travel agent: nature!

This is my first time participating, the theme was quite a surprise! Shame the idea itself didn't really evolve, the game ended up being very simple.

The game was written in C++ using GLFW, OpenAL and FreeType. All content made with GIMP, BFXR, Autotracker-Bu and Audacity. Vista upwards. You'll probably need the VC2012 redistributable linked above.

Summary: collect food, escape the red birds and get inside the DNA region when it appears.

entries.title: Physicalution
entries.description: In this sandbox game with no goal, the physics of the world evolve every 30 seconds. The first 30 seconds have no collision. The rectangles' collision is somewhat buggy but still works. I should have attempted to learn game physics better before taking on such a project.

entries.title: Space Evolvers
entries.description:
A new alien species began to reproduce rampantly and threaten peace in the galaxy! What's worse, they evolve very quickly! It's up to you to destroy them before it's too late!

Controls:
Mouse Move: Move spaceship towards cursor
Mouse Click: Shoot

*** Google Chrome is strongly recommended! ***

Technical note: I've used a simplified form of genetic algorithm (only mutations) combined with a single layer neural network. As for the game engine, I've used Crafty.

*** Changed to Jam: didn't read the rules carefully and used some Creative Commons content from OpenGameArt =/ ***

entries.title: Cellular Division 101
entries.description:
Welcome to my first Ludum Dare entry game page!!!! It's a wacky, wavy, inflatable, arm-flailing tube game page warehouse and imporium!!! So I wanted to make a game about the evolution (thus natural selection) of the single celled organism world. But alas, I spent WAY to much time watching Dr. Who. So my game is only half done, a little bit broken, and I had to implement the scoring system at the very end.

The goal(now) is to keep away from the big cells, but murder the small cells. You can of course attack whomever you want tho. If your health reaches zero, you die, obviously. :O

The cells do have the ability to mutate(which you do not), and they do follow loose guidelines of natural selection. Now because of how the AI is coded, they tend to look like they are just randomly moving about (which I guess sometimes they are) but for the most part they are hunting, or fleeing. Because they mutate, they can and WILL get stronger faster and bigger. But it's quite interesting to sometimes see the small quick ones escape detection and rapidly grow their numbers. But beware, sometimes small ones can be VERY strong.

Note!!: I have a 2.something ghz cpu, and once cellular count reached, around 500, I was getting under 30fps. Sorry :(

Enjoy!! 

P.S. There is no end :( Post your score!


OH! Controls!
movement - WSAD

entries.title: Coin-Operated Afternoon
entries.description:
IMPORTANT, READ THIS (it's for your own sake): 

This.Game.is.HUUUUUUUUUGE!
Like...369MB...ZIPPED! (No setup though, just unzip and run the Playsomething.exe. Run winsetup.exe to play windowed) 
So it mighttake around 20minutes for you to download it. (And one more to unzip it) Try the two mirrors, pick the best.
"-What ?! 20 minutes ?! What am I going to do during 20 minutes ?"
Errr...I don't know,maybe you can try some other games. I heard there are plenty of them around here. 
 
"-But why is it so huge ?!"
Because it's a stop-motion animated game that contains things you won't find in any other games, like : 

- 15 different endings
- Stunning photographic animations
- Pieces from more than 20 boardgames (will you find them all ?)
- 2011 photographs (the last one was too offending)
- Hellboy on a poney
- Torrid sex and crossword sex
- Insane violence and sane violence
- As much strategy as tactics (and you might find an interstellar battle)
- Orcs, zombies and panties
- Silly dialogs
- A subjective typology of boardgames gameplay and their subtle impact on sociologic relationships, personal development and flat-wasting.
- Oh yeah and pixels too. 


You'll have to make a boardgame session evolve through the dialogs.

We had A LOT of fun making this, we hope you'll have some too! 

(Oh yeah...and no sound. Maybe in a future version)

entries.title: DrumBeat Evolution!!!!
entries.description:
DrumBeat Evolution!!!!

The song will never stop playing so you have no choice but to add to it on the fly, letting it grow and evolve into awesome beat!

The evolve button gives you the opportunity to add fitter notes.

NOTE: You can erase beats at Evolution Level 7.

NOTE: The page might appear white until the game downloads.


UPDATE: Added JAR File that can be Downloaded and Executed. It runs it in a frame as an alternative to using the Web Applet.


If you're struggling to get a Beat started just put a Bass Drum on beats 1, 3, 5, 7 and a Snare Drum on 2, 4 ,6 8. (Like the first ScreenShot.)

This is my first Entry into the Compo. In fact, it's my first Game! Usually I mess about and end up with something you could only call a tech demo if anything, then get busy with life. 

I honestly didn't think I was going to be able to pull this off so I'm happy that I at least got a working entry a few hours before the deadline.

Thank you for playing and thanks for any feedback.

entries.title: Plan M
entries.description:
NOTE: The 'Original Jam Version', rather than being made of strawberries, simply has no audio. That's right, NONE.
If you're just looking for a fun game to play, get the Enhanced Edition. Your ears will thank you.

To be fair, though - if you're rating Plan M for the Jam, please rate according to the Jam version, NOT the Enhanced Edition (which includes substantial changes and additions).

----------------------------------------------------
=== CONTROLS ===
----------------------------------------------------
* Move your mouse to the top of the screen to view the items you are carrying.
* Left click - Look
* Right click - Interact

----------------------------------------------------
=== DESCRIPTION ===
----------------------------------------------------

From the makers of subAtomic (Murray Lewis & David Blake) comes a brand new point & click adventure. It's bigger, bolder, and funnier!

The evil Dr. M has used a nefarious machine to devolve everyone back into monkeys, so he can become their master!
Fortunately, he didn't count on Detectives Vandall and Hopkirk - two survivors who will stop at nothing to put things back the way they were.

* Full-length point & click adventure!
* A story so packed with comedy it's liable to explode at any minute, covering you and anyone watching in a disgusting-yet-amusing goo!
* Stephen Hawking gives a conference from the ceiling!
* Meet a monkey pretending to be the president!
* Electrocute a small child!
* And much, much more!

The Enhanced Edition includes a soundtrack and audio effects, as well as several re-written and completely new scenes.

----------------------------------------------------
=== ABOUT THE DEVELOPERS ===
----------------------------------------------------

If you have any questions, please contact myself or Dave on Twitter at @GameDevIdeas and @GameDevDave, respectively.

If you enjoyed this and subAtomic, please also check out @HungryPlanetGS (http://www.hungryplanetgames.com/) - we're coming up to our first commercial point & click release and we'd love to get your interest.

----------------------------------------------------
=== FAQ ===
----------------------------------------------------

Q: How do I leave the playground?
A: Interact with the car.

Q: How do I play in fullscreen?
A: Run 'winsetup.exe' (you may need to right-click and select 'Run as administrator' in Windows Vista/7).
Uncheck the box marked 'Run in a window instead of full-screen'.

Q: I get a graphics error when I try to run the game!
A: Run 'winsetup.exe' (you may need to right-click and select 'Run as administrator' in Windows Vista/7).
First, try changing 'Graphics driver' from Direct3D 9 to DirectDraw 5. If that doesn't solve the problem, experiment with different 'Graphics filter' options - it may be that the game is trying to run in a resolution too high/low for your graphics adapter.

----------------------------------------------------
=== SPECIAL THANKS ===
----------------------------------------------------

* Members of the Freesound project, for providing quality audio samples:
alister667, Andreas.Mustola, avakas, CJ4096, D W, digifishmusic,
engreitz, Flasher21, FreqMan, joedeshon, JoelAudio, junggle,
kineticturtle, KNO SFX, Lunardrive, mattwasser, Nathan Lomeli,
nmscher, NoiseCollector, Percy Duke, roper1911, RutgerMuller,
sagetyrtle, sandyrb, shawshank73, Slanesh, SpiderJerusalem,
Srehpog, suonho, thedapperdan, Tomlija, TreasureBoxFilms,
tweeterdj, wildweasel, YvesSch & Zoltan Csengeri.

* Kevin MacLeod, for giving away thousands of amazing music tracks for free.

* Chris Jones, for creating the Adventure Game Studio engine.

* Ron Gilbert, Tim Schafer, Charles Cecil, and other industry luminaries, for creating some of the classic adventure games which inspire us.

entries.title: Quantum Seed
entries.description:
You are controlling the 'Seed' you have to collect the elements to grow, and to reach the final stage, while being in a space which have 3 gravitational zones.

(Game mechanics: the floor and two sides have gravity along with the seed. The elements above the seed get pulled towards it, however if they are on the sides or below the seed, they get pulled in the direction of the walls. Upon hitting the walls, they get destroyed.)

We didn't have a journal, so I'm going to sum up things here. Two of us working on the project. Apart from making games in one day, we are colleagues in a small indie studio - I'm being the creative director and Andras is the lead developer of the team.
We tried to have quite an abstract approach to the theme, while trying to come up with an easy but original game mechanic. This is our first Ludum Dare entry, and it was very cool to do something so quickly and see it working.

We made the game in 13 hours 
Before that we had a one hour brainstorming session, where we came up with the game idea & logic.
I went on designing the visuals, having the first sketch made in 1 hour (with Paper on iPad, screenshot included below), while Andras started coding.

We were using Unity with 2D Toolkit
All artwork made by us
Music is from Magnatune (Tokee - Coma)

Maybe next time we should start a little bit earlier to have more time to polish and add extra stuff - we had so many idea how to evolve the game during development.

entries.title: The Evolution of Flight
entries.description:
Controls: WASD/Arrow Keys + Mouse 
"N" key on the intro screen: Reset 
Note: your starting aircraft can't fire while moving, the second aircraft can move up/down very easily, and each of the others have their unique limitations and advantages. I attempted to design the stages to let you go just a bit further with each aircraft until you ultimately win. :) 

I had fun with the idea of evolving gameplay as a parallel to the evolution of aviation itself. In our modern day, it's easy to take the security and comfort of modern airplanes for granted--like how the WASD controls and overwhelming firepower for a shoot'em up has become pretty much standard. So I attempted to hark back to humble beginnings to show the limitations and frustrations of earlier aircraft and how aviation became what it is now. 

Oh, and there's a boss at the end somewhere. 

[Tip: To dodge the double attack, I've been going right then left (or vice versa depending on his position), cutting between bullets with the glider. For other ships, circling around the boss is possibly an option--though not all ships might be agile enough to do that.]

Final note: I'm sorry if it's either too easy or too hard. This was my first shmup, haha. Nevertheless, I hope you enjoy it! :D

entries.title: The Path for Evolution
entries.description:
Wow, just in time!

I'm a bit disappointed, though, with this one. I made the classical error: Too ambitious for my experience and time. I didn't have time to add proper sfx or music. Also the game lacks a bit of polish. More about this tomorrow with the Post Mortem.

The game: As I have no knowledge about DNA, biology and so, I decided that given that Evolution took so long to be a Ludum Dare theme... what if Evolution itself fights against the previous LD themes? It has been in the final round 7 times and 9 voted, that's 9 levels!

Every mini-level is inspired by one past LD theme, as can be seen on the top-left corner of the screen. Plus a last level surprise not inspired in any past them, but with which Evolution has got to fight til the last blood drop :)

HOW TO PLAY: 
You have to collect a letter from the word EVOLUTION in each level. When the letter is picked up, a door opens to the next level. The first level can be tricky, but just think about finding the first letter. By the way, the game gets a little better after the first mini-level :)

Controls: Sometimes cursors, sometimes mouse, sometimes both of them:)

Hope you enjoy it!

UPDATE: Ok, looks like the first level is not so obvious so, as I want you pals to play the game, here's the trick: Place objects clicking around and hit the "Boom" button. Check the screenshot!

UPDATE 2: Crap, it seems like there was some z-fighting issue with the "Next" button after winning the first scene! On my Intel card the button was shown in front of the dark plane, but on nvidia, it was rendered behind... Please check it again!

entries.title: Vesuvius

Vesuvius is a game in which you evolve not by beating enemies but by suffering.

Left and Right arrow key to move. Up to jump.

Good Luck

entries.title: 1000 Evolving Kittens
entries.description:
There are 1000 kittens! And they are evolving. You have ideas about what a Kitten Should Be! Use a mouse to exercise your agency, for Ultimate Kitten!!

---

The game as it stands is without a win state, except, I suppose, for lovers of chaos and worms. Without player input, the kittens will evolve into worm kittens and devour all other unevolved kittens. With player input, this will still happen, since the next evolutionary jump up from "Fat Kitten" is not in place yet. But it will be! I'm working on it for a post-compo version.

---

Post compo version is now available! It has music, some more sounds, another (2) possible kitten forms, a glowing eye, multi-kitten select, some small bugfixes.

Still to do:

- More kitten forms, including Ultimate Form
- Ending
- Better kitten sounds maybe

I have some great forms planned that should help make the shape of the final game more plain.

entries.title: Assimilation
entries.description:
Earth is being invaded by a swarm of nanorobots. They assimilate everything they find allowing them to evolve into more advanced forms. Will you be able to stop them from assimilating earth before you are assimilated yourself?

You're going to have a nasty surprise in the first minutes of gameplay =P

Timelapse video coming soon. (As soon as I figure out how to turn 18.7 GB worth of avi's into a timelapse in a reasonable amount of time =P)

Update - 7/9/2012:
Well, that took longer than expected. Check out the post compo version: 
  - I fixed a bucketload of bugs;
  - Fixed the broken English (hopefully all of it);
  - Improved dialogs and scene transitions (you can now skip all of them quickly);
  - And fixed a couple of rushed object placement fails.

entries.title: Epic Pong Evolution

REMEMBER:  Evolution's Occur As Game Play Continues!


Well, this year was a lot of fun, the team has definitely learned from it two.  We plan on attending the next Ludum Dare but whether as a team or individually is still being debated for now.  Thanks for everything and the awesome community.  

Also due to our Java programmers not being available we are sorry to say we made this game in XNA and if you don't want to install XNA to play this game we understand.  Sorry for the inconvenience. =)

You can use Z and X to move in single player. In multiplayer first players moves with the Z and X keys and second player moves with the N and M keys.

entries.title: EverWorld

Menu/close menu - Esc
Next chat box/interact - enter or space bar

First time attempting this! Thank you all for playing!

It's been brought to my attention that it may not run if you don't have certian file types on your computer, due to the program not saving all the game elements in the same folder. If you get an error that says "RGSS102E.dll could not be found." or any other RGSS-related error you should be able to fix it by downloading the rest of the files from the second link. Just put it in the same folder you extract the game to and theoretically it will fix all the things...

Made in less than an hour for the Ludum Dare Jam!

entries.title: Observer

To aid in your observations your conciousness has been uploaded into an Evopod.

Now you can monitor and take part in the Evopods culture.

So you start off as a little seed, your goal is to grow into a tree and then evolve to be able to survive different climates. Use WASD to move and Space to jump. Next time will be better

entries.title: One Day To Breed
entries.description:
When you only have a single 24-second long day to live, you need to take evolution into your own hands. 

Start out as a near useless cube and then control successive generations as you struggle to find the best suited mate and spawn a child slightly more suited to the harsh cube world environment. Also collect more cubes.

Controls:
- WASD or arrows to move
- Space to breed
- z to jump, if you evolve the ability to jump

Features:
- Cubes!
- Two dimensions, plus an additional dimension FREE!
- Bad coder art!
- Worse coder music!
- More cubes!
- Frustration!
- Romance!
- Cubes!
