entries.title: Super Genome: Hyper Evolution Turbo Edition
entries.description:
*Important Update*  Most of the bugs have been worked out, if you had crashes or white textures before those have been fixed now...If you had control issues the keyboard control that was in the debug build for testing is now turned on also, mostly for you trackpad users who don't have a real mouse or a decent nub :P  (I asked PoV and he said it was fine since it was essentialy a "port" to allow slower computers and computers without real mice to play)  Aside from the standard "click to where you want to move" you can also use wasd (sorry non-qwerty keyboard users, this code was never meant for release, it was just a debug thing)

The source package also now contains a standard makefile instead of just the codeblocks project, and i've included all the headers and engine shared objects packed with it. (don't need to go to my site and download it anymore)

This was built for linux and android, the windows version is a port and my engine is not yet very well tested under windows so there may be some bugs! Please rate the other two versions if possible.

the android version may take a few hours to show up in google play as well.

This is a simple action rpg operated entirely by the mouse (linux and windows) or touch (android).  Kill enemies and you will start to evolve parts of your body into parts of theirs (don't kill too many blobs or you'll be stuck a blob for a long time!)  Parts can freely mix and match.

See if you can survive and make it to the end!  (There IS an end, and it will be obvious when you see it that you need to go there)

Quick Evolution Tips:
* Fighting a single enemy too much has the potential to de-evolve traits you have gotten from other enemies
* There are three "visible" traits in your evolution, head, body, and back.  Body in general determines your base defense and attack speed, head determines your base damage and range, back(wings) lets you fly at different speeds depending on wing type
* everything has a tradeoff, for instance a heavy body like the wolfrat has higher defense but will be slower than a lightweight bird body,
* there are more "invisible" traits, that unfortunately i did not have time to sprite.  Legs provide a speed boost and can be obtained from any creature that has them (bird,wolf,spider). The bird legs are slow but faster than having none (blob), wolf is fast and spider is fastest.
* the second "invisible" trait is skin type, you start as "naked" type which has no stat changes at all (blob is essentially "pure" no modifiers on all stats), you can evolve hair from wolves, scales from snakes, and feathers from birds, hair has a minor defense bonus, scales has a major defense bonus, and feathers has a speed bonus.  Again, they ARE there you just cant see them due to time constraints cutting my spriting short.
* the third invisible property is venom sacs, you either have them or not, you can evolve them from either spider or snake DNA, they cuase enemies to harm themselves when they attempt to attack you after you've hit them at least once
* the last invisible property is the bat's echolocation, which brightens up the rooms, this is only obtainable by bats and is the only property that CANT de-evolve once you have it

Overall there are 36 unique body combinations for your creature that are visible (modular sprites, it mixes and matches them based on your current statistics), in all there are 2304  different combinations of abilities so how you play and what you attack and in what order can have a very VERY drastic effect on how the game plays for you.

entries.title: Treevolver
entries.description:
Treevolver - A genetic Engineering Puzzle game.
The rules are simple, but the game is not. You need to guide the evolution of trees until you breed a tree identical to the target tree. Have fun!

A couple notes:
 I'm having some issues with my DNS, so if the web link doesn't work, try the Alternate URL.

This is my first HTML5 game, so if things break (and I'm sure they will) please let me know so I can try to fix them. I've tested it under current versions of Safari and Chrome, so if all else fails try one of them.

It's also hideously unoptomized: The game should work on android/iOS, but loading levels will take 30+ seconds, and everything will be generally laggy.

Libraries used: jQuery 1.8.0, Processing.js 1.4.1, messi. I'm also using the fonts ChunkFive and Orbitron by The League of Movable Type. All licences are included in the source .zip

entries.title: Living Worlds
Ludum Card Evolution

It's almost 100% of what I designed, so I am very proud of it (you where suposed to have 5 creatures in the 2nd half of the game, but I didn't have time to implement that, and nevertheless, it does not feel bad the way it is played right now).

********************* MAC USERS!!!! ********************

If anyone happens to own a mac and the game runs, please tell me in the coments, so I can sleep pacefully, otherwise I'll have to wait untill Monday to test it again.

entries.title: PixelVolution
entries.description:
PixelVolution is the story of an evolving pixel...
The game should have had 4 differents gameplays and music depanding of the evolution of the character, each gameplay proposing a puzzle...
Unfortunatly, only one gameplay is present in this version, and music is not implemented. 
After this level, there should have be another evolution where you have arms and gameplay is a sokoban like, then you have an enigma, evolve again obtaining wings...But haven't been able to work on it the last day, so i just wrapped up the whole thing quickly and submit..
Anyway since it was my first Ludum Dare (or any other gamejam) ewperience, i'm really happy, good time !
Made in HTML5/JS with easelJS.

entries.title: Sea evolution
entries.description:
A fascinating world of creatures in the sea that need to eat and evolve to become stronger. All the creatures can eat or be eaten. If any creature can't eat he dies after a time.

You control one of the creatures while the others eat your food or try to eat you. The circle around you represents your hunger, if you can't eat in a time you'll die like the others and the game is over. Try to stay alive all the time you can. 

There are three levels of evolution and the last of them can lay eggs to make life go on. Each creature has special abilities that make them stronger to another species (attack, defense, speed and others).

Also, you can play or see how the evolution happens in the sea.

entries.title: Simulation
entries.description:
This is a game about adaptation. It takes a more abstract view to the whole "evolution" theme and puts you directly in control of the homeostasis of an organism. The "help" option explains the rest.

***READ***
The mac version works fine, but on windows, open the .jar file with command prompt by typing "java -jar "(no quotes) and dragging the file into the command prompt window and pressing enter. I haven't tested it on Linux, but it's a .jar file so I'm sure it would work..

The only thing that I didn't make is the music. But everything else is my doing.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Small Worm
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry.

You are a small worm who has to eat to evolve.
There are a total of 10 stages and 9 different Upgrades you get by evolving.

Controls:

Space to confirm evolution

Try to beat the game as fast as possible and post your time!

entries.title: Squishy's escape

W A S D to move.  Once you get evolutions, numbers choose between them & left click uses.

No music, should have sound effects.

After 22 years of development and numerous delays, Team Clew is proud to announce Super Clew Land!

entries.title: Survivalism

Survivalism is about assimilation and confrontation. Adapt your arsenal to the enemies you are facing, stay on the tip of your toes and be quick or be dead.

You need to pick up Allels to adapt the genetic configuration of your attack. Enemies are susceptible to different genetic components and you are able to fire only one shot at a time, before you need to reconfigure your attack.

Control scheme:

entries.title: SURVIVE
entries.description:
GAME:
Survival of the fittest fight for supremacy. You control organisms with the ability to drain health from each other, and create stronger children from their own health.

You win if your hue is dominant, you lose if you die and there are no more organisms with your hue to take control of.

CONTROLS:
* WASD - move
* Left click - drain health from other organisms (if you are not full)
* Right click - repair an organism or create a new one

* b - colour-blind mode (brighter organisms are closer to your hue)
* n - disable birth sound (bleep bloop)

GUIDE:
* your health is the portion of colour within your hexagonal border
* if you die, you take control of an ally
* if you are low on health, left click on enemy organisms to stealth their health
* if you have high (especially full) health, right click on the ground to create offspring, or on an ally organism to heal it
* win by stealing health from other colours and converting it into babies of your colour

NOTES:
The idea was originally to have a heavier emphasis on creating better offspring, but as it stands offspring are only a slight improvement on their parents. Offspring have a slightly different hue from their parents, so distant relations in the family tree will not necessarily be allies!

The bleeps and bloops are the sound of organisms being born! The lower the pitch, the less alike to you they are. The other sound warns you when you are low on health, or too full to attack.

With more time, I'd ideally make the organism AI better - they ought to run away when in danger, and create children away from enemies who are likely to consume them immediately.

POST COMPO FIXES:
* Collision - organisms now collide loosely, preventing too many organisms swarming in the same place
* Input fixes - clicking on organisms is now more reliable
* Sound fix - the sound no longer repeats after the game ends
* AI changes - organisms now try to run to safety to replicate, and find enemies to kill more easily

REFERENCES:
Made using love2d (https://love2d.org/) - the .love is just a renamed .zip of the source.

Font from http://www.fontspace.com/digitaldreamdesign/d3-honeycombism

entries.title: The Debate
entries.description:
It's pong between Darwin and Jesus. The winner finally decides the debate between science and religion.

I only had 4 hours to start and finish my game, so I stuck with something super simple. Hopefully it still says a little something about the conversation to whoever plays it.

So sit back, read some interesting quotes from each side, and reflect on the ridiculousness of it all.

entries.title: The Evolution of Darwin
entries.description:
The Evolution of Darwin sees you take control of Darwin, a small green creature who sets off on a journey across the world. On the way he adapts to get around the environment which results in physical change.

Created with Game Maker 8 for Windows.

entries.title: The Neverending Dream
entries.description:
You are John, a rebellious teen who never learned anything in school. Now he has grown up, and one day when he wakes up he finds himself on an island. Knowing nothing about the world, he must find his way through the evolution in the hope of returning home.

Controls:
WASD - Move
P - Pickup message
E - Search for stuff around you
Q - Use a skill (Woodcutting or Fishing)
I - Inventory menu
Mouse Left - Fire the gun

My tips:
Look at the Inventory Menu frequently, it really helps solving the "puzzles".
Always read the message found on every map!

entries.title: The Unbeatable Blob
entries.description:
The unbeatable blob is more a bit of an experiment than a real game, due to an insurmountable lack of time.

You can move by clicking.

Eat the smaller astroids to become bigger. Astroids smaller than you are green-ish, astroids bigger than you are red-ish. Yellow astroids are about as big as you.

There's no penalty for hitting the red astroids, though they will fly off instead.

I know the blob glitches a bit when it gets bigger, I've kept it in as a feature.

The game's main inspirations were Loco Roco and Katamari.

The following features are sorely lacking:
 - A menu system
 - Sound/Music
 - Some way to win
 - Some way to lose

So feel free to not rate this very highly, I'm quite aware of it's shortcomings. However, I will try to rate as many other games as possible.

Another fair warning: Don't keep it running, or the world will eventually die in a fire. or a huge blob.

entries.title: Universe Exploder
entries.description:
Evolution has been completed!

Now the only thing that has never been done is blowing it all up to start again!

Welcome to the Universe Exploder!

This is a Psychedelic Text Adventure with Music and Graphics.

Please feel free to listen to the .OGG music tracks outside of the game.

It is a pretty chilled far out game so relax and enjoy it!

:-)

entries.title: Volve
entries.description:
(Pronounced Vol-vee) Just so you guys don't pronounce it like Valve with an O instead of A :P If you think about it, it's kinda like saying 'wall-e'

Help protect your companion 'Volve' from the evil spirits sent down from the sky.
Use your trusty bullets to help defend him until he has fully evolved!

Long bar down the bottom tells you how much time until next evolution of Volve!

Controls:
Arrow Keys - Player movement.
Spacebar - Fire bullets.



Created in FlashDevelop with Flashpunk. My first ever real game that I am actually happy I finished (I did attend ludum dare last time but was not happy with the final result. I still submitted though) This time I feel satisfied with what I have. And flashpunk is awesome so I'm definetly continuing to use this!

Please leave any crits, suggestions, bugs or error reports below and I will try my hardest to reply and/or fix them! I am planning on finishing this into a final game, maybe with more levels, better enemy spawning and anything you guys suggest!

entries.title: !wrms
entries.description:
Who would win in a grenade fight between Darwin and God??? Finally a game to answer this age-old question.

Ready... Fight!

entries.title: 'Volver
entries.description: Press F1 in game to view read me. This whole game was made without writing code!

entries.title: A Blug's Life
entries.description:
I started this in Game Maker because I had worked in it before so I figured it'd be easy to get right into things. Unfortunately, it took me longer than I expected, and I also spent far too much time fiddling with little animation bits. There's some glitchy bits with movement but otherwise I'm happy with it (engine-wise, that is).

tl;dr I spent too much time fiddling with little polish and I ended up not having time to make more levels

Story is that these aliens (blugs, cause they're blue and look like slugs to me) are dying out and need to repopulate, so they flew off to another planet to harvest its resources. As soon as they've got enough nutrients, they asexually reproduce and the first one gets transported back to the spaceship. The planet's interesting new plants can force genetic mutations in the blugs that give them new abilities, so the blugs have decided to take evolution into their own hands and use its' power to get even more nutrients and expand the blug empire.

Controls:
Movement - Left + Right keys
Jumping  - Up key
Attack   - Z key (not gameplay-useful, only in test room)
Fullscreen - F4
Quit - ESC

entries.title: Aargh, Invaders
entries.description:
Aargh, Invaders!

Wave after wave of enemy ships, Every 10 waves brings a new generation evolved from the best waves of the last!

entries.title: Aeon
entries.description:
Aeon is epic snake evolution game. It extends over wast period of time.

It all began with small snake that was lost in woods. After many many years snake begun to evolve, to adopt to its environment. Snake was forced to live rest of its life in tight and dark world. Snake had to evolve so much that now, instead of eating other creatures, snake is consuming energy that it can find.

Your task it to help snake to survive as long as possible. That can be done by carefully but quickly planing your moves.

Check my post for rest of the story.
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/?p=173415


CONTROLS: (Keyboard)
- Left, Right, Up, Down for navigation
- Escape for Pause
- Left shift for Jump power up
- Left CTRL for Beacon power up
- Space bar for EMP power up

CONTROLS additional: (XBox 360 controller for PC)
DPad or Left Thumbstick for navigation
Start for pause
A for Jump power up
B for Beacon power up
X for EMP power up


Goal of this game is to collect as many tokens as possible. This is done through number of stages. From simple - classical snake game to complex maze in dark gameplay, all in one level without interruptions.


NOTE: Microsoft XNA Framework Redistributable 4.0 is required
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Bacteria Infection
entries.description:
This game is in a VERY basic state, with only three levels, and shallow game play.  I make it in python, and unfortunately since this is my first game, I have no idea how to publish it in a user friendly format.  If you know how I should have done that better please comment.  Enjoy!

To play: run 'main.py'

entries.title: Cosmogonie
entries.description:
Cosmogonie is a short interactive experimentation. The only controller is your mouse, you have to use it in various ways to interact with the environnment.

(Don't hesitate to play it a second time after finishing, you'll understand much better, and everytime will be different)

Sound is a big part of this so please play with headphones or speakers on :D

entries.title: Dissolution
entries.description:
NOTE: 

> PLAY THE COMPO ENTRY FOR JUDGING

> WHEN YOU'RE DONE, PLAY THE JAM ENTRY IF YOU WANT TO SEE WHAT'S IN THE CAVE :-)

The game is called Dissolution. It doesn't have a genre and combines various elements of platformer, adventure, RPG and puzzle. The protagonist (his name is the Dude) is an amorphous creature with mentality of Max Payne who once wakes up in a cheerful and colorful world and can't stand it the least bit. Dude tries to find his way out and fights various obnoxious unicorns and fairies while trying not to be consumed by this inhospitable environment.

The world is constantly in motion, as black-and-white (part of which is the protagonist) does its best to consolidate its efforts and gather up enough resources to defeat the vicious creatures of light. 

As Dude moves across the terrain, he slowly submerges in the flowers and grasses, so the player's task is to find sources of black and gray and munch them to develop some kind of resistance and eventually evolve into something bigger and stronger.

entries.title: Diverge
entries.description:
A puzzle platformer game made in Construct Classic.

You are a small orange creature who runs and jumps about the world. Your goal is to find and collect the 5 hidden fallen stars. You can evolve by collecting Red, Blue, Purple, and Green orbs. BUT, you can only evolve 7 times per character. (i.e. you can only collect 7 orbs before having to restart.) You will have to evolve yourself in different ways to get all the stars!

I'm very happy I was able to finish my game on my first entry into the competition! I think the thing I struggled most with is teaching or explaining to the player how to play the game, as it can be a tad confusing. I also couldn't think of a more fitting name. Everything else should be fine though. If you get stuck or confused, the help.txt file might be helpful. There's an easter egg hidden somewhere on the map, which shouldn't be to hard to find. Also, there's an ending cinematic if you collect all five stars :) Enjoy!

IF THE GAME FREEZES AFTER THE TUTORIAL:
I'm sorry this happens. At this point, the game creates and modifies a bunch of objects for the main level, all in one go. If the game freezes, and doesn't crash, try waiting a while. On my computer it only takes about 5 seconds, and on others I've seen it take like 10 or 15 seconds, and that's the only solution I can think of. Maybe you could try waiting a minute or more. Sorry again.

I apologize for not being able to port the game to OS/X or Linux, but if you're on a mac you can try Wine. And if the game crashes on Windows, please try to tell me when or what causes the game to crash, and the error message. Thanks a lot.

About the source:
I'm really sorry, but I do not believe the source of the game is available. I've tried opening it in Construct Classic 0.98.9, r1.1, and r1.2, and it just gives an error of "this game was made in a newer version of construct." If you really want to see the source, I can send you some backups I made during development, so you could see if those work. Or if you have any questions about the code, I would be happy to explain stuff to you. Just let me know. Also, the source still does contain the graphics and sound effects, so you can still have those if you want them.

entries.title: Growth
entries.description:
Click to move. Drag to rotate.

Drag and Drop the flower to plant it and watch it grow.

Click on a flower to harvest the color. Click on the Update Generation to clear the field.

Music Attribution: Eliot Corley, License CC-BY-SA 3.0

entries.title: I'M BUGGING OUT MAN
entries.description:
Kill ALL THE BUGS.

Controls:
A/D or LEFT/RIGHT : move
Space : Jump.

entries.title: Lucid
entries.description:
You're stuck inside your subconscious, and you must test your skills in order to escape.

WASD to move

M to mute music

other controls explained in game.

entries.title: Mad Scientist Monster Maker
entries.description:
Build up a giant mega-monster and destroy cities!

- Smash buildings to find and eat the 3 scientists in all 5 cities
- Eating humans gains health (citizens and scientists are worth the most)
- Upgrade your monster in your evil genetic lab
- Get bonus points for throwing vehicles
- Eye lazers!  When the indicator lights up, press space to shoot.  Raising your LAZER stat lets you fire more often.

Post-jam note:  I sped up the enemy bullets to make it a bit more challenging.

entries.title: Meatify
entries.description:
Hi, we are Ruthless Games, a group of portuguese students who like to make games. This is our first released project, and we are happy to show you all our game.
Our game is called Meatify and revolves around the story of Zacarias, a fellow who wishes to become a butcher. However you don't control Zacarias in his quest to Ultimate Butchery, you will control the level around him and aid him in his advancement.
As Zacarias becomes more powerful, capable of a greater range of motions, your powers in the world will deminish, as Zacarias needs less help.
The story of Evolution of a person, with the aid of others.
Also, to show the real Evolution, we change the surrounding according to Zacarias' evolution.

We are very happy with the result, but as always with something made with a short deadline, there is always that little feature.

We were able, although, to create a level editor so that  you can create you levels and share them.

Hope you enjoy our game as much as we enjoyed making it.

Note: the block on the bottom left corner represents the block you have selected to put, and on the right there are two blocks, which represent the moves (changes of level's blocks) you have left. Sorry but we didn't have time to implement anything fancier.

Controls:

1-9         pick block (some cannot be picked in some situations)
mouseclick  add/remove block
r           restart
space       unleash Zacarias

PS: Includes Fart Jokes
PPS: If Zacarias stands in mid air at the beginning of the level, press R, it will all be ok.
PPPS: The game is in Java so requires it.

entries.title: Ontogeny
entries.description:
'Ontogeny' is a running game similar to ones such as 'Jetpack Joyride'. It is the story of an escaped test subject from a  secret government facility in which they were testing the effects of a recently discovered disease on humans. Said disease gives these humans the ability to scale their evolution  forwards or backwards to reach an evolution that is either more or less agressive than the previous one.

The game itself is unfinished and i am hoping LD allows you to update during the course of the next few weeks. It is playable but sometimes glitches out.(by sometimes i mean ALOT.) If you do discover any glitches that are currently not listed below please comment and tell me. If LD does not allow for updates but you would still like to know more about this game then come like us at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Shugor-Corporation/117741101680899

CONTROLS
--------
Arrow Keys - Move
Z - Cycle down evolution
X - Cycle up evolution
Mouse - Move through menus and such

**Known Glitches**
---------------------
Breath does not currently work.
Sometimes you will randomly bleed
The lowest and highest evolution are not
invincible and do not have a timer for how
long you can use them.

Thanks for trying it if you do!

~Shugor

entries.title: RIVE
entries.description:
RIVE is a game about evolution! By splitting you create mutations of yourself which have slighty different properties. Each offspring has the potienal to become a great lineage! But each offspring also need control and since multitasking is hard you just control all at once! Which offspring will you favor and lead to a great destiny, which will you condemn to a quick but brutal death!

You can control your offspring with W A S D. By pressing SPACE you can split to double your offspring. Press R for restart and Esc for a quick break!

entries.title: Social Evolution
entries.description:
Controls: WASD or ARROWS
Instructions: Avoid red, take yellow, get girls, get Lucy.

Your goal is to date Lucy. In order to do that, you first need to reach your maximum evolution by gaining attributes (getting a car, going to the gym, etc) and avoiding others (overweight, etc).
Also, you need to date all the girls before Lucy, because that will increase your popularity among girls.

Done in 24 hours with no framework (only FlexSDK + FlashDevelop).

entries.title: Star Explorers of the United Nations
entries.description:
In an unknown part of the galaxy where life evolves at a super-fast rate, how will you confront what you discover?

A dopey little shmup with a couple fun easter eggs. Can you reach both endings? (without looking at the source code?)

Controls: Arrows to move, control key to fire gun.

entries.title: Tad's Adventure
entries.description:
Tad's Adventure

TAD (Timely Adaptive Design) must navigate  a harsh and unyielding environment.  As he progresses he will need evolve into a stronger creature by learning new abilities, while at the same time forgetting those that help the least.
The game is a basic shooter, with a twist.  All abilities (save for basic movement) must be selected from a random list of choices.  You may go completely defensive and avoid enemies rather than confront them, or take the offensive and try move to the top of each food chain.  Each level you will choose two new abilities, but you must first lose one you already had.  Choose carefully as each has their own benefits and weaknesses.

Controls:
Keyboard:
Arrow keys - Control movement
F - Swim (if you are not buoyant)
D - Use your normal attack if you have one
S - Use a special attack (if you have one and the special gauge is full)
Space - Start and pause game

Gamepad:
Digital directional pad - Control movement
(A) - Swim
(X) - Normal attack
(S) - Special attack
Start - Start and pause game

Written in C# using XNA 4.0.  If you haven't run an XNA application before, you will need to install the XNA redistributable, available from Microsoft at http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914.  Note that you will not need to install the game itself on your machine, just unzip the archive and run the game executable.

entries.title: Tardigradevolution
entries.description:
The controls are: Space bar and left/right arrow keys.

So unfortunately, I tried integrating facebook and having a whole database and saves for scores/evolution points etc, so you could resume by just logging in. I ran out of time, so I'm just editing the shop code (that's already written) to something less impressive but will actually work. Hope that's okay.

Unfortunately, a lot of things were last minute since I decided to have a nap, and the map finishes after the second mob (Going to upload the map editor later).

entries.title: the Fisherman
entries.description:
Before anything, the tools: Notepad++ for the programming, Gimp for graphics and Chrome for testing.

the Fisherman is *thrilling* game of fishing, where your goal is to slowly evolve your modest fishing ship into a master of the sea, collecting 10 000 gold pieces!

Be careful however... as your ship grows, so does the envy for it!...

that's the theory of the game at least... due to time restraints (oh noes, who would've thought that could happen! :P) there are very few parts to buy. Sadly the core of my link between the theme and the game was how your ship would "evolve" as you got richer and bought more parts and made it bigger and better. With only 1 or 2 pieces to buy per type, that concept is completely lost...
Also, the game has been tested  very little and is likely to be kinda buggy in some parts. But it should be winnable at least.

Tips for playing:
the longer distance you travel, the more new shops will buy your fish more at a higher rate.
Also, the game goal is actually 10000, not a million, didn't have time to change the sadly crappy title screen.

entries.title: Triple Threat
entries.description:
******************************
****** 2-PLAYER GAME ******
******************************

Okay, I made a 1v1 iPad game that works pretty well on computers, besides the vertical resolution. I probably shouldn't have spent so much time working on touch controls during the compo though...

Anyway, your units 'evolve' with new attachments as the game goes on, and your strategy for controlling your squad 'evolves' as their capabilities change.

The winner of each of the first 3 rounds gets first choice of items. The winner of the final round wins the game.

CONTROLS:
PLAYER 1: arrow keys
PLAYER 2: WASD

NOTES:
- Bumping into other units locks up their controls temporarily, but does *not* hurt them, even though I totally made it look like it does.
- The items aren't vertically flipped for the second (top) player, so they'll have to do it mentally if they want to correctly predict what slot will be filled.
- If you can't see the whole resolution in the web build, try a downloadable version.

Tools used: Unity + RagePixel + CFXR + Garageband
Keywords: web, bullet-hell, bullet hell, shmup, multiplayer

entries.title: Watercolor Wheel Evolution
entries.description:
*** Had to make a bugfix (within bugfixing rule #1). The original version will eventually crash when reaching generation 10. If you have downloaded the original version, please redownload. ***

* Almost all arts by my daughter, who will become 3 this week! *

Absorb the stuff floating around with the Wheel to influence the next generation. Depending on the stuff you absorb you will be faster, bigger, slower or smaller next round. The stuff that makes you smaller and slower also hurts you. Your size represents your health.
Each type of stuff influences an aspect of the Wheel. 
Absorbing stuff influences aspects and number of the stuff in the next generation. If you leave out types of stuff they will be bigger and faster next round and even get random movement changes.

Go try it out.

** Windows version: Start WatercolorWE.exe **
** On systems with python/pygame (Linux) start WercolorWE.py **

entries.title: World of Bacteria
entries.description:
You take a control of a group of bacteria. Your goal is to survive as long as possible and grow population big as possible.

All bacteria are different by their abilies, they multiply, mutate and conjugate, die plus you can buy and improve genes and powerups yourself. There are other cells, particles etc for you to eat and lymphocytes and phagocytes to eat you.

You can group and evolve your bacteria to create optimal populations for maximal survival and to prolong your certain defeat.

The game is complicated, so read 'readme.txt'. Randomness is a big factor, so gameplay might vary. One time ends in the beginning and in the other you might success.

!!Note that when you buy stuff you have to have the bacteria you want to update selected, otherwise it won't update it even if it plays the sound


3.9
Uploaded an improved post-compo version, I feedback is appretiaced and I will still improve the game

Changelog:
 - Added menu where you can change the screenmode and game       speed
 - Added mouse-driven shop where you can instantly select your update without playing with keyboard
 - A lot of bug fixing
 - Improved readme, remember to check it!

entries.title: 2-deoxyribose
entries.description:
The platypus are angry, because evolution has fucked them up. So they decide to mutate their own DNA, and kick some asses before the extinction hit the race. Simple as that.

You can choose up to 3 mutations before a game. Each of them brings some advantages, but sometimes some trouble too. Their names and effects are hidden at first, but you'll be able to unlock them by lasting at least 30s in a level.

Try to combine the most powerful mutations to obtain the best score :) 

In game, fire with the mouse, move with the Arrow Keys or WASD, reload with CTRL or R and mute with M.


I used Flashpunk with FlashDevelop, Photoshop and Bfxr.

I'll probably update a bit this description tomorrow, a bit tired at the moment . Good night yo.

entries.title: a day to remember
entries.description:
I wasn't a fan of the theme of Evolution but I didn't want to not take part!

The idea of a day to remember is that the dinosaurs are about to be wiped out and with your last remaining minutes you have the chance to try and save yourself and your brothers and sisters by coming up against harsh realities in life and then mating with your partner to give your children a better life.

You do this by inspecting objects in the environment, if an exclamation mark pops up you need to go back to your partner and see just what you've done for your children.

The game is far from complete, I was pushing it getting it done for the Jam, so I obviously just set everything a bit too high. Plus I probably didn't make it in the neatest of ways. It's super buggy and doesn't have an actual goal due to time constraints or any threats which were all planned by did not make it into the final game. I also didn't get the time to record or add in sound effects which really annoys me as I always aim to get something in.

I made it in Game Maker HTML5 although early in development it decided that the game wasn't going to run in HTML5 so I decided to just go for Windows instead of waste lots of time. Which was then spent on different bugs that weren't hard to solve but took me forever to realise it.

I wish to thank you in advance for playing my game if you find the time.

entries.title: Beast Feast
entries.description:
Straight outta Underground Pixel comes an arcade game, the likes of which you've never seen before! Beast Feast was made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 24 and stars an adorable... erm... monster. In order to evolve to his final form, he must eat the meat dropped by the enemies that he blows up with his egg bombs. Reach 50 on the food counter to win, and try your hardest to get there in the lowest time possible!

Instructions: Arrow keys to move. Z to drop an egg, Z again to blow it up. Evolve by collecting food dropped by killed enemies. Don't get touched by an enemy or get too close to a bomb you set off or else you'll lose 5 food!

entries.title: dronepool
entries.description:
Requires HTML5 canvas capable browser to play.  Chrome works best.  It's plain javascript so 'view page source' to see sources.

See the in game text for more details.

To the code averse: I'm sorry.

entries.title: Dudes in Forest
entries.description:
your objective is to mate with dudes until you get the best genes possible.

Made using python 2.6 with pygame, gimp and mspaint.

Didn't get everything done, but the game is playable and very hard if it's not your lucky day.

In source package the game.py is the main class.
Sorry for no sound and innovative name.

entries.title: EVO - X
entries.description:
[UPDATE - 08/28/2012]
Since many are, with reason, complaining about the game being unplayable, I'm adding a "post-compo version 1.01", with only two modifications: I added a demo and a "keys pressed HUD" (only activated during the demo, though).
Even so, I know there are two small problems with this demo:
1- since I mostly tap "x" to attack, it sometimes isn't shown...
2- I used floating point timers in my game for calculating when the next action should be performed... but that can cause some inconsistency if the framerate when playing is diferente from the one when recording... (since the replay is frame-by-frame, I think...)

At least, I finally understood why the gameplay fells so terrible to many... xD

---------------------------------

A flash adventure about a strange creature that can actively modify itself, given enough sample (that's, kill enough enemies and you get abilities =D).

Instructions:
arrow-keys - move
x - attack
up key - jump (when enabled)
c - run (when enabled)
k - stats screen
p - pause

entries.title: Evo... launch-ion?
entries.description:
Bah... ran out of time on this one . I kinda like the way it looks... but thats about all :)

I wanted to add multiple evolutionary stages (I even have them modelled) and a few different abilities gained along the way, but I have a habit of putting off the important stuff (like gameplay features and working physics) in favour of playing around with visual effects.

Next time I'll hopefully have a bit more time and energy to devote to LD!

Controls
=========
Smash the left and right cursor keys until they break, then hit space to (evo)launch your fish out of the water.

-Volcanos (evo)launch you up in the air, try to dive into them with the down arrow key!

-Collect the blue scraps of DNA for no discernible reward!

If your fish should fail hit Enter and you'll get a new one to (evo)launch.

entries.title: Evolver.exe + Src!
entries.description:
Technically speaking there's not much here, but at least I got it done and made an effort to do an entry.

there are only 2 levels and you use the keyboard.  You WIN by having the window close at the end of the second level.  Hitting "Esc" to close the window does NOT count as winning :-)  I leave it up to you to figure out how it works, think of it as a towlr exercise

The idea was that the game evolves as you play it, but I didn't get that far because of my limited time.  So now you only have the 2 levels.  It's okay to rate it poorly!

Now with executable version for windows!

Just run evolver after extracting it to an empty folder of your choice.

For max and linux -- sorry guys but you need to get LOVE2D from http://love2d.org and then use it on the love file.

The source is included in both versions (in the case of the Evolver.zip file with just the .love file, you need to unzip Evolver.zip and then rename the love extension to a zip extension and it should have main.lua in it)

entries.title: Evolving Cubes
entries.description: It's pretty lame so far...

entries.title: EvoTD
entries.description:
EvoTD is the next generation of tower defense games, where towers will evolve with experience, crushing the enemy in its path!

Just click on Web to get playing now!

Hey guys! So EvoTD is a tower defense game that I created, in which the towers will evolve as they get experience with damaging the enemy. The game is a Java applet so it can be run on most any system, and all the instructions are in the game! Have fun!

entries.title: Fend off waves of zombies with your evolving gun DELUXE
entries.description:
Here's my first game made for LD.

It's a tragic story about a girl whose OH WAIT
You're a brave red square who is surprised to see zombies raining from the sky. So you grab an evolving gun and procceed to kill as many undead squares as you can.

Arrow keys for moving, R for reloading, mouse to aim and shoot. Collect cash monies to evolve yourself and your gun.

Features 16 weapons and even more square zombies!


Weapon guide:

Tier 0: 
Default gun.

Tier 1:
Top: Light revolver (leads to rifles)
Middle: Heavy pistol (leads to shotguns)
Bottom: Light pistol (leads to autofire)

Tier 2:
Rifles: Heavy revolver (not quite a rifle)
Shotguns: Double-barrel
Autofire: Machine pistol

Rifle tier 3:
Top: Sniper rifle
Middle: Rifle
Bottom: Carbine

Shotgun tier 3:
Top: Full-auto shotgun
Middle: Semi-auto shotgun
Bottom: Pump-action shotgun

Autofire tier 3:
Top: Submachine gun
Middle: Assault rifle
Bottom: SAW

entries.title: It a disaster, hofally next time it will be better
entries.description: Okay story, my name is Bryon Glass. This is my first time entering any competition for a game, When I started the game I ran into a big problem. Windows stopped working, I didn't have time to reinstall it, so I moved to linux, However never doing images in linux, and trying to create images using a Inkscape I had never used before was a disaster! After staying up all night trying to create images that look terrible. I had wasted a good portion of a day and didn't have much to show for it. So I got to coding not knowing what I would do about images, then I ran into another problem, linux wasn't picking up keyStrocks in Applet(I was trying to use applet instead of my usual graphics because everyone like game you don't have to download) Finally I got keystroks to work in eclipse but when I uploaded my first game to the website keystrock stopped working on linux, at that point I just went to bed. Overall it was a disaster... But I still wanted to enter something so I can vote. Sorry for how bad the game is.

entries.title: Friend Ships
entries.description:
PLAY HERE www.boxhacker.com/lud24

See link for how-to-play!

- Kill ships

- You can make them angry

- Shoot asteroids to collect ore (makes you appear greedy   to other ships)

- Go to a sun to re-fuel

The games AI did not work out so the above feature may or may not work out well...

Requires flash plugin + a hardware accelerated graphics device.

Things we would do differently next time:
x - Work longer
x - Not spend a day finding a new moniter...
x - Work on game essentials first then effects etc
x - lower the scope of the project

Made with:
x - FlashDevelop for the code using AS3
x - Flash CS3 for the GUI + GUI code
x - Photoshop CS3 for art
x - SFXR for some sound

Developed by:
James Wrightson, programmer, design and coffee addict www.boxhacker.com

Claire Knight, art, sound and gui
www.claireadele.com

entries.title: LimiT
entries.description:
Game name: LimiT

Game Controls: left right for movement/z or up to jump

This was my first actual LD48 that I'm competing. I put in a great deal of time into making this game. I hope you enjoy!

All of the sprites in this game were created within the time frame (You'll notice the decline in the quality ;_; my wrist is all swollen)

SOURCE: I used Construct2 as for the programming part of my game. So I attached the project files without the graphics

Story (Don't have to read anything below here + my English is terrible)
https://docs.google.com/document/d/148CSPLoATmtT8Xs6G1Jimg9_9Fp30Us_-oPru2yEJhY/edit

Rant

I hate hate hate hate hate programming. I hate it so much. Especially this weekend I couldn't even think how certain game mechanic works on Construct2. So I pitched several ideas like abilities gain after each evolution. ;_;
You can also notice the terrible animation coding. All I can do is draw so I used my 150% effort on graphics.
Again thanks for playing!

-Sakuyan or @hyungkim7 on twitter

entries.title: Monkey Bowling
entries.description:
This is my third LD game. I had a lot of fun making it. If you are going to participate in a future LD I would highly recommend livestreaming.
I had a nice chat with people watching my livestream and they helped me with playtesting and kept me motivated.

Tools i used:
Haxe with the HaxePunk Library
Gimp
Raptor's SpriteEditor
As3 SFXR
Sublime Text 2

About the game:

Help the monkey evolve into a more advanced species that can hit a strike on those bowling pins!

Controls: 
WASD: Move
Space: Read signs
1-4: Select evolution level (if unlocked)

entries.title: Mutants
entries.description:
It's a early alpha to show what I've done so far.
WEBSTART CURRENTLY BROKEN!
To run it with windows, extract the zip and run mutants.exe (or mutants.jar).For linux users: just run mutants.jar, it should work.
Coming:
- more Levels
- more enemies
- better sprites
- DNA research to know what to update
- upgrade system for you and your enemies
- destroy one update by winning a minigame

I finally finished a post-compo.
I added a score and health notice to the game, also music!
It's a great 8 bit track from http://ozzed.net/music/8-bit-Empire.shtm
I fixed an animationbug.
Big thanks for helping me with this goes to my friend marco.

You can find the updated game here:
http://seiby.de/games/mutants/mutants_run_postCompo.zip

entries.title: Myxolous
entries.description:
Guide your civilization of Myxos to victory and evolution!

- Mouse Controlled
- ARROWS to move camera

entries.title: Neon Spores
entries.description:
In Neon Spores you play as an alien trying to influence the evolution of an ecosystem.

Please let me know if you have any issues.

edit [28-08-2012]: I fixed some a bug which caused a crash by spawning too many sprites

You can change your window size by editing "preferences.txt"

Controls:
WASD - Move
Left Click - Shoot energy
Right Click - Drop held plant

See the screenshot 3 for how to play. There is no real victory condition, just try to make as much of the ground green as possible (until you die or the game slows down and crashes...)

Known issues:
- You can fly into the ground and you wont die
- I forgot to add the code that stops you flying off the edges of the map, oops
- Game balancing
- Stability

Hope you enjoy :)

entries.title: OF SPECIES
entries.description:
"I was on my way to Aeolis Mons. We lost communication with the rest of our unit earlier this morning after they were dispatched to the supply drop site. I had a strange dream last night. I can't quite remember what happened but it was terrifying in a way I can't put into words. It felt like a premonition - something dark was coming."

--------------

Instructions:

Click and hold on objects to investigate for a chance to find helpful items.

Med Pack: Use this to restore health.

Bandage: When bleeding (indicated by a red health bar) use these to prevent further health loss.

Syringe: An experimental steroid that can protect you from damage - requires continuous dosage for sustained effect. (Indicated by a blue health bar).

--------------

Created in Flash with Actionscript 2.0
Graphics created with Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, and Cinema 4d
Audio recorded in Pro Tools

entries.title: Robolution
entries.description:
Robolution is my first ever entry for ludum dare. It is an exciting platformer eqsue finding game and you job is simply to evolve a human in order to survive.
You play as a pathetic human stuck on a mushroom filled alien planet coated in ruin with Lava waiting to burn your goolies off.
Simply put, find the cores to build and evolve yourself. Hopefully enough to find more stuff to evolve a little more and more, and are you even human anymore? Surely if you evolve this much you gotta be a meta-human or something.
Never mind that, go find all the 105 and find something special. Because Easter Eggs are tasty.

Controls are as follows:
WSAD to move around
Enter skips text
ESC to close the game
and the mouse controls the camera

entries.title: Species X
entries.description:
Apparently some guys found a fungus in a forest that seemed strange and made some crazy evolution-experiments with it.
Unfortunately the fungus ended up spreading very fast and growing bigger and bigger and zombifying everything around it. The goal is to destroy all the solid brighter fungus-things. But hurry up, because the farther the fungus spreads, the more enemies will spawn!

entries.title: TOWER OFFENSE
entries.description:
A game where cells eat each other to make themselves better and try to pass towers.

If a cell eats a cell at or above its own level, it will use those advanced parts (or whatever) and make itself significantly better.

If a cell eats a cell below its own level, it will only absorb the HP.

UPDATE: (post compo)
In 'GUIDELINES' is a document describing all the secrets in the game. Looking at it may ruin the fun of the discovery of all the ways for a cell to evolve, but will also make sure you found them all. Look at it if you want, it isn't an official part of the game.

The post-compo version is slightly better. The changes are as follows:
- implemented 'halo' around changing cells ( I had wanted to do this but ran out of time).
- prevented an error that occasionally prevents one from getting past wave two of level one.
- added support for skipping dialog with <enter>.
- added support for visiting past dialog with <backspace>.
- fixed some text errors in the dialog.
- added 'fastforward' button that will remove the cap on fps and allow the simulation to run faster (if your computer sucks it won't run any faster).
- fixed turrets spawning wrong (in the original code I accidently switched the data value for 'kind' with data value for 'wavespawn' making a basic turret that should spawn in wave two spawn as a machinegun turret in wave one).
- added the identity of the mysterious static at the end of level five! It's pretty epic. Well, maybe not...

Please don't look directly at the bugs!
http://puu.sh/ZpuZ

entries.title: UED(UFO - Earth Defense)
entries.description:
The Goal of the Game ist to destroy the Enemys.
Control:
Left/Right/Down/UP: Arrowkey Move
X:Shoot

You need LÖVE2D to run the Game

Sry for the Filehosterlink,in 1Week i will change the Link to dropbox

entries.title: Whelp
entries.description:
Born as a dragon whelp, your goal is to dig upward and reach the surface. Each level allows you to evolve and gain new abilities.

A and D to move, W and Space to jump, click blocks to destroy them, climb to to the top.

entries.title: Advolvolution
entries.description:
Advolvolution has two game modes. The first is survive. In this game mode, you attempt to survive for as long as possible while being attacked by hordes of enemies.

The other game mode is inventively names "1000 Kittens", and spawns you in a world filled with, yup, you guessed it: 1000 kittens. But not just any kittens, randomly coloured kittens! Your goal here is to collect all 1000 kittens as quickly as possible. No pressure.

Evolution comes to both game modes in the same way. As you are busy slaying gooey looking bouncy things, or rounding up your furry friends, the world evolves around you. This could work to your advantage, blocking your attackers from getting to you, or it could corner you leaving you with no option but to fight back.

WASD to move, space to attack. Enter selects the menu item and escape pauses the game.

I will also be adding a timelapse video to the links once I have put it all together.

entries.title: Amazing Neko Neko Shop
entries.description:
UPDATE : music and sound bugs are fixed! Enjoy the new version!

IF YOU HAVE PROBLEMS WITH SOUNDS, PLEASE DOWNLOAD OPENAL HERE : http://connect.creativelabs.com/openal/Downloads/oalinst.zip

A shop. Some Chemical X. A debt to pay to the mafia. And 6 kittens. Let's breed them into the cutest so most lucrative kitty!
But beware of evil mutation, hate between kitties, and kittens becoming fat! That's not good for business!

entries.title: Buffalo Joe
entries.description:
Only the fittest can survive, and Buffalo Joe is fit like a battleship!

How does this fit the theme?

Well... I can always claim "survival of the fittest," right?  =D

But the original intention was to have special plants which would evolve your herd and give them wings, allowing you to fly over the lava gorge and win the game. So if intentions were gold I'd be at Fort Knox, but since time's oversold it's more like "guess not"!

Read the post-mortem if you like: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/28/buffalo-joe-post-mortem/

Want to simply win the game? When you start, pressing "a" adds a baby buffalo. Forgot to remove that debug key... d'oh!

entries.title: Cave Creature
entries.description:
Cave Creature is a simple RPG where you take control of a cute cave dweller, and slowly evolve him into the highest lifeform of the continent!

 - Gain stats!
 - Grow horns!
 - Grow a tail!
 - Explore a giant world map!
 - Kill all the pink blobs!!!

There is no ending, so just level up until you get bored.  :)

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Cell evolution simulator
entries.description:
Syerjchep Evolution simulator.
Updated and Reuploaded for the Jam.

FOR SMALLER SCREENS
press W once the game has loaded

Hit demo for an example layout if you can't get life to start on your own. (also check out help)

entries.title: Caveman's Quest for Food
entries.description: This is yet another retro style one button game with 16x16 sprites. You are a caveman in quest for food. Instructions: Press enter to start (or touch the screen in Android) During game press space (or touch in Android) to change direction. I wanted to create a new gameplay mechanic using just one button or touching the screen. Made in 48 hrs using: Game Maker Studio Beta Paint.net SFXR Beatcraft (I did make a game in less than 48 hours, unfortunately I couldn't submit it because I run out of time. I wasted friday night and saturday working in a gameplay that doesn't work very well and it wasn't funny at all. On sunday I had only 5 to 6 hours to put together a new game mechanic, and finished a couple of hours after deadline, so I submit it to the Jam)

entries.title: cell.evolve
entries.description:
Here is my contribution, inspired by the great game Osmos, but you control many cells.

Tech: FlashDevelop, TweenLite, WolframTone, as3sfx.

- Click on a blue cell to and click where you want to move
- Eat food and boosters (speed + metabolism)
- Avoid ugly stuff (poison, evil cells)

- ESC toggles menu
- SPACE restarts level
- R restarts from level 1

Divide into 5 cells (by eating) and be the only cell type left to complete a level.

entries.title: Core/24
entries.description:
Just a simple clickfest.
I could have done better if i didn't tried to do something i had no clues about how to do it. But well, whatever, it was fun to make.

entries.title: Creature Ranger
entries.description:
Description:
Use the WASD keys to move around and step on the orbs to collect them.  Each step makes you lose orbs, so don't get too low on any of them.

Runs on Windows 32/64.  Untested on linux/macosx (download the windows submission, the jar files are in there).

Unzip and run the exe or use the .jar

entries.title: EvoCube: Epoch Victorious
entries.description:
A game about out-evolving your competition and navigating weird tron-like cubist landscapes to cheesy dance music! It's survival of the fittest to beat all the epochs. (i.e very loose theme interpretation :) )

Made with Unity4. OSX tested, the others I've left it up to faith that Unity did the right thing on export. Let me know if they don't work.

Instructions:

Move your cube onto the white exit pad to advance to the next epoch.

Esc = backs out
'r' = retry current level (if you get stuck)
wsad or arrow keys = move the cube around.

entries.title: EvoGoop
entries.description: This is a game in which you must escape the caverns. You can play for however long you want and still win. You can mutate in this game into 16 different creatures. I lost 14 hours before I made this game due to the fact my old Idea was too complicated. Hope you have fun.

entries.title: Evolution Racer
entries.description:
Customize your character and race your car.

This is a collab between me and kevlarx. He thought of the idea and forced me draw stuff.

entries.title: Griff Dangers in Mettle vs. Metal
entries.description:
You are Griff Dangers. You've been called to investigate rogue robot sightings in the city. But you soon find out, these are no ordinary robots. These robots are intelligent. They will evolve to adapt to your fighting style. But you are Griff Dangers. You can handle it.

Killing bots at close range will increase their fire rate.
Killing bots at long range will increase their health.
Killing bots with grenades will increase their movement speed.

Controls
A: Left
D: Right
Spacebar: Jump
W: Use
Mouse: Aim
LMB: Shoot
RMB: Scope (sniper rifle)

Engine: HTML5/Construct 2
Images: Paint.NET
Audio: SFXR, LMMS

entries.title: Invasion
entries.description:
CONTROLS
Arrow keys to move.
X to interact.

HINTS
Some plants are sturdy enough to be climbed. They grow more leaves than usual.

There's an ending, although it may be difficult to find.

entries.title: Lab (R)Evolution
entries.description:
Not finished...unfortunately change of weekend plans...still I wanna to participate somehow :)
It awesome contest and I cant wait till next one.

entries.title: Locked Away
entries.description:
LOCKED AWAY

It's the year 2000.

The world of the future.

Flying cars, video phone booths and electronic books.

The Inter-network lets police access data from across the entire city.

But one thing hasn't changed: the criminal mind.

* * *

This game is played in your web browser. It was only tested in Google Chrome.

The game has three "assignments".

This is different from any game I've ever made before, so I'm very keen to hear your feedback :)

entries.title: Phantom planet
entries.description:
We barely made something working. Basically, there's 4 types of living beings on the planet, one of them is planet itself. They all interact with eachother, and have a chance of triggering an evolution. There are two possible evolutions for each (and each can devolve back with right influence), and the chance is affected by the domination factor of that specific being. 

This is a very unfinished version, so bear with me! Though it doesn't have a defined end, you can still try and get all the evolutions- it functions as a sandbox game (it probably has quite a few bugs as well)

CONTROLS:
Arrows: move
Z: enter meditation
X: remove being

REQUIREMENTS:
XNA redist: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Pimp my Rat !
entries.description:
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Here is "Pimp my Rat", the story of a green rat whose only goal is to help a professor to create a new form of plant. He will have to try 3 different kinds of pills wich will change his own body and abilities to complete the professor's test sessions.

- Platform game 
- 5 levels
- High challenge. 
... Be careful ! This cage is full of traps !

Controls:
- ARROWS : Move
- Left SHIFT : Run
- Space : Jump

We hope you will have fun playing our game.
We will post soon our post-mortem with our impressions about our first Ludum Dare experience.
Happy Gaming to everyone :)

entries.title: Space Sheep: Cyber-Genetic Wariors
entries.description:
Cybernetic, genetically altered and fast mutating white sheep (dubbed, Wht_Sheep) have invaded friendly space! Pilot the prototybe, Blk_Sheep, genetically engineered to have an upper hand in the mutation game!

Enemies evolve through the game with you as they pick the best performing individuals from a generation and mutate them to form the population for the next wave.

WASD/arrows to move, mouse to aim and shoot.

entries.title: Super Charles Darwin
entries.description:
So I decided to make an action platformer in honor of Charles Darwin.

This game is probably the most complete I've ever managed inside 72 hours.

There are 3 levels and a boss fight. Several powerups, enemies and environments.

The difficulty is tough, but with some patience you should be able to make it. I really hope you enjoy :)

\o/ All art, gameplay, music, sfx* in 72 hours by myself alone. \o/ 

[*EXCEPT the Wilhelm Scream which is of course the Wilhelm Scream as comments pointed out]

http://akseli.virtuaalipalvelin.net/darwin/

(Also note that it works best in Chrome, should work in FF and there will no sound in IE at least)

Tools used:

ImpactJS (html5,javascript)
Paint.net
sfxr
FL Studio

entries.title: The Gift/Curse Of Evolution
entries.description:
CAUTION: THE GAME WILL CRASH IF YOU NAVIGATE AWAY FROM THE WINDOW. BEWARE. KEEP THE WINDOW UP WHILE PLAYING.

You have been given a gift

The world around you evolves rapidly.

But you do not.

Maybe it it a curse

Use the world to survive the world.

Controls:
The white box is the mouse
Arrow Keys to move.
W to make the world update only when you move (not recommended except for bossfight and true roguelike style)
F5 for full-screen (Sometimes crashes. Use at own risk)
Esc to unlock the mouse
Left Click to pick up items on the ground (must be close enough)
Right click to use items
0 - 8 to select items in the hotbar
E to evolve the selected item

If you stand under a tree long enough you may get a branch. This is a good thing to pick up and evolve. BUT ONLY ONCE.
Evolve it again at the boss fight

To summon the boss, make a campfire and stand next to it until he appears

Don't die
Kill the other human that evolves before he kills you.
(Get a sword somehow)
Beware of lava. Bonus points if you win and clean up all the lava

It's hard. Have Fun, and PLEASE DO NOT STEP ON THE FIRST TREE SPROUT!

Update: DEFEATING THE BOSS IS POSSIBLE. I WORKED IT OUT. JUST STAY NEAR WATER! (I love how I created something that even I could not defeat until just now)
I will make a video for anyone who struggles if I get 3 decent responses in the comments!

entries.title: The Legend of Elzad
entries.description:
The Legend of Elzad

The game page contains all the controls and a few special notes.

Timelapse is now up.

entries.title: Vol
entries.description:
Vol, a first-person block explorer with procedural levels and visuals!

Stop those dastardly hexahedrons before they evolve!

Let me know if you got to level 7+!


Feel free to contact me at:

entries.title: Wolf vs Jackalopes
entries.description:
Survive as long as you can by eating rabbits before your food runs out. Rabbits that are near each other will mate and produce offspring. As time goes on, rabbits will evolve into jackalopes. Try to keep them away from the other rabbits or else they'll spawn demonic jackalopes! 

This game uses HTML5 canvas and should work in modern browsers. 

Controls: Arrow keys, space, enter.

Tools/Libraries used:
HTML/CSS/JS with HTML5Boilerplate, Jquery and CreateJS (EaselJS, PreloadJS, SoundJS)
Art: Photoshop
Sound: GarageBand (iPad), BFXR, Audacity, Soundbooth

entries.title: A Long Road to Happiness
entries.description:
DISCLAIMER: This game is hard, and has a steep learning curve. One might venture to say that I enjoy torturing those who only want to be helpful and rate my game ;)

A game where you control a young protagonist named Violet in her search for a cat that she finds too fluffy to resist.

On this journey, she will encounter a large population of signs and other curious yet naturally occurring lethal deathtraps, and eventually (read, at the end of the game) learn a useful lesson about evolution: That it's terrible.

Controls are all explained in game, but only if you don't figure it out yourself. I aimed to have a tutorial system that doesn't treat the player like a three year old.

Features:
- 40 levels of increasingly difficult platforming spread across 4 different areas. The platforming is based off jumps, double jumps, wall jumps, and even placing your own blocks. There is also a workaround allowing you to skip levels if you have failed them a lot.
- An intuitive tutorial built into the early levels, allowing to to figure the game out on your own if you can, and helping you if you can't
- A soundtrack straight out of Hollywood, heavily orchestral, albeit a little short, and sound effects which fit in with the music.
- Cloth physics based graphics allowing for your character to have a dynamic hairstyle and dress.
- A level select which remembers what levels you have beaten , even if you quit the game.
- A perverted signpost and several Marilyn Monroe moments
- A terrible "I really hate this theme" last minute storyline.
- A cat. 'Nuff said.

A walkthrough will be coming up in the near future.
A level editor will also be released shortly afterwards.

KNOWN BUGS:
-Sometimes you will lose a placeable block for no apparent reason
-You can trap yourself in a freshly placed block 

The game was made in Gamemaker 8.0 pro in case any of you want to check the source.

entries.title: Adaptation : large or small
entries.description:
This time i try to do something better (not really difficult :)) than last, so i say goodbye to c++/SFML and hi to html5/javascript for the first time.


in this game you have to adapt to pass obstacle, these obstacle are managed according to the regulations required, and there are three types of rules:
  - Has a size equal to
  - Being higher (or equal) has a size
  - Was less than (or equal to) has a size
to do this bonus appear:
- Red makes you fat
- Gray makes you lose weight
- Black acceleration of the game
- Purple slowing the game
- green You become transparent for 1s

entries.title: Atavic adventures
entries.description: Created with CraftyJs and a lots of junks of code stolen from many people... too many to count.

entries.title: cosmic evolution
entries.description: this is a musical game about cosmic evolution. it's barely a game actually.

entries.title: Darbot Saves Science
entries.description:
This is a little platformer made with the free version of construct 2. 

arrow keys to run and jump
space to shoot
tab to change weapons
r to retry

entries.title: Defend against Evolution
entries.description:
Here is the result out of my first Ludum Dare.

This is a "tower defense" game where you have a limited number of tower to place.
Enemies are bred from a generation to the next (at least those that survived...) and you have to adapt your strategy to counter their improvement.

At least that was the original idea.
This was my first time creating a flash game, first time with Haxe and HaxePunk.
Definitely not the best way to be productive...

At least, I reach my goals of learning hands-on and having something to show at the end, even if I feel bad about what I end up with.

This was a great and humbling experience!

entries.title: Evidently
entries.description:
Stop the archaeologists gathering evidence to support evolution! 
And watch out for the police!

Blow up cars, splatter archaeologist and policeman brains everywhere, stop the Darwinian revolution!

Earn achievements to unlock INSANITY MODE and rip the endless policeman waves to shreds in the goriest anti-evolution game ever!

Note : I do not endorse actually killing supporters of evolution.

entries.title: Evilution
entries.description:
Subject 7A is the failed experiment of the crazed evolutionary geneticist, Dr H Gruber, which has granted him the ability to transform his evolutionary traits. 
Escape the lab by changing Subject 7A's form to pass the obstacles.

See the readme for further instructions

entries.title: Evodash
entries.description:
W - JUMP/FLOAT
A - STOP
D - DASH
S - SINK
SPACE - START GAME

My god what a game, I hate the graphics, but lets see how far you come...

entries.title: Evolution Revolution
entries.description:
You are the red organism, chase the pink ones and stay away from the green ones. Shoot with space and collect upgrades to stay ahead of the competition.

Controls and Gameplay:
WASD to move (sorry no arrow keys in this one)
SPACE to shoot in the direction you are facing

GREEN BAR is HEALTH
BLUE BAR is MANA (Which actually doesn't matter in this implementation because I didn't expand to special abilities as hoped)

GREEN BLIPS are ENEMIES and chase you
PINK BLIPS are ORGANISMS to try to eat
YOU are the RED one

COLLECT ORGANISMS to level up
As you level up you get faster, gain shooting speed, and a little more health. The enemies also get faster and gain more health, so watch out.

OTHER ITEMS are scattered about the playing field:
HEALTH POT heals you
MANA POT restores mana (does nothing in this one)
ARROWS are speed boost for a little
SHOOTING GUN is shooting speed boost for a little
SWORD is temporary damage upgrade

HAVE FUN, HOPE YOU LIKE IT! :)

entries.title: Flrrr
entries.description:
"Flrrr" is short but not necessarily easy. Evolve by collecting colors and bringing life to your world. But beware, the colors on the floor will hurt you! Also the background (music) evolves while you journey forward. 32 colors is a reasonable amount. Can you beat this?

The game may seem very easy at the beginning, but spare your health ;). Controls and some explanations are shown ingame.

Few technical details:
 * The game will use the resolution of the current main display.
 * Use the "-windowed" argument to start a 800x600 window.
 * Should run quite good on older computers. The fullscreen effects are not blindingly fast. Window mode even works on Atom CPUs/ION platform.
 * On my 64bit Linux the 32bit version was not able to capture the mouse. Hope it works for you :/. Also there is a 64bit version for Linux.

// Updated the Linux binaries with the fixes for blocking issues on some systems. Apparently that's ok with the rules.
// (Old "may crash" version still available at http://dev.spectratic.de/Flrrr/)
// There is a gameplay video available: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yXDQNj0fSaA

Known issue:
Score does not count beyond the 32 goal, probably no fix for that as it would change the initial behavior.
Guess that kills the "endgame" content :).
You can cheat and keep moving after death as long as you don't release the keys.

entries.title: Goat Boxing
entries.description: Manage and breed your own army of goats in a series of fights in order to get a goat strong enough to beat the dreaded Billytron

entries.title: Gone With The Wind
entries.description:
In Gone With the Wind, O'Hara lives in the last stage of human society evolution and the consequent post-apocalyptic environment, due to it's actions. His home was lost in the disaster and alone, he has to conquer a path filled with obstacles, struggling against time and the wind that threatens to do away with what's left of his life.



Em Gone With the Wind, O'Hara vive no ultimo estagio de evolucao da humanidade e as consequenciaas de seus atos em um ambiente pos apocaliptico. Sua casa foi perdida na catastrofe, e sozinho tem que conquistar um caminho lotado de obstaculos, lutando contra o tempo e contra o vento que ameaca o levar embora.

entries.title: Helix - A DNA Editor / Creature Platformer
entries.description:
This game needs no installation! (Just extract the *.zip file)

Helix is a platformer with (more :>) than 57 different levels. If you die, you have the possibility to edit the DNA of the character to change its appearance and skills helping you to continue easier. But not all modifications are useful.

Leveldesigner is included, just in case you want to create your own levels, but if you do publish it! ;)
Make sure you rename level.dna to create a new empty level.

This is my first compo submission for ludumdare - and my own first plattformer.

Have fun and don't forget to rate and comment :)

Oh, and it would be interesting to know if you have discovered the effects of some DNA changes (sometimes hard to notice). Let me know in the comment section :)

Hirsch

IDE: SciTE4AutoIt3 
Compiler/Interpreter: Autoit v3 
Music and Sounds: TuxGuitar 1.2, GXSCC Beta 236E and my guitar
Graphics: Corel PaintShop Pro X 
Icon: InfranView 4.32
GUI: Koda FormDesigner 1.7.2.0


Download info:

entries.title: Move the Cheese
entries.description:
You are a lazy, psychicly gifted mouse. It's 3PM and time for some refreshment. Use your ESPer powers to bring the cheese to you for a snack.

This game is based on an associated word: revolution.
All code is available under the MIT license on GitHub.

entries.title: Slug evolution
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum dare and I forgot about it at the start so I was partially rushed through some of it because I wanted to meet the 2 day deadline. But then I missed it and had to switch to the 3 day jam.

This idea randomly came to me and I decided to just work with it making it up as I went along.

The basic Idea is that you have a family of slugs that you try to evolve into better slugs. You have to try to keep them alive then get them to mate with other slugs to get better slugs that can do better skills so you can keep them alive. 

You can train the slugs to do different jobs but it costs resources to train them. The jobs starve the slugs and sometimes use resources to do the different jobs. 

You also have to watch out for the salt storms. If one hits one of your slugs then it has a chance to partially starve that slug. 

If you have soldiers the stronger they are reduces the chance that a slug will be starved, also making a blacksmith work to make better stuff for your soldiers will reduce the chance that a slug is starved by a salt storm. 

A farmer will take 1 resource and be starved by 2 points to make food depending on its strength. 

A Miner will be starved by 3 points to make resources depending on its strength. 

A blacksmith will take up 4 food and 10 resources to decrease the chance that a slug will be starved by a salt storm depending on its strength. 

The color of the slugs have nothing to do with its skills. Mating 2 slugs will take 5 resources and create a new slug with different skills.

entries.title: Cannibal Slugmage of Eden
entries.description:
Note that when the game is started, a CMD window will appear with a lot of errors (though this seems to be fixed in the post-compo version). Rest assured that these ARE normal and usually do not interfere with play once the SDL window appears.

There is no tutorial right now, so this will require some explanation. 

CONTROLS
* Move around with wasd. (In the post-compo version, controls have been changed to qweasdzxc to allow diagonal movement. Sorry, non-qwerty people. :( )
* Press g and then a direction key to grab in that direction.
* Press t and click a slug in your inventory to drop it.
* Press m to enter magic mode. While in magic mode, you can eat slugs for mana or click a spell to enter casting mode. While in casting mode, click the world to cast your selected spell. (Note that, as in Magic: The Gathering, ending your turn resets your mana to zero!)
* Mouse over a slug or a spell to see its stats.
* *** If you get stuck (such as by entering Magic Mode or Drop Mode without any slugs in your inventory), in the post-compo version, you can press escape to end your turn. ***

SPELLS:
* Lightning: 1 mana. Kills exactly one target slug.
* Hand: 5 mana. Puts the target slug in your inventory.
* Fire: 10 mana. Kills all slugs in the target square and all adjacent squares.
* Dawn (unimplemented): 100 mana. Ascend to godhood and remake the world in your image.

STATS
* Mana: the amount of mana you receive for eating this slug.
* Docility (TAME): the slug's aversion to fights. Slugs with low TAME will frequently kill slugs around them (but not you, for they are lowly slugs and you a mighty Slugmage!)
* Perseverance (PERS): the slug's attention span. Slugs with low PERS will frequently switch targets.
* Weight (WGHT): currently no effect. Originally, the Slugmage was to have a weight limit, so that slugs would have to be bred for low weight in addition to high mana yield.
* In addition, each slug has a color that is derived from its weight (green), docility (red -- low docility means HIGH red!), and mana yield (blue). Slugs with radically differing colors will have trouble mating.

MONSTERS
Monsters in Slugmage, as lesser beings than yourself, cannot harm you. However, as they are the main source of the mana with which you exert your divine presence, you would do well to learn about them.
* Font of Life: actually a type of venerable slug, Fonts give up their mobility in exchange for independence and asexual reproduction. Fonts remain capable of sexual reproduction (but cannot initiate it) and grant renewed life to weary slugs around them.
* Slug: a stupid creature that has nothing better to do than chase random other monsters. Slugs require constant rejuvenation from their home font, and will return to it when they begin to shrivel up. Certain slugs with low perseverance may give up their futile chasing altogether to become Fonts.

entries.title: Conway's Revenge
entries.description:
My entry for Ludum Dare #24, with the theme of Evolution, is the game Conway's Revenge.

It is essentially Conway's Game of Life (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life) modified to work with multiple opposing teams of cellular automata. The rules of reproduction have been tweaked to make the game more interesting and 'game-like' by preventing deadlock scenarios and making sure it's not too hard to get your cells to grow and expand.

It has three game modes planned, two of which are implemented:

  1.  Campaign - A set of puzzle levels where you face off against progressively more difficult enemy formations (unimplemented).
  2.  Battle Royale - A bloody melee between four different teams of cellular automata. The grid is initialized with a random pattern, perfect for conflict!
  3.  Sandbox - A blank slate for you to explore and test your own creations with up to four different teams.

Try it out and let me know what you think!

The official project page (including links to the source) for Conway's Revenge is here: http://nickknowlson.com/projects/conways-revenge/

Check out my journal entries for the post-mortem.
