entries.title: Cubic Evolution
entries.description:
Evolve the cube from something drab to something FABULOUS! ;)

I am not going to put instructions here, but rather, let people figure it out.  There is a win condition and I am interested if anyone is bored enough to see it!

Light on the theme, and a bit abstract.  But it's a game, I made it in 48 hours, and I like it.  Web version is available now; additional builds/media will be available sometime tomorrow.

I guess I missed the window for the regular competition?  I swear that in the past there was a grace period for making the submission itself; but the option isn't there.  Oh well I guess.

Hope some people enjoy the game!

EDIT: Going to put instructions here after all.

The objective of the game is to evolve the cube.  After a certain amount of time, cubes on the larger cube will start flashing.  Clicking on the flashing cubes breaks them up and sends them to the orbiting nodes.  At any time, you can click on an orbiting node to transfer the cube energy inside of it to the main cube.

Clicking the flashing cubes fast enough, and without clicking non-flashing cubes, will start a combo (Shown in the upper left).  Higher combos increases the rate at which cubes start to flash.  It's 5 cubes per multiplier, and you have 5 seconds between cubes before the multiplier resets.  Hitting a non-flashing cube resets your combo.

I had intended to put a time element in the game so that there's some point/competition but it's not in there, maybe use a stopwatch? ;)  It's a silly game anyway, but it was fun to make and maybe with some love it could become something greater.

This is a multiplayer sword fight deathmatch on a scenic castle map. Players are given four variable stats. Each time you get a kill,  your current mutation becomes permanent. Generally your character's stats improve through natural selection. That is all mechanical.

FunFact: you can drink beer or even eat while playing this game as it's designed to be played using only one hand. ;)

entries.title: Manual Population Control
entries.description:
An arcade/tower defense/coffee break strategy game, made with Python & Pygame. Keep the enemies from becoming too specialized at wrecking your defensive turrets by juggling them like a pro.

Instructions (now with a gameplay video):

The round object at the left is a generator, which your job is to protect. Use your mouse to connect it to turrets - left-click to draw and right-click to cut a wire. 

There are three genes in play: red, green, and blue. 
-While an enemy is attacked by a turret with its color, it's immune to damage.
-When an enemy is killed by a turret, the enemy gene pool adapts to the turret's color by one fitness point, meaning that enemies of that color become more common.
-Additionally, an enemy gene levels up after every 4 fitness points, spawning more powerful enemies. Namely, the blue gene will give more health, the green one more range, and the red one more attack power.

You can also take advantage of genes.
-A turret that kills an enemy adds the enemy's gene to its gene bank. 
-A turret's gene bank can hold 3 genes. 
-The cumulative genes of all turrets _connected to the generator_ can be used to build more turrets in the white slots. Select the genotype of the turret by clicking on the bottom left colors; then connect a white slot to the generator and click on it. Building a turret costs 1 gene of its color.
-Additionally, if a turret's gene bank has 3 same genes in a row, you can level up that gene by clicking on the turret and pressing the double helix button. Turrets built after that will be more powerful in the same manner as enemies.

Knowing all that, try to keep the enemy gene pool in control by strategically connecting and disconnecting turrets from the generator. The goal is simply to survive as long as you can; your score is the amount of enemies killed.

It's challenging but addictive - just the way I like my games - so don't give up.

entries.description: A platform game in which you have to evolve to get further.

entries.title: Player 2, start!
entries.description:
The game is packaged as a single executable on all platforms (except MacOS, it is a zipped .app). You can double-click, and the executable will fetch Panda3D and launch the game.

"Player 1 and Player 2 are brothers. Player 1 always was the braver one, he always willingly set for new adventures, as opposed to Player 2, more shy and reserved. Player 1 and 2 just finished their game, and Player 1 only wish for one thing : explore a new world! Player 2 isn't sure that's a good idea, and try to change Player 1's mind. But too late : Player 1 leaves on his own.
Player 2 begins to seriously worry as his brother doesn't seem to come back. Maybe it's time for him to be the hero and go help Player 1...
And that's how Player 2 will embark on a journey which will show him how much video games have changed throughout the years, not always for the best. Maybe Player 2 will be able to find a better place for him and his brother to live as video game characters."

Unfortunately, we couldn't finish on time (no dialogs, no transitions between levels,...) and are only able to provide the source code.
It is tryable, though.
Thanks for those who'll be bold enough to test it! :)

entries.title: RPS Evolution
entries.description:
I wasn't happy with how this finished up. No sound and no different enemies or ending. I play TI2 for not finishing completely, but the game is in working order.

The combat is Rock Paper Scissor based with 'charges' which you must rest to regain more. You gain exp which increases your damage, defence and maximum hp.

The 5 levels represent Very Easy, through to Very Hard, all of them scale with your stats.

I apologize again for the lack of completeness D: This turned into more a practise of programming then a game creation~

I livestreamed the whole thing, which can be viewed at http://www.twitch.tv/tentaclenoises under videos.

I will also have a timelapse up of the whole thing! will update this when it is done.

entries.title: The Balance
entries.description:
__Intro__
The balance has been created by 
Abe - http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/abe
Reuno - http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/reuno
Kuru - https://www.facebook.com/pages/Art-of-Kuru/177891188907256
Mr_Hk_ - http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/mr_hk_

If the 6Mo Loading is too long, grab a cup of coffee (or any alternate beverage ).

__Story__
Did you know that everytime a new planet is born, it gets automagically populated by a bunch of colorful creatures ? Half of them are pure evil while the others are really nice fellows.

Ok you probably knew that already. But did you also know that everytime a new planet is born, the Evolution Master sends his devoted assistants to evaluate its potential ?

It's up to them to decide whether the planet will evolve towards good or evil. Basically what they do is destroy either the planet's cute or evil inhabitants. Whoever's left gets to rule the planet.

Are you up to the task ?


__Credits__
- Created in 48H for the Ludum Dare #24 (Yeah we know, we had 72H but we've chosen ton fight with our Compo fellows).
- Source code could be found at : http://github.com/abe33/ludumdare24  ( Yes we weren't supposed to post as jammer, but we are happy to share it with you) 
- Special love to the talented Andy for the Awesome track "The Neon Nest". You should have a look at www.uniformmotion.net , it's good for you.
- Line Tship and her magical apple/chocolat Muffins.

entries.title: B07s
entries.description:
The Story

The roB07s have taken over the complex. You need to disable them all by evolving to the highest security level: 0xFF. To do this you must transfer and add the security codes of a bot with lower security level to your own. But be aware of bots with a higher security level than yours - they know you are a threat and will hunt you when they see you.

Controls

ADWS - move
Space - jump
Mouse - look
F - toggles flashlight

Notice

you need Java to run B07s (get it here if you don't have it already: http://www.java.com) and a graphic acceleration card.

If you are using the version for OS/X, Linux, Other please execute the "b07.sh" to start the game - DO NOT DOUBLE CLICK ON "b07.jar" because then the game won't start with enough amount of memory and will most likely get stuck at "creating level ...".

entries.title: Badass
entries.description:
Badass decided to perform natural selection himself! 
Help him get rid of hipsters!

The game is really simple, press X to attack nearest enemy!
You can also do the jump! (Space, Z, Y, or Q)

DON'T LET HIPSTERS FLANK YOU! Jump when you're surrounded!

This game is super short, because you have many more games to play. You can beat it in just few moments! It's also  quite easy but you can get your ass kicked by a bunch of hipsters if you're careless!

Have fun!

entries.title: Cellvolution
entries.description:
Devolve today with Cellvolution!

A simple but engaging action/strategy game where you must navigate your cell to avoid and consume other devolved cells. As you progress through the infinite amount of levels evolution gets progressively harder as the cells grow in size. Only forward thinking and luck will get you through to the next level of evolution.

The premise is straight forward, your cell randomly changes color and this color tells you the other cells you can pair with or need to avoid. You have limited health and time but must consume a growing number of matching cells to level up. Don't worry, you will have power ups like speed boost, or health refills to help you in your evolution. Be careful, one power up provides you the ability to evolve quickly but with it comes greater difficulty, you will see.

CONTROLS:

The controls are simple, "WASD" or Left-Right-Up-Down will allow you to navigate between crowded cell filled areas or avoid unfriendly cells coming after you. Collect power ups and matching cells but avoid the other colored cells. The mouse is not used.

WHERE TO PLAY:

http://bobthegoblin.com:8081/LD48/index.html

TIMELAPSE:
http://youtu.be/2Dro3DkLgNQ

I used a tool called gawker and it really made small screens that skewed on YouTube. That was the best I could do :(

GAMEPLAY VIDEO:
http://youtu.be/t31ARPDDzEU

TECHNICAL DETAILS:

Made using Cocos2d-x HTML5 Alpha and the code is 100% Javascript with no other frameworks.
http://www.cocos2d-x.org/projects/cocos2d-x/wiki/Html5

This is a browser game so there is no install but you need a newwer brower with HTML5 support.

entries.title: Crab
entries.description:
So here's Crab, my little game for the Ludum Dare #24!

Don't expect a lot of gameplay here, the goal was mainly to create a strong and odd atmosphere - the game's pretty short too. The link with the theme may be hard to find, but it's there!

You play as a red bubble, which keeps corrupting houses it lives in.

About the controls, they're pretty simple:

- Use the mouse to move the red bubble
- Use left click to interact
- Use F to toggle fullscreen
- Use Q to quit

I finished it about 10 minutes before the deadline, and ported it to Windows afterwhile. I had various issues with my compiler and SFML 1.6... So I had to adapt the code for the 2.0RC version. The source code is a real mess by the way! I'll probably upload an extended version on my website - mainly to clean the code, and add various elements I hadn't the time to include.

For the tools:
- SFML (Graphics)
- OpenAL (Sounds)
- The Gimp (Art)
- LMMS (Musics / Sounds)

I hope you'll enjoy the game!

entries.title: EDR
entries.description:
Unfortunately very unfinished the idea was to have it so your character would be able to modify his ability and evolve it untill you could pass the dungeon but such is life.

Controls are WSAD movement, up and down key to play with global lighting and right mouse button to kill stuff.

If nothing else I discovered a rather cool way to do lighting for my 2d game-stuffs so, not a total loss.

oh and L-key enables an EXTREMELY slow improved lighting mode that supports an infinite number of light sources per object so.. melt your pc or something! 

Zip file includes literally everything, all the psd's including some unused ones, the GMK and other goodies.

entries.title: Enhanced Man
entries.description:
This is a classic, quite simple platformer where you use the arrow keys to move and jump.

Press enter/esc/space to start the game when the first text is shown (forgot to add a message there ;) ) 

Pick up different powerups to jump, run, and air-glide better. This is the "evolution" part :)

Blue cubes are extra health
'R' pickups makes you run faster
'Ae' pickups makes you control the character better in the air (sideways and down)
'J' pickups makes you jump higher
'H' pickups increases max health and refills health completely

You can jump much higher on lava, but you get damaged!

Some control issues: You don't have to time the jumps. Just hold the up key to jump higher on lava.

Other known issues that will be fixed in the post-compo version: 
* Missing health bar
* Missing in-game help messages
* Level 1 is to difficult
* Entering a lava block from the side kills you very fast :)

Tested mostly in Chrome for the WebGL version.
The canvas version seems to work in IE8, Firefox, Opera and Safari but runs really slow ;)

If you don't here any music or SFX, please let me know. I would also be very grateful for telling me about any bugs or other problems you find :)

Enjoy!!!

entries.title: Evolve
entries.description:
Very happy to have something to submit and really enjoyed the comp. Congrats to everybody involved. I'm looking forward to playing a load of games over the next few weeks.

Anyway, about the game...

I had a hunch Evolution would be the theme so had an idea in my head from the start. The end result is not too far from the initial vision although several shortcuts had to be taken to finish in time and I'm not entirely happy with a few elements of the game - the lack of any music being one. 

I seem to have mainly been making action/arcade type games lately and wanted to try my hand at something a little more abstract. I'm also interested in finding out how I can direct the player towards the games objectives without actually telling them directly what to do. To this end the game contains no instructions other than the title "Evolve". 

Hope you enjoy it.

entries.title: Evowing
entries.description: Evolution theme used via genetic algorithm to "evolve" enemy upgrades

entries.title: Exvolvere
entries.description:
This is my game. There are many more like it, but this one is mine. And I'm proud of it. I've spent maybe a few days learning java before starting this project, so it's messy, probably sloppy, and rather limited. All the same, I'm pleased with how it turned out.

I'd like to keep developing this over the long term - the ultimate goal being that you actually script your cell, having four human-programmed AIs controlling the cells and fighting.

The game's been tested on Windows and Linux (developed on Linux). I feel sure it'll work fine on OS X since there's no OS-specific code on it, but I can't know for sure since I don't own a Mac. Please feel free to try it out and report any bugs!

REPORTING BUGS:
Screenshots and a description of what you were doing at the time are the two most useful things I can get.

KNOWN BUGS:
<fixed> Null pointer exception if you pick an invalid cell type.

entries.title: Graphics are overrated
entries.description:
Your goal is to survive while the weather keeps changing.

you have to keep your temperature stable around the middle, if you max it out you burn, if it get's to low you'll freeze

but you'll have to have energy to walk.

around the world there will be magenta pickup's availible those will level you up, wich result in less affected by the weather, but faster change of temperature + energy

Random Generated world 


green tiles: give you energy
red tiles: Temperature rises
blue tiles: Temperature drops

Controls: arrow keys + spacebar (selection, respawn on die)

this was my first LD, learned alot in it. A bit bad timing, because 27aug is my birth day, so lost about 20h to that. but totally worth it :P

will join next LD.

Using the source code:
- play on same map as your friends by entering the same seed
- change difficulty

PS: the game isn't that good :P

If you're having problems running it:
- Check if you're having the latest version of JAVA (7u6 or something), it's build for that. Don't have any other versions installed, and installing older versions gave me a lot of problems in the past, so I won't be able to build with an older version of JAVA.

entries.title: Jim's Quest
entries.description:
Jim's Quest, developed by craio95 for Ludum Dare 24 Jam. Programmed in C++ and SDL, compiled with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012, graphics made in PyxelEdit, sound created in Bfxr. System requirements: Microsoft Windows XP (may or may not work, tests have been inconclusive) and above, .NET framework 4 (not sure if required).

My first Ludum Dare ever and my first serious game project ever, so yeah... It's not that good. You are Jim, an adult trapped in a kid's body. To "evolve" you need to collect all the DNA found within the levels. For controls, read in-game help. This is just an alpha version. I will continue to develop it until I finish it.

entries.title: Kibitzer
entries.description:
Hello Everyone!

I hope everyone had a blast during this Ludum Dare, despite it was a tough for me to finish the game on time for the Jam, because i had so much stuff going on during the weekend, I did have a lot of fun (our kickstarter campaign on one hand: http://kck.st/MjgYVk , and a presentation we gave on tandem with Ace Team on the other hand: http://on.fb.me/PWKzE5 )

About the Game:
You play as a all seeing entity that watches over planets as they evolve from a lifeless mass of gas to a green planet full of life.

You've got to use your resources wisely in order get rid of asteroids that threaten the process.

About the source:
You'll need a copy of impact.js in order to use it.

entries.title: Leap of the Lemmings
entries.description:
Not really much of a game, but a somewhat interesting experiment.
Press "Run" to make the "lemmings" jump off the cliff. The ones that survive will reproduce and then you can make them run off the cliff again and again. There is a button to make the camera go to the top off the cliff, and a button to go to the bottom of the cliff. I had much more planned, but of course, there is only so much time.

Alt+F4 to quit Windows standalone exe.

[EDIT] Web Player link is now fixed, thanks for pointing that out!

My intention when making this game, was that each generation, you would be able to pick some sort of mutation to be applied to the newborn lemmings, which would either help or hinder their survival of the fall. Then those ones that survived would go on to reproduce. I never got that far though unfortunately.

entries.title: Mrs. Mr. Dr. Evolutio
entries.description:
In this game you play an epic high school science teacher of ambiguous gender.

Your job is to protect the fertile minds of your students from the creationist dogma spreading across your classroom.

The more GREEN a student is, the more likely they are to ask a question that spawns lovely pro-evolution green sparklies. Do not shoot these.

The more RED a student is, the more likely they will spout creationist nonsense, polluting your classroom with black sparklies. Shoot these.

You have 3 weapons at your disposal:
Rockets shoot sparklies.
Bombs drop knowledge on students within the blast radius.
BLAST can only be used when you have bonus points.

A full school day is 7 class periods. Do you have what it takes to endure this game of unnecessary length and reach the secret end screen?

Mac coming soon!

entries.title: Planetary Overseer
entries.description:
Have you ever wanted to help guide evolution? Specifically, have you ever wanted to use some methods (they're probably highly illegal; don't inquire too much) to mutate animals to try to build a stable ecosystem? Well, then this is the game for you! Your goal is to, by mutating individuals, make it so 3 species can coexist.

The player is given actions to do like blocks in a tetris, and you just use them at that order by simply clicking around

entries.title: Rock-Parer-Scissors War
entries.description:
I wasn't going to participate at first but ended up realizing an idea I had.

In the game there are 3 units: rock, paper and scissors, each unit is running from the stronger unit and chasing the weaker one, or if it can't see anyone it just wander around at random, after defeating enough enemies your units level up (evolve) which make them better but more expensive.

If you find a winning strategy or sure it's random, leave a response in the comments :)

For in game help press F1.

entries.title: SUPER ROBOT EVOLUTION.
entries.description:
This was made by me, M. Lorenzo LiteLab/LiteCloud. I created the sounds, graphics, ideas, designs, and the code in which extends it's base. The base is flixel, it also uses a tweening library by the name of Actuate.

SUPER ROBOT EVOLUTION is about robot, you play as him and you ravage other robots, in turn, you will gain experience, level up, and evolve throughout. Your stats get boosted with each level. And with each level, builds up the difficulty.

I'd like to thank my girlfriend, friends and the entire ludum dare community for inspiration, I've been wanting to join this contest for so long.

I hope you enjoy this game, as much as I did making it! :D.

To control, use the ARROW KEYs and SPACE, or use ASDW and LEFT Mouse Button. You can use either in combination(ARROW KEYs and Mouse, etc.)

Programs used to make this game:
Flash Builder CS5 (Code.)
Fireworks CS5 (Graphics.)
Bfxr(Sound.)
FL Studio(Convert Bfxr wavs to 24 wav mp3s.)
And Google Chrome(To test the game site and view Ludum Dare :D)

And, last but not least, Thank You. Hope you all had fun! :)

entries.title: Tactical Binary Evolution Combat (TBEC)
entries.description:
Created for the Ludum Dare 24 in Game Maker 8.1 in a 48hr period!

Tools: GMK8.1, Gimp, Sfxr

Story: 

Develop and evolve your program to destroy the other programs and gain dominance!

CONTROLS:

left click - drag to select units/mine block
right click - attack
wsad/arrows - move screen
1,2,3,4,5 - select program to create
m - map
v - evolve selected units
c - click and drag to mine blocks

Goal: kill the great menace!

entries.title: The Adventure of Charles Starwin
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move, Space to shoot.
Far from a complete game, but playable.

Each new enemy which spawns bases its stats on the average of the surviving enemies so in theory they 'evolve', in practice it makes very little noticeable difference, although they do tend to get faster. I'm sure the concept could be done well (in fact someone nearly certainly will have done something similar and better in the competition) but I don't have time to do it.

entries.title: The Origin of Valmalvax
entries.description:
Weird, experimental, shmup / strategy game.

You are in control of a creature that will evolve depending on how often you perform certain actions. 

Shooting, moving around, eating the corpses of the creatures, taking oxygen and enduring punishment will fill your meter a little. When you completely fill a bar, you won't see the benefits immediately. You will transfer that experience to your descendants, so when your lifetime is over and you die, they will take your place as your evolved form to continue your journey.

CONTROLS
Mouse - move cursor. When your creature is overlapping the cursor it will shoot automatically.

Left Click - Will teletransport your creature to the current cursor location. (you need oxygen at level 9)

**This is the Ludum Dare #24 version, it isn't finished, I'll keep working on it and post a link later in case you want to check it out. Thanks!

entries.title: The Plurality
entries.description:
Made in Java with Slick2D.

I tried my best to learn how to make applets before this, but I didn't and I'm sorry, you'll have to download it. :C

Also, sorry about the lack of sound. :P

I'm 14, but please don't be gentle with your criticism. I love making games and want this to be a learning experience, please give me pointers.

There are two endings, try to get both!

Use the WASD keys to move, Shift to push crates, and S to open doors or hide under ledges.

If you get stuck somehow press J to reset the level.

Press K to go to the next level if you're a dirty cheater.

You need updated Java v7 to run this. Unfortunately it only works on 64bit computers, sorry about that. :C

---------

Follow me on twitter at @N427Games

entries.title: The Unravelling Of The World By A Man Made Monstrosity
entries.description:
The Unravelling Of The World By A Man Made Monstrosity is an arcade shooter about an AI who discovers that it has free will.

IF YOU DIE, MAYBE TRY AGAIN. THERE ARE ROUTES FOR YOU TO GET PAST EVERYTHING WITH MODERATE EASE.

We did some voice acting because we had an hour or two left over after were finished, so make sure that you play with the sound on if you want to hear that.

Tools:
Audacity
BFXR
Photoshop CS6
FlashDevelop
Flashpunk

Not that you'll need it, but here is a SICK PRIMA DIGITAL STRATEGY GUIDE ONLY $14.99 AT ALL GOOD RETAILERS. http://i.imgur.com/gikuT.png Might not be 100% accurate as it's the thing I made before actually making the levels so that I could figure out what linked to what. Someone somewhere might find it useful.

entries.title: Uberlution
entries.description:
In Uberlution, play as a little guy who gets bullied by the others ! Sneak behind your biggest foes and get some xp by fighting the little ones, yeah, that's right, like a coward !
Evolve by eating them, be bigger, be stronger, see better !

And reach the mighty level 10 awesomeness !
First level might be hard, but find someone edible and you won't regret it. Mash keys to escape other's attacks, and hold space to eat people.

Lots of things were cut during the making of the game. I spent  like 3 or 4 hours doing a perk tree that I took back because I lacked time. This is my biggest disappointment, and I simplified the game A LOT.

This is basically the game where you eat smaller fishes to get bigger, except it's supposed to be a stealth game, where you upgrade your speed, strength, discretion, field of view, radar... I'll probably make the game as I envisioned it soon.

Anyway, enjoy ! Don't forget to extract if you have problems launching the game

links.label: Windows (Yeah I know download is boring D: but try it please)

entries.title: Augment to advance
entries.description:
A tricky little platform game, where you need to evolve your speed, jumping ability and gliding.

You can use the keys "WAD" or arrow keys to move. "R" will restart the current level, and "M" will mute the audio.

There are 15 levels to frustrate you ( and yes is meant to be hard - it's as unforgiving as old school gaming )

I hope you enjoy my first Ludum Dare entry!

entries.title: Bullet Evolution
entries.description:
Bullet Evolution!
I made a shmup for this Ludum Dare competition.

Use WASD To move and K to shoot, depending on the enemies you kill different stats will increase. If you kill the enemies that move fast, you will move faster, if you kill the enemies that shoot fast, you will shoot faster! Etc. The enemies that shoot a spread of bullets increase your power which thus increases your bullet spread/power.

Enemies also get stronger as you get stronger.

It didn't turn out as good as I hoped but hey! I finished it  in under 48hours so it is a success in my book!

entries.title: CellEvolution
entries.description: A basic platformer game.  Get all the cell parts.  Arrow keys to move.  Made in Processing, using Player.pde from http://www.openprocessing.org/sketch/17115   I made up the music myself and played it :D  Sorry for the horrible quality of music and game.

links.label: Web (Takes a bit of time to load)
Source (On the bottom of this page)

entries.title: Cosmic Canvas
entries.description:
- If you don't have an up-to-date browser (such as Chrome), play the Windows executable for better performance -

You are Guaxbot, colossal organic machine that can make planets.

Guaxbot has a symbiotic relationship with the planet it creates. It must find a magma core and grow it up to a T3 planet in order to survive.

As you orbit your core, you can pull space debris such as DUST, LIQUID and GAS towards the core, using your mouse. Use these same materials, or the ones produced by your planet to attack invaders.

If you grow your core up to a T3 world, you will survive for eons to come.
If you don't, the planet will crumble, and you will die in a few years.

To win, achieve 125 total materials in your planet


Credits: 
Programming: Henrique "7Soul" Lazarini 
Music and SFX: Lucas "X-wing9" Barcellos 
Sprites: Matheus "Mat" Leiras 
HUD: Renato "Reanto" Gusmao 
Planets Graphics: Thiago "Guax" Portella 
also freesound.org 
and Construct 2 

Edit: Fixed several bugs.
Edit 2: Fixed one of the songs not playing and set the game to scale to your browser window.
Edit 3: Fixed the player being able to instantly skip the win/lose text by clicking when it appears. Fixed some other problems when the game ends (persisting objects and particles)

entries.title: Dinosauria Square
entries.description:
Dinosaurs! Breed dinosaurs and evolve their stats, to defeat the ultimate dragon god!

Each dinosaur has stats (strength, speed, vitality and attractiveness), that you need to evolve to be able to defeat the dragon god that lurks in his cave. When you die, you continue as one of your children or relatives, so don't worry about the dragon god killing you!

When you reach age 17, you will grow, but as the old saying goes; "He who eats rabbits grows more quickly". Click on the "mating call" icon when you are near your desired mate, and if she shows you a heart, stand near! Use your dancing moves to increase your chances! Also, don't give up if she refuses you the first time!

(HINT! You need to have at least 9 STRength to inflict minimal damage to the dragon boss. Try breeding dinos with high STR)

[BugFix! Previously, the fire balls could not kill you, thank you someone for pointing that out, now they do.]

entries.title: Dragonkin EVO
entries.description:
#The idea:
First you begin in cell stage then evolve into underwater snake and then you come to the surface as a reptile and tart catching flies with your tongue. Then you grow wings and become a flying reptile. After that you learn how to file breathe and become something like a dragon... *idea stops somewhere here* ...finally you evolve into intelligent
humanoid dragon race. Your planet is almost destroyed but your race smartest scientists invent time traveling machine to go back in the past at the beginning of your evolution to undo their sin against nature. The scientist cant send a message in time to simple creatures like cells and reptiles
so they implant the message into your DNA. *then the game starts from cell again* Somewhere in humanoid stage your race learns to read DNA from species and understand that there is a message to them from the other future. Your race becomes the protectors of nature and balance. And you eliminate everyone who breaks the balance.

#About:
 You start as a cell and then evolve into snake and then into reptile. And my time ran out to finish the game :V

#Guide/Mechanics:
   *All Stages:
      Lives - you have 3 lives and enemies take you 1 life
      DNA - you need to collect enough DNA to go to the next level
   *Cell Stage:
    Viruses(the red things) - they move randomly and if they touch bio material they use it to replicate themselfs.
If you toch them you take damage
    Bio material(small things that look strange) - you need to collect them to get DNA. They also heal you.
    Water flow(the blue lines) - they push you in the direction of the flow. They also push bio material. However,
Viruses "swim" to the oposite direction of the flow
   *Snake Stage:
    Bubbles(the empty circles) - you have to colect them to get DNA. Also your size grows when you eat them.
    Bubbles filled with plankton - the only difference from normal bubbles is that they heal you.
    Bad Bubbles - they do damage if you eat them
    Snake Body - if you eat yourself you get damage :D
  *Reptile Stage:
    Dear-Man Alien(the yellow creature) - it files very fast
and you have to catch it with your tongue.

Every stage has different controls which are showed before the stage starts.

#Controls:
 Move - W,A,S,D
 Tongue - Right Mouse Button
 Change text between stages - Esc,Space,Enter,Left Click

#Cheats/Debug:
 Go To Game Over - G
 Go To End - H
 Next Level - PageUp

#Unfinished(due to time):
 In snake stage the snake is buggy because I had to finish the other stages.
 Reptile stage was supposed to be stage where you catch flies and your tongue grows so that you can reach higher flies.

#Notes:
 If you get a crash or the game runs too fast or find any thing wrong use the "cheats" to see the other stages 
 If you find a bug that isn't stated in the bugs section post it in the coments

#Bugs:
   In snake stage you will see the snake flashing
   Sometimes in last stage you get random GameOver
   Sometimes there is object left from the last stage

entries.title: Evolutionary Designer
entries.description:
Tutorial is highly recommended! Chrome or Firefox highly recommended!

Mixes World of Goo with Qwop by allowing you to design your own organisms and control them to get to the end of 6 levels.

Controls are explained in the tutorial, but to summarize:
Space: switch between designer- and play-mode

In designer-mode:
Drag left mouse on blob: create muscle/blob
Drag middle mouse on blob: drag blob around
Right mouse: remove muscle/blob
Hovering on a muscle and pressing any key will bind the key to the muscle

In play-mode:
R: resets the level
Any key you have bound to muscles for movement (numeric, alphabetic and arrow keys)


You can also share your creatures with others when you press escape in designer-mode.

If you can't figure out a level, you can watch my playthrough for some inspiration (contains spoilers): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tq9deX4v7Ss

entries.title: Evolve and Defend
entries.description:
Arrows to move.
WASD to attack.
Clock on a building to view available upgrades.

If the HP on a building drops to 0 and you have an upgrade, you will lose an upgrade. If you don't have an upgrade you die.

You know how they say don't try and use a new language or engine. I didn't listen.

entries.title: Flourish
entries.description: Just a tiled map, draggable with the mouse. I used Cocos2D-Javascript which supports TMZ maps. I created an elaborate map and tiles for the first day only to discover it took over a minute to display with Cocos2D-Javascript. I spent the rest of the time search for a suitable alternative, so there isn't a game to show at this time. Lesson learned: get familiar with the framework and its performance before starting a competition.

entries.title: Genocide
entries.description:
Genocide is a survival platformer game in which you must drive every other race extinct, and all creatures, including you, can multiply and evolve. Everything you need to know to understand and play the game is in the Help section in-game, so if that sounds fun to you or you want to know more about it, just click that Web link, or the Java link to play windowed.
It's made in Java. If you want to be able to play it, you need Java 1.6 or higher.
This game was tested on 64-bit Windows 7 using JRE7. It seems to crash a lot for some people, I hope to find a solution to that problem some time soon.
The music was made with Autotracker-Bu and the sound effects were made in sfxr. The graphics were made in GIMP.

entries.title: Guardian of the Evolution
entries.description:
My first LD completed :D using the trustworthy, battle-tested framework libgdx <3

When I was planning this game on paper it seemed much more fun, but I did everything that I could to improve it... anyway, enjoy the game, and good luck everyone :)

entries.title: KIKI adventure
entries.description:
this is my first LD and i'm using flashpunk
these are my tools
flashdevelop,sfxr,pxtone,pickle,pyxeledit

help kiki fight his enemy by collecting star

by collecting enough star, kiki will evolve into another form and can shoot,however kiki will need star power to shoot

and in the last form, kiki can move freely to avoid his enemy and defeat the last boss

arrow for movement
z – for fire (you must fill up star bar first and evolve to fire, and it cost your star bar)
m – mute music
escape – return to menu

entries.title: Life Stream
entries.description:
Control the life stream to form new life by combining different creatures and reach your goal!

----
All of the game is entirely mouse drive.
In-game help text should point you in the right direction.

entries.title: Lolicopocalypse
entries.description:
Roguelikish movement. Evolution takes place not only on the level - the screen rots, all colors mutate...

Made with SDL+OpenGL+SDL_mixer and software pixelated renderer for mobile devices
Video of software renderer on GCW Zero prototype: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k63XdzwxQbo

The Wii version: [ http://wiibrew.org/wiki/Lolicopocalypse ] (Thanks to Rikku2000)

The Wiz version: [ http://dl.openhandhelds.org/cgi-bin/wiz.cgi?0,0,0,0,37,598 ] (Thanks to Zear)

entries.title: MuTaTrIs
entries.description:
Everyone knows the world-famous Tetris. 

What if blocks could change over time? What if those blocks were... mutating?

Be careful while making lines, now the rules are changing!

A line containing a GREEN square will add something on the next block pattern... and a line containing a RED square will remove a part of the next block pattern.

Note that any modified pattern will REMAINED CHANGED until the next mutation!!

Review your strategies and do the best score.

PRESS 'SPACE' TO ROTATE THE BLOCK.
PRESS 'ARROW KEY' TO MOVE LATERALLY ('DOWN' TO FALL FASTER)
PRESS 'P' TO PAUSE THE GAME.
PRESS 'R' TO RESTART.

This game was written in HTML5/Javascript/CSS3. 
(No specific framework nor library, it's my home-made engine).

============================================
PLEASE READ BELOW:

Known issues:
- Doesn't work with Firefox (yet), please see below if you want to learn more and why not try to help me out
* - The Firefox version will load the game even if the musics and sounds are not (this can result in no musical effects while playing)
- Black/White screen on startup (it's actually the loading screen)
- Can be very laggy on some computers (the code will be compressed soon)
- No menu/title

Feel free to report any bugs or problems you met :)

entries.title: Next Generation
entries.description:
Here it is. Very rough, but I'll be updating it.

Web Build will always be most up to date.

---Rules---

Next Generation is a turn based life simulator game. Your goal is to survive the ever changing world for 13 turns by choosing mates with traits you expect to be beneficial.

Move with the WASD keys.
Press Enter for next Stage.

Mouse over objects for more info.

Attacking and mating is done by clicking close by organisms. Make sure your Reproduction types (Sexual & Asexual) are compatible.

During your turn's stages, make your moves quick and keep an eye on your Energy bar. If it's low, find nutrients. Your energy bar does not decreases on the Ai's turn.

Your energy meter depletes the longer you take your turn. Either make quicker decisions or invest time to find Nutrients to replenish it. 

Always seek mates, if you fall behind, other organisms will become strong than you and attack you.

---

Much of the art was not done by me (because I'm not an artist at all). In fact, all the 2d cell art is pulled from this wonderful TED Education video, "The Wacky History of Cell Theory" which can be seen here http://youtu.be/4OpBylwH9DU

"The Wacky History of Cell Theory" is a lesson by Lauren Royal-Woods and was animated by Augenblick Studios (http://augenblickstudios.com/).

entries.title: Ninjural Selection
entries.description:
Forget natural selection, it's time for *ninjural* selection! Wield the power of life and death to guide the evolution of your little invaders. Run, jump, slide, and wall-jump around while you shoot invaders to cull the herd or punch and kick eggs out of them and watch them multiply.

*The updated version actually has a goal now! Please check it out and let me know what you think!*

entries.title: Slowly
entries.description:
A game about living your life as a tree.  Nothing more.  Enjoy the weather collecting sun and water to grow yourself to new heights!

Have fun and enjoy my first LD entry!

entries.title: Tadpocalypse
entries.description:
Chad the tadpole dreams of growing up into a frog, but there's a problem - the fish are coming!

Play through 5 exciting waves of enemies, evolving over time to defeat the fish and finally achieving your dream of becoming a frog!

My first Ludum Dare entry!

CHANGELOG (27/08/2012 01:20am GMT) - Added coral! A slow but indestructable obstacle, swim around it to avoid it! Also, minor bug fixing and audio tweaking.
CHANGELOG (26/08/2012 11:49pm GMT) - Fixed a bug that caused noise at the end of the game, as well as fixing upgrades to make them less abusable.

entries.title: The Evolution of Cthulhu
entries.description:
Collect food < or = to your self, don't die. move(W,A,S,D). evolve.
Its a network game running off a little database so you may bump into other players, you cant harm each other.

entries.title: The Three Rituals
entries.description:
I'm quite proud that i actually managed to finish it, and still get some sleep! Please feel free to post spells in the comments to help each other out, but please post a *SPOILER* if you post a spell that summons a demon king! *SPOILER*.

I have really tried to make the Demon kings worth the effort, so hopefully you'll enjoy them! ^^

You get health from killing enemies, forgot to mention that, and it feels quite important.

entries.title: Tower Evolution
entries.description:
A simple tower defense game in which your towers combine different upgrades to become a unique weapon.

If for some reason my very temporary and unreliable website goes down, the standalone version is basically a mirror of the site.  Open the HTML file to run it.

Instructions are on the webpage.

entries.title: Urban Sprawl
entries.description:
Urban Sprawl is a city building game in which you are the mayor of the soon-to-be vast town of Jarlsberg. You are tasked with placing buildings to push the growth of your city. Throughout the game houses will build on the tiles around your Town Center and continue to sprawl outwards, provided you are a good and loyal mayor. Each special building has different effects for the tiles around it. 
As you play your city will either go bankrupt or go down in history as houses cover all areas of the map.  

The world that you build in is new every time which allows for different outcomes with each new play through. The best way to enjoy Urban Sprawl is to play more than once. Continue playing and notice new trends and more efficient ways of building your city. You are the mayor after all and can't just leave the citizens of Jarlsberg to suffer.

Urban Sprawl is written in HTML5 and will play right in your browser. The game is even optimized for decent play on most tablets and smart phones so give it a shot if you own one.

Please let us know what you think of Urban Sprawl; we love to hear your comments and appreciate all feedback. We will most likely continue to work on the game which is accessible via http://thegamingproject.org

The Gaming Project is proud of the Ludum Dare 24 game we created and with the closing of our second Jam entry we continue to look forward to future events.

entries.title: WTF Aliens!?
entries.description:
Running this game:
If you want the Windows version, just download, unzip and click on the WTFAliens.exe icon

If you want to run this game via Love2D, make sure you have version 0.8 and that it works correctly.

I know I know, it's not obvious how this is about evolution.

I WAS going to make the ship EVOLVE with the music, but I ran out of time.

But you know what bro? It's cool, I got this...
The aliens in this game are the aliens you failed to contain in OMFG Aliens! (my LD#21 entry) and they've evolved... Maybe?

Anyway, in this Rythm/Shooter game, you go for HIGH SCORES, tap direction and action in sync with the beat for EXTRA AWESOME POINT VALUES! Combo Aliens in a single shot, pump up that SYNC bar and charge up to blast away with bigger shots. And if things get TOO hectic, use a PULSE WAVE to clear the screen.

Controls : Just press whatever keys you feel best represent a direction and ACTION setup, I got this...

Updates : I TOTALLY fixed that bug where the thing didn't work on Windows, and also a little bug with the particles on fast machines.

There was this one bug were the aliens were like "Yo, we're going to spawn SUPER fast, like 2 fast 4 you, bro!" and it's cause I'm all like "TO THE MAX" with my math.max() command, but I was supposed to be all math.min(). Now aliens won't be DOUCHEBAGS when you're being too AWESOME!

Apparently there's also a bug where everything goes "Yeah, but NO, bro.." and locks up like a deer in headlights.
I think I TOTALLY fixed this. I messed with sound retriggering and got it to be COOL when SHOOT sounds were SPAMMED.
If it still decides it's going to be UNCOOL and locks up on you, let me know and I'll tell it who's BOSS!

entries.title: DANCE DANCE EVOLUTION
entries.description:
wow!! dance dance evolution is a game about dancing and evolution that i'm making.

it's not done yet, but it will be within the next few hours!

entries.title: E.V.o
entries.description:
not completed

Video of timelapse and game. Be sure to watch it 1080p!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shFooVU-cvI

entries.title: Enzyme
entries.description: You are a white blood cell. Viruses are threatening to destroy life and your duty is to quickly destroy them before they prevent evolution! Be careful not to destroy good entities.

entries.title: Evo Face
entries.description:
Evolving your face! And when your face will see amoebas they will also evolve. But your mission is to evolve your wife!

Unfortunately the game was not that what I wanted to do. It full of bugs. Random does not work very well. And a lot of the game is not the best.

But I hope it will be worth your attention.

If you play in a browser use Google Chrome.
Or you can download the exe.
The game supports the gamepad.

Thank you for your attention!
Everyone good mood and thank you for this wonderful time!

Oh, yes. I apologize for my English.

entries.title: Evolution Game by legionth
entries.description:
My first LD Game. To be honest one of my first games. It is not great game, but this wasn't my goal. I wanted to improve my Skills and to see how much i can creat within 48 hours.

See you at next LD ^^

entries.title: Evolving Words
entries.description:
A web-based word game. Evolve from a CELL to a WORM, from a FISH to a FROG, one letter at a time.

Needs a pretty modern browser. Tested mostly in Chrome and Safari, should work on recent Firefox too. Internet Explorer is unlikely to deal. It'd be fun to try on a mobile device.

The game didn't wind up at all where I wanted it, but I figure since I've come this far, I might as well go the distance... :-)

For build and develop, I used Ruby's MiddleMan gem. I wrote my code in CoffeeScript, and built some offline precalculation using Node.js.
At run-time, I'm using: d3.js, jQuery, Mustache


- Images are all photographs I took during the compo.
- Sounds are, naturally, bfxr/cfxr.
- No music this time.
- The HTML and CSS was the default boilerplate generated by the Middleman, but has since been completely replaced.
- POTENTIAL RULE-BEND: The word list was generated from the ispell English dictionary wordlist <http://wordlist.sourceforge.net/>. A couple of IRC people said it should be fine to use a dictionary but a word list isn't explicitly covered by the exemptions like fonts and drum loops.

entries.title: Game Time Evolution
entries.description:
My take on the theme was to show the evolution - the progress - of games. The effect isn't great, as I didn't have time to finish all my ideas (but then, this is Ludum Dare. No surprise), but I'm quite proud of this game.

There is a prologue, which I strongly suggest you watch. This will give the setting and the story. There is also text in some levels, giving the minimum amount of info to play the game. But you really should go through the prologue. It's basically the whole story. Really. Please.

Controls:
Arrows/WAD    - move and jump
Space         - use Posi (when you have it)
Right/D/Space - advance text

Tips:
-You need to collide with the center of the portal to go to the next level.
-If you don't land on top of the ground, you will pass through it
-You can miss a platform by a few pixels and still 'pull yourself onto it'

(All of these features are by design, not bugs)
Anyway, thanks for playing. I hope you enjoy it! If you play it on Kongregate please rate.

-Made with Actionscript 3 and FlashPunk-

One last challenge: Can you name the systems that go with the controllers in each level?

entries.title: Gobbulator
entries.description:
Sharp gameplay and slick tunes pervade this top-down action game. Colorswap and eat your foes to survive and evolve!

The screenshot is.. not representative of actual play.  Consider it a casualty of war.

Love,
tastive and icelus

UPDATE:  As per the spirit of the rules, we fixed the gamebreaking bug.  The others are left untouched.  Think of them fondly, as they are the lovechildren of insufficient time.  Thanks for playing!

entries.title: I'd Change the World for You
entries.description:
Hey there!

Just like many of you, this is my first full Ludum Dare submission.  Here's what the game's all about:

Separated by the one you love, you must transform the world around you in this laid-back platformer in order to complete your mission.

As an added challenge, try and get all 5 hidden stars in the game.  (Eventually this will be used for achievements on sites.)

Note: I used the engine I made in my "I'm in" post to get a heads start on scene rendering and platform physics.  Other than that, all 1000+ lines of code were written within time. :)

I will have a timelapse ready in a few days.  Since it usually takes longer to make the timelapse than it is to record it, I'll just post a link as a new post.  :)

How does this game relate to "evolution?"  Well the world literally evolves, and enables you to progress in the game.  I felt that doing a game where the player evolves is too expected.  I feel like I've accomplished my goal of being unique!

Thank you so much for playing, and I wish everyone good luck on your ratings!  I really love Ludum Dare! :D


****Update at 2 hours, 18 minutes remaining: Added quality option and fixed score counter****
****Post-compo version has a new game mode if you get all of the stars!***

entries.title: It Will Grow
entries.description:
A game in which you selectively breed plants with the goal of discovering the lost Golden Fruit.  Place seeds on top of each other, and when they grow, their offspring may be different.  You have control of time by switching seasons.
Entirely mouse-based. Left click picks things up, plants seeds, and activates buttons, and right click drops seeds wherever they are without planting them.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Jump'o'lution
entries.description:
You are a tiny blob that one day will be the pride of creation.
But you're far from there. (And you'll only get there if you have a nice modern browser :-) )

This is basically a jump'n'run (see the analogy with the title there?)
Move left and right with a, d or cursor left, right. Jump with w, up, x or space.

The trick is that you loose energy everytime you jump (or get on those hideous spikes) and the less energy you have, the lower you jump. 
But fear not! Eat your nice, cuddly neighbors to get more energy.


Have fun!

entries.title: Mutate
entries.description:
Sorry for no OSX download, game blackscreens on osx with no error

You have to extract it from the zip for it to work :)
My first ludum dare :D
Level up by killing zombies, each level gives a new mutation. Can you get the right mutations to survive?
See the How to play section in game for details, use W and S to navigate the main menu, enter to select

entries.title: My Time
entries.description:
----- PLEASE READ -----
This is actually Zed. Hi. I've already submitted a competition entry, here: 

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-24/?action=rate&uid=4687

...and am now also submitting a Jam entry. As far as I know, there's no rules against doing so. Having said that, I will NOT be using this account to rate ANY games at all, because I wouldn't want to have two votes. If anyone requires me to provide proof, then when judging is over, I'll provide a screenshot of my 'rated' page (or I assume someone in an admin position can confirm that I haven't used this account other than this submission). Hopefully everybody's okay with that.
----- STOP READING NOW -----

Before the theme was announced, I put out this tweet:
http://twitter.com/dedhedzed/status/239041340422369280

Well... 'Evolution' won, so...

entries.title: Orb
entries.description:
Hey LDers! Here it is! Orb!
Play through generations of monsters by learning new traits and abilities as you go! The longer you play, the more generations you'll play as and the more traits you'll have!

Orb is a platformer with some beautiful brawl-like combat. 'Mario' your way over your enemies, or give them the ol' One-Two Punch! Different traits will give you different abilities, both passive and active! So be sure to mix and match!

Controls:
WASD: move/jump
SPACE: jump
E: interact/pickup
ENTER: attack

We hope you love Orb as much as we loved making it for you!
Please leave us a comment and tell us what you think! Whether it's good, bad, or ugly! We'd love to have the feedback and try to improve our skills as game devs so we can continue to make games that people love!
We will def be sure to check out your own game if you leave us a comment and rating!

And hey, maybe if we get enough feedback, we'll add a list of what each trait does!
Thanks guys and Happy Voting!

~ScreamRawr & Jif

entries.title: Path to a New Species
entries.description: This is a short text adventure about evolving into a new species, depending on which path you choose.  It is written in Python.  I just started about 6 months ago, and this is my first finished project.

entries.title: Project V
entries.description:
readme contains controls

You are a computer virus which needs to steal data from enemies.

entries.title: Promoted!
entries.description:
DISCLAIMER:
We're terribly sorry, but we couldn't finish the game in time, so this is a VERY incomplete version...
We also have audio tracks that we didn't get to put in the submitted game, but you can listen to two of them (links on the game page).
We are still working on the game and will have a complete version soon (but of course you have to rate this one)...

entries.title: R/evolution
entries.description:
R/evolution takes you through the evolution of the wheel. You must hop from wheel to wheel to get to your final goal, while avoiding falling to your death.

I also have posted the game up on Kongregate, so if you like it, then please head over there and vote. thanks!

Built with: Haxe, NME, and awe6
Sound effects made with: sfxr

entries.title: Sam Onion: The Case of the Mutese Falcon
Selection Sort
entries.description:
We wrote Selection Sort from scatch using C++ and the libtcod library. We didn't have time to impliment all the features we wanted, but at least there's something to play. 

In this game you are an alien invader who has come to a planet to exterminate a constantly evolving species. The controls are WASD for movement and arrow keys for firing your weapon. The enemies have three traits, attack (red), health (green), and speed (blue). You must survive wave after wave of this species as it becomes more and more evolved based on survivors of previous waves.

The linux source code is provided below. There's also a precompiled binary in the bin folder which will work on 64bit systems. The binary must be run from within the bin folder to avoid errors. If you wish to compile yourself, you'll need cmake, SDL, and libtcod.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Spawning Creatures, Evolution of Creatures and Creatures Mayhem
entries.description:
Our ideas was to battle waves after waves of enemis. At the end of each wave, you choose couples of unit to get new types (a better version of its parents).

*Edit* With our team of 3 programmer, we did the best to make decent graphics and sound/music. We need more practice!

Have fun.

entries.title: The Chamber
entries.description:
Well this didn't exactly get done, but I suppose that's what I get for trying to make my second game ever during Ludum Dare... The game seemed to follow the theme a bit more when I considered it... Oh well enough apologies. It is a puzzle game with ( what I hope is ) an interesting back story. Not that the story got finished. It was worth a shot and I learned a good deal, such as: Next time the game is going to be randomly generated so I don't have to worry about making levels. Hope you enjoy whats there!

Oh and by the way, if anyone read my post during the comp I didn't actually have a partner. Turned out he couldn't do it. So since I won't be able to work on it tomorrow anyway I may as well submit it now.

P.S. Did you notice the spaces around the parenthesis up there? I guess I've been coding too long.

NOTE: The web link is a zip download. I don't have anywhere to host the game, but it is in HTML5/JavaScript so you can just open it in Chrome, Firefox, or Opera (Not Safari). I wouldn't recommend Opera though, because it doesn't let you hold down an arrow key to move faster.

entries.title: The Room
entries.description:
Johnny is lonely, his only companions are the items in his apartment when he comes home from work. You must help Johnny get into his groove and find out what it is that he likes in his apartment before he gets too depressed to go on. Adapt or die to the mundane.

The jammers : 

Art : Johannes Sigurdsson @joisigurdss, Jon Einar
Sound & Music : Gunnlaugur Larusson, Kristleifur Dadason
Code : Ingimar Gudmundsson, Marco Bancale

entries.title: Your Offspring
entries.description:
A game about a little photosynthetic bug that fell into a pit.
You need to adapt yourself at your preferences and find a way out of the pit.
Learn to fly higher than the hole itself, harden your skin to go through the spikes or make a total bloodbath filling the pit with your enemies blood, its all up to how you play that will make you escape the pit.

entries.title: A Nature Evolution
entries.description:
It's our second entry on the Ludum Dare. We are brazilian students of programming and we had lots of fun doing this game, we hope you all appreciate it. The game is about how the nature always is in a constant state of evolution.

Team:
Igor Silva - Programmer
Gustavo Silva - Programmer
Pablo Alexandre - Programmer
Juliano Cunha - Programmer
Vynicius Morais - Programmer
Henrique Elias - Artist

entries.title: AntiVirus
entries.description:
Micro-evolution in action! Fight off the viral invasion, but look out, they evolve--  Thankfully though, so do you! Good luck, since in the arms race against the viral menace, WE MAY BE THE LOSERS...

Made in the Blender Game Engine on Ubuntu. The Windows build has not been tested.

entries.title: AvRvE
entries.description:
AvRvE
(Aliens versus Robots versus Evolution)

Your name is Al-Ian, and your job is to go to Earth and
destroy some of Earth's most potentially dangerous species 
before they're given a chance to evolve and wreck havoc on 
homo sapiens (in the future). Make your way through perilous 
puzzles, and be sure to avoid all of the Robots that are 
trying to stop you from giving mankind a chance to 
successfully thrive. 

*GOAL*
Work through a series of isometric puzzles and complete any 
necessary tasks to kill off any major threats. *ROBOTS 
CANNOT BE KILLED*, just make sure you avoid them like the 
plague. 

*IMPORTANT SHORTCUTS* 
ESC - While in-game, it opens the pause menu
R - With the pause menu active, it restarts the level
H - With the pause menu active, it brings you back to the 
main menu (you will lose progress)

*CAKE N' CODE*
Zeik: The Boss Programmer
Cake: The Dainty Designer

entries.title: Barrel Roll
entries.description:
Your ship evolves as you play the game.  Pick up weapons and have parts of your ship break off and re-structure itself as you navigate a narrow corridor.

Use A/D to steer your ship down the alley.

Hit Enter to fire your weapon.

Thanks for checking it out.


To play:

download the .jar and double-click to run.

if that doesn't work, try running it from the command line with:

java -jar barrel-roll.jar

entries.title: Blocks of Life
entries.description:
This is my first entry into a Ludum Dare competition. It is built from scratch using Unity3d, with assets being created in Adobe Fireworks.

The 'Cubes of Life' uses the mechanics of Conway's Game of Life to generate Cubes in a grid formation. The player must run around and destroy these cubes until they are all gone, or the 60 seconds is up. Your score is the number of cubes you break. Destroying a cube by running into it or shooting it removes that cube from the game, so it will not affect future generations. You decide how the cubes evolve.

entries.title: Box vs. Nature
entries.description: This is an arena shooter where the enemies evolve between rounds. Two alpha specimen are chosen from each species of enemy, and they mate, which mixes their attributes into new enemies, which can also get mutations.

entries.title: Caveman Carnage
entries.description:
This is a game about giving the evolution a hand. In the future, the mankind has downgraded into cavemen, and the strongest man no longer gets to win the ladies. Your job is to change that. The easiest way to do that: throw rocks at the weaker ones.

WARNING: The game is seriously unfinished, and I recommend that you stop playing after level five or you'll risk freezing your browser. :/ There's also a lot of features that I wanted to implement ( see http://blog.avd.io/posts/ludum-dare-24 for more info ) but didn't have the time, but I'm surprised I got this far.

entries.title: ContraEvolution
entries.description:
A game based on the "Evolution" theme - though evolution is not exactly desirable in this one - basically, you need to prevent the creatures (bacteria or other nasty.. stuff) from breeding (and thus evolving) in order to survive - well, you won't survive anyway, but the goal is to try it for as long as possible - time is your score.

This is mine (code + graphics) and my brother's (audio) first Ludum Dare entry and we're looking forward for the next LD (perhaps even with some blog posts).

You can reach me (Vaclav Patejdl, or "vaber") on twitter @the_vaber, through Skype (the.vaber) or e-mail ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */) in case you have any urgent questions/... that can't be resolved through the ludumdare.com portal.

PS: please excuse any kind of bad english either in the game itself or in this brief description

entries.title: Darwin Second Strike
entries.description: Zombie Darwin rises from the grave to wreak terror on those who don't believe his theories, by pelting them with copies of his 'Origin of the Species'

entries.title: Deep Sea Fish Loves You Forever
entries.description:
"Deep Sea Fish Loves You Forever" is an underwater exploration game in which you must uncover and analyze oceanic wildlife.
There is a total of 5 species to uncover and the best ranking you can get is S. Good luck!

- If you are having trouble finding your first few fishes, try moving a less frantically and let them come to you =)
- If you have performance issue, you might want to try using Firefox rather than Chrome to play the game, I know it has been helpful to some people.

entries.title: Evolved
entries.description:
My incomplete 48h competition entry.

The idea was a fighter/platformer in which two sides in a debate over evolution fought over their ideals.

Submitting this complete with placeholder sphere character mostly just so I can rate everyone else's games!

Edit: I completely forgot to mention the controls!

Keyboard:
Left/Right - Move
Shift - Jump

Gamepad:
Left Thumbstick X - Move
Button 3 / Button 4 - Jump

Advanced:
When touching a wall, moving away from it will cause you to wall jump.

entries.title: Manual Selection
entries.description:
Ant wars. Your team is blue.

- You can "clone" ants of your team by left-clicking on them
- You can place food on the ground by right-clicking
- Cloning and placing food drains energy (energy bar)
- Ants picking up food increases energy

Select the "fittest" ant to win against red.

You win by destroying the enemy hive or by killing all enemy ants.



have fun :)
pragmascript

entries.title: Microbe Madness!
entries.description:
A game about battling microbes, a homage to the old StarCraft custom map called "evolves madness". 

All my source code is on GitHub, I made sure to make tags pretty often, and there are 16 different tags, showing the scope of the progress I made over the weekend: https://github.com/MattRix/Madness/tags

entries.title: Pixeloution
entries.description: START A PIXELOUTION!!

entries.title: Rainbow Morph
entries.description: Kill enemy morphs to make them your allies!

entries.title: Replicate
entries.description:
This is a game about a little guy I call DNA Replicase. He takes free-floating DNA bases and attaches them to strands of DNA to make whole DNA! Unfortunately he's been taken ill, so they've brought in a replacement - YOU!

Use the arrow keys to add in the corresponding base to the one  shown. But don't take too long or the chain will move on without you.

entries.title: Shroom
entries.description:
Shrooms... You need them. They give you life, and you can't live without them. Fight through nasty spiders, chickens and squirrels that are in your way of getting your precious shrooms.

Update:
Shroom 1.1 is out, with bug fixes and one brand new level!

entries.title: simUniverse
entries.description:
Thrilling simulation of the evolution of our universe.

Firmly press down on the space bar and hold onto your seat to make the evolution happen.

entries.title: Slime Fighter
entries.description:
Hey guys, so here's the deal...

Arrows to move, Z to jump, X to attack, Enter to Pause/Unpause


*as this is an HTML5 game, it is best run in Chrome or Firefox and WebGL is required, apologies to older machines that don't support this*


With this entry, nothing worked, at all...  This weekend was full of non-stop frustration for me, but I insisted on submitting an entry and this is what I wound up with.  Playing long enough will reveal how the theme is included, though I can't say I'm particularily proud of my concept, it's nothing remotely original, all I can hope is that you guys find it fun instead.  


There is a known bug, though its rare, but if you find that your opponent stops taking damage, you'll have to press F5 to restart.  Sorry about this, but we all know how Ludum Dare entries can go :D


I'm a member of Fireskies Studios, a very small indie group based on Vancouver Island in Canada, please feel free to stop by our rarely updated website http://www.fireskiesstudios.com/ it's been a while, but we've been busy working, not web mastering lol

entries.title: Survival Of The Tastiest
entries.description:
The game is in the form of an Android APK. It was made for multi-touch devices, although there's a version you can play online (press CTRL/CMD to simulate multi-touch).

And it kinda, sorta, maybe works! A lot was left out. Alas, it was fun, especially as a first Ludum Dare entry!

Spawn pastas (by "ordering" them) and conquer the table! It is kind of challenging. There are right moments to spawn stuff.

You CANNOT control the flying pasta. That's not the idea. The idea is to have autonomous flying pasta! They're sort of dumb sometimes, though. Pasta technology is still a work in progress.

Be sure to check the plate's bills! They indicate the plate's state, like who's conquering it and who it belongs to (also indicated by the plate's colors).

The game decidedly fails to explain the gameplay well and should be judged as such. But if you're curious about what it's trying to do, there's some more information in the postmortem:

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/27/survival-of-the-tastiest-post-mortem/

Known issues:
* It may crash eventually after a long time (texture memory problems probably)
* When you open the order menu, sometimes it doesn't let you close it anymore
* On Android, you need to install Adobe AIR prior to running the game (you're automatically redirected when running it for the first time)
* On Android, after the game ends, you can't restart it. You have to close it manually, either on the application settings, or calling the task switcher and swiping it away (Android 4+)
* I lowered the quality of the images to around 60% on Androids to avoid memory issues, since I couldn't do a lot of debugging. Sorry for the eventual bad texture quality
* On Android, the game will work on all devices that support AIR, but it's mostly meant for tablets; playing on phones will probably be frustrating

entries.title: The ducks are taking over!!
entries.description:
In a prehistoric cave, ancient ducks and other species are rapidly evolving. Kill them before they take over the world!

Left/Right arrows, A/D or Q/D to move
Up, Z, W or Alt to jump
Space, Shift, Control or X to shoot

Enemies evolve depending on your interaction with them. There are 5 areas they can evolve in: reproduction, durability, intelligence, strength and movement. Depending on the way you play (or the enemies you face) one stat may evolve more quickly than another.

There are three levels but you have to select the level before you start, you can't proceed from one level to another (yet). The levels are meant to demonstrate the different enemies and possible level designs.

entries.title: Tileshift
entries.description:
Tile Shift is a tile-based game that uses a genetic algorithm to build map permutations.

It builds permutations in real time and selects the best one that helps the user achieve one of the many goals on the map. We also have higher level permutation generation for the door levels.

Including Authors: 

steve.rutherford
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/category/ld-24/?author_name=steve.rutherford

entries.title: Upward Mankind
Wisdom
entries.description:
A small game I made.
You control someone and his faithful robot, together you are on a quest to collect as many wisdom orbs as you can, you don't eveolve your body, you evolve your mind.
6 Levels.
2 Characters.
5 Minuts.

------------------------------------------

Sadly due to problems in my family I had to stop earlier, probably gonna work on it after Ludum Dare to make it a better and more fun game.
Sending it anyway because I don't want to have wasted all these hours on nothing.

entries.title: Aggrandize
entries.description:
Not what I intended the end result to be. Went through several revisions of concept and ending up as.. this.
You have to "evolve" into a serial killer, I guess..
The goal was to have upgrades to the player as time went on, but fixing the movement took up too much time..

Available only for android.

QR added in screenshots straight to .apk download

entries.title: Bit-Craft Evolution
entries.description:
Story: You have liberated the protoype bit craft fighter with the legendary Evolution-Tech from the evil Bit Empire - now you must fight your way to freedom!

Notes: If possible please try to use the latest Chrome browser as this game uses many new shader features from HTML5 and Chrome seems to handle these effects the best. Newest Firefox is next best.

Instructions: 
WASD keys to move (or arrow keys)
Mouse to Aim
Left Click - Shoot
Right Click or Space - Special Weapon

Gameplay:
Every enemy you destroy will release 'Bit DNA'.  Each bit you pick up will evolve your craft - sometimes just a little, sometimes significantly.  Speed will increase, your firepower will increase, and your weapons may change.

In normal mode, once you destroy the first Bit Empire Cruiser you will win the game.  If you change the setting to Hardcore, the game will go into an endless mode.

Feel free to leave me comments here, on my blog, or on FB:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Eyemobi/260949787353647

Thanks so much for playing :)

entries.title: Blocks eating blocks and evolving into more blocks
entries.description:
BLOCKS.

Summary:

Explore the terrain and collect resources until your life expires; when it does, control shifts to another block-organism.  After you've played through a generation of block-organisms, you get to play through the descendants of the previous generation, created by a pseudo-Genetic-Algorithm/upgrade system.  

Your upgrades/mutations will be visible on your blocky children.  Different mutations will benefit you in different ways, such as increasing speed, jump height, foraging range, swim speed, breath underwater, lifespan, and more.


UPDATE: 

The feedback I've been getting is pretty unanimous in that the game is unclear/too hard.  I can't fix that because of the 48 hour restriction obviously, but I will try to explain the things that are in the game.

CONTROLS:

- WASD to move
- Space to jump
- R to restart

The game is intentionally very hard at the beginning (though I think I overdid it).  You die quickly so that you can get to the next generations more quickly, and experience the evolving portion of the game faster.  Don't sweat it if you die a lot without getting any food; even if you only get food one or two times, you will still see upgrades in the next generation.  On the flip side if you think it's too difficult, it might be that the map generator handed you a really terrible map.  In this case refreshing/restarting may fix everything.

There are five types of terrain, and five types of food which correspond with them:

Jungle - Has dark green tiles that are impassable, and food runs away from you
Desert - Has no obstacles, but has very scarce food
Ocean - Swimming slows you down, and you can run out of air
Canyon - Has black tiles that you can fall into and die.  This is where jumping can be useful.
Marsh - Slows your movement, and has invisible food that only comes into view as you get closer to it.


In later generations, your evolutionary progress shows in what look like food blocks that are on your block.  The benefits of these upgrades mirror the challenges of the respective terrain.

Jungle food - Makes you faster, so you can catch food that runs away
Desert food - Increases lifespan substantially, and makes each food regenerate substantially more life
Ocean food - Makes you swim faster and gives you more air
Canyon food - Increases jump height
Marsh food - Marsh terrain slows you down less, and your search range for hidden food increases

Hope that helps somewhat.

entries.title: D'evilution
entries.description:
Play as the nameless protagonist as he transitions from innocent child - to delusioned youth - to heartless killer!

Use the ARROW keys to walk around the world.

Use the SPACEBAR key to interact with others.

entries.title: Carcinogen Corp.
entries.description:
STORYLINE

Our character is a young boy, living with his parents in a small town on a small island. The island has 
recently become of interest to an industrial corporation who seek to gather resources from the island. 
The company has opened up four stations on the island, each pumping out fumes which are having strange 
effects on the local wildlife.

Find out what's wrong on your island and beat the evil corporation.

Controls
WASD - Movement
Spacebar - Shoot
Right Click on character to build cannon below yourself
Right Click on character to build Barn no purpose except to show of a beautiful barn

entries.title: Dr. Helix
entries.description:
Sorry for this essay I wrote here, just skip straight to the Controls bit if you're not a text person

This is Dr. Helix, my first ever LD entry, it started out as an action/research game, but time constraints & technical issues I moved it back towards a slightly more traditional top-down shooter mechanic.  I have tried to keep it a little different though, you have some gadgets...

The main gadget is a DNA-changing gun, and almost all of the things in the game can be turned into something else (platforms, barriers, powerups, creatures etc).  You can also teleport a short distance, which works well with changing enemies into platforms.  You have a normal gun too, so I tried to put stuff in that used both mechanics, like when you hit a miniature death-mouse with the DNA-gun, then it evolves into a giant spider. Bad right? BUT, if you shoot the crap out of a giant spider you get an ammo top-up, and there's loads of death-mice running about that you need to shoot the crap out of.  So that's what I was aiming for.

Overall I'm really pleased with everything, except maybe that it didn't relate to the theme as much as I'd have liked.  Oh and I also didn't get time to do music, which is a shame as I always enjoy making music.  Got some sound effects in there at least.  Also there may be a few clipping issues, but luckily you can teleport!

Submitted as a .zip file with a standalone .exe inside, no installers or anything.  Thanks for playing, this is the first game I have ever finished and it has been a great experience

*** CONTROLS ***
W,A,S,D to Move & Mouse to Aim
Space to Switch Guns
Left Mouse to Fire
Right Mouse to Teleport

*** HINTS & TIPS ***

~ Use the Right Mouse button to teleport, it's handy in a tight spot
~ Shoot Flowers with the Genome Gun to get more DNA
~ Don't kill the iSharks on the first level!
~ Evolve the Cycloctopus into a Barrier for protection
~ Evolve the Orbs of Certain Doom into a Turret to clear the enemies
~ Evolve the Yellow Suppository Birds into Flowers
~ Evolve the Death Mouse into Drunken Spider
~ Kill the Death Mouse for Health
~ Kill the Drunken Spider for Ammo
~ Butterflies Evolve into iSharks when Near a Bridge

So when it's hectic, evolve some barriers to hide behind, then evolve a Orb into a turret and lead enemies into the bullets.  There's a bit of tactical depth here, enough to get you tactical-ankles wet (well a bit wet)

entries.title: Dr. Laser-Shooter, Or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Laser
entries.description:
