Pretty easy to figure out this game, shoot an ever-evolving super-germ with lasers to delay the inevitable! Upon leaving the petri dish, maybe all of humanity dies? At any rate, the game ends then.

I used Game Maker for almost everything. I also used Photoshop to make one background and Audacity to record a sound effect.

entries.title: Fire Frog
entries.description:
This was a great competition! While Internet was lost due to a storm on the latter half of the competition, (and as such the levels are poorly made), this is much more of a game than my last entry. We're very proud of it. 

The concept is simple, you need to open all the gates to get to the next level. You can only open a gate by firing bullets of the same element as that of the gate. You change elements by getting hit by enemies.

X-> Fire
Space-> Next Level

Squirrel->Earth
Bird->Water  (Yeah, I don't know either)
Fire->Fire


The purple things are health, everything else are enemies of different elements. 

The programming was done in Java with LWJGL and slick-util, and the art in Photoshop. The music was done in Finale Notepad. It was a two person team.

Hope you enjoy!

EDIT:
Removed the Linux/Mac versions, as I have no way to actually test it for the errors people have been having. Apologies to those who wasted their time.

entries.title: Gattagon - DEMO
entries.description:
This is a game about a mushroom. A mushroom that learned to grow and use his environment to his advantage. Now he must survive against waves of enemies in order to keep his place at the top of the evolutionary tree.

The game includes a readme with instructions on how to play.

Have fun. This was nuts to make!
Not quite finished but watev.

entries.title: Genes Chase
entries.description:
Goal of each level is to collect genes represented by green icon. At the beginning of each level you can choose what life form you want to play as. Each form has different abilities and needs to collect different amount of genes.

CONTROLLS:
arrow key to move 
ENTER to accept
END or Q to quit
S in main menu to mute melody

To run game you need Java JVM 
you can download Java JVM from here:
http://java.com 

**EDIT**
I have recompiled game under older version of Java so now it should work perfectly

entries.title: Geometry
entries.description:
Give the site a few seconds until it fully loads! Sorry I didn't have time to make a proper loading screen.

Game is kind of imbalanced, would have needed a bit more time for that. Wasted too much of it on graphics.

Tip: Grenades go to the exact position of the mouse, not the direction of the mouse, like bullets.

entries.title: Gobblegoks: Evolution
entries.description:
FYI: A 'decent' score is over 10k, 'good' over 15k and 'pro' over 20k. If you are struggling to get over 10k, try watching the gameplay video for tips. My high score is 25440.

Ports to other OSs may be coming if I can work out how.

Overcome insurmountable enemies as Pog the Gobblegok by using your extraordinary powers of evolution.

Controls in the game menu. Don't press R when you're near the edges of you'll fall out (if you have energy).

==Tips==
-Use your medium form (E) for most of the fighting.
-Use your small form (Q) for escaping if you are in a bad position.
-Use your large form (R) for taking the damage from the small quick enemies - your big form has 2,000 health, small enemies do 20 damage. 
-Don't use your big form for trying to take damage from bullets as you can just dodge them with your other forms.
-Don't swap to small form (Q) unless you have 5 or more energy, or you will not be able to evolve back and will be stuck in ghost form, which does little damage.
-The next wave does not wait for the current wave to die before moving on. Kill enemies quickly.

entries.title: Just a Theory
entries.description:
Game Description:  Over the course of this century, we have seen dozens of efforts by fundamentalist school boards to purge mention of evolution or the darker side of our nation from our history books.  Today that changes.  You are one teacher, but one of many, at your school so small.  You must traverse the hallways, scavenging what you can, to preserve the light of science in this school.

Note: Some of the screenshots haven't updated yet - they're from my first shot at this.

After much deliberation and a viewing of the Expendables 2, I decided on a different direction.  I had been focusing on the mechanics of evolution (natural selection, reproduction, adaptation) but I was getting nowhere.  I decided to mix it up.  Now, I am going with a game about Evolution - the teaching of evolution and the 'controversy' therein.

GAME COMPLETE

Known Bugs: 
 - Sometimes pages spawn on top of a table, and can't be picked up.  May just have to deal with this one.
 - Collision detection with the environment is a little off.

entries.title: Legacy of Lavern
entries.description:
Your cat, Lavern, is running into a deadly cave. But there are no enemies... until now. Lavern leaves something for the rest of us... Explore this small dungeon in this action RPG. 

See it as a proof-of-concept. I am no artist and unfortunately I had not enough time for sound and music...

Hope you like it anyway. Any comment is very appreciated!

entries.title: Life on the EvoHedron
entries.description:
Well, it's not done, but it's late and I have to get up early tomorrow to go on introduction camp for College. They're going to make me an actual DECENT programmer there :D

I'll probably upload a newer, post-compo version with actual gameplay elements beyond choosing a race and one skill somewhere next weekend, after camp is over. Sadly the only missing part is content, really.

Game's made with Flashpunk.

entries.title: Parasite
entries.description:
Requires a current version of Java to run.
Controls etc are described in-game.

You a deadly infection, have just on goal: 
Infest all healthy cells to destroy the organism and win the game, but beware the evil antibodies, that try to neutralize your mutated cells!

Hope you enjoy this little game : )

entries.title: Robot Panic
entries.description:
Use the arrow keys to move and the up arrow to jump once the rocket pickup is collected.
There are two pickups in the game,:

-Rockets, which let you jump
-Pusher, which lets you push crates

entries.title: Seed Feed
entries.description:
Play as Charles Darwin as you launch seeds at birds to feed them.  The finches have evolved to have beaks appropriate for a certain size of seed, so make sure you feed them the right seeds!

For background on how it fits the theme, see this:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darwin%27s_finches

How to play:
- Use the mouse to pull back and release to fire the slingshot.
- The queue of seeds is displayed in the lower left corner of the screen.  The next one to fire is farthest to the right.
- Once you have fed a bird three seeds, it will fly away, and a new bird will replace it.

entries.title: Slimevolution
entries.description:
Please don't rate until you evolve a few times, because it starts slow!  

~~~WASD to move~~~
~~~Arrows to shoot once you've evolved enough~~~

First dodge enemies, then destroy them when you get strong enough.  Play as a little slime that must evolve to survive!  Defeat Bats and alligators, get friends and eat alligator ham.  Made in AS3 using FlashPunk.  Hope you enjoy!  Thanks to NewGrounds for featuring my game!

entries.title: The Evolution Of Stars
entries.description:
This is an educational game about the evolution of stars written in C# XNA where you play through the life cycle of a star and command the fundamental forces of nature to become a Neutron Star (as every star really wants to be a neutron star), aimed at the A-Level syllabus in the UK (16-18 yrs) I'm not technically a physicist so I used Wikipedia and http://www.astarmathsandphysics.com for research.

If your not interested in the physics you may like the many pretty particle animations such as the ones for the Supernova or Black hole and they are to a certain degree physically accurate animations so you should hopefully learn something watching them too.

Good look collecting all of the achievements! (the supernova, planetary nebula and black hole are the nicest animations  IMO so its worth trying to get to them.)

GUIDE(SPOILER):
--------------
A lot of people are missing some of the content so here is the guide on how to get each animation:

1) Planet. collect as little of the dust as possible try to right click a region with few large particles without attracting anything. 

2) Protostar. attract for about at least 2 secs to collect some dust and right click.

How to win the Hydrogen fusing minigame: hold left click and fuse the ones which are close to each other first it might take a few tries but its not too hard once you got the hang of it.

3) Brown dwarf. Lose the hydrogen fusing minigame.

4) Sun -like star + Red giant win the hydrogen fusing minigame)

5) Planetary Nebula + Whitedwarf. If you didn't collect too much dust in the first round (just more than enough to not get a planet) then after the red giant phase you will become a Planetary Nebula then a White Dwarf

6) Supernova. if you collected a lot of dust in the first mini game ( collect for about 10-20 secs) then you get a Supernova after the red giant phase.

7) After the supernova phase you get a strong force minigame where you must keep the proton and neutron apart (use two hands on the space bar alternating to click faster is what I find is the best way to beat this minigame). win it and you get a neutron star, lose it and you get a black hole.

To run it you may need:
-Direct X9
-Latest version of the .NET Framework
-The XNA redistributable

Use this image if you need a clue to get some of the achievements.
http://www.astarmathsandphysics.com/a_level_physics_notes/cosmology/a_level_physics_notes_cosmology_template_html_42d1285.gif

entries.title: The Evolution of Time
entries.description:
Well, It's not finished, but I tried my best. It needs more levels, more different interactions, sounds... but with a bit of imagination you can get the idea. right?

There are many things I wanted to implement but I didn't have the time.

Keys are: Arrows for movement, spacebar to jump. It can also be played with a gamepad, I tested it with the Xbox Controller.

Hope you enjoy, as much as I did while I was creating it.

entries.title: The Long Evolution
entries.description:
This is 'The Long Evolution'!

You Steer with ASDW or the Arrows, Space to attack.
You need to stand on top of an enemy to hit an attack.
The more you evolve the harder it gets!

-Magnus Morud Vaagen

entries.title: The Spaceworm
entries.description:
My second attempt at a LD, and my first time finishing :D It's not perfect, but I'm pretty happy with the result for what it is. 

There's two abilities you can make stronger by using them more, so you can essentially play the game in two different ways.

entries.title: Unnatural Selection
[0-Evo]
entries.description:
My first attempt at LD though not my first game jam. Definitely thrilled by the do it-all-by-yourself concept !

In [0-Evo] you must keep in check the evolution of a growing cell culture to maintain a satisfactory level of pureness. Simply blast any cell with your laser by clicking on it.

Tip : you have to keep a pure group of cells but you can chose any type of cell as your target group.

Done in Flash / AS3 with Flash develop, a small open source blitting lib I've created with my work partner serveral years ago. All sounds were create with sfxr and modified with Audacity.

entries.title: A Quirk Of Humanity
entries.description:
Controls: WASD + Spacebar
---
A game about revolution, humanity's struggles, and bosses. "The evolution of revolution".

Control several different characters as they fight throughout the ages of history! 

I had a lot of fun making this. Let me know how you like it!
-Joe V.

entries.title: City of Stillness
entries.description:
The basic premise of this is that every time you take a step your stats (up in the top left corner) change.

This was about evolution when I began, honest! It just... uh... evolved!
The fighting is pretty broken. I can't really salvage it within the time frame though - hopefully a bunch of cute talking cat things will be enough in its place!


CONTROLS:
WSAD -move
E -interact (talk/use shrine/harvest tree)
Space -attack

OR

Arrow keys -move
X -interact (talk/use shrine/harvest tree)
Z -attack

Or rebind them with the Unity splash screen, if you are using the windows or mac versions.


It can be a little tricky to figure out in game, but you have to be underneath the trees, and then press 'interact' to harvest them.

If you are lost and need the locations of the orchards, there is a .txt file included in the downloads that will tell you where everything is. I recommend you use that if you are lost, as there is a fair bit of blank space - if you're lost it's my fault not yours.

entries.title: Cuboid Sandbox
entries.description:
Half game and half simulation, this sandbox let you discover the beauty and wilderness of the different Cuboid species fighting for food and territory control in a constantly evolving environment.

Gameplay tip: try influencing the world placing food and cuboids by hand :D

entries.title: Darwin Defenders
entries.description:
Darwin Defenders is a spaceshooter.

Move the mouse to control your character.
Click to shoot.

Enemies come in waves. 
After each wave, a genetic algorithm selects the best enemies and cross-breeds them to produce the next generation of enemies. 
Each game is different. Over time, they evolve to exploit your weaknesses.

NB: There's a bug that stops your bullets when you get hit.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Darwin's Apple
entries.description:
This is more like a 9 hour game - I did the bulk of the work on an airplane flight across the country. So I apologize for the hasty crap art and the lack of game balance.

The JAR is all uploaded now, and the applet is working. If you get poor performance in the applet I suggest downloading the JAR, but gameplay should be analogous on both. The source is included in the JAR if you unzip it.
===================================

You are a renegade angel who has decided that man should have the forbidden fruit of the tree of knowledge in order to evolve from Homo Erectus to Homo Sapiens. The path to the fruit is fraught with dangers, however, and the lowly Homo Erectus are not strong enough to make it there alone. You must selectively breed the Homo Erectus until they are strong enough to fight off the feral creatures blocking the way to the apple.

TO MOVE, LEFT CLICK ANYWHERE on screen. You will automatically path find. In addition, HOLD SPACE to lure Homo Erectus after you, RIGHT CLICK OR SHIFT-CLICK a Homo Erectus to tell it to go breed, and HOLD SHIFT OR S to bring up a stats display for each Homo Erectus.

The forbidden fruit is at the bottom right of the map. The monsters get stronger as you go, and you may also find different types of Homo Erectus along different side paths.

TIPS:
A good strategy really is to just select for fertility first, and then when you have very high fertility start selecting for attack and defense. The game is not terribly well balanced so you can pretty quickly get a small army that can win you the day. Also, I erred on the side of easy so it's very unlikely for a child to be worse than its parent in any way - if you keep breeding you're golden. I also implemented but later removed an inbreeding function (inbred creatures are much much worse) but I didn't have time to communicate this aspect at all so it's removed.

========================
WHAT THE STATS MEAN
========================
power - how much damage you do
defense - reduces the damage taken from enemies by this much
dodge - the percent chance to completely avoid an attack (max is 75%)
hitPoints - how much life you have
fertility - how many offspring you can have (maximum). When 2 creatures mate, the amount of offspring is (parentA.fertility + parentB.fertility) / 2.

So in combat damage done to a defender is:
attacker.power - defender.defense
but only if rand() > defender.dodge

------------>Known issues:
-Splash screen says go the bottom left. GO TO THE BOTTOM RIGHT ACTUALLY. Whoops.
-Game hangs momentarily at the start presumably due to some assets needing to load which I didn't bother to do beforehand.

entries.title: darwin_award
entries.description:
darwin_award


Save humanity from Darwin Award winners.

Move:  Arrow keys WASD IJKL
Swap:  Space X
Donate:  Ctrl Z

If the graphics rendering slows down too much, toggle display of edges with the 'e' key.


This game requires a nice balance of all the various parameters and I am not sure I have achieved that yet.  If you find yourself failing too often or succeeding too easily, feel free to tweak the source in Processing.


Some knowledge of the human HLA sytem may be useful

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_leukocyte_antigen

but the allele nomenclature used here is simulated.


Tools used:

Processing
Pickle Editor
GIMP
Audacity
Figure
Piccolo2D
Piccolo2D library for Processing
Nest library for Processing
Gamepad library for Processing
Various http://dishevelled.org libraries
Guava, Apache Commons Math


Note Processing requires Java JRE or JDK version 1.6 or later (open-jdk is fine).


Gameplay/walkthrough video:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDkGt-TpJ34&feature=youtu.be


New!  Post-compo version:

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/87680069/darwin_award-postcompo-osx.zip

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/87680069/darwin_award-postcompo-linux64.zip

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/87680069/darwin_award-postcompo-linux32.zip

This adds an intro screen where you can input the various simulation parameters, a halo to identify the player character, and a visual indicator for the process of donating alleles from the player character to the recipient.

entries.title: Dinosaurs must Die!
entries.description:
Control the evolution of life on earth though firepower, kill all Dinosaurs!


I've included a packaged file for Windows and Linux 64 bit, so you should just need to extract the archive and run the executable. 

If you have trouble with the packaged file (or you're on Mac OS), you can run the python source directly if you install python-opengl, python-pygame, python-numpy and pybox2d.

entries.title: Evoes
entries.description:
This is a puzzle game that looks a bit like Osmos however the game is played totally different. In this game you need to adsorb 3 smaller orbs into 1 big orb to evolve the orb to another Orb.

The game is made with Inkscape and Sublime Text and is written in HTML5/JS/CSS3 all graphics are SVG images. I have tested it in Chrome and Firefox and it works in both browsers. (Best in chrome, firefox is little bit slower with SVG images)

Because I lost a lot of time on fixing bugs I only have 3 levels.

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/26/submitted-17/

entries.title: EVOLVE, YOU FUCKER!
entries.description: An Atari 2600 game about turning from a fish to a lizard to a bird and back again.

entries.title: Extinction Exhibition
entries.description:
Try to build a working ecosphere, and have as many co-existing cute animals as possible in this little world!

Give them the ability to fight, to swim or to fly. But watch out: The beasts are hungry. And so stupid, that some will go extinct because of that. Or because you gave the carnivores on the neighbour island wings.

Welcome to the Extinction Exhibition.

entries.title: Fish In the Mud
entries.description: I couldn't get the replay to work, but I'm pretty proud since this is the first time we've written in ActionScript

entries.title: Kryphilis
entries.description:
KRYPHILIS

No good. He got it. She got it. They give it. They get it.

Only you can help this promiscuous population to safe reproduction. Guide them so that they mix their genes well.

Click/drag to show the way.

Tools: SdlDotNet, VS2010, Photoshop, sfxr, python, imagemagick.

entries.title: Live On Out
entries.description: Use arrow keys and space to play. The game is an evolution of game mechanics, art, and genre. The ideas I came up with started rough and evolved into the final scene. There wasn't enough time to make sounds or music, so feel free to add your own. Please enjoy my first Ludum Dare game!

entries.title: Monster League
entries.description:
SUPER IMPORTANT UPDATE: Using JarSplice I have managed to get the jar working! Run the JAR at the windows link to play! :D

I've only been coding for about two months, but I don't think its SUPER bad. Let me know what you think of it.

entries.title: Moustache & Mukset
entries.description:
Moustache & Mukset is a rts game that involves a you commanding a small army of line infantry equipped with muskets and two cannons. You must defend the field and not lose more than 65 men while attempting to either kill or route the AI.

The theme evolution was incorporated by an AI that is meant to follow your moves and learn from them and evolve to be smarter. Unfortunately that is really hard to do. So...its not quite there.

Each package contains the normal game and then the version which will run better on slower pc's and macs. Source code is also uploaded.

Coded in c# using unity3d indie.

entries.title: Organismo Vivente
entries.description:
Spore-like RPG with 3 branches of evolution.
Everything needed to start playing is covered in in-game instructions.

[](/b14)

links.label: Video of the first day of development

entries.title: Peanuts!
entries.description:
Come and take a peek into the ardillous life of Peanuts throughout their history.
They were living peacefully inside the earth until they are forced to flee from dangerous conditions.
Forced out of their natural habitat they must evolve and adapt and never stop running to ensure survival!!

GAMEPLAY

- The Peanuts are no different than any other race and as so a leader always rises to the task when needed, you will control the leader of the escaping legion.
If you die still having Peanuts in the flock, another one will surely take the lead!!

- You can roll (right arrow) to avoid falling objects.
- Stall (left arrow ) to make sure some danger passes before you move on.
- Jump and dash mid air (up + right arrows) to make your way through big gaps or higher obstacles.
- Throw a peanut ( space bar ) from the flock, knowing full well he's sacrificing himself for the group's sake.
Not implemented 
-- throw peanuts to free other peanuts caught in inprisionment and add them to your group!
-- throw peanuts to take down obstacles and clear a path for the group.


So we planned for 5 levels and ended up with a flawed mere one hehe, still the base gameplay is mostly there, with some hard edges to polish but, in our opinion, pretty fun to experiment.
Altough the collisions still need some work.

We hope you enjoy the little preview as much as we enjoyed making it :)

Below are some screens of what could have been.

entries.title: ROCK EM SOCK EM DARWINS
entries.description:
ROCK EM SOCK EM DARWINS is an educational boxing sports action arcade game designed for your pleasure.

[ARROWS] to move around
[SPACE] to punch

ROCK EM SOCK EM DARWINS is written in Python 3.2 with Pygame. You can play from the executable (main.exe) on Windows or from the source on any platform with Pygame.

entries.title: Terminal Illness
entries.description:
Credits:
-Esteban Alonzo (Chorinator) [Programmer]

entries.title: The Life Tale
entries.description:
A Game of evolution where you, as an creature, must fight your way through the food chain.

#####Controlls:#####

Tab - shows stat buttons.
Shift - zooms out.
Enter - respawns when dead.
WSAD - movement.
M - mutes the music.

#####Version list#####
V1.1
 -Removed automatic fullscreen mode on startup.
 -Added new icons to the evolution upgrades UI.
 -Rebalanced the gameplay
 -Removed impossible to beat enemies from spawning on the start of the game.
 -Added animations to fish.

V1.0 Compo Version
 -First release

#####Description for testers:#####

The game is pretty hard and requires some farm at the beggining. To have an easier beggining press the sun in the menu to get +2000 life essence on the start. Then make surve to evolve into a fish, as it makes the game more easy, although the regeneration rate at the same beggining gonna be a little slow.

To gather life essence swim into an enemy organism that looks weaker than you. Then you'll notice damage turn's info popping out about how much damage you and your enemy dealed. If the enemy damage looks higher it's probably wiser to try to avoid him for some time.

You can avoid some of the damage by quickly attacking some enemies at once. Damage turn restarts every 0.5 second on every creature, this means that after getting hit you can still hit another creature without you getting harmed.

After the evolution the best way is to upgrade damage one time first, as your base damage is pretty low. Then the best pick would be to upgrade life and armor. The size upgrade is giving you the most advantage later on for a really low price of 100LE each, and it helps out a lot in hitting multiple organism at once, thus lowering your total damage that you receive.

#####Handbook:#####

Upgrades:

Speed        - Max spd +20, costs 100LE +25LE per spd level.

Acceleration - Max acc +20, max spd +5, costs 100LE +25LE per acc level.

Armor        - Max arm +1, max life +5, armor regen +0.01, costs 125LE + 25LE per armor level.

Danger       - Level +2, power* +10, leadership** +1, costs 200LE + 50LE per dng level.

Damage       - Power +20, costs 150LE + 25LE per dmg level.

Size         - Size + 2.25% base size, max life +5, power +2, costs 100LE.

Life         - Max life+20, life regen +0.2, costs 150LE + 25LE per life level.

Form         - gives you a new form. Costs 2000LE + 4000LE per form level.

Enemies:
Cell - +5LE 
Plankton - +12LE
Fish - +30LE

* - raises the damage output.
** - currently not implemented

Windows bugfix allows you to resize the window. It doesn't change the gameplay, nor the design. Also it's not required to play.

Have fun in conquering the depths!

entries.title: The Underglen
entries.description:
- left/right arrow keys control your movement
- spacebar to jump, hold it down and release to go higher
- e to interact with the environment (seaweed)
* there is no goal *

entries.title: Total argument
entries.description:
WARNING: Loading can be LONG!

WE RECOMMEND: Playing in Chrome/Chromium because it provides the best performance.

It is war. The evolution theory caused turmoil and rebellion all around the world. The mad scientist called Darw declared the human's ancestors are apes! His followers formed a massive army of devils, heretics and homosexuals that march to holy city of Rome. All faithful must defend the church with help of all saints and angels. For creationistic theory! 

It is war, indeed. Blinded idiots who refuse to accept modern science decided to attack us. They still believe the world has been created in seven days. We are last flame of understanding and wisdom, that can give light to all humanity. But first, with the help of modern research, we must drive back these fanatics and put end to obscurantism. For evolution theory! 

The point is to control as big part of land as you can. Where your last unit stands, there is end of your realm. You can train units in your fort, which can be upgraded. To get access to more powerful troops, you have to build some supports buildings. Gold is from fallen enemies, faith (or wisdom) from land you control. Enjoy. And prepare for last fight.  

About:
We are group of five students from Prague (Czech Republic). We are all about sixteen yards old. Some of us love programing, some of us love graphic and I, I like games. We all hope you will enjoy our second Ludum Dare game.

entries.title: What's All The Rush For
entries.description:
WATRF is a game where you try to evolve as fast as possible using different key combinations for different creatures. But for what purpose?

It's up to you to find out...

entries.title: .Evolvorous.
entries.description:
Hi !

Here is "Evolvorous" !

It's a game about species evolution who depending on abilities that they get, they adapt their body in front of environnemental conditions, fights and the kind of food that they eat.

In Evolvorous, you play a species who have to evolve by developing her body and his way of living  in order to survive.

And you can mix all the species !

Control : Use mouse and follow tutorial (on the top-right of the screen).

Just a little install is needed to play.

is there a little problem to find his mouse cursor at start! Then you have to move largely your mouse to left or right to be able to see the cursor in game. Sorry for this!

Credits :
- Art : Ludovic servat 
(Book : http://game-designer.fr/  and Blog : http://repstyleart.com/ourpleasure/)

- Dev : Laurent Goethals 
(http://andreilgame.e-monsite.com/)

Music : Kevin MacLeod 
(incompetech.com)

Have fun !

entries.title: 500 years
entries.description:
This was normally supposed to be for the Compo. But I ended up wasting time and getting behind schedule for the Compo.

The game is a simulator of 1-4 tribes on a randomly generated Island. Depending on the tribes profiles and priorities, the simulation will happen differently. The tribes are all controlled by AIs. So as a player, you can either watch the simulation or, you can unleash disasters which can advantage some tribes and slow others.

500 years was made using game maker 8.1.

You may use/modify the source as you please.

update :
 -> modified the tiles.
 -> randomized tiles.
 -> disasters effects now vary depending on the profile of the tribe affected.
 -> added pop messages when tribes reach a certain level in technology/warcraft/religion/politics
 -> fixed the message boxes closing when pressing arrow keys problem.
 -> added information on the main menu.
 -> increased disaster radius.


If you have any ideas let me know in the comments.
I'll try to make a post-compo including as many new features.

idea box :
- when a tribe discovers a new technology, it will have an effect.
- tribes can expand.
- ressources can deplete.
- you can spawn a monster and the tribes will unite to kill it.
- sprites vary according to technology.
- add mouse control.

entries.title: A Caveman Goes to Space!
entries.description:
A caveman's only desire is to go to space. Help him out by evolving your way through the different eras in order to realize his wondrous dream!

Controls:
WASD - movement
Mouse - aim
Space/Left Click - shoot

Engine: XNA
Audio: FL Studio (built-in plugins), Pooboy plugin, Sonatina Symphonic Orchestra
Art: Paint.Net

entries.title: Bunny Jump
entries.description:
Well here it is. I have to say its not exactly what I envisioned but we had a bunch of homework and classes to do during the competition. I'm glad everything works though.

Try to get to the end and when you die you can upgrade your stats by 'evolving.'

A colaboration with Martian712

entries.title: Convolution
entries.description:
This game is based on Conway's Game of Life but is a team death-match with points to buy patterns.

With background music (move the OGG file if you don't want to listen to it).

Enjoy <3

Thanks to 31eee384 (aka the31 on IRC) for the Windows version!
31eee384's game: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-24/?action=preview&uid=1712

PS: If you're compiling for MacOS, set CXXFLAGS=-std=c++11, the only dependency is SFML 2 RC 1. Please send me your executable so I can add it here.

entries.title: Dawn
entries.description:
This is Dawn! A game about self discovery and stuff. The controls and mechanics are up to you to discover yourself. (Hint: They are not complicated at all.) ((Unless you're on dvorak.)) (((Spoiler for dvorak people: theyarezandxandc)))

*See if you can find the secret easter egg also! It's pretty damn cool and explosive!*

Also, kudos if you figure out the movie that is referenced throughout the game.

EDIT: Discovered there is a way to fall out of the world. It's not intended, but I'll leave it in for funsies. It's not gamebreaking anyway, since it doesn't happen unless you're asking for it.

EDIT2: Added a link to a Let's Player / Walkthrough on youtube. I encourage y'all to try to beat it entirely without it though.

Like this game? Consider following me on twitter: @SteelRaven7 <3

entries.title: Direction
entries.description: Press Enter to start, mouse to build things, WASD to move the map, E to see detailed stats. Direct the evolution of your creatures. Survive as many waves as you can!

entries.title: Emergent Dungeon
entries.description:
Fight your way through the dungeon. As you complete each stage the game will evolve into the next, more complicated form.

I was only able to make 2 stages, a text based stage and then a low resolution platformer. I had planned to do 3 or 4, each getting more graphically intense, but I didn't have enough time, as I lost most of the first day.

Thus I didn't have time to do sound and the collision is fairly poor.

EDIT: I have fixed a very minor bug (porting issue), and the word wrap issue that was annoying me ("Typo" bug). The old version is here
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/75047185/Emergent%20Dungeon%20-%20Windows%20-%20V1.zip
and the old source is http://dl.dropbox.com/u/75047185/Emergent%20Dungeon%20-%20Source%20-%20V1.zip

entries.title: DNADream
entries.description:
A game about growing a plant until it gets to the Sun. To make it grow and turn as you wish you must select the gens you want the plant to have.

The controls are mouse based, just click on a DNA ball to add or change a gen.

I hope you enjoy it, all feedback is welcomed and enjoy the compo!

entries.title: Evolve 'em all
entries.description:
Try and get the weapons you want, evolve them, and try to kill the boss. 

This game is meant to be hard, but I finished it so you should be able to ;)

CONTROLS:
Arrows to move, hold space to shoot
Sorry for wasd addicts... (azerty keyboard here, not used to wasd controls)

/!\
You'll need a recent browser to enjoy all of this game (especially music).

entries.title: Fishy Fishy Fishman
entries.description:
TO RUN THE GAME: Head to the links provided below.  On Windows there's already a "fishy.exe" within: unzip the repo somewhere and run that EXE!  (On other platforms, you'll need to open the project in Unity and build for your target platform.)

This ended up actually being more like a 15 hour game jam - I joined up way too late.  It's playable, but *just* barely.  My first time using Unity - it's a fun platform once you get the hang of it!

Spin around other fish and touch them from behind to "eat" them and gain points.  Eat yellow pellets to "evolve" and move faster.

TERRIBLE KNOWN BUG: After you die once, the bounding box checking whether you touched an enemy fish from behind stops working.  I ran out of time while trying to resolve this... so try to get as far as you can on a single life, or restart if you die!  Ha!

entries.title: Kitten Farm Simulator 3000
entries.description:
Fulfill the kitten farmers dream of having 1000 kittens by gathering resources and evolving his farm into one capable of storing so many kittens!

Watch out for the zombies though, they seem to have acquired a taste for kitten blood.

(I'm terribad at art and audio, sorry :P)

Timelapse is available here if you want to see it;
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQw9AnnSF64

entries.title: Lab Giraffe
entries.description:
You are trapped inside a lab. Your neck is rapidly growing and once it reaches the roof, you will have a swift demise. You must find enough stem cells to reverse the process. Luckily, an earthquake is currently taking place.

Press M to mute music.

Created with XNA 4.0 Refresh.

entries.title: Mars Evolution
entries.description:
You are an engineer helping to terraform Mars. Use the mouse to move and interact. Try to figure it out. :)

HINT:
 - The goals are related to the drill, the plants, the rover, the cave on the left, and the alien. 

MORE HINT: 
 Playthrough: http://youtu.be/tG3aAWVsaTE

entries.title: Penelope Panther
entries.description:
Windows 64 bit - http://www.mediafire.com/?394zf6b6okx9oa2

We loved Ludum Dare and will be doing it again.

You can find our whole statement at http://fgtestground.weebly.com/ludum-dare-24.html

Controls:
(dvorak keyboard) - Comma,a,o,e to move
(qwerty keyboard) - w,s,a,d to move
left mouse button to use the basic attack
1 - to fire rockets(after you get the upgrade)
space - to dash(after you get the upgrade)

entries.title: RobotCity
entries.description:
I didn't have time to add controls to the page the game is on. So I will put them on this page till tomorrow maybe. I might also upload a timelapse.

=======================
===GAME IS FIXED NOW===

==Java 7 required==

If you download the source it should include a compile.bat file so you mess with the code more easily. The code is somewhat messy because I started panicking when time was running out.

Why I made this:
I was thinking about a game where it would be a top down robot shooter where you character would evolve into something bigger and has more guns. Then I decided you should maybe be in space flying from planet to planet getting things to prepare for a big planet where you get a device that basically lets you evolve into a dog and then it shows you 3 years before saying "I wanna be a dog" - the end

But I realized it was stupid and I would've run out of time anyway. So I tried making a city building game where your city evolves as you defend it. There was supposed to be bosses and different enemy types and they would attack in waves but I ran out of time. You will find the extra images in the source. I also tried making workers go from place to place doing the jobs as enemies killed them with you defending. But I didn't have time to fix the bugs. There supposed to be a larger map too. Try imagining what it should've been like and then go play it and realize how bad it is. I may make a post compo version.

CONTROLS:
Control - switch between fire and build mode
Click - Place building/Shoot
W/S forward and backward
A/D turn robot when in build mode (in fire mode it follows your cursor)

Other instructions:
Shoot the other robots.
There are three building types:
Miner - gets stone to make more mines houses and farms
Farm - makes food
House - (you only need one of these, but you must have at least one) makes workers for every 5 food
The only purpose of buildings is to increase score.

entries.title: Scavenger
entries.description:
A 2D top-down physics-based space game.

VERY broken right now, plus a little bit unfinished.
It's not as unfinished as it looks. A lot of the functionality just isn't being used right now because of the slightly more major problems with stars. Will fix tomorrow and add Windows version when I wake up.

entries.title: Space Worm
entries.description: Built with Unity3D. Grow your space worm into a gigantic monster. Work your way up the food chain by evolving better mobility, armor, and offensive abilities. Arrow keys controls the worm. Enter activates menu options.

entries.title: The Adventures of Box Man
entries.description:
Box man is trying to get home but stuff keeps evolving and eating him.  Help him get home ... please :-)

Made using c++, allegro & box2d.

entries.title: Thrust
entries.description:
The original idea was to make a space shooter where the player would be able to buy and place the weaponry in different slots of the ship while they advanced in the levels.

I kind of have the slots system, and the component systems but the game part is missing. Nevertheless I'll share the final result.

entries.title: Tiimmmeeee
entries.description:
Your aim : find your flying saucer !
After the Intro, use these keys to play :
Left & Right arrow to move
Up Arrow to jump
Space to use the zapper (you must get it before, and it require battery (you must get first the zapper to get battery))
The zapper allow you to accelerate the time to make the scene evolve ... to allow you to access new area.
In theory, theory, the player have to analyze scene to use the zapper in right order. But due to the time there so few room to make challenge, so there really few enigma, but anyway, you can test the concept.
Note : A room can be evoluted 2 time, and the statue room IS NOT the end (you need to be abble to reach the flying saucer to finish the game, and there is an outro :p). There is 8 room ;-)

Ps: No Sound

------------------------------------------
If you want the solution, go here : http://matheod.alwaysdata.net/LD/Tiimmmeeee/solution.txt

entries.title: Unnatural Selection
entries.description:
Well hello there ... welcome to Unnatural Selection.

This game was made in 5 hours for the LudumDare 24  ( i started another game on day 1...but it wasn't any fun...so i scraped it in the last minute)

Because of the limited time frame there are some things missing(cool menu/ awesome graphics ... and so on)

In this game you play a meteor throwing thing who has the assignment to destroy the last dinosaurs on earth. ( Hold left mouse to aim, pull and let go of the button to throw)

In the left upper corner of the game screen you can see the amount of dinos you can let through before you lose.

Timelapse and postmortem will follow shortly ( as well as Linux and Mac builds .....if MonoGame works )

entries.title: Watching the world evolve
entries.description:
This is a text based game on the evolution of the earth over the years. It is a short linear text game with small branches with backstory and humour. 

Note: If you see a message a about a lock perimeter, just ignore it. It has no effect on it.

entries.title: Yellow Dog
entries.description:
Controls: Click the buttons to give the dog food, water, a treat or to take him outside. 

This is my first LD. I designed this around my dog, who slept by my feet over the past few days. I recorded a time lapse of my progress from the beginning until now.

As you play the game, based on your actions, he'll either become a good dog or a bad dog. Bad dogs bark at cats and dig holes. Good dogs don't go potty in the house. 

--------------
You're now the owner of one yellow puppy.

Over time, he'll grow into a adult yellow dog, then an 
old yellow dog. Yellow dogs grow up in about 7 minutes.

It's your job to ensure that he grows up happy. 
Feed him when he's hungry. Give him treats when
he's done good. He'll learn from your actions.

And for goodness' sake, don't let him poop on the floor.

entries.title: .ISO - Part One
entries.description:
Here it is. ISO - Part one. I may make a Part Two. Who knows. I'm just a bit fed up with coding at the moment. 

ISO is a linear story-based platformer in a future where technological implants in humans have caused them to rapidly evolve into nearly completely mechanical monstrosities bent on destroying every non-implanted human in existence. 

As a last-ditch effort, the human Resistance put all their efforts and resources into creating one final weapon- You- A super-soldier of biotechnological make that would be capable of destroying the entire machine army in a fell swoop of a fist. 

Before you could be activated, though, the Resistance was seemingly destroyed.

For thirty years you have waited, dormant, in the ruins of the old Resistance outpost... Until you were activated with a mysterious radiowave transmission from deep space.

Now, it is up to you to discover the fate of the Resistance, the meaning behind your activation, and the shattering secrets hidden in the fabrics woven by time!
--------

INSTRUCTIONS:

Up, Down, Left, Right to move.
X to shoot.
Z to jump.
C to see which keys you currently possess.
Hold Shift to dash.
Hold X until you are glowing to unleash a charged shot.
Shift+Z+Direction to open a door for which you have the key.

--------

This game took about 30 hours of total nonstop work to complete. I put a damn lot of effort into it, so please take the time to download and score it. Additionally, please be gentle with the criticism, this is only my second game and I'm 14. Thank you, and enjoy.

--------

Also, check out N247's awesome game, http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-24/?action=preview&uid=7563

EDIT:
Apparently the movement isn't too great. I thought it was good, but hey. If it's the speed of the movement that's bothersome, just hold shift to dash everywhere.

~Kortuga

entries.title: Alien Rockpool
entries.description:
*** WEB VERSION NOW AVAILABLE ***
(suggest you try this version first) 

*** IF YOU SKIP THE TUTORIAL *** (aww, I spent some time on that... :d )
Controls are:-
Number keys 1-3 = Set tadpole group behaviour.
Click = Send Alpha tadpole to mouse location.

Basic jist of the game is that you have no shortage of numbers, but no defence or means of attack against 3 baddies washed into the same rockpool as you. :(

You'll have to be prepared to allow some to die so that new spawn may have the means to take on the baddies:-

1. A big fat Crab with a pointy thing.
2. A big fat Ray with lightning zaps.
3. A big fat Jellyfish with poison. 

Each baddie ability is effective against the other baddies. 

Poison has to be ingested. (i.e., more to be eaten, ohnoes!)
Lightning can be fired, but only in Attack mode.
Spikes are used in close range, but only in Attack mode.

Done in LWJGL so reasonably recent Java runtime (1.6+) needed.

entries.title: alteration
entries.description:
The evil slime creatures from planet Null Terminate have been traveling back in time to alter the course of evolution for their own nefarious needs. As a member of the Time Police, it is your sworn duty to right the wrongs that they have committed, repair history, and ensure a natural evolution.

Controls: arrow keys to move, space to interact with objects.

entries.title: Beginning To End
entries.description:
A 8 bit game programmed in Java in 47 hours, with a little more than a hour to spare. The game auto-updates when I release a new version, and if I add more levels. 
The game so far only contains 4 levels, but that number will greatly improve. 
The game is quite short, but is slightly difficult at times.
All this means, is that you have more time to rate games and make your own levels! If you make a cool level, send it to [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Make a webpage on constructing a custom level 
Update Game

entries.title: Bio Hierarchy
entries.description:
Here's my entry for the Jam, Bio Hierarchy!
It's nothing much, a simple topdown shooter game made with Game Maker. 
You control a little creature named Sid that will have to evolve to prevail against Gurl!
Remember, try to survive and DODGE DODGE DODGE!

entries.title: Darwin Fitotherapy
entries.description:
My first entry on LD.

Done with pure java (using just a lib for sounds - which were made on bfxr), this game involves a lot of things, but none particularly fancy.

The main point is about killing rabbits with fruit juice. Try to have fun, i guess.

Controls:
Arrow keys + Z/X/C
WASD + I/O/P

Tips:
-You start with 2 pesky rabbits munching your trees. Expect that number to increase in some minutes;
-Collect the fruits, make concoctions, throw them either at the trees or the fluffy devourers. The strategy is yours to ellaborate;
-If you aim right, you can buff two trees at once with only one potion;
-You can't win the game. You can just survive longer.

-Potions are random. There's no way you can predict what are you going to throw next. But their colors are unique:
*Red: Heals all plants hit to 100%
*Green: Increases health regen on all plants hit
*Light Blue: Increases growth rate on all plants hit
*Pink-ish: Increases fruit rate on all plants hit
*Orange: Incapacitates all creatures hit (Time depends on how many creatures are incapacitated)
*Dark Blue: Awakens all incapacitated creatures

entries.title: deevo
entries.description: The OSX and Linux versions require Python 2.7 and PyGame installed. (http://python.org http://pygame.org)

entries.title: Digital Evolution by TheJackiMonster
entries.description:
It's a 2D Jump&Run with little fights of the strongest..
If you die, then you get more life or energy..
Collect bones to enter next levels and collect apples or flesh to heal your character.

Controls:
W,A,S,D: "move"
Space: "jump"
E: "attack"

It's simple evolution..!

[You can make your own levels with a draw-program..]

I hope you like it.. :D
(If the text isn't so good, please forgive me, because I am a german 14-years old guy..)

entries.title: Dinosaur Evolution
entries.description: This is a game about the Evolution of the Humans vs. The Dinosaurs (really alligators). You control a robot controlled by a human.

entries.title: DNA Wars
entries.description:
As far as I know evolution is based on genetics. DNA Wars is a strategy/puzzle game in biochemical setting where you have 4 types of organic cells and your mission is to cure 4 genetic mutations which will try to hurt you.

Powered by FlashPunk.

Please read the tutorial if you will have some issues.

This is my first strategy game though, i hope it's fun.

Known bug: if particles stop to drop just refresh game page

entries.title: Dracolution
entries.description:
A small adventure game. You start as a young dragon. But you will grow everytime you beat a level.
Also, you can choose a new color for your dragon everytime you grow.
The colors don't have any effects on the gameplay yet. There was no time left for that. :(
There are two small boss levels. An evil wizard (screenshot) and a knight.

Have fun playing!


Controls:
- point and click to move.

entries.title: DrinkMilk
entries.description:
A game where you control a centipede in the battle for survival against other centipede! 

Local multiplayer available! 

Needs XNA redist to play, also, you need to install the font contained in the folder.

Mouse/WASD or arrows to move!

entries.title: EVOL
entries.description:
It's a game.

Clickthe Post-Mortem link for detailed apologia.

entries.title: Evolution - Caveman
entries.description:
Caveman has to prove to be the fittest individual in the wild.

Help him fight dinosaurs and achieve evolution!

* Requires Java JRE 7
* Developed in Java using libGDX.

entries.description: Sorry that the game-play doesn't have much to it/make sense. I couldn't get the AI working so I couldn't finish in time.

entries.title: Flower o Doom
entries.description:
Defend your flower from ants with your powerful minions!

_____________________________

I wasn't in the mood and didn't finish this Ludum Dare. The game is half finished and broken.

entries.title: Grow
entries.description:
Well, it's not complete to our vision but it is something! We will post more information and the textures/assets not used a little later. 

Control is use your mouse to rotate and left mouse button or letter 'w' to go forward.

Space is to shoot at the enemies. The goal is to get food to sustain energy and health (and you grow when you eat a lot) and kill all the other tadpoles. 

Watch out for the stork!

entries.title: Mech Creature
entries.description: In this game humanity was destroyed in nuclear war and the only form of life who can survive was bio-mechanical form of life. So the character is a small robot who will evolve during the game.

entries.title: Modula
entries.description:
Z/X to shoot guns and missiles respectively
Arrow keys move

Enemies are procedurally generated, kind of.
Each level is based upon the enemies that gave you the hardest time during the last level, and some random mutations of them.
Was going for an 'arcadey' feel.

entries.title: Scopes (Monkey Trial) Simulator
entries.description:
This is a (very simple) strategy game I made in about 12 hours. Unfortunately, there wasn't as much polish or testing as I would have liked, and I'm not entirely sure if the game is winnable except by extreme luck. The game is coded entirely in Javascript, HTML, and CSS, and makes heavy use of the AngularJS: http://www.angularjs.org/ library.

* Edit: The game is fairly winnable if you focus on one or two states, you just need more states that are blue than the opponent. The "play again" buttons are sadly broken, so just refresh the game or hit the "reset game" button. Nothing will be changed from this version until the voting is over.

entries.title: Screaming Fish Growing Appendages
entries.description: This is the collaborative effort of 6 people it was a learning experience for all of us. Whether or not we met our expections, we learned a lot about game devlopment and how to work together.

entries.title: Shootout
entries.description:
Instructions:

1. Use left, right & up to control movement.

or
   Use A, D & W instead.

2. Use Z & X to fire.

or

   Use O & P instead.

Hint: You cannot jump until level 4.

Hint: If you tap up quickly at level 5...

This is my entry for Ludum Dare 24 - it is a simple shooter
The enemy and game mechanics evolve as you play.

entries.title: Snakey's Cravings
entries.description:
Team Snakey:
Nicu Listana - Programming, Art, Director
Jason Eldred - Art, Music
Ryan Jow - Art 
Zachary Santos - Music

Objective:
Score as much as you can without touching the sides of the screen.

Controls:
Z - rotate clockwise
X - rotate counter-clockwise

Evolution:
Eat 2 hemps and evolve to a Jamaican snake.
Drink 3 beers and evolve to a college freshman.

entries.title: Soul Jar
entries.description:
Hi guys, first time Ludum Dare entry, hope you like it, its about evolving AI.  A robot that collects and imitates lifeforms, a "soul jar" from space, crash lands and must return to his ship.  Along the way you teach it how to behave and depending how you influence and evolve his AI will result in several different endings.

His AI will develop based on your actions, as he learns from you.  If you become aggressive shooting your way through the enemies the robot will take on aggressive traits, eventually even targeting you, if you heal, carry and protect him he will learn to protect you also, if you are greedy and consume all the food and liquids and items he will adopt those traits also.  There are lots of possibilities with how he acts though I kind of ran out of time as the list is still largely unimplemented.  Future version maybe?

Short Trailer here:

http://youtu.be/Q1eV13gY5tk

entries.title: 'The Neon Pink Philosophy'
entries.description:
A few things before I even get to TALK ABOUT the game...

There's two versions. One is Flash, the other a standalone .exe for Windows. The reason for this is that the Flash version requires a pretty competent processor. I made the game on a dual-core desktop, and the Flash version lags HORRIBLY on it (it's okay on my i3 laptop, though). 

So if the Flash version is laggy for you, PLEASE play the standalone version instead. It is NOT fair to rate something you can't run properly, after all. Thank you.

SECONDLY, if you're the kind of person who cares, despite being hosted there, the Flash version isn't eligible for the Kongregate competition, due to lack of integrated API. I know some people got a bit tetchy about playing Kong games since that whole 'thing' happened, so I dunno, this information might be useful.

FINALLY! This game has fully voice-acted cutscenes that tell the story that is basically integral to the whole thing. They ARE skippable (via the 'Escape' key), but I'd really appreciate it if you'd watch them - You're judging, after all, and how can you judge content you've skipped?

RIGHT!

NOW ON TO THE GAME!

You are Fred, a small, philosophical pink thing, doing the bidding of an ominous disembodied voice from above.

Collect the green food things to add 10 points to your score, but be quick, because your score is dropping every second. 

Try and avoid getting hit. Every hit you take will cost you a whopping TWENTY points, which is a lot. And now you're thinking "Wait, I CAN;T DIE?! Ahahaha! Where's the challenge in this?" Well, bub, the 'challenge' is in getting a high score. FOR A REASON.

There's a 'true' ending to the INCREDIBLY WELL-WRITTEN, VOICE-ACTED NARRATIVE that you'll only get to see if you can score more than 700 points overall. So y'know, put some effort in.

Move with WASD, aim/shoot when you're able to with the mouse (hold the left button down to shoot continuously), skip cutscenes with 'Escape' but, like I said, please don't.

That's everything, I think. If you encounter any bugs, grab me on Twitter (@dedhedzed) and I'll try and get them fixed as fast as I can. 

Phew!

entries.title: BATTLE ARENA PARTY 7!
entries.description:
BAP7 is a Multi-Player Strategy game.  The game starts by each player customizing their units with elements and abilities.  When the match starts the units will attack each other with their limited AI. The player who best specialized their units will win.  Players can then further specialize their units, and try to counter what their opponents did.  Thus the tagline, "Strategy Evolved." 

We saw the keyword of evolution as "adapt", so we created a game where players must adapt their units based on their opponent's choices.

Made by Ryan Burns, Joaquin Del Canto, Billy Do, and Andrew St Clair.

Music:
"Blitz Pixel" by MSX Crew
"Underground Ex School" by Bitluzherbip
Used with Creative Commons License Non-Commercial

So I wrote a beatbox generator and tried to have some monsters for a challenge. But the game just did not work out.
So what I ended up with is a toy that generates beatbox beats that you can listen to.

Hit Space to have a new beat. You can also walk around and kill the monsters, or be killed if you touch them from the side or jump on them while they beat.

entries.title: Cellar
entries.description:
HERE WE ARE! Windows version finally up, take time to learn about crosscompilation :)

The random fonction is not the same between mac and win version but the user experience is pretty similar :)


NEW VERSION UP! This one should be compatble with 10.6+, i can't try it since i'm on 10.8

I'm having issue to upload the new sources, but there is just a minor fix with the wait time after having successfully mutated a cell.

I will post on twitter a post compo version with sound and more features as soon as this will be done.

Cellar is a minimalist mutation simulation.

At the start, two cells are randomly generated.

Genetics values are represented by the color of the cell.

On the first cell you can use radiation by clicking on the dark buttons to make the cell mutates. Its color should change as the genetics values change.

The goal is to reach the same evolution as the second cell using combination of radiations. You can check the percentage of Genetic Match by clicking the button next to the second cell. Red is under 90%, Green is over. 
When the Match is tested and return a positive answer, two new cells are generated.

For Mac and Win, and I'm working on Linux support.

I've used C++ and the GLFW openGL library. I made it in ~12h.
Follow me on twitter @L_Etrangeliste

entries.title: Dungeon Thingy (Unfinished)
entries.description:
Hey, this is my first ever Ludum Dare entry and I've enjoyed participating very much!
My game isn't nearly as finished as I wanted it to be so I'll give you a run down of what I wanted it to be, what it is and what it isn't.

What I wanted:
A Rogue-like where you are a monster that EVOLVES and rid the dungeon of pesky heroes for you master. You would choose certain evolutions at points during that game that would give you new abilities (Invisibility, poison, ect.) and then you'd carry on until you died and got a highscore (How many heroes you killed).

What it is:
Right now it's a simple little game where you run around a one floor dungeon (Ladders don't work yet), opening doors and running away from an angry looking head. The dungeon works, the line of sight works, simple AI works, death works, and so does some other stuff. Oh and the dungeon is randomly generated (That took me the first 12 hours :D).

What it isn't:
A lot. I'm sure you can see what it isn't but I'm planning on finishing this game as I'm enjoying making it :)

Thanks for taking a look, comments are very welcome!
Joseph Little.

EDIT: Reuploaded with some changes to solve problems with XNA.

entries.title: Dinolution
entries.description:
Dinolution is a platformer where you play through the journey of a dinosaur across the world. Some obstacles may present themselves that prove tough or impossible, and here your character can evolve to a new form to meet the challenge.

The game can be played with a keyboard or a gamepad. It has been tested on Windows but may well run on Linux or Mac OS X. Please give it a go and give us feedback!


Keyboard Controls

Movement - WASD, Arrow Keys, or Numpad.
Jump - Space or Control
Run - Shift (left or right).
Attack - Enter, Numpad Enter, or R.
Pause - Escape

Gamepad Controls (XBox layout)
Movement - Left stick or D-Pad.
Jump - A Button
Run - X Button
Attack - B Button
Pause - Start Button


The Evil Cult Team

Luke Baird
Andrew Beasley
Patrick Beasley
Brendon Byrnes

entries.title: Egocell jam
entries.description:
My game for this entry (my first LD) is talking about a cell (wow!).

This cell is very egocentric and narcissic. Located on the human brain, she is thinking about looking for a new body (yes, this cell can control bodies), because she finds the human body not good enough for her.

So she jumps off the human, and accidentally gets on a rat. For her, controlling a rat is horrible, so she begins running and searching a new body.

After one level, she finds a dog. She continues to search a better body, though.

I ran out of time, so the game only includes 4 (big) levels. I will provide a link to a version with more levels soon.

This is my first LD and it was a very, very great experience (very hard too, as this game is my second C++ game on PC).

You can find my post-mortem here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/28/egocell-post-mortem/

I streamed on http://twitch.tv/adbook/ if you want to see the records.
Now, let me sleep for three days, please !



Note that the game is not complete.


EDIT: I noticed a huge flaw in the way the collisions were performing: if the player falls from too high or comes in a platform the wrong way, It would occasionate a buffer overflow and eventually a SEGFAULT (wich would cause a crash...). The same with the screens between each level. I fixed these two flaws, and by some board effect, the player's jump became stable (so the bug was due to some wrong collision detection), as did the mobs jumps. I uploaded the fixed version to avoid SEGFAULTS and memory leaks !

entries.title: Hobolution
entries.description:
Basically a slimmed down version of my main game that I'm making. I must admit that this was rather rushed, since I have other commitments to attend to (study, work, etc).

Personally I don't like some aspects of it, but I won't talk about them in case I'll infect your mineset and have a different view on the game. 

Anyway...controls: Arrow keys and the occasional Z button.

You can play this game on any platform that supports HTML5 which means you can play on your touch device (because I added touch screen support)

Ok since I was too tired to make a help page I'll make it here. 

You are a homeless guy and you want to get back up to the top. You collect bottles and try to get a job and buy a house (to rent off).

Collect bottles and hand them in at the bottle shop (not hard to miss)

After you get past $500, you'll (mentally) evolve into a worker, where you can get the ability to work (you'll need a resume, so go to the library)

Past this point you evolve by gaining money from working (one of the black buildings will give you a job, just walk up to it).

Unfortunately I was unable to implement the leaderboard and save features, along with other stuff like the insides of buildings, different cloths, npc, other art stuff. :(

Hopefully my second LD will be better.

entries.title: Homes Through Time!
entries.description:

The idea was to have the evolution part be part of the story; doing small missions to improve your current home. I barely managed to output one very, very short level, though the story really requires about seven, minimum :P

As such, not much evolution at all, nor is there much of a game to speak of.

There is also no sound.

On the flip side, though, I am fairly pleased with the graphics, although they could use a bit of polish, especially the hero. :P

_______________________________________________________
INSTRUCTIONS

Move with the arrow keys.
Interact with x.

entries.title: Lepton's Quest
entries.description:
NOTE: OS/X package now available!
NOTE2: In the ZIP one, click "RUN Lepton's Quest", not rungame.bat (should have removed that one) 

Linux: You need the SLUDGE engine to be able to run the .slg file. Newer Debians and Ubuntus/Ubuntu derivatives have it in the repository. Just: 

sudo apt-get install sludge-engine 

I believe it's in the Arch repos also.

You also need to install libalure1 manually. Get it here:
http://packages.debian.org/wheezy/libalure1

Or, if all that fails:

http://opensludge.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/opensludge/doc/SLUDGELinuxHelp/Compiling_SLUDGE_on_Ubuntu.html

or download the Windows ZIP and run:
wine SLUDGEEngine.exe game.slg

(Note to self - learn to make self-contained packages)

- - - - - - - - - 

Well crikey, this was a rather interesting experiment. We did not finish, but submitted something that at least vaguely resembles what we wanted to end up with and can actually be played through.

We saw "Evolution" and went "Pokemon, yay"... the resulting game not quite that, although the combat system was going to be reminiscent.

Things that did not make it:
- Combat system
- Monster fights featuring said combat system
- Loads of sounds
- Some music
- Some NPCs
- NPC animations
- Monster animations
- A few plot points
- Some additional locations

How this was made:
- Loads of people helped to build the sets we used, in Minecraft.
- Minecraft worlds were converted to Wavefront objects using mcobj
- Scenes rendered in Blender
- Intro/Outro made in Maya
- Game built in OpenSLUDGE

All names are in the credits. 

Writing of dialogue by WelshPixie. Music by Shadowthewedgehog95, Shakdude, Creammin (not used yet). Fonserbc made a texture pack and mod to help the builders see what the final output might be while they were building. Intro, outro and sound effects (many still to be used) by Kasperophof and kongering.

Thanks to everyone in the http://indiesquish.com/ community who helped out!

(Gah, upload to server going slowly)

entries.title: Planetary_evolve
entries.description:
// If you want to play a good game, don't waste your time here. It's an unfinished piece of sh*t, it's not worth your time.

Basically, I tried to make a game as a sort of simulator/strategy/sandbox thing with the main goal of evolving life on a planet and then developing it's technology. Every evolvement process (both technological and organic) is scripted and the gameplay consists of influencing the process in some way. 

In the end, I failed and managed to finish only evolutionary process, meaning I've scrapped technological advancement part and conflicts between different species. I've also left behind some more stuff from original concept, such as life transfer between planets.

The version you see here is shameful to call an alpha even. It's unfinished and there's actually no reason for uploading it here. There's a slight consolation in this being my first actual game project and a game jam, also my first *real* experience with Unity besides testing. I guess it's something.

I will try to finish this in the following days so that the game will be more of a "game" rather than a test.

Note: There are other types of planets with other basic conditions in game code, including gas giants and ocean planets. I will add random planet generation in forthcoming updates so that they will be available too.

EDIT 1: Added web version, added 28.8_Data folder to windows build.
EDIT 2: Fixed some bugs, added a note about game's state, working status messages. Since contest rules permit only small fixes, this version is a 'final' contest one (unless there will be bugs, which I'll fix). Any new updates will be linked as "(latest)" in download section, with changelog info here.

entries.title: Meow for MUTATION!
entries.description:
Story:
An intelligent race of feline-like creatures has just learned about the upcoming attack of ALIENS. Having no choice, they must defend by all means possible. The problem is, until now, they had no use for weapons and war machines, being the peace-loving folk they are. So they figured they will use Crossover Accelerating Technology (C.A.T.!) to speed up their evolution - that's the only chance for them to survive!
----------
Controls:
X (hold) - speed-up next turn
H - help/info (also displays current objective)
ESC - go back to title screen
MOUSE CLICK - select specimen for elimination, change slider values
----------
Implementation:
Game is essentially an implementation of genetic algorithm. Player can modify mutation and crossover rates to influence creatures population. These, and selecting creatures for elimination, are means for creating specific units, which is the goal of the game.

If you're interested in GAs, see:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_algorithm
----------
Note on post-compo version:
Created within jam deadline, this version relies on player selecting specimens to PROCREATE, instead of deleting them. This is a completely different mechanic, and probably more playable than original. Some tweaks are also applied to mutation to increase the chance of getting the right features.

entries.title: RUN RUN AMOEBA
entries.description:
HTML5 browser needed. Use the arrow keys absorb DNA to evolve into a faster Amoeba and outrun fossilization. Evolved Amoebas will be granted leaderboard status!

====================
CONTROLS
====================

LEFT ARROW: MOVE LEFT
RIGHT ARROW: MOVE RIGHT
UP ARROW: JUMP (HOLD FOR MAX, TAP FOR MIN~SKILL HOP)



====================
DESCRIPTION
====================

It's a pretty hard speed platformer. If you ever played the carpet level in the classic Aladdin, or some of the other older speed memory games you will have fun with the challenge. If that style was never your thing then you may not like this game too much as it requires several replays and memorization.

There is a screenshot with some advice if you REALLY want to make it on the leaderboard.

====================
MECHANICS
====================

Every piece of DNA evolves your Amoebic acid to be 10 faster in x-velocity. It also increases your speed cap by 10.

Kicker: it increases the Walls velocity by 11 -3% of your velocity and increases the walls cap by 11. IT also stops the wall forcing it to re-accelerate.



====================
Gameplay Video
====================
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o-N91MJsIYQ&feature=g-upl

entries.title: War Of Elements
entries.description:
This is a small game, where you can add Elements who are fighting against others when they are reachable.

Made with Java.

Should work with every Java compatible OS.

*UPDATED: Link to the game ;)

Introduction: (Sorry, I forgot that :D)

First you add a new element by clicking the button "New Element". 

Now you can choose what your new element can do like:
 - Name (The name of the element)
 - Life (How much life the element have)
 - Armor (How much armor the element have)
 - Sword (How much damage the element do)
 - Width & Height (The scale of the element)
 - Color (How your element looks)
 - Steps (How many steps the element per "walk" do)
 - Steps per second (How many "walks" the element per second do)

Click on "Add Element" and the element will approach on the right side from the game.

Now you can select the Element and add some on your battlefield.

If 2 elements are too close (10px and less) they will make damage on the other element each walk.

When they die they disappear.


Click on the button "Reset Elements" to clean the battlefield.

entries.title: Winding of Isaac
entries.description:
Super incomplete, sorry. This Android game was inspired by the upcoming Hurricane Isaac, as our team is based in Louisiana.

Your goal is to make a big friggen hurricane and slam it into the Gulf of Mexico.
In yellow is your speed, in blue is your amount of water. As you gather more water, you get larger relative to the map. Hot air and cold air makes you get higher and lower, which lets you gain speed, lose water or lose speed, gain water.

The white arrows manually adjust your course through the map. The blue and red arrows throughout the map are supposed to change your course and height.

It takes a careful balance between water and speed to make a good hurricane. If you get too low to the ground, you'll gain too much water and crash into the water (aka break the game). Go too high, and you'll be ZOOMING FAST, but you won't have any water.

HTML5 version coming soon.

Credits:
Lead Designer - Mitch Orcino
Programmer/Designer - Kyle Bradshaw - @TehSkull
Artist - Dae in Cho - @Haloflooder
Musician - Seth White - @HerbivoreZombie

entries.title: 3 Little Pigs
entries.description:
----------------------------------
This is a short 3D game where you play as Big Bad Wolf to reclaim your lunch ham.
Gameplay is extremely simple and based on bringing the pig's houses down.
----------------------------------

-------- How to Play --------
Use WASD or arrows keys to move and Space to jump.
Eat the pig to pass the level. There are two (not random!) alternate game endings .
----------------------------------

-------- Theme & Sound --------
Theme: this is a classic of architectonic evolution :-)
There is no sound or music, don't look for it, it's just not there.
----------------------------------------

-------- My goals --------
My goal for this Ludum Dare was to learn how to work with the Blender Game Engine.
I managed to learn a lot and to produce this game in the last 12 hours (as proof).
3Little Pigs is not supposed to be a great game, it's the results of a learning experience.
------------------------------

-------- Tools used --------
Blender 2.63a and Gimp 2.6
The game was made with the Blender Game Engine, which means OpenGL, the Bullet Physics Engine and Python.
Also, it only has textures working properly thanks to the Blender community (thank you Olson, Qantourisc and meta-androcto).
---------------------------------

Source and binaries are under GPL.

entries.title: _Evolve
entries.description:
To Play: The game currently consists of 10 levels. Each level has an objective. To complete the objective, you must create the proper ecosystem for the various critters inhabiting the world. Use the eggs on the left of your toolbar to place critters. The next two tools allow you to manipulate ground height. The next two allow you change the temperature. The next two let you manipulate water amount. Finally, the two buttons on the far right let you show the temperature or water heatmap.

You gain eggs as creatures are surviving and reproducing on the map. So, having mice breeding and living happily would create mice eggs.
The first tier of creatures (eggs on the left) feed on their favorite terrain. The next tiers eat the lower level. So, a wolf will eat an mouse, gecko, finch, etc. 

Enjoy!

entries.title: Adlus: Mouse Of Truth
entries.description: magicdweedoo

entries.title: Boby
entries.description:
This, is Boby.  Boby is a un-evolved human taking a walk.  As he walks faster and faster, he gathers some candy-looking DNA and begins to evolve.

This is a really simple game I made because I seriously couldn't think of anything I'd want to make with evolution.  Hopefully next LD I'll think of something better :D

entries.title: Ebosslution
entries.description:
Ebosslution is a plataform game, my first game!. The player have the control of a rare slim who can shot bullets and grenades, but when he shot he goes into stress mode and loses health until he stop shotting.

There are 5 levels, each one have an evolutionated boss that you need kill to pass next level. The final level (#5) have all types of bosses plus the final boss.

Game done with ImpactJs

Controls:

x: Jump
c: Shoot
TAB: switch weapon

entries.title: Evergen
entries.description:
The web version works properly in both Chrome and Firefox. Should work in any WebGL compatible browser.


Evergen is an evolving tower defense game.

The object of the game is to build and evolve your network of energy as large as possible before the time runs out or you are overwhelmed by enemies. To start, click on the flickering energy node to expand your network, this costs 25 energy points. The game will generate a portion of the network that's powered by that energy node (which will now look like a glowing orb).

The white enemies are attracted to these energy nodes and will immediately move towards them. If an energy node runs out of health points (indicated by the orb shrinking) it and the entire portion of the network that it powers will disappear forever.

To protect these nodes, click on a hardpoint (a dark circle) which are spawned in various places along the network. This will create a defense turret (costing 5 energy points) which will target enemies and shoot them down. Turrets can also be relocated to another empty hardpoint, useful when a portion of the network is about to go down, you can save the turrets by moving them.

You can press "Space" to reset the game, and you can "Right Click" and drag to pan the camera around.

entries.title: Evolution Jumper
entries.description:
Build your own DNA from fragments to gain and lose attributes and progress through this short game.
IMPORTANT: Press TAB to open/close the DNA screen. Hold Shift to sprint and press space to jump.

You may need:
- Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable
x86: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=5555
x64: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=14632
