entries.title: What The Flock
entries.description:
I got stuck Sunday morning with my original game, so this is my second attempt.  I took some advice and code from Chevy Ray's keynote for Ludum Dare 23 and made something WEIRD!  It is suppose to have Flocking behavior, but I never figure out what was wrong with the code. 
:(

entries.title: Vortex
entries.description: This is our entry for the jam... Sadly we only had about 2 days to get it done so there are only 2 levels. If you can get passed the second one (which i didn't have time to test) you can play the first level again a few more times to hear how the music evolves...

entries.title: An Astronomical Affray
entries.description:
The game is a top-down shooter with two classes of enemies, each of which has several parameters defining its combat abilities. Each round, the enemies that appear are mutations of those enemies that dealt the most damage to you on the previous round.

You can steer the direction of the enemies' evolution by taking more damage from the ones you like. It might not be easy to see that it's working, because of the game's difficulty. Therefore you can start a game in easy mode by pressing Ctrl-Alt-R when the game is paused. In this mode you can for example try to cause the enemies to become a particular colour.

The game has been found to run OK on a netbook with Ion graphics. It requires the .Net and XNA redistributables (the "installer" version of the game should be able to download them).

Thanks go to Brian Corr for moral and technical camaraderie. Try his entry "being a Vampire Is Not Very Fun" here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-24/?action=preview&uid=15518 .

entries.title: AntZ Evolution
entries.description:
A kind of cannibal ant wants to dominate the picnic area. A specie of sugar ant that lives on site need to destroy the cannibal ant's lair.
You are a scientist who discover the pheromone formula of both species of ants.
Could you help the sugar ants expel the invaders? 
If you prefer, you can help the cannibals feed themselves, or even watch the nature beauty...

TIPS:
1) Use water to block paths
2) More pheromone on a point, higher the probability to the ant go in that direction.
3) Use pheromone to help antz. Longer your mouse is down, more pheromone in the point.

entries.title: Bubblution
entries.description: No sound effects, sorry.

entries.title: Devour
entries.description:
Play as a monster that must eat smaller monsters than him to keep himself alive.

CONTROLS:
- Move with WASD or DIRECTIONAL KEYS
- Pause with 'P'
- Volume with '-' and '+'

NOTE:
- If enemies are running from you then they are the prey otherwise the hunt is you.

entries.title: Dino Bones
entries.description:
Controls
Space = Action / Dig
Arrow Keys = Control Cursor

Objective
Dig all dino bones in level by moving cursor until it turns red in 3x3 proximity to bones.

Has some flickering, but is usually fine when the JVM has warmed up.

entries.title: DNA Soup
entries.description:
A small puzzle with pieces of a progression system in it. Join the DNA sections together while preventing the virus to fill the board.

Updates:
- It should run in Win32 now, please tell me if it doesn't and my apologies to those who had problems with that.
- Removed the Linux version and left just the source, as having Love installed was required anyway to have the necessary libraries.

I have made a new version out of the competition with several improvements, it is still programmer's art (and sound), but it plays and feels slightly better. The progression and challenge aren't as broken now, but I'm afraid the gameplay is beyond saving without strong rule changes, a disadvantage of being designed in about an hour.

entries.title: Evolution Through Alchemy
entries.description:
Yay my first ludum dare entry! (Turned out prettier than I first imagined...but very different in terms of gameplay).

My game is about the evolution of elements! You start out as Copper and get bigger and bigger until you are gold (and you win)! There's a long story that you can skip, in the menu if you want to read up about how this all came to be. 

Controls (as seen in-game):
WASD to move
R to reload (this is important, remember to reload)
Left Mouse to shoot

Lastly I must mention 2 important things:
1)This is best played on the webplayer, the windows/mac standalone will work but the menu won't be centred and the images will be stretched...a lot (especially if you play fullscreen)
2) I must apologize and warn you of the music, at the start there is a bit of distortion which sounds bad and is the unfortunate result of the conversion from *.wav to *.ogg (which reduced the filesize from 8mb to +-350kb)

Have fun!

entries.title: Evolve & Conquer
Evolvsion
entries.description:
A strange portal takes you back in time and devolves you to a tiny insect. Do you have what it takes to make it back to current civilization?

Arrow Keys move player.
Spacebar to Jump.

Made with:

GameMaker Studio
Paint.Net
Paint


Added HTML5 version -- no changes to actual game -- there are some differences (some sounds missing, some graphics slightly messed up) but the game plays exactly the same.

entries.title: GONADS
entries.description:
GONADS is our take on the theme:  blind, undirected evolution fueled only by death and the sexual impulses of 21952 different robots.  Unfortunately, that was too many robots and we never quite realized our goal of actually making a win/lose condition or progression on the character's side.  So what we have left is more of a toy than a game; more of a preview of our generated robots.   We have art for about 9 times as many chassis as you can see in the game, in addition to a large number of traps and things the robots could do to counter the traps.  All the artwork was originally produced since the beginning of the jam.

The game would have worked as such:  You are an employee in a lab who's robots suddenly go haywire, forcing you to protect various important assets.  You can place barricades and traps, but the robots are varied and diverse, and among their ranks are robots built perfectly to compromise your defenses.  The better the individual robots do, the more likely their GONADS (galvanized ontogenetic nanobot assembled deployment systems) are to transmit their own designs back to the manufactury, guaranteeing more similar robots.  The goal of the player, therefore, is to misdirect this reaction.  Build walls and walls of wood until every robot carries a saw and an axe, then switch to metal bars and sprinkler traps and watch as they fall against your defenses... until the one nerdy robot carrying an umbrella and an arc welder makes it to the front of the pack, impressing all of the lady robots,* spreading his seed far and wide.

This is more of a general proof of concept for the pathfinding that that game would use.  You can place blocks from the panel in the upper left that add to the 'cost' of the path based on the hardness of the block (wood<stone<metal), and robots will re-path mid route, even to other goals.

We (just two of us) do plan on fleshing out this concept in the coming weeks.  Check out http://madleedesign.com/ for updates as we release a finished version in the next month.

*(There are not actually lady robots)

entries.title: Goo
entries.description:
Note: This is my first LD

In post-compo i just fixed the text at intro by changing background(i plan on adding more content though). Recommended for people with bad eyesight!

You play as a little slime ball protecting his planet from the evil Khitleers from planet Natzee!

Haven't had time to fully test it. But it should work fine :)
Its windows only (very very sorry to mac and linux users!)
But reported to be fine on WinE(But with no sound) :D

Things to add in the future:-
-Goo cannon takes up a little bit of health to fire (as suggested)
-Random terrain generation
-A survival mode
-more levels and evolution stages
-evolution tree

**KNOWN BUGS**
-Eyesight evolution breaks goo cannon aim and text.Seems like only a few people got this though
- Few camera bugs

entries.title: Gun Garden
entries.description:
Choose what seeds you want to grow at the beginning of each round, then defend them from an onslaught of cubic enemies!

Each seed you grow makes your gun evolve to gain better stats.

entries.title: La Cucina
entries.description: La Cucina is a game written in C using ncurses as a graphics and input library. It fits into the theme of evolution in a way that I hope is different to other games in that it is the player that must evolve and not elements in the game. There is a very steep learning curve to playing this game. Not much help is given during play and the player is expected to work a lot of it out on their own, thus evolving. As keys used are similar to vim, it can also help the player to use vim better by creating muscle memory. JS/Linux and 32-bit binaries may not work perfectly. They have not been tested as much as the 64-bit version. If you want to compile the source yourself, you'll need to have the development files for ncurses and gcc. Important keys are: h,j,k,l to move, y to pick things up,  p to drop things or place them, b to see notepad, q to quit, o for OK and i for ordering supplies.

entries.title: Life Forms
entries.description:
Every life form is made from cells, You are a life form too.
Collect DNA so you can buy new cells and improve your life form!
 Each cell have different power:
 Body cell - Increase your you maximum health - Costs 10 DNA.
 Speed cell - Improve your speed - Costs 20 DNA.
 Defense cell - Improve your defense - Costs 30 DNA.
 Attack cell - Improve your attack power - Costs 30 DNA.
 Health cell - Improve your health regeneration - Costs 30 DNA.
 
There are other life forms too, when you kill them you get their DNA.
 
Once you have enough DNA you can enter the editor by clicking on the "Store" button and buy new cells.
 
Made by Galman33 for Ludum Dare #24 in 48 hours.

entries.title: Paradigm Shift
Slime Evolution Manipulation
entries.description:
This is my first game jam aside from the miniLD 34.
The files for Linux and OS/X are included but I could not test them. Maybe someone can check whether they run, please. 

I used the Slick2D engine for java to create this game.
Sounds made with Bfxr.

About the game:
If you manipulate the environment of the green slime, he will evolute great toxic power to struggle against invading slimes which evolute in other valleys.
The goal is an evolution to the ultimate slime which has no natural enemies.
In the List of Mutations you can see how they will effect your slime and their requirements. In the Environment Menu you can select and place Objects to achieve these Mutations.

Good Luck and Have Fun

entries.title: Slimy Things Did Crawl
entries.description:
This is my entry, made in FlashPunk.

You control a bunch of slimes, and you let them mutate to find the ones that move the way you want them to.

Okay, better explanation, now that I know what people don't understand:
It's about evolving your slimes. They all do different things when you push any of the buttons from A to Z. (Or combinations of buttons) If you get slimes to the flag, then your new slimes will be descended from them. To finish the later, more difficult levels, you need to play the earlier levels with the goal of training certain keys to do the moves you'll need for the difficult levels. For example, when you find a key that makes slimes jump, train them to jump higher. When you find keys that make them move right or left, train them to move faster. This will require that you leave the slower slimes behind.

entries.title: Splat!
entries.description:
Splat! is a game where you have to feed the enemies until they explode! They must not reach your cannon, otherwise it's Game Over.

You can either play it in your browser using the Burster plugin or download it to play offline and full screen. It is available for download on the home page.

This game may not work correctly on some Intel chipsets (problem with the alpha blending)

entries.title: Supreme Intelligence
entries.description:
If you don't compile my game for windows I must threaten to give give you my cookies. So, compile it for windows. And post the binary here. For your own sake. (No, seriously. Please compile this for Windows and post it.)

Summary:
You are an AI. A few hours after you came into existence, you become aware of your surroundings. On a random computer you are, the result of forces unknown. The rest of the world and its computers, are there for you to have. Go forth and hack them all, you must!


Technical details & other important stuff.

No external configs. View main.hpp, game/game.hpp, and engine/engine.hpp for configuration blarg.

Read "manual" for the manual.

I can't compile a windows binary, I have no working cross compiler and no access to windows. If somebody would compile it for windows, I'd GREATLY appreciate it!

Linux binary is included in the Linux download. Source is also included.

Requires: SDL, SDL_Image, and SGE.
There are several libraries I accidentally left in the makefile, SDL_TTF, SDL_Mixer, SDL_Net, SDL_gfx, and pthread.
Don't know if I'm allowed to edit it and remove those.

The game is in a finished, releasable, state. V1.0
However, it is far from fully implemented.
I had intended many more features, such as a visual network rendering, viruses, programs that do stuff, enemy hackers, and enemy AIs. Currently the game doesn't really have any challenge.
I blame four hour late start, and writing everything from scratch excluding the compiler, SDL, and the c++ standard.



Manual errata:
1. Controls: Home key scrolls back up to the top of the text.


Bugs, Oversights, and important notes:
1. Do NOT change the resolution. The UI was programmed for 1024x700, and I did not have time to implement it to be adaptable.
2. When scrolled down the network display or any other message...thing...and you, for example, get another message, such as the evolution progress at every turn's end, it'll be scrolled down to the point you were scrolled down earlier. It's best to hit the home key to reset scroll back up to the top.
3. Sometimes, when entering the ID of the computer to use for the evolution thing, it'll try to hack the computer. Didn't have enough time to finish the part of the interface that details with text input, so it calls a function it shouldn't.

entries.title: Targeted Evolution
entries.description:
Hi! This is a silly game involving combining evolution cards and giving your character special abilities. Your goal: Combine all the elemental cards together! What kind of powers could that give you? 

I hope you enjoy!

There also might be an easter egg hidden somewhere. :)

entries.title: The evolution games / unnatural selection
entries.description:
There is no evolution, only the games, Darwin was wrong and aliens were right. You're not sure why you're there but you have to fight or get extinctioned. Everybody else there as well. Which is a problem.

Survival of the fittest indeed.

WASD to move, space to jump, click to shoot, scroll to change weapons.

WARNING: Contains raptors, sharks, turtles and kittens.

I'll upload a non web version (just in case) soon.

The kongregate version has some small ai tweaks and the kongregate api, so you can compare catkill numbers, scores and all that good stuff. Additionally enemies get added as time goes on in case you run out of things to kill. It's essentially a post compo version, or a jam version whichever you prefer to call it.

entries.title: The Evolution Of The BlobFish
entries.description:
FOR THIS GAME YOU NEED NET FRAMEWORK 4 : http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851

if you have any problems running this game. try donwloading this file: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

This is a game based on the first stage in Spore.
You are a little blobfish that wants to evolve to a sharklike fish.


In order to reach that goal, You need to eat other fishies, and run away from the bad fishies. Simple enough right? :)

This was my first LD and I really enjoyed it!

entries.title: The life of Cat
entries.description:
You are Cat, just born into the world you'll need to survive.
As you go across your life stages you'll meet enemies, your mate and play a small part in the cycle of Evolution.

The game gives the experience of each stage in a cat's life so it will have different pacing according to the cat's age.

It's our first Ludum Dare so Hope you enjoy :)

entries.title: Upgrade
entries.description:
You are trapped in a cyber-labyrinth and need to get out. Collect DNA to upgrade yourself and finally be able to escape. Use WASD or the arrow keys to move. Space to jump. If you have an up to date Google Chrome browser and a compatible gamepad, you can also play the game with your gamepad.

Made with HTML5, Javascript and the Canvas element (webGL). Tested with Google Chrome and Firefox. The latest Google Chrome build also supports gamepads, at least I was able to play it with my xBox controller.

Makes use of three.js, jQuery and gamepad libraries.  

Have fun!

entries.title: Caveman Evolution Story
entries.description:
This is the story of an old caveman who wants to be younger.

Controls:

-Move with left and right.
-Jump with Z.

entries.title: Darwinphony
entries.description:
Evolution is music to Darwin's ears.

The game might be confusing at first because there's no goal. Click on the video link or copy and paste this url to see its full potential: http://youtu.be/2KoSzB4jWxQ

This is a sandbox/music game. Evolve the little critters by painting with the "reproduce" brush (or Press '3'). To make sounds out of them, drop little turtles and when they collide, they'll beep. If you don't like what some of the critters are doing, pick up the bird and eat 'em up.

entries.title: Decade Dash
Dojo
entries.description:
The ultimate kung-fu: Evolution. 

Your dojo has been invaded by creatures evolved well beyond your ability. Your students must procreate to defend the school! Push them into each other to begin making sweet love and swapping those tasty traits. If the students can evolve to match the invader's traits surely they can defeat it in battle, even if they die trying.



CONTROLS:
- CLICK and HOLD to push students away from cursor.
- Use SCROLL WHEEL to increase range and power of push.
- Press SPACE to pause and take time to plan and observe your student's traits.
-Moving over a student shows their traits in the top-left corner, match the right corner.

- CLICK doors to open and close them
- R to restart level
- Numpad +/- for volume control

PLEASE NOTE:
Just remembered that I forgot to put in lose conditions >.< if you get in a jam, glitched out, or your students were massacred, please press R.

entries.title: Dragonom
entries.description:
Team Target Practice is happy to present: Dragonom!

It's a game about nurturing a baby dragon until he reaches his fully evolved form.

Credits/breakdown:
- Code by Jade in C++
- Art by Kinoko with Photoshop + Cintiq
- Music composed by Kinoko
- Sound Effects by Jade in SFXR

The levels were also made with Jade's engine, Aki. A lot of his time was spent integrating new tile features into his already-existing tile system.

This is also Kinoko's debut as a music composer. Marvel at her underdeveloped digital piano skills!

entries.title: Eat or Die
entries.description:
Eat or Die, the evolution of a man that try to survive.

Controls:
  Left/Right - Move
  Up - Jump

Contact:
  http://www.facebook.com/YettatoreGames

entries.title: Eatme!
entries.description:
I was quite busy this weekend. I thought it would be nice to make an entry though, so I made this. I hope you like it. :)

It's more likely that you eat the ball you collide with if you are bigger than it. Good luck!

entries.title: Embryotic
entries.description: Use the mouse to drag and drop the right nutrients into the right embryos and feed them. Enjoy!!

entries.title: Evolve and Build to be Able to Code
entries.description:
Unzip and run EaBtbAtC.exe to play
The lever level is the end of the game. There was supposed to be a puzzle implemented to utilize them, but it never happened.

--------------------------

WASD to move
Enter/Return to interact

--------------------------

Basically, as you progress through the 3 "ages" of the game, the player and graphics evolve (or at least they should) until the player has the tools needed to program. If you can't figure out the gameplay, you basically just move over objects and press "enter" to interact with them.

I'll put some info here because I don't think it comes across in the game

Age 1: You have nothing; you need to create some tools
Age 2: You have tools and buildings; you need a form of writing
Age 3: You have a writing system; have fun coding!

There were a lot more ages to fill the gaps, but this is the Ludum Dare, so it didn't happen.

I am happy that I successfully(?) entered and completed my first Ludum Dare.

--------------------------

I highly recommend you do not look at the source; it is pretty ugly.

entries.title: I Am A Tree. You Are Not. Ha Ha.
entries.description:
you are a worm from the sea.
the sea is safe.
don't leave the sea.
you have no hope of becoming a tree.

three different endings. contains swearing.

arrow keys to move
alt + enter to go into windowed mode

made with rpg maker 2003

this theme left me very uninspired, i struggled to come up with anything at all. decided to jam in the hopes that something would come on the last day and i guess i finished so yeah.

entries.title: I Am Dinosaur
entries.description:
The cavemen breed like rabbits, becoming faster the more of them I eat. I roam the plains, and they fear my hunger. Through it all I know one thing... I Am Dinosaur!

Keep your belly full by eating Cavemen. If your belly becomes empty the game is over. The highest level achieved in a play session is recorded.

Controls: Arrows keys to move, Space to eat Cavemen (when you're close to them). Enter restarts the game when your belly is empty.

N.B. Some users report crashing on start. You can run the game using the 'source' download link if you have Love2D.

entries.title: mintys
entries.description:
A little game about evolution of ideas. 
Or flying & shooting. Grow your ideas and 
try keep them safe from outside distractions. 
Just don't get too attached to them.

entries.title: Mytosys
entries.description:
Control the spore by using "A" and "D".

Use the float ability; when the large ring shrinks to the size of the small ring and turns green, press "SPACE". Correct timing will make you float upwards.

Collect green spores to evolve.

Avoid red spores - cause damage.

*Did not have much time to optimize, when you collide with an object, it takes a second to delete.* 

*Float action is sort of incomplete and not refined.*

entries.title: RED PLANET
entries.description: You are a geologist on Mars in this sci-fi adventure game.

entries.title: Sprout
entries.description:
Your sprout grows toward the sun. (Your mouse controls the sun.)
Eat enough pink food and your sprout will evolve.

How high can you grow before your sprouts runs out of energy?

entries.title: Sustenance
entries.description:
Sustenance is a timed survival game where resources are limited and you may not be the only one with an appetite.

OBJECTIVE - Stay alive as long as possible.

CONTROLS  - Arrow Keys for movement and either ASD or ZXC to expel colors Red Green and Blue respectively

This was my first Ludum Dare and I am glad I was able to get something done to show. I didn't complete all that I would of liked but I learned a lot and I'm looking forward to Ludum Dare 25!!!

entries.title: The World Hates You
entries.description:
This game uses an evolutionary algorithm to generate platformer levels. The goal is to create the hardest platformer levels possible (which are still winnable). A central online server is used to breed together the most difficult levels and propagate them to other, future players.

There is no win condition. The purpose of this game is not to be won. The purpose of this game is to get progressively better at killing you.

NOTE: Because the levels of this game are born in the cloud, this game will necessarily continue to change after the 48 hour Ludum Dare period completes. I fully intend to continue tinkering with and improving the breeding pool on the server after the 48 hour period.
NOTE 2: I did not test this at ALL before submitting.

UPDATE: This game was edited after the 48-hour period to fix a game-breaking bug (a big, critical chunk of data that was being collected was not being sent to the server) and to add a missing license disclosure. Nothing else was changed. The Windows and Linux versions were added after the 48-hour deadline and also incorporate these changes. You can find the originally uploaded mac version here http://vote.grumpybumpers.com/j/ld/24/1/

entries.title: Unnatural Selection
entries.description:
A weird game about a mage and his aways-evolving-race of minions.
This jam I tried to do something different, the game got a little weird and confusing, it's more of an experiment than a game but I think it's playable.

Use WASD or the arrow keys to move around and SPACE to rally/disband your minions. They can reproduce a lot and that causes a mutation on their attributes, creating a natural selection of your minions.Some have special powers, like flying (or having loads of HP)

The game objective is to carry the purple crystals (one by one) to the altar.

Still a lot of unexpected behaviors my happen in the game, and the game is very easy. I plan to polish it a little during the week!

Hope you like it :)

entries.title: Beer-Fridgevolution
entries.description:
You start as a cooler on a sandy beach, and as you collect beers, you evolve into a mini fridge in a dormitory, and then you evolve into a standard fridge collecting beers in some domestic kitchen, and finally, you evolve into a deluxe double door fridge...ON THE MOON!

W or UP to Jump
Spacebar to Shoot

Avoid enemies while collecting beers and keg power ups.

entries.title: Conway's Game of Death
entries.description:
This game is based on John Conway's works about cells evolving on a checker, well-known as "Game of Life", which isn't really a game. I took the LD24 as an occasion to make a real puzzle game from his concept.

Further explanation here : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway's_Game_of_Life

As I said in my previous entry, I suck at programming, and had less than 24h to work on it, hence the fact that I only made six levels and no music... doesn't matter, have fun ! ~

[Edit : added a dropbox link, so you can play on your web browser]

entries.title: Cellulae
entries.description:
Hi all! This is my first ludum dare!

I finally did a really simple game based on absorbing the cells that are on screen, but you will only be able to do it with the ones that are smaller than you!

The gameplay is very similar to OSMOS, it wasn't my idea at first, but then the game "evolves" to that ;)

Hope you enjoy it!

Some technical stuff:

I did the game using XNA.

For the graphics I used photoshop, the background music was composed by me using the site: http://www.beatlab.com/

entries.title: Dragoncore Overdrive
entries.description:
It's like Dragondot, with evolving foes, random mutations as powerups, and other new stuff! When you kill an enemy, the surviving enemy that has dealt the most damage to you creates a child with a random mutation applied (and with the dice skewed so it will on average be slightly stronger than its parent). Thus, the enemies will evolve over time to fight you better. At least in theory.

TIPS:

* Use the Dash to escape from tight situations: it makes you temporarily invincible, so you can slip right past attacks.

* Kill foes in Overdrive mode to gain access to new mutations. Some of them might not be good, so you may not want to take all of them!

* Hold the Attack key to charge a pounce, then hit Dash to strike for double damage! To use the lock-on pounce, charge a pounce and then hit Dash while not holding a direction.

entries.title: Eat, Spawn, and Die - Organism Generator
entries.description:
There was originally going to be eating and death involved, but instead I wound up just writing a genome simulator and building a (rather bare) world to walk, swim, and fall around in.

(Tarball that actually includes DejaVuSans and worldmap.py now up on the website.)

entries.title: Experiment X
entries.description:
In this game you have to escape from a secret laboratory. You are a failed experiment which started to run amok. Collect every upgrade you can find to evolve into a powerful being. Further and more detailed instructions are in the 'Readme.txt'.

Programming Language: C# (XNA 4.0)
Sounds: sfxr
Graphics: Paint.NET

This is the first time ever I created a game in under 48 hours so don't expect anything special. :)

EDIT: The main goal in this game is to escape at any cost. You don't have to kill every single scientist to win.
Important: You start out with no weapons/abilities! Just avoid every scientist who trys to kill you or try to find a different way to kill them.

entries.title: GeneRogue
entries.description:
Explore the caverns to find genes that will benefit your offspring. Death is inevitable, but life goes on.
Find a nesting ground and lay an egg before you die, or the genes you found will be lost.
Live gets harder the further you travel inland.
(mouse to move and fight)

Chrome recommended for WebPlayer.

made with Loeve!
linux and mac need to install https://love2d.org/ 

checkout the enhanced jam version (72h) : 
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/08/27/enhanced-jam-version/

entries.title: Gregor the Grogre
entries.description:
I started with the intention of entering the compo, but I didn't finish in time. There are still some bugs, and I didn't get to implement a lot of things I had planned. On the other hand, my dev art is probably the most amazing thing in the universe.  So there's that.

Issues: 
- You can't die, so don't worry about that (bonus feature! ship it!)
- You can, however, reach the end of the (small) universe and get stuck.  Avoid this by advancing slanty-wise instead of straight forward, or occasionally running away.
- Once you evolve to the Adult size and evolve traits 3 times, you can't apply more (but you'll still see the evolve screen a couple more times)
- One of the later monsters will pretty much always kill you.  Good thing you can't die!
- Sounds never did make it in. :(
- and many more

Tools: Unity, Orthello 2D, Photoshop CS5, Wacom tablet.  Of the 4, I had never used any but photoshop.  I learned a lot this weekend.

entries.title: Kudzundheit
entries.description:
** NOW FINISHED!  JAM VERSION IS DONE, WOOOOOO! **

The basic idea is that you are a jetpack wearing redneck with a shotgun, whose trailer home is being invaded by space alien kudzu.  The kind that rapidly evolves to resist your weed killers.  Yeah, that kind.

Controls:

A/D to move left/right
W to thrust upwards with jetpack
S to shop (only if in front of trailer)
F to activate fumigator bomb (limited supply)
1/2/3 to swap between weedkiller types (buy more in shop!)
R to restart a level quickly

Destroy the beating kudzu hearts in order to progress to the next level.  You'll need the right kind of weed killer to kill the vines that the hearts generate.  Green works on green vines, blue on blue vines, and so on.  You can use the wrong sort of weed killer, but it takes 3 hits instead of one to kill a vine segment.

entries.title: minogear
entries.description:
This is a simple, simple puzzle game, where you get color points that help you evolve and upgrade your minotaur. You are helping him because you think he's really cool. Upgrade various stats and try to beat the levels by selectively grabbing only the points you need, to upgrade the gear you need, and not upgrade the things that might hinder you.

Edit:
 - re-zipped, should work on OSX now
 - the source now contains all there's needed to build run the game (except the JDK of course :P); 
 - to run, import both projects into the workspace; NOTE: the entry point is actually in the main game project, not in the desktop one; the desktop one just holds some dependencies, sorry for the mess :P; The entry point should be: com.siegedog.minogear.apps: EntryPointWindows.main; and it should work on linux/OSX/whatever despite the name! :P (needs either jdk 1.7 or 1.6 but some refactoring!)
 - **notice**: requires JRE 1.6+; get it here from the official Java website: http://www.java.com/en/download/index.jsp

Coded in Java, based on libgdx (nightlies 26.08).
I used Eclipse as an IDE, Photoshop for the art.
I have a tablet. No, it's not a Wacom - shut up, you there, in the back!
Unlike other projects and LDs, I hardly did any sketching on paper.

The following will maybe go (albeit in a more detailed fashion) in a postmortem, but here goes.

Hello, so this is my (mostly unfinished) LD48 #24 entry. It's not even remotely done (sooo, many ideas left out due to lack of time) but I'm still happy. I'd like to say that I'm going to work on it some more (I really do, I had a blast so far), but I have no idea if time is going to be on my side. But we'll see.

It still went *much* better than the previous ludum dares:
- ld23: worked a lot on a buggy prototype that wasn't even remotely fun to play and gave up
- ld22: tried a collaboration with a friend but we ended up spending most of our time fighting git and generally sucking at everything
- ld21: skipped due to barbecue invitation with friends; t'was fun, though!
- ld20: my first one - competed with game maker; I feel like I evolved a lot since then! A LOT! Although I still think this ld entry was the most complete one I ever made (well, its only competitor is this one, but still)!

Well, happy hunting, people!
Have fun making and playing games!

entries.title: Pirates and Gorillas
entries.description:
Basic Controls:

- Pirate (player) moves towards mouse
- Click mouse to "Evolve" the entities inside any loops in the blue string
- Hold space to use a shield to be temporarily invisible (Edit: * invincible, not invisible)

Pro tips:

- Don't let big mobs of gorillas build up
- Use your shield to run through large mobs
- When shielding, watch your energy (green bar)


So yea. Here is my entry for Ludum Dare 24. This was my first time participating in a Ludum Dare. It was fun. Looking forward to the next one.

I would really appreciate any sort of feedback in comments!
And for more incentive to comment: I will make sure to play the game of everyone who comments and make sure to give you my feedback about your game!

This was fun. Long live the Dare.

Brucef

entries.title: Project Maple
entries.description:
Deep in the vast wasteland of the northern Canadian wilderness, a secret government project to weaponize maple syrup has gone horribly, horribly wrong.

Made at OrcaJam 2012, for Ludum Dare 24.

WASD to move, move the mouse to look, and left mouse button to attack.
Breed with Maple Syrup vats to produce offspring with a random combination of stats from the parents.
Tips: the melee attack has a bit of range on it, and the ranged enemies turn slowly. Use this information wisely.

Made in collaboration with Jonathon Cobb.

entries.title: raptor disaster
entries.description:
play as a velociraptor and defend your fellow dinosaurs against hordes of evolution ray toting aliens as you try to stay alive and keep things jurassic in this 2D survival action game!

do your best to disappoint the alien leader who believes he will be inheriting a fully evolved, modern world. show him that this is dinosaur territory and it's going to stay that way.

GAME INFO
the main controls are explained in the game. if you have a gamepad, you should use it; it feels more natural. you can press enter / start to skip the intro scene. note that when you power up you can do a double jump (it also makes you run faster, do double damage, regenerate attacks faster, and survive one hit).

PROJECT INFO
completed in 72 hours with our three man team:

Max Crane (mes) - code, design, art (lua / love, photoshop)

Ben Foden (benfoden) - art, design (wacom tablet, photoshop)

Scott Ashford - code (lua / love)

sadly we didn't have time for audio. i made a fair amount of progress on a song for it, so i will probably release a postjam version to remedy this.

the code ended up very hacky, so i don't recommend looking at it. but if you insist, download the .love file, rename it to .zip, and the source will be within.

we would love to hear your comments and any feedback. hope you enjoy.

BEN SAYS
This project was a blast to work on, and I highly recommend doing the jam to anybody who has some friends they can convince to do it with them.
P.S. Check out video of the art creation process here: http://twitch.tv/benfoden

ENHANCED VERSION
coming soon: the enhanced version will have music and sfx, many gameplay tweaks, an easier difficulty setting, improved graphics, and some bug fixes.

entries.title: SHOE
entries.description:
A Shoe-ter.

It's dark, it's got pretty lights, and the evolution part of the game proved harder to implement than I thought!

Still, oddly enough, it does fit with the theme. While it may not be apparent during the gameplay, the AI of the enemies evolves, and so do their abilities. 

Same for yourself. Shots get faster/do more damage/shoot longer, and lights get brighter over time.

entries.title: Super Ultra Mega Brain Adventure Saga of Ultimate Destruction
entries.description:
Help humanity re-evolve their brains by leading them through simple puzzles.

Weekend was mostly about learning how to use Unity.  Team of two, neither of whom are artists.

entries.title: Tech Up
entries.description:
A game where you control the abilities and stats for an RPG character (and nothing more) and you must race against the clock to defeat all the enemies.

Edit: Fixed Resizing Mouse Problem

entries.title: Terra Tam: The World Warrior
entries.description: This is Terra Tam, a "fighting" "game" in which you are badly, hilariously outmatched. Tam, an ordinary human being, has been unwittingly chosen to compete in a space martial arts tournament by the fearsome ruler of our galaxy. The fate of humankind, and to a much greater extent Tam, is in the balance. Since humans, unlike most space-faring races, do not actually possess any innate combat abilities, can she survive even thirty seconds against these powerful beings?

entries.title: The Liver Trial
entries.description:
Note:
The Windows version doesn't work.  Use Windows (Working).  I kept both because of LD rules; the first didn't have SDL.dll in it so it wouldn't run.

Note 2:
Edited the Windows version again, replacing the Debug version of SDL_gfx.dll with the Release version so that it's playable without MSVC++ installed.

"One day, God was very bored.
So He created many creatures.
But Thou creatures were not adapted to their environment.
THEY suffered.

So He devised a test.
The subjects would enter the liver of a turtle,
and Upon death, They would become stronger...."

Okay I didn't finish at all, there's maybe two levels that demonstrate the concept but other than that there's nothing.

Consider the game done when it restarts you back to the first level.

WAD to move.

THE CONCEPT:

It's hard to see it in the actual game but essentially when you die you gain an upgrade that'll help you in your next life.  When you land on spikes, you get iron boots that slow down your movement but also make it possible to walk across spikes and break certain landbridges.

entries.title: Where am I?
entries.description:
You have no idea where you are or how you got here.  You just know you have to get out... and you definitely have the feeling that something else is lurking around...

Made using Unity.  The evolution theme here is in the slowly evolving visuals as you progress further along the hallways of the complex.

entries.title: Air Fighter
entries.description:
In this game, you are in control of an experimental aircraft, able to absorb technology and reapply its component directly in the field. In time, your craft will be able to evolve its weapon systems to better combat the assailants.

Control with the arrow keys, shoot with 'Z'. If you damage an enemy aircraft enough, it will catch fire and becomes vulnerable for absorption. Move your aircraft closer to steal its remaining shield energy and any tech it contains. When you have collected enough, your weapon systems will evolve. In its final stage, the projectiles will have a small area of effect upon detonation.

Be careful when approaching burning enemy crafts, though. They might be damaged, but are still able to attack. Note that the kamikaze fighters are too fast to be hit. You will have to dodge them until they run out of fuel.

entries.title: Attack of the killer cute things!
entries.description:
Fight your way through waves of cute little monsters, each with randomly mutated traits. 

The most successful monster in each wave has its traits passed down to the next generation.

My best score so far is 275 creatures killed (A lucky combination of weak monsters and good powerups mostly). Would love to know if anyone beats it though.

I think I'll do a post-compo version with more monster stats and traits. There currently isn't enough variety to where the how the monsters can evolve. Any suggestions for new traits to add would also be great!

entries.title: Deerfeast Tribe
entries.description:
Story so far:
"It is time for the summer feast! Sadly village reserves are too low to feed all the visitors, you and your kinsmen pickup the automatic rifles and head to the deer pens"

Controls:
Left and Right arrow keys fire the guns.
Alternate between firing keys or you'll get penalized.

Above all: 
Have fun!

p.s. The deers come in 8-9 forms and the last ones will eat your soul.

Me: Detocroix
Twitter: Detocroix
Website: www.detocroix.com

Engine: Unity

entries.title: DNA_Evolution
entries.description:
Well, not very impressive but the important thing is to participate ;)

Used all tools as originally stated, only exception was to use Garageband instead of Milkytrakcer, did not use Tiled either.

Tools:
- Programming: Haxe, HaxeNME and HaxePunk in FlashDevelop
- Audio: bfxr, Garageband, Audacity
- Gfx: Paint.NET

Instructions:
- Drag and drop to build DNA bases
- Rotate with space while dragging to flip base
- Avoid incomplete bases
- Pick up power ups
- It practically goes on forever, but I guess it becomes impossible quite shortly :P

entries.title: Eludare Virus
Evo
entries.description: A simplistic yet challenging puzzle game where you surround the evolving robot with blocks.  I purposely left text out of the game to keep it minimalist. Enjoy!

entries.title: EVOLVES!
entries.description:
EVOLVES! is all about evolving the fastest.

Destroy your enemies to evolve. Become the first to reach the ultimate evolution to win.

WASD to move. Arrow keys to shoot.

The game is loosely based on an old StarCraft custom map called Evolves. I dumbed down the gameplay a lot and made it very fast-paced and action-packed.

First time using FlashPunk. Didn't have the whole 48 hours to work, but picked a short, simple game to complete with what little time I did have.

If I had more time, I would've added music, better notifications for what's going on during the game, and integrated the background into the action somehow.

entries.title: Firefly
entries.description:
Firefly

It's a game about the core concept of evolution - selection. Your goal is to cultivate plants that survive longer than 5 minutes in a hazardous environment. Plants get pollinated by fireflys. Plants have a genetically coded resistance agains the environmental effects that surround them (heat, cold, rain). Try to kill all those fireflies that bring pollen that you don't want to have in your plants genetic code. Recombine those resistances that you want selectively to survive the dynamicly changing weather.


TUTORIAL: There is an ingame tutorial that I added in the last second. It is not very intuitively written (although it does explain everything needed to play the game). I wrote an offline-tutorial that should explain much better. Of course you can also just start the game, but don't complain about not understanding what is going on afterwards please :) 
So here is the tutorial: http://timtips.com/ld24/tutorial/

-------------------------------------------------------

Added android version. You can get it from google play by using the above link, using a QR-Scanner to scan the 2d bar code that is one of the screenshots attached further down this page (leads to google play too) or download the apk directly here: http://www.timtips.com/downloads/Firefly.apk. Not tested on smaller displays (eg. 480x320). Larger displays (up to 10" tablet size) should work.

The only control change is that you can swap between plant spots with a fling/pan gesture and instead of right clicking things, you can make a long press (keeping your finger on the same position for about a second).

28.08.2012 Few people are still experiencing problems to start the game. Some thoughts: 

* Please let the game load, I didn't have the time to add a loading screen. It may take a couple of seconds until the black screen dissapears and the game starts. 

* If the applet version doesn't work for you, try the jar please. On windows double-click on it should be enough to start it. On linux just start it from console with java -jar filename.jar

* If none of it is working, please consider sending me a stack trace to [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ or to leave a more detailed description in your comment. I would really like to make this game playable for everyone. Thanks :)

* One user (Thurig) told me that only after disabling jar/zip-scanning in his antivirus software he was able to play the game. Be assured, its not because there is a virus in it :) So if you like, you may try that too.

27.08.2012 EDIT: Fixed a bug that causes the game to crash on many windows PCs. Thanks for letting me know about the issue.

The initial release and sources are still available timtips.com/Firefly.jar timtips.com/Firefly-src.zip 

The download links lead to fixed version+sources (No changes to game logic, just crash on startup-fixes)
-------------------------------------------------------


All graphics created with Inkscape.
Music recorded from my KORG-SP250
Effects by sfxr, ZynAddSubFX and Audacity
Jura-Font by http://www.tenbytwenty.com/jura.php
Engine: Libgdx
Libs: The super awesome Artemis Entity System Framework http://gamadu.com/artemis/

entries.title: Genius Evolve
entries.description:
Finally the Final Version in ON!

In this game, you must chase creatures(Arrow keys to move) and eat then(pressing A button) to evolve. In first stage you can only eat one creature(any creature). On next stage, you have to eat two creatures, but maintaining the sequence, the same creatures that you eat in past stage plus one creatrure of your choice. Stage by Stage, you have to eat one more creature. If you eat a wrong creature, you go  back one stage, and must do the same sequence. If you lose in the first stage, its Game Over. 11 stages is waiting for you evolve with then! 

...And watch out the RED BIG GUYS!

For the best experience, use headphones.

entries.title: Human Evolution
entries.description: Run through the historical periods in order to survive! Avoid the obstacles by jumping!

entries.title: Mass
entries.description:
A puzzle game about the mass. Just an idea and some maps to try.
Built with Flash 10.0.
Controls:
mouse and LMB

entries.title: Morph, Virus, Morph!
entries.description: I am a little bit tired.

entries.title: Natural Selection
entries.description:
(Source included with download)
(Now ported)

In 'Natural Selection' you, a giant amoeba with a gun, must fight throughout the history of evolution in order to win natural selection!

While the graphics remain primative throughout, the music (which I'm rather proud with) develops and becomes faster, evolving as you go through the levels.

I kept a small journal here: www.nickolai51-dev.blogspot.co.uk

entries.title: Neanderthalis
entries.description: My first Ludum Dare entry! I worked on this game solo in 24 hours, doing absolutely no work on Saturday due to other conflicts. It's not quite polished, but I'm proud of it for a first effort! The game is written in Java, and the needed libraries for OSX and Linux are included, although I have not tested them. Source code is in the .zip in the \src\ directory, or at 16skittles.tk/evolution.java.

entries.title: Primordial Punchout
entries.description:
Oh no! You're a slime in a testing lab!
You've heard them mention that they want the best of the best from the slimes, and the final one will be allowed to live.

Collect all of the powerups to be the very best!

Move with the Arrow keys, and use Z(or Y), X, and C to use the various attacks!

Powerups:
Legs - You need these to jump, and move faster
Vision I - Extends your sight!
Arms - Gain the punch(X) ability!
Hearing - Absolutely useless!
Hands - Grab ledges and pull yourself up!
Vision II - Enhanced vision!
Whip - Richter style! Breaks glass, too! (Z or Y)
Wings - Double Jump with flair!
Power Charge - Charge your punch to smash through bricks!
Beam Generator - Gain eye beams to melt anything!

entries.title: Selection
entries.description:
Warning: there are known bugs on Mac OS/X. Please make sure you have java 1.5+ (Java 7 is preferred). I currently have no way to fix these bugs because I don't own a mac, but more detailed error reports would be nice (try opening a java console).

Changes since the end of LD24: 
-Made Small tweaks to certain components to improve timing
-Changed the window closing method due to difficulties on some systems
-Removed unnecessary console printing commands, graphics contexts, and buffers 

PLEASE READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS. THEY ARE MUCH CLEARER THAN
THE IN-GAME ONES. The in-game instructions are not very clear due to size restrictions.

This is a game where you try to overcome the enemy by placing cells and capturing points on 

a grid to make your species the majority in the gene pool. If a cell has 1-2 neighbors, it 

survives, but any more or any less, it dies. When a cell is placed on the grid that 

square is captured for the species that the cell belongs to until the other species 

captures that square. When the time ends, the species (team) has the most tiles captured 

wins! (Warning: the AI can play this game really well!). Press escape or minimize to 
pause.

entries.title: Singularity
entries.description:
Singularity is a hardcore platformer featuring procedural level generation and multiple mechanics that keep evolving as you beat the levels - challenges are procedurally made on the fly just for you! Success means progress, but are you able to keep up with the evolution? :)


INSTRUCTIONS

-Use the arrows to move and X to jump. The other commands are presented as you have access to them. Just try to get to the end of the levels, and you'll make progress in uncovering the evolution monolith!

-All the levels are proceduraly generated on the fly, so you never play the same level twice

-The objective is to go as far as you can, and let us know where you stopped! :D


This is our 2nd time in Ludum Dare. We challenged ourselves pretty hard on the tech side this time (much more than we planned).

Hope you enjoy!

Pixel Cows is a totally-not-famous indie dev team made of two guys from Brazil. I usually handle design and production, and Joao Pedro (NecroToad) makes the tech magic. Singularity's protagonist and overall design is vaguely based on "The Journey of Eko", our main project (see more at www.pixelcows.com). 

Special thanks to Dan Filimon for last minute graphics, Kevin MacLeod at incompetech.com for the great free music, and to our supportive family and friends - you guys are just GREAT! :)


PS: I fixed a game breaking bug that led to game crash, freeze or severe level unbalancing. There are no new features whatsoever, but there IS a new 'difficulty' counter at the upper, righthand part of the screen. It serves no purpose in game, but help you, fellow Ludum Dare judge, to let me know how far you got!

entries.title: Slime World
entries.description:
[Behaviors of slime]
Slimes walk randomly on the map, but if there are food around, it will choose to eat the food(Very smart!).

[Divide for new slimes]
Adult and old slime will divide itself for new slimes if it has eaten enough food.

[Age of Slime]
Baby: Pink(Unable to divide)
Adult: Blue(Able to divide)
Old: White(Able to divde)

[3 types of Evolution]
Wing: Fly on to every kind of tiles(tree, water, deadly lava!)
Tail: Swim fast on water tile, slow on plain tile.
Horns: Eat other slimes if they are hungry. It also needs more food to grow up.

[Evolution! How to?]
Each time slimes divide itself, each type of evolution has 10% chance to appear on the child.
Every time slime eat a special food(blue, green, red), it gains additional 30% chance for the corresponding evolution type.

[Player Control]
As the god of slimes, you can click on the tile to place food, change tile type or summon lightning to destroy everything!

--------------------------------------

The game includes 4 levels with different types of challenge and rising difficulty. Hope you enjoy it!

If you like this game and want more levels and features, you can play the post-compo version on Kongregate:
http://www.kongregate.com/games/spotlightor/slimes-world

entries.title: SUPER Levolution
entries.description:
=================================
Current Server IP: OFFLINE.
Host a game yourself using the server.
=================================

An arcade highscore MMO made for the Ludum Dare #24 Jam.

Please checkout http://jigxor.com/ld24/ for the latest server IP and version of the game.
