entries.title: Swarm
entries.description:
-Swarm-
Trapped in a field, our hero attempts to fight of swarms of creatures that seem to evolve after every wave. How far can he get?

*XP Users and other's who have the game crash upon starting: I've Forced software processing and changed the texture pages if that doesn't work then I really don't know what will (Use Alternate Version)* 
*After 48H Bugfixs: Added an auto evolve key that was originally accidentally commented out, "U" press to autoevolve and start next round. Reduced time between spawns,tweaked movement algorithm, decreased laser lock-down time*
*To play original download this http://www.mediafire.com/?i0c62eug09qjy3t*

Controls:
- In Game-
WASD: Movement
Mouse: Aim
Left Click: LASERS!!!!
Right Click: Bullets
- Selection -
W and S: scroll through Evolution options
A and D: Modify said options
Space: Accept

Each round forces you to select the next form of evolution's for the swarm. Every 20 waves up to wave 100 a new spawn page is unlocked and must be enabled to continue.

Dodge through the enemies bullets (blue) and lasers (red) while returning your own bullets (white) and lasers (red). Lasers have a slight charge time in which they are lighter then it's damaging stage. For the player it also freezes your character for 1/2 a second.

How high of a score can you get?

Highscores: http://gamejolt.com/freeware/games/arcade/swarm-ld24/9347/#high-scores

*the spawn type "Just Don't" is extremely powerful but provides x2 multiplier per spawn page it is on*

entries.title: The Distressing Evolution Adventure of Dr. Cain
entries.description:
-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-
The Distressing Evolution Adventure of Dr. Cain
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
Controls:
-=-=-=-=-
D: Move right
A: Move left
W: Enter door
Space: Jump 

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
You play as Dr Cain, a curator of a Natural History Museum, and you just got in a new virtual audio tour system! Before you open in the morning, you decided to test it out... 
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
Added windows & mac builds!

entries.title: The Lost Laboratory
entries.description:
You are one of the last survivors in a post-apocalyptic
world. Fighting for survival day by day you find a secret
laboratoy. Selfish as you are you try to use the lab to
enhance yourself with godlike abilities, by analysing the
DNA of the mutated creatures that inhabit this unreal
world. In your quest to evolve past the human limits you
will face many obstacles, radiation is just one of them.

Team codeprolls:
KayelGee(coding/artwork), seniorheuser(sound/music)

entries.title: Walkabot
entries.description:
Walkabot!

Made in about 10 hours, had some other things to do this weekend.

The full design is meant to award the player points at the end of each level, then the player chooses which upgrades to get. The levels were then unlocked in a varying order depending on the available upgrades - as you unlocked abilities the game unfolds in different ways. Sort of had an evolutionary feel to it, in a not-so-strict sense.

Ultimately didn't have time to implement that, so I auto-unlock abilities as you progress. There's I think 5 proper levels, and 1 little end level for you to mess around in. No audio.

Anyhow, enjoy! <3

-Nick, krangGAMES

entries.title: 3 Apples High
entries.description:
Here's my entry for my first LD. Really happy with the final result.

Hope you enjoy !

(Unfortunately, I lost my music records. So no music, just some tiny sounds)

entries.title: A Game of Towns
entries.description:
HTML5 game based on Conway's Game of Life.

No gameplay as such, but the simulator works fairly well.

Villagers can be spawned. They gather food and spawn siblings when they've eaten enough.

There's also a fire, as it was a fun way to stop the bushes from taking over.

Minimal art, no music or sound.

Initial idea was to have the huts evolve into towns and then cities and up the scope of the game, but that never happened.

If the page freezes on 100%, just refresh.

Tested on Firefox and Chrome. Other browsers will most likely work.

entries.title: Bacon Lettuce & Tomato Evolution for the SNES
entries.description:
There isn't much game play to speak of. Both A and B buttons will fire. Every other shot is a slow one.

The bacon evolves after a certain number of bugs are shot (25 right now). The Sizzle Meter, in the lower right, indicates the progress towards evolution.

Everything, except the title screen was created this weekend.

The game was only tested under SNES9x, but it should work fine on any emulator. I don't know if it will work on a real SNES; I did not have a chance to test it.

entries.title: Bittp 2 8-BIT Retro Game
entries.description: Sorry for the late download link. Windows .exe will be the only platform. The screenshot shown below was the final version tho I lost with source code. Download link will have a version without blur and unfinished objects (correct level design).

entries.title: Cocci
entries.description:
Description:
As my first ever submission to Ludum Dare, here is Cocci. In this game you guide a colony of bacteria (initially red [and created as a Brownian tree]) down a tunnel, trying to minimize collisions with the walls (blue) and obstacles (yellow). As you progress, you will unavoidably run into something. When a collision happens, the section of your colony that collided dies, while surviving bacterium mutate and replicate, creating new members. As you continue, the shape of your colony evolves, sometimes helping you avoid obstacles (an advantageous mutation), sometimes making them unavoidable (deleterious mutation).

The title of the window tells you how many collisions you've had. The right most number in for the current session. The previous numbers are for previous sessions. A "*" denotes that the session wasn't finished.

Controls:
Arrow keys move
Space starts and resets
Escape exits

Resources:
I used Java, LWJGL, Slick-Util, Eclipse, and Audacity for this project.
I started with this base code: http://lwjgl.org/wiki/index.php?title=LWJGL_Basics_3_(The_Quad)
I used some code from here for sound:
http://lwjgl.org/wiki/index.php?title=Slick-Util_Library_-_Part_2_-_Loading_Sounds_for_LWJGL
I also reused an old drawCube() method I had written a while ago.
If any of this isn't kosher please let me know.

Instructions:
Download/unzip/run Cocci.jar in the folder it's in

Notes:
I ran the gamut of emotions while making this, from caffeine induced glee to frustration and anxiety that the whole thing would end up terrible. Overall, although it's a bit janky, I'm really happy with how it ended up. Also, save yourself the headache and me the embarrassment and don't look at the source code, it's a tangled horrible mess. Thanks a lot for hosting Ludum Dare!

entries.title: Collect
entries.description:
Collect a game about collecting + signs and evolving to pass all the test.

Just use the mouse to jump towards the + signs.

entries.title: Evolver Worm
entries.description:
This weekend has been a whole lot of fun!
Hope it has been the same for you.

The game is about a little worm on a quest to find his mate.
Along the way he finds crystals that evolve his abilities.

I realized that this would probably be an idea that had 
already been done - but I wanted to pick something simple
that I could finish in the 48 hours.

Looking forward to next time already!

Thanks for looking

entries.title: Game-Age
entries.description:
My entry is a visual evolution of gaming. So please play beyond what you initially see, it does get better and looks can be deceiving! Besides my programmer art being horrible, I was trying to capture the feel of late 70s, early 80s arcade games.

I decided in my entry to show the actual evolution of video games themselves, and this is what I ended up with.

My game was written with Construct 2. I loved working with it, it was my first time and I think its a great tool.

My source is on github, I included the link.

All comments are welcome!

NOTE: This is a WEBGL/HTML5 game. It is best played in the newest chrome and barring that the newest Firefox. Some of the effects will not show up in IE and it may run slowly if your browser hasn't been restarted in a while.

NOTE 2: The controls for the final round are: Arrow keys move you around, you auto aim towards the mouse cursor, HOLD the left mouse button to fire. Right mouse button will fire the breakout ball but you can only have one in play at a time. Running into it will pick it up again and you can then reshoot it.

entries.title: Hero's Evolution
entries.description:
My most complete ludum dare entry yet! 
If you are wondering about how it fits into the theme, I thought the evolution of character would work, as I didn't feel like making a more literal themed game.
Press "M" to mute the game if you so desire.

WARNING! There are spoilers in the comment section.

Created with FlashDevelop, Flashpunk, Gimp, Audacity, BFXR, Autotracker-Bu, and Ogmo Editor.

entries.title: Legacy Bird
entries.description:
Legacy Bird
-A ginormo sword clone, dating sim, rougue-like.

6 different enemies to cut
5 different girls to smooch
12 different weapons to cut with

absolutely everything becomes available after floor 10

Happy Smooching!

entries.title: Life is Pietzsche
entries.description:
A commentary on some of the faulty assumptions that are made in evolutionary theory, Life is Pietzsche uses Nietzsche's criticisms of Darwinism as core concepts.

Witness the inevitable demise of the strongest.

There's an important lesson at the end.

Best experienced in Google Chrome

My first Ludum Dare entry, made with Construct 2

entries.title: Missing Links
entries.description: Flash game playable in browsers with Flash 11 plug-in. Game revolves around finding missing links to prove that evolution is real. In addition to exploring caves, you must deal with poisonous spiders. Being a modern-day explorer stereotype, you have a whip to protect yourself from these nasty creatures (and medical coverage if you miss).

entries.title: New Unity Project
entries.description:
Here is our game, "New Unity Project". Our goal was to create a game which evolves as it is coded by the developpers. It was our first particpation in team at the Ludum Dare. Tha game is not as polished as we would have wanted, but it's playable. We have a strange bug wich appears at the very end of the development, it should be corrected tomorrow.
We used Unity to develop the game. It was a very good experience, and of course we will do it again, and we will go further!
I hope you will like the game, even if we didn't make all the things we wanted to. 

We just corrected the bug at the end of the game, you can finish it!

Thanks for your attention.

See you soon, for next Ludum Dare!

entries.title: No Tap Enis
entries.description:
Click on any of the links to play it in your browser. Built on Html5 Canvas. Works best in Chrome.

Play as a stick and try to hit circles. More specifically, run through them. See what happens when you do.

Objective: Get a huge, fat stick.

Controls:
W = Forwards
A = Rotate Left
S = Backwards
D = Rotate Right

entries.title: Nucleus
entries.description:
Nucleus -- A game of evolution.
You begin as a simple amoeba, fighting others in order to survive. You can then develop new body parts to help overcome your foes, fighting through wave after wave of enemies.

Made with GameMaker, must be downloaded.
The number of waves is infinite, using a series of algorithms, waves become harder and harder generated solely by code after wave 50.

Unfortunately no Music, I was short of time, but I did get some SFX in!

There was to be a snake boss on wave 50, but again, I ran out of time...

entries.title: Pinball Color
entries.description:
With only a weekend to make a game, for me JavaScript and HTML5 posed the easiest route. So now you get Pinball Color (I'd write "Colour" but I'm trying not to throw off you Americans)!

OBJECTIVE:  Like Pinball, except with more pinballs and more colors. Free the frozen pinballs by evolving their surrounding blobs. When a pinball collides with a blob, the blob will take on some of the color of the pinball; the closer its color to the frozen pinball it encircles, the smaller it gets. Free as many as you can before your health out! Freeing gives a health boost.

CONTROLS: A or Left Arrow and D or Right Arrow.

LIBRARIES: Uses jQuery, a little and a lot of Box2DWeb.

ISSUES: Doesn't work in IE.

I even made some audio, though it's essentially a bad idea to play too much audio simultaneously with HTML5 so I've had to keep it minimal.

I took to the idea of portraying evolution's process though gradual change with the mixing of colour, and though not a deep undertaking on the theme I am quite happy with the result. :)

Here's a little snapshot of the game on YouTube: http://youtu.be/CoRVkgVaybc

entries.title: Prometheus
entries.description:
Description
^^^^^^^^^^^

This stated life as an RTS game with metamorphic units, but due to some setbacks I didn't have time to finish it :( So there was a change of plan, and my game evolved into this!
 
You play the role of a shape shifter, who can mutate into different characters. The six characters each have their own unique strengths and weaknesses:

- Some move swiftly.
- some attack at range.
- Some have armor to absorb damage.
- Some have special abilities.

This uses the theme Evolution through the fact that you must adapt to your present situation, by shape shifting into the most useful form. 

However, you only have finite energy, both for shape shifting and for special abilities, so use it wisely. You can collect energy crystals to replenish your reserves.

The objective of the game is to survive as long as possible.

Information
^^^^^^^^^^^

- The game is controlled with the mouse only. LEFT click to walk. RIGHT click to attack. If you right click a point beyond your attack range, then you make a "push" towards it, a combination of attacking and stepping forward.

- The close button on the window will safely terminate the application.

- This application uses FMOD Sound System, copyright Â© Firelight Technologies Pty, Ltd., 1994-2011.



Have fun, and remember to post your high score below :D

entries.title: Psychiatric Evaluation
entries.description:
This game is our vision of the evolution theme. An adventure of a lonely psychiatric patient who wants to escape the asylum  where he is trapped.

-- UPDATE --
Critical bug fixed when entering password
Walktrough Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6qk5gYxYjrk

entries.title: RedArmy
entries.description:
I created the whole game with Blender 2.63 and the music with Magix Music maker.
This game have no source code! I used the logic bricks only. If you want to see them you have to open the .blend files and change
to the game logic mode. You open the files with Blender.

The theme:
The theme was evolution. There are 2 aspects: firts I became better myself because it was my first LD and the first game I created.
So I evolved myself. The other aspect is that, while I increased my skills, I also increased the AI. The enemies start as some spikes
an they evolve to spheres which use a navmesh and jump only when the player is above them.


So, have fun!


.blend file is for Mac and Linux users included

entries.title: RGB Evolution
Species Hunt
entries.description:
Species Hunt! A game where you have to shoot birds! With a camera!

Enjoy a peaceful stroll on the beach while snapping some exotic (Ha! I mean common) birds. Try to take the best photo ever! Or fill up your collection of new species you have personally discovered, then name them after yourself! Or just enjoy the view and watch the birds muck about.

Requires XNA 4.0. Should work on most machines, but if it doesn't, let me know and I'll try to fix it ASAP!

Controls are editable in-game. But a quick rundown:
Move with WASD/arrows
Equip camera with RMB
Take picture with LMB
Show/hide photo album with tab
Run with shift
Zoom camera with Q/E or mousewheel

Photographs taken in-game can be saved for use outside the game. Simply click on the photo in the album, then save to disk. You can also enable autosaving every new photo taken automatically in the options menu.

Please note: Key configs are persistent, but all other options are not.

----------------------------------

Update 27/08

I've added a post-compo version with a widescreen resolution of 1280x720, which makes photographs of 1920x1080. So if you want to make prettier photographs, now you can. The system requirements went up though as you need a slightly more modern video card now. And the camera lens rectangle is slightly smaller than the photos. But other than that, everything should still work fine. 

Also, don't rate this version! Rate the original.

entries.title: SURV: Evolve to Survive!
entries.description:
My first try in the LD Compo. A top-down abstract pixel shoot 'em up with an upgrading system.
Engine made with Game Maker 8.0, music and sfxs made with FamiTracker and sfxr.
******************************
Controls:
wasd - moving around the screen,
mouse - shooting.
******************************
Enjoy!

entries.title: Survivor
entries.description: I made the simplest game I could think I could think of.

entries.title: The Darwinci Code - Adaption FTW!
entries.description:
Hey guys! We would like to present you our second game created for Ludum Dare Jam. Powered by Crafty, it is smooth to play and easy to enjoy ;-) Darwin is watching you.

Instructions:
To win you have to hide your white player. To do so, move it to a place in between four tiles that matches with the pattern your player consists of. If this place is not arranged yet, you can pass items to slide the traces and modify patterns. When an enemy has found its place time runs out faster. Before the round ends, make sure your pattern matches at least with two or three tiles you are placed on. After each round Darwinci eleminates one of the least hidden players. Get through the four rounds to win the game.

Have fun and post your comments!

entries.title: Combine And Conquer
entries.description:
In this game, your aim is to survive through five rounds of natural selection. If you play your cards right, you might even wind up as a kitten! But odds are you wont.

Before each round, you are given two evolutionary paths to follow. The result will be a new hybrid animal that you will play as in the next round of combat where you will play five of your evolutionary rivals. Once you kill them all, you get to make another evolutionary selection.

CONTROLS

Movement: WASD (Note that what these keys does exactly depends on what you are but they will always move you in the direction you would expect. For example, if you have wings, W may make you fly whilst if you don't it may only be jump etc.)
Attack: Space (always attacks directly in front of you)
Move to next screen: Enter

Well that's about it for the moment. It's been a great LD and I look forwards to playing all your games! I hope you enjoy mine :).

entries.title: Death Hockey
entries.description:
Evolution is about survival of the fittest... in this game it is your duty to sort out the slow ones which can't doge a circular saw. Enjoy a nice game of Death hockey, only instead of usual air hockey puck, you have a circular saw - oh yes, and there is a janitor, which cleans up...

CONTROLS: Just drag the blue hockey blob around and hit the saw-puck

OBJECTIVE: Kill as many "slow" creatures as possible. Each gives you a point. Crack your old high score... And listen to the janitor - he has important things to say...

entries.title: Evolwar
entries.description:
The idea was advance wars with dinosaurs. It's round based and the units are able to "evolve".

Controls:
Arrow Keys: move the selection
x: select unit/walk to
c: abort
v: next unit
return: end turn

Follow the signs on the screen.

entries.title: ExoSlime
entries.description:
-- If you are on Linux you can play the LOVE file by installing: https://love2d.org/

Press ESC to to skip the intro. (It quits the game on any other screen)

Kill some slimes in this jam packed action adventure game.

Wield your trusty spear and impale hordes of enemies as you explore the castle depths in search of what lives below and how exactly this game has anything to do with the theme.

Cool game-play including:
* 9 rad levels
* 5 monster types with unique artificial intelligence
* Epic boss battle
* 2 musical tracks
* 8bit sound effects

Move with arrow keys, press x to attack.

All game assets have been created by me. This was supposed to be a comp entry but I lost a handful of hours to a wedding on Saturday. Enjoy!

entries.title: GenFight
entries.description:
programming: staxx6
design: kinxz

Yeah it looks more like a element theme but the origin idea was a game where you "create" your own monster with different type attacks and it evolves to the element. But the time says no and it was the first entry, so... :P. 

Warning: Far far away from finish! ;)

Types: 
Fire - Figlu - red
Water - Washi - blue
Nature - Nabis - green
Normal - Nomau - -
Special - Spmew - white

Bonus damage against other types:

Fire -1.5x-> Nature -1.5x-> Water -1.5x-> Fire
Water -0.5x-> Nature -0.5x-> Fire -0.5x-> Water

Elements -1.0x-> Normal -1.0x-> Elements
Special -1.25x-> All -0.75%-> Special

Fixed annoying lose/ win screen and added mac osx.

entries.title: Human Evolution
entries.description:
This game was created at the real life gathering in Germany / Darmstadt. Everything was made from scratch, no engines or frameworks were used.

Controls:
W A S D to move
arrow keys to shoot
Enter Key to Confirm

Note:
If you have any performance issues with the JAR-File Version, please try the Web version without audio.

Thanks for playing :D

entries.title: Kittens vs Evolution
entries.description: 2012, the world wide web is dominated by the kittens. All ? No, a little website called Ludum Dare still resist. In order to make it fall, the Kitten empire send it best warriors to take care of it newly democratically elected theme : Evolution

entries.title: Martha Z.
entries.description:
This is my very first submission to Ludum Dare!
I have absolutely zero programming skills, so I used Multimedia Fusion 2.

This game makes you play a few moments in the life of Martha Z.

SPOILER WARNING
As the game begins, Martha has been bitten by a zombie, though she isn't really aware of it. The virus is slowly changing her. Some actions accelerate the evolution, others slow it. In the meantime, she has to manage her feelings after a painful breakup with her ex-boyfriend Joe.
How is this going to end?
END OF SPOILER

I hope you'll be able to enjoy it (and understand it!) in spite of the lack of finition.

I didn't have time to write some blog entries, sorry about that!
Thanks for visiting.

entries.title: MiniEvolution
entries.description: Evolving the green pixels, and destroy reds. Description mutagens you can see here: http://amsmirnov.ru/ld24/legend/legend.html

entries.title: My Pet Monster
entries.description:
A game about a pet monster. It happens to lack an ending, so when your monster is bright green you can assume the game is over!


I was unfortunately unable to get the game finished for the compo, but managed to get something close to a finished game in time for the jam. I kept within the compo rules though, working solo and making everything from scratch-- I just needed the extra day.


If you're on linux and having issues running the game you can try your luck with the post-jam updated version which doesn't require libsoil. Gameplay wise this version is identical to the jam-version, with the exception of containing music (turn off the music on the escape menu if you want to give me a rating based on this version):

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/36451301/my_pet_monster_linux_1b.tar.gz


Controls are as followed:

Jump: 'c' or Space
Attack: 'x' or 'v'
Action: Up


Written in ANSI C, using SDL (http://www.libsdl.org/) and SOIL (http://www.lonesock.net/soil.html).

entries.title: One Last Chance
entries.description:
------------------------------------------------------------
EDIT - The .apk works best on Tablets, or on 
phones running ICS or higher.  Mostly it's 
a matter of screen size, but 
also of performance.
------------------------------------------------------------

From the Recursive Frog team ::

What if one day a mysterious person sent you an app on your smartphone that lets you peer into the past, and put right what went wrong?  Your relationship with your girlfriend has devolved significantly over time.  Would it be possible to evolve it into something better?

:NOTE: Once you see the "Force Close" screen after visiting the past, it means the scenario is complete.

FOR MAXIMUM EFFECT, download the .apk and play as a person using a smartphone while you, yourself, are using a tablet such as the Nexus 7.  STAND UP AND TURN YOURSELF AROUND to look around the scene, just like the character in the game is doing.

For the time being, the apk is hosted on my own site.
 I'll push it to Google Play once I can convince Unity to sign with my keystore.  

The game is short, not complete, but open-ended and a huge mind trip.  Play around as much as you want.

entries.title: Orbitary
entries.description:
1This my first entry in the Ludum Dare Competition. 
Use the mouse to move, collect green cells and avoid red cells. 
If the web version is laggy, download the jar file. 

Changelog:
[1.0]

[1.0.1]

entries.title: OS: Evolution
entries.description:
Seems to work best in Chrome, but tested in both Firefox and IE.  People using a trackpad may run into some issues.

***When playing, the position (angle) of your mouse is important (though not at the start)***

OS:Evolution is a platform game with a few physics twists.  The goal is to reach the top floor and shut down the OS.

WASD or Arrow Keys to Move.
Mouse to fire (when the time comes)
R to reset the level.

I most likely made a beginners mistake of making it too hard.  I'd love to hear how far you got :)

I wasn't quite sure what to make of this theme.  I started with an idea and quickly realized it would be impossible to accomplish within 48 hours, so I simplified it (unfortunately losing much of the "Evolution" aspects) and this is what I ended up with.  Of course there are things I wish I'd done differently, and things I wish I had time to add/fix, but I imagine that's just part of the competition.  This is my first time participating in a LD, and I'm happy to have finished.

entries.title: Planets
entries.description:
Hi there,
This is my first time in this contest. Learned a lot of things, made a few mistakes also.
This game is about planets : your goal is to make them evolve into livable worlds by throwing asteroids at them.
It's played with arrows and space button (instructions in game). Planets score points when they reach outer limits.
Enjoy !

entries.title: Rubicon's LD24 Age of Defense game
entries.description:
Hello everyone! I am Rubicon and I thought that I would try Ludum Dare 24! I am really new to making games and do not know that much. But while I was trying to make a game I learned a lot so I am not walking away empty handed.... I still have a lot to learn though.. and the game is not an executable or anything it is just the Eclipse code files. There are things in the code that i could not figure out. But I thought that since I put in the work, I might as well share what I have accomplished :) I hope that I can participate in the next Ludum Dare and actually get a complete game out for you all to enjoy. I will continue to try and learn! Thanks for stopping by!

**Edit** Thanks to Cthulhu I fixed the enemies not following the path after level 3 and Towers can not be placed on the path now. Also there is a Game.jar file in the file that will run the game. Thanks Cthulhu!!

~Rubicon

entries.title: Survival of Polyminos
entries.description:
ARROW KEYS - Move
Z,X - Rotate
I'm sorry I didn't support other keyboard layouts :(

I uploaded the source late.
No hard drop. Sorry!

Just like the falling block game.
The pieces evolve based on your actions.
Sorry for any English-language-related mistakes!

Explanations of inner things (to add value to the game :D )...


//----------------------------------------
//How They Evolve
//----------------------------------------

The area on the right contains the current population of polyminoes.
The starting population is composed of monominoes.
Polyminoes breed and reproduce in that area.
You get your pieces from this pool.

Pieces that were played well (by you) will have lower chances of reproducing, while bad pieces will be returned to the pool to reproduce more. See for yourself!

This means the pieces will eventually become harder to play and easy (weak) pieces will eventually be extinct.
This also means that pieces that you find hard to play will keep bothering you until you lose.

The fittest (baddest) species will soon dominate the population.

"Natural" selection by you + crossover + mutation -> Interactive Evolution!

I didn't implement mutation.


//----------------------------------------
// How They Breed
//----------------------------------------

Each polymino is represented by a tree data structure, with four children for each node.
The two parent trees are combined by swapping branches.

Example: T-tetramino + S-tetramino
R - root node
O - nodes
_ - empty

T-tetramino:

_O_
ORO

[Root]
. |_[Up]
. |_[Left]
. |_[Right]

S-tetramino:

_RO
OO_

[Root]
. |_[Right]
. |_[Down]
. . |_[Left]

Child:
The base tree was from T-tetramino. The Left node was swapped for S-tetramino's Down node.

_O_
_RO
OO_

[Root]
. |_[Up]
. |_[Down]
. | . |_[Left]
. |_[Right]


References:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_algorithm
http://www.obitko.com/tutorials/genetic-algorithms/crossover-mutation.php

Notes for post-compo(?):
- Hard drop
- Piece land pause
- Rotate before land pause
- Slide before land pause
- Line clear pause
- Bug: rotation collision
- Speed up evolution
- Prevent too much complex pieces
- Game is too punishing
- Phylogenetic(?)/evolutionary tree of all evolved species at game end
- Choose starting pieces
- Evolution is not too obvious

(You can't make those snakes in the game)

entries.title: The World Tree
entries.description:
The World Tree is a platforming adventure in a mystical setting.  You, as the spirit of unevolved lands, must face dangers of Deconstruction as you collect the six artifacts required to evolve the World Tree in to its true state as the focus of all evolution!

There's a Windows executable available that should work as is.  OSX/Linux should work in theory, but you do need python 2.7 and pyglet 1.1.4 to run it.  I haven't been able to test it.  Sorry about this.

This game is created with python 2.7 + pyglet 1.1.4, using OpenGL.
Audio tools/instruments used were sfxr by DrPetter and Massive from Native Instruments, Renoise and Audacity.

www.python.org
www.pyglet.org
drpetter.se
native-instruments.com
renoise.com
audacity.sourceforge.net

I had a lot of fun making this game and felt that everything went fairly smooth!  It's my most complete Ludum Dare to date for sure!

It's not absolutely spotless though, there are lots of things that could be improved.  The code is very, very messy with gigantic classes, the rendering is done via immediate mode quite inefficiently, collisions do occasionally glitch. lack of content and so on.  Consider it a prototype.

As a sort of weird little quirk, all graphics are generated in code.  I just didn't want to draw.  So there.

I hope to maybe be able to clean this one up a bit and add some content - it is on very short side as I didn't bother to create a level editor and writing levels into lists is a pain :p  Hopefully it at least provides a feel of what it could be.

Again, there might be an issue with performance.  I've only been able to test it on one system.  Let me know.

Anyways, have fun and thanks!

entries.title: The Wrong Kind of Evolution
entries.description:
A long time ago some primates went underground and evolved in a different way to normal humans, in the present day they come out at night.

To play extract the zip and run the LudumDare24.jar.
It doesn't work if you don't extract it.
This is my first LD, sorry im not good with the art.
If you have trouble running the game comment and I'l see what I can do.
I cant test the linux version as I don't have linux at the mo so sorry if it doesn't work.

Me and some friends are starting a gamedev business, if you are interested or you like this game follow on twitter:
https://twitter.com/M4tt53
https://twitter.com/Giant_Jelly

entries.title: TRANS
entries.description:
Hello,
This is my first entry to a Ludum Dare and, if it's a very modest contribution, I am proud to present my project: Trans.
Trans is a very short incursion in interactive narration with a (very light) gameplay. The story is quite fuzzy, something about transgender, transsexuality and transhumanism. Something about the evolution that we, as a species, are performing every day.

TO PLAY: Use the arrows to translate the text that is moving in order to collide with other texts. 

To do this project I use, as a beginner, Unity 3D and Garage Band.

Thank you for playing :)

entries.title: Trinity Labs
entries.description:
A game of evolutionary match 3. With a laboratory feel.

Simple ruleset, a limited number of things to build and a single objective per level... only, there are some intentionally fuzzy edges and all is not quite as you'd expect it in any other puzzle game.

See if you can find out what evolves at the end of level 5... and if you can keep things in order until you get there.

An experiment in rapid pipelining and physical puzzle mechanics by Gareth Jenkins -- garethjenkins.com

entries.title: Ulovetion
entries.description:
You are the last survivor of your species. 
Will you solve the mystery of the Lovis and the elemental gates of evolution ?

CONTROLS: arrow keys.

---
Quiet a simple game for this first entry, even if the starting idea was more ambitious. I miss the audio even if it's ok without it.
This first LD was really instructive. Hope to be more efficient next time.

---
POST COMPO VERSION

In this version, main bugs were fixed, music and SFX were added, and the gameplay was clarified. 
I try to fix what I wasn't able to finish during compo and I used comments I received to improve a bit the game.

Now the faces of the lovis give you information on the validity of the gate in the combination. It becomes some kind of master mind. You can now move at any time, a lot of strange events due to speed incoherence have been fixed.

Since there is sound, you can activate/deactivate it with the "m" key, and WASD control are now available

entries.title: Unlikely Companion
entries.description:
First LD! Woo!
Controls are WASD and mouse.
Game has 7 levels.
Enemies and your companion evolve throughout the game.
Credits (for libraries, software, etc) are available when you complete all 7 levels.
Mostof the music's pretty good, but art mostly resembles "programmer's art" ;P
If I ever update this, I'd like to give it some actually good graphics and online multiplayer :P
Feel free to use any of the elements of this in your own projects, just give credit if possible. But don't worry if you forget who made it, I'm not gonna track you down x3
As per the competition rules, all sprites, music and code were made by me in the 48 hours, aside from public libraries.
Porting to OSX failed (WineBottler seemed to disagree with mouse input). Sorry!
Source includes all GMRES, MCSZ etc files used as well as the GMK. If you use the source's debug mode, it'll automatically unlock all levels and will display some lines and circles around weapons that I used to calculate direction.
Story could do with a little improvement but for 48 hours it's okay.
Saving is minimal, I was kinda in a rush so I used GM's default saving rather than writing my own, which I usually do in bigger projects.
Anyway, have fun playing Unlikely Companion, and tell me what you think.

entries.title: Volver
entries.description:
Volver is an advanced aircraft capable of mutating its weapons to imitate enemy technology. Destroy your enemies and use their firepower against them!

Arrows and Z

(reload page to restart)


Notes:
This is my first foray into web programming. I only tested it under Chrome and it seems to fail to run properly under some versions of Firefox and IE.

entries.title: Ancient Ruins

entries.title: Adventures of Charles
entries.description: I've only included a python and Pygame installer for Windows. You can run the game if you install python 2.7 and Pygame 1.9.1 for supported operating systems.

entries.title: Ase Evoluutio: Enjoy or Die
entries.description:
Besides the awfully thought-out title, I'm proud of this game. The graphics are near non-existant, but it's not about that. It's about how fun the game is (and maybe how quick you push that MUTE button).
Your weapon evolves depending on how you use it (unfortunately with 29 weapons they're not all bug-free and some may just flat out suck). Hit F1 in game to view the instructions and notes. Oh, and there are more enemies as you level.
That's it! Have fun and enjoy my game! (Or die)

entries.title: Concealing the truth
entries.description:
Finally I decided to join LD today with only 5 hours to do something.
I regret not having motivated to engage before, it was great to paint the "creatures".
I hope you enjoy the game as much as I have done programming it.

CONTROLS:
A/D move left, right.
SPACE kick.

GAME: You are against evolution, send the creatures back to the primordial sea!

pd: This game plobably have the ugliest cats ever!

entries.title: Darwin's Booby Snatch
entries.description:
Controls should be obvious (although irritating). You have to mouse click (or poke) at a location to move there. Lay down traps to lure birds into them then collect them once they're caught. Don't scare the birds off!

If anyone is interested the map is roughly meant to be the Galapagos islands. Well, parts of them anyway. To save time I reduced the bird images to three with hue shifts. Originally I wanted 12 that were all based on birds found on the Galapagos islands. There are a lot of other things I wanted to include. A lot! Honestly, I don't know what I was thinking.

entries.title: Detective Darwin
entries.description:
Detective Darwin is a private investigator, a single human stranded on a planet full of blobby aliens with sophisticated cycle of evolution.

Followed by his alien assistant, Mendel, and using his amazing skill of relation deducing, he solves various cases in order to fix broken families.

There are 5 cases to solve, aliens are randomly generated.

The core idea: aliens have certain properties (leg count, eye count, colors...), there are specific rules of inheritance for each of these properties. Your task, as a detective, is to find a certain alien within a given group, using these rules. It might be a long-lost children,  elderly parents or step-brother.

CONTROLS:
  Mouse only.
  Click to skip dialogs.
  Punch - be pushy, make them spit it out
  Pet - be gentle, listen to their heart
  Point (in selection mode) - select alien(s)

entries.title: Epocalypse
entries.description:
You can hide in your house at night.
Point your mouse over the Evolute Button (E) to see how much resources and coins you need to evolute.

CONTROL:
Movement: W,A,S,D
Shoot: Left Mouse Button
Punch: Right Mouse Button
Run: Shift
Evolute: Click the E button on the bottom right

Update: There is now a stable Mac built for all you Mac users.

entries.title: Eve
entries.description:
Eve is a game/simulator where you create a species. 
Try experimenting with different setting and see how your species evolve.

When the action timer finishes a loop the lifeforms will try to make an action. If they are next to another lifeform they will either try to fight, mate or do nothing. This depends on they preferences, which can be seen by holding the mouse over a lifeform. The preferences change when the lifeforms succeed in fighting or mating or by changing the preferences of the simulation in the create world screen.

Programming: Flixel
Music: Acoustic guitar
Boost: Pizzas,beers and coffee

entries.title: EvoDragon
entries.description:
Darwing is a space dragon alien thingy and his egg has crash landed on a planet full of evil boars. Help Darwing evolve by slapping Omniboars so he may escape. 

Instructions:
-Slap the displayed number of Omniboars to evolve.

Issues:
-Play full screen for best performance.
-The game may lag or not load in chrome.
-Player death is wonky, just let it do its thing and it will return you to the main menu.

entries.title: Evolution
entries.description:
=== STORY ===
Evolution looks cool but things can go wrong.
You have to stop the evolution of a new life form !

Why ?  Because one day they will steal our ideas and violate our patents. 

Thoses life form are agile, unpredictable and they can divide themself or even revive from a dead body.

Burn that sh*t as quick as you can !

--end transmission

entries.title: Evolution Game by GBGames
entries.description:
While it doesn't have all of the features I wanted (multiple enemies with different weapon types, for instance), it should at least feel quite complete and self-explanatory. 

The enemies get stronger as you go. While it is not how I originally intended, it's the evolution part of the game.

entries.title: Fall Of The Ark

Description: 

In a post apocalyptic future where one man rules all...

MOUSE to Shoot

The story of the game is in the instructions :3

PS : Sorry for my bad english, shame on me.

entries.title: Icarus: the Evolution of Flight
entries.description:
A sidescroller about the ambition of man and the history of flight.

---

Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth - 
Put out my hand, and touched the face of God.

---

Credits

Sarah Baradhi - Score & Sound Design
Yi Fu - Aircraft Component Art
Stephen Griffiths - Programming
Kircy Jong - Background Art & UX
Harry Lee - Design & Production
Jarrel Seah - Lead Programming
Katie Williams - Additional Writing

Sound effects from the wonderful Stephan Schutze's Sound Librarian used with permission. http://www.stephanschutze.com

Icarus was developed in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 24 Jam. Congratulations to Kircy, Sarah, Stephen, and Yi for completing their very first game jam!

---

IMPORTANT NOTE:

Unfortunately we haven't been able to upload our game yet due to internet woes and sleep deprivation. We beg for your forgiveness, and we promise that the game will be available to play as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience and understanding; this is really frustrating to us as developers. Congratulations to everyone who participated in Ludum Dare!

Regards, 

Wanderlands

entries.title: Move forward
entries.description:
Firstborn is looking into way to evolve. Sadly "it" is for supprise.

Controls: 
WSAD to move
Mouse to move and atack things 

HIT Windows or WEB JAVA for best graphics. Flash one don't have water :P

entries.description:
Made in processing.

Aim:
Control the evolution of The Pink so it neither dies nor swarms everything.

entries.title: Refuse Annihilator
entries.description:
You are piloting a remote controlled spacecraft. Your job would have been to shoot bad guys. But what if all the bad guys have already been shot and there's only debris left?

Well, shoot the debris. At least your spacecraft is evolving.

You have 6 spacecraft. After you managed to wreck them all (or drowned Earth in a pile of junk by not shooting enough of it) you get 6 completely new shiny spacecraft. Each time this happens they will be slightly better tailored to your piloting skills.

You get points for destroying stuff, your accuracy in doing so, and your survival time. Try to score as much points as possible. First one with more than a million gets a beer ;)

The game is completely written in JavaScript, using Craftyjs. The graphics were made in Pixen and Pixelmator. For sound I used Bfxr, Propellerhead Fusion and Garageband.

You'll want to run the game in Chrome, or else terrible things might happen.
Sound sucks across all browsers (but less in Chrome).

Known Bugs:
- Music hiccup in Chrome
- No sound at all in Firefox

entries.title: Super Devolution Man
entries.description:
Created in LOVE Game Engine (http://love2d.org/).

There's only one level.

To play the game you can download binaries for your platform or the Source/Universal file. The Universal file can be opened if you have LOVE installed on your computer. Also the .love file can be unzipped to have a look at all source code and data.

entries.title: ROVOLUTION
entries.description:
UPDATE:

You Must have the latest version of java runtime to play this

I updated some native libraries, some people were saying it wasn't playing so I made sure that it had the latest nightly builds of the LWJGL's for each OS.

Should work on Mac Win and Linux....let me know in the comments.

I used Slick2d as well as paint / GIMP and sfxr.
I spend a lot of time on the game engine so there's not a lot of game play, So I'm releasing this as a demo and will continue to work on it after the LD.

This is my first LD ever and it was fun.

Source is included in the folder src

To run, click the LudumDare24.jar, if there is any problems running it, let me know.

The level Ends with you obtaining legs, I never had time to make more levels.

Also you can recharge your battery for a score penalty.

As well as this being my First Ludum Dare this is my first actual proper attempt at making a game (I've always programmed apps)

All your constructive feedback is appreciated

entries.title: viviDNA
entries.description:
A mad scientist has put you, the rainbow virus, into a cage in outer space to test your adaptability. Survive as long as you can by outleveling your enemies to you can to show him that you are the master of evolution.

Created with flixel, FlashDevelop, and Gimp. Bfxr and freesounds.org for sfx.

Arrow keys to move. 
Escape to escape to menu.
0 to mute, + / - to adjust volume

entries.title: Wroms'Evolution
entries.description:
Click mouse left button to increase speed for seconds
(Red Bead x 3 needed)

Click mouse right button to release a fire ball
(Yellow Bead x 3 needed)

Blue Bead can increase beads drop from sky
(blue to max)

Green Bead can change stone beads to other beads
(green to max)

Stone Bead can decrease the worm speed for seconds

White Bead can increase the worm body length

Once the worm body length to the max,the worm will get a evolution 

2P using Arrow Key to control worm and Number Key 1\2 to speed
 up or release fire ball

Higher level worms can eat lower level worms

Ate all enemy to win this game

entries.title: 8-Bit Big Bang (that was the origonal name, I never changed it, it was 8-bit)
entries.description:
for win 7 or vista users try use this: http://wiki.yoyogames.com/images/7/77/GM_Convert_Game.zip 

otherwise the game will not run.

There is a bug that sometimes when you kill another lifeform and your about to evolve (say you have 8 total ponts) you will skip an evolution and never be able to evolve again, or win :/ so sorry. you evolve every 10 points, if you pass a factor of 10 total point (the gray box) and do not evolve the bug happened and you will need to start over.

To evolve you must drain the power from bits of space dust that are floating around the world. there are four main types and three hybrids.
light Blue - speed
Red - attack
Green - health
violet - Absorption (increases power draining speed)
yellow - Red+Green
Deep Blue - Violet+light Blue
White - All
Objects:
there are several objects in the world.
Voids - small purple lights that glow brighter as they drain power from anything touching them. they sometimes form Black Holes.
Black Hole - a deadly void that pulls in nearmy objects and destroys them.
Energy Stars - white spinning stars that give energy to things that touch them.
Genetic Nebula - a rare golden formation that creates life.
magnetic field - an invisible force that holds particle in place.
Particle Spring - a rare formation that makes Deep Blue and White Particles.
Shooting star (white) - commonly seen flying around they make white particle when they spawn, and more when they leave the screen.
Shooting star (Gold) - rarer than white shooting stars they trail yellow particles.
Crystal Shard - Red shards of crystal that fly around and break into red particles when they collide with the player or it's attack.
Life forms:
Shell - Well armored life form that runs when attacked and leaves behind exploding energy balls.
Hunter - a faster lifeform that chases other life and tries to kill it by shooting energy beams at it.

if you win post your Years to evolve on here.
good luck! :)

entries.title: A League for Fishes
entries.description:
The Readme:

A League for fishes!

Controls in water (when you got no legs)
WADS or Arrow Keys = movement

Controls on land (when you got legs!)
WADS or Arrow Keys = movement
Spacebar or Number Pad 0 = attack

When on land you can eat the bright red enemies.


Multiplayer:

Player 1:
WASD and Spacebar

Player 2:
Arrow Keys and Number Pad 0

In multiplayer you win by eating your opponet. You need to get 25 food for evole, which enebles the ability to eat!

entries.title: Cellvolution
entries.description:
So, here's our first "game" (ever)...
It doesn't really have fun gameplay or anything like that, but we learned a lot by making this and had fun (and lots of frustration as well)! Since we put a lot of effort into it, we will definitely continue working on the game and making it more fun after the compo!

The basic idea:
You start as a single cell, your goal is finding more cells to start the evolution. We don't want to tell you the rest of the story (that will be added later), since it would spoil some upcoming gameplay features :P

As we said, there's no real sense in playing this, besides the AWESOME music and the BEAUTIFUL parallax-scrolling ;)

We hope to see you again at the next Ludum Dare!

"Have fun!" ;)



~MrOtton & reklrekl

entries.title: Chromosomatrix
entries.description:
Chromosomatrix is a top-down shooter. Kill the baddies and collect their gene codes so you can evolve yourself. Each gene in your chromosomatrix increases your power, speed, defense or recovery. Evolved genes has its power multiplied. You can evolve by making rows or columns of the same gene codes.

WASD to move, mouse to shoot

CONTROLS - Arrow keys and Z but they're configurable from the main menu.

KNOWN ISSUES - This is the first time I've put anything together with javascript. There's no doubt some compatability issues or suchlike so any help in identifying and knobbling them is appreciated.

AUDIO - It would appear javascript is rubbish with sound so I guess you better cue up some mp3s while you battle for evolutionary supremacy. Ah well.

entries.title: Negemon
entries.description:
This game was created from scratch over the past 24 hours (late start!) so I apologize for the short length of the game.

On the theme of evolution, I obviously wanted to create a game based off of some game that I've never played before that I understand to be chock-full of evolving creatures. I chose the title Negemon because Negentropicmon wouldn't as a logo.

I hope you enjoy it!

I neglected to mention the frameworks and tools I used!

Tools: FlashDevelop, Photoshop, MilkyTracker, FLStudio, Magical 8bit Plugin, and Bfxr.

entries.title: Octo-Darwin Vs Bat-Monkey
entries.description:
Darwin has created an experimental evolution ray, which rapidly evolves life! But something's gone horribly wrong... The evolution ray mutates life into horrific winged tentacle beings!

Bat-Monkey has escaped from Darwin's evil lair and stolen the evolution gun! Help Bat-Monkey escape by shooting the glowing objects (bananas, mud puddles and horses) to rapidly evolve them and slow Darwin down!

It's a pretty hard game, but games these days are far to easy we say! It's good to have some good old fashioned difficulty every now and again.

Try to beat the developer high scores on our online score board!

CONTROLS

Space to Jump
Mouse to aim and fire

INSTRUCTIONS

Extract and double click launch in the octodarwin folder
(You must have the latest version of Java installed)

CREDITS

Aaron Gordon
Oliver Knott
Alistair Lynn
Jeremy Morse
Sam Phippen

(Known Bug - Doesn't launch in administrator mode)

Please rate and post your feedback in the comments, and we'll play and rate your game in return!

entries.title: Plinko Breeder
entries.description:
Hey guys - I wasn't really able to participate much during the jam, so please play and LEAVE COMMENTS on the post-compo version but feel free to rate the game all 1's or N/A's. There is not much point in playing the Jam release as it's way incomplete. The post-compo is a complete game.

In Plinko Breeder, if your Plinko chip can't reach the goal, you have to employ selective breeding to obtain a chip that can. Some levels may even take a few generations.

Beating the game will require breeding multiple generations and a bit of cleverness. Are you up for it? :)

This latest post-compo version tries to incorporate all of the feedback recieved so far and has been completely revamped to (hopefully) not require any instruction. PLEASE post comments, though!

If the game is too easy, try disabling natural selection under "Advanced Breeding." Much respect to the breeders who "get it" and can disable stats. ;)


Features:
Evolution! Gene pool will gradually improve to achieve the best shape and size for each level. (can be disabled)
"Realistic" simulation of genetic lineage.
Genes can be recessive or dominant.
Nuclear-Mood-Light
One Easter egg :)

PLEASE post comments and thanks for playing!! :3

entries.title: Praegressus Bellum (Evolution War)
entries.description:
PREREQUISITES-
-Python 2.7 and it's respective stable Pygame release must be installed.


Hello hello helllloooooo developers, this is my first Ludum Dare. Also, my first heart attack. You see, I was in the middle of the development of a clever, smart, smooth comedy puzzle. However, like all good things that happen to me, I encountered a problem with it and therefore gave up on it and tucked it away in a dark corner where I was sure to never see it again. Meaning, my "Open This Folder When I get a Girlfriend" folder.

Anyway, second of all, the INSTRUCTIONS and DEDICATED TO NEIL ARMSTRONG text files are blank. That is because I realized I forgot to fill them out after I had already compressed, uploaded, and shared my game link, and am too much of a lazy bum to update it. So I will just write those here.
SUMMARY-
-This is a local multiplayer game where the 2 players control a blue single-celled organism, and a red single-celled organism. The objective of the game is to collect 10 black cells, which will randomly appear at random locations on the screen. The first organism to collect 10 cells will evolve straight to the age of Space Flight. My innovative Indie game element is that if the 2 cells touch each other (bow chicka bow wow), they BOTH will lose ALL their cells. By "touch each other" I mean fully overlap one another- one organism can go halfway through another, for example. This gives a nice twist to the gameplay where one has to avoid the other player while trying to race them to the same spot. This can lead to some very Scooby-Doo chase scenes.
-To move, the players mash their WASD or arrow buttons, depending on the player. The faster they mash the buttons, the faster they will go and the more they will complain and not play this game anymore.
-An announcer, who I like to call "Very Low Budget Crappy GLaDOS", will announce things at specific points of the match.
-Though there is no distinct Multiplayer or Singleplayer mode, if you have no one else to play with, try to keep the balls as close together as possible and to follow the black ball. Make sure that the balls are touching(without one fully overlapping the other so your score doesn't get reset), while still maintaining a speed to follow the black ball with. If the organisms overlap or disconnect, you lose.  Ambidextrous players will have quite the advantage.
INSTRUCTIONS-
Player One(Blue/Smurf)-
W-Up
A-Left
S-Down
D-Right
Player Two(Red/Commie)-
Well, the arrow keys.. You know.



Lastly, I would like to dedicate this game to Neil Armstrong. I find it tragic that the theme was Evolution, and man who helped in the evolution of science and technology so much as Neil Armstrong passed away. Rest in peace. You were the very first to leave this world, and you do it now once again. Safe travels, Commander.

I wanted actual evolution to happen and specifically specisation. The latter didn't come out in the wash but it's not terrible and certainly has evolution in it.

Everyone said to use a framework. So I didn't. I didn't run out of time so much as burn out. I'll probably come back to this and add a couple more levels later. It needs tidying but I hate tidying!

entries.title: Untitled Tower Game
entries.description:
A tower climbing action game. 

Initially, I had a bare-bones description here that deferred to the readme, but now that I have the time I will write a bit about the game. The game's "gimmick" (and the connection to the theme) is that the control scheme gets significantly more complex as you get further and players have to adapt to the new controls. This gimmick doesn't really show itself until maybe stage 8 or 10 or so, and the stages are rather difficult due to hastily done level design, so for most people it will just seem like a generic platformer that has nothing to do with the theme. And even for players who got to the later stages, the connection to the theme probably wouldn't have been obvious without this explanation. So I expect low marks for "Theme", but I had fun making the game.

About the two download links: I noticed a stupid bug right after the submission deadline passed, so I fixed it. The bug was easy to fix but fairly serious (the "infinite" lives on some difficulty settings were not actually infinite) so I think it's okay to rate the late version. However, the original version that was submitted before the deadline is still available by clicking the "on-time" link just in case.

entries.title: Worm
entries.description:
Worm
by Imosa

Warning: I may be using some terminology incorrectly. Please don't crucify me for that, or do and explain my error. 
The idea for this game was that you have these "worms" in a sort of tunnel system (looks more like a tree in the current version), who move at intersections based on their DNA. The yellow dots are energy (or something). Every new generation, is birthed from the last, favoring the DNA of those worms that collect the most energy (see that? Natural selection. I know these words). 
The players job was going to be to introduce the 3 mutations into the DNA, thus keeping the population diverse and guiding it to greater sources of energy. 
Although the point system is never touched in game, I'll explain the intention. Points would be awarded for the success of your population; however, less points would be awarded the longer the game went on. The player could spend points in order to mutate his population. The goal is to get as many points as possible, by making strategic mutations to the population. 

Buttons:
Generate!: Interbreeds the current population to create a new population.
Delete: nothing
Invert: nothing
Duplicate: nothing

The two little squares around the map are anchors to scale the map.

Keys
W/S: Increases/Decreases the number of genes in the DNA 
D/A: Increases/Decreases the number of worms
Q: Randomizes the population's DNA
E: Creates a new map
X/Z: Control the highlighted worm. 

P.S. The .sh file isn't set up to be an executable, sorry.

entries.title: Advancer
entries.description:
The concept of the game is to evolve the game itself. The games complexity, the graphics, and your abilities improve as it evolves.

~Controls~

Left/Right Arrows - Move
Up Arrow - Enter doors
X - Jump

entries.title: Ascension Garden
entries.description:
Here's a game about building a spiritual garden. Enjoy!

WARNING: AUDIO IS VERY LOUD
I accidentally had my speakers too low when I was making the sounds and didn't realize just how loud the audio was until too late.

Input:
  Mouse - Use tools, select flowers
  Space - Harvest energy, breed flowers
  R - Restart Game

Dig holes and plant seeds in them to begin creating a plant. Once a flower has been buried, it must be watered to reach its full maturity. Watering requires energy, which you can get by harvesting kinetic energy from mature flowers (using the shears). Be careful not to over-harvest, or you will kill the plants!

To get more seeds, you must use the cotton swab to mix the pollen of two flowers. Select the swab tool and two flowers and hit space to generate seeds. This also requires energy.

If you don't have enough energy to continue your garden you can press [r] to restart.

Be cautious while moving plants, if they are stressed too much (spinning, immature, recently bred) they may not survive.

entries.title: being a Vampire Is Not Very Fun
entries.description:
It's not an easy life for a vampire these days....

being a Vampire Is Not Very Fun at all. I (a vampire) want to change that, and so i seek to reanimate the corpse of Charles Darwin (rumoured to be a vampire, like me!). 

being a Vampire Is Not Very Fun is a grapple-platformer wherein a lonely young Vampire (ME!) aims to find Darwin's grave by running (WASD to move, and Shift to run), Jumping (Space), Wall Jumping (Space on a wall), and grappling (use the mouse, point and shoot). I can adjust zoom with the mousewheel. In the event that I am stuck, or the screen goes white, I can kill myself with the Escape key, and thereby 'escape' my immortal coil (har, har).

I'll need to be careful if I'm to unlock the secrets of Vampire-kind's evolution!




Just unzip and run 'Vamp-Ire' to get moving. sound is a MUST as this game has no subtitles.

Made in xna game studio. Keyboard and mouse required, nothing graphically fancy. Should run fairly well on just about anything.

NOTE: XNA/.net redistributables required! I will try to sort out an 'installer' version that will download them for you but I  have to go to work now.

Source in zip file on the off chance you actually want to look! Special thanks to Michael Pauley for Jamming with me on this. Check out his submission 'Astronomical Affray' if you get a chance!

entries.title: Darwin's Island
entries.description:
You are the blue microbe. Your goal is to reach the right end of the level.

This ended up being more of a genetic computing demonstration than a game (look in the source code if you are interested).

The 'controller' object takes a set of 16 traits and creates genes by picking random traits and sticking them together.

Enemies can only acquire genes on spawn, not lone traits, so they acquire some interesting combinations.

Natural selection is implemented. Enemies that do damage to the player (or other enemies) get to spawn offspring instantly. If the game needs enemies, it will pick an existing enemy to clone and give a few new genes. Apart from dealing damage, proximity to the player gives an edge.

The three key parameters are:
global.gene_pool_size, which dictates the number of random genes are in play

global.traits_per_gene, which dictates the phenotype to genotype ratio

and genes_per_monster

Genes work in this game by modifying values already there. Genes can have positive or negative effects.

Try experimenting and influencing which ones spawn descendents.

Controls:
Esc - quit
Up - jump
Left - left
Right - right

Enemies:
The red microbes. Yellow-outlined microbes do contact (mucus) damage. Red projectiles will hurt you.

Friendly fire is on, so use your foes' shots and contact damage against them!

***Technical stuff***

Written in Game Maker 6.1

Known bug: random enemies disappear on spawn

Buy upgrades to grow stronger.
But be quick! Your enemies evolve constantly!

Note: I can't get this to work with IE9. It is an issue with this library I'm using to color my flies called Pixastic that on purposely checks if the browser is IE and if it is, it shuts down itself, without considering the version.

entries.title: Future Rabbit
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry!

Controls:

Use A & D to run forward and backwards. Press W to jump up and S to jump down. Collect as many carrots as possible while avoiding collecting turnips. Your evolved ears let you hear different vegtable in the ground. Items that are too deep will be unidentifiable, but if you further evolve your ears you'll be able to hear deeper. Look out for crabs roaming the tunnels - the space bar shoots laser from the rabbit's eyes. Collect Science Carrots to upgrade your features. Access the features upgrade window by pressing Enter/Return.

About:

The game takes place in the future where rabbits have evolved into the dominant species. Almost every graphic is a unique, individual cross-stitch, except for one or two simulated UI pieces.

Development: Eric Decker
Graphics (Cross Stitch): Erin Gregory

entries.title: Genvaders
entries.description:
Your goal is to shoot as many aliens as you can.

After you get rid of one bunch, an evolved bunch of aliens will appear.

The aliens evolve based on how well they hit you and how long they stay alive. You can prevent the aliens from taking too much advantage of it by killing the nastiest ones first and dodging their bullets.

Windows: Completely self-contained zip; no installer; just extract and run.
Linux: Executable python file. Requires pygame.

I'll put the links here in the description too because for some reason they keep disappearing from their regular places:
Windows(py2exe): http://minetest.net/packages/misc/genvaders_win_py2exe_05.zip
Windows(cx_freeze): http://minetest.net/packages/misc/genvaders_win_05.zip

My first entry!  It went ok, but I have done only 50% of what I wanted.  Some real-life stuff complicated my 48h.  And I had a major problem with my Wacom Intuos.  My next LD will be a more "serious" entry.

entries.title: Primordial Guard
entries.description:
Primordial Guard

Your mission:
Watch over your cells and obliterate
mutations that do not evolve towards
ascension.

Instruction:
Move your guard around by clicking in empty space.

Activate your pulse weapon by clicking on a cell.
Use your weapon to remove cells that are genetically
inclined to move away from the "The way to ascension".

Note that once you turn the weapon on, it is always on.

Click on mouse button to start game.
Click on mouse button to start level when it says "Get ready for level:"

Have fun!

Platform: Windows
Requires: Visual Studio 2010 Redistributable package

entries.title: Rift of Time
entries.description:
Rift of Time is a game in which you and another player will take control of a Scientist and an Australopithecus. Your only hope will be to roam the corridors of a gloomy research complex in order to reach the surface.

The Australopithecus' main strength is his powerful voice, so you must have a microphone at your disposal. The Scientist uses traditional controls to trigger various mechanisms, and he'll have to use his head to progress along his companion.

entries.title: Survival of the Fittest
entries.description:
On a manned mission to a distant habitable planet, your ship crash lands and your entire crew dies. Alone in a strange place, you must explore and overcome various environmental challenges. There appear to be several species of intelligent aliens that have evolved to the planet's harsh climate; perhaps you can enlist their aid to survive, and maybe even find a way back home.

I realize this is more of an art demo than an actual game. I wasn't able to spend very much time this weekend working on it, but over the next several weeks I will be working on completing it and adding a lot of features and polish. If you're interested in future progress, you can find more information in the post mortem in my journal. Thanks for looking!

entries.title: The Origin of Faeces
entries.description:
You are an Ape who, upon reading of the Pope's insistence that evolution is "Just a Theory," decides to do something about it.

Unfortunately there are vast parts of this that are unfinished. Some things I'd like to add for the Jam:
 * fix the Hazards system. it was fun
 * fix the (extremely broken) tree swinging
 * add the projectile weapon mentioned in the title.

But it's 5 minutes until the end of submission hour and my (3g) internet only just started 'working' again :|

== Source ==

I'll chuck the source up on github soon - just going to go through and clean out some of the bug-testing cruft and post the link separately.


== Updates ==
28 of August
- added an updated/bugfix version with quite a few little tweaks
   - this is just mostly stuff that irked me, but I'm kind of inspired to spend 24hrs on it just to add the stuff that almost made it in (mostly hazards, the boss and the intro "movie" as I life got in the way of participating in the jam)
- there's a change log on github here: https://github.com/pentaphobe/Origin-of-Faeces/blob/Source-Only/CHANGELOG.md

27/28 of August 
- Added a Mac build (still no windows projector).  This is still the exact same version as the compo and should be used for rating rather than any future bugfixes.

- Added link to the github repo.  Comments are thin on the ground at the moment, but I'll update over the next couple of days (in between playing all these sweet games!)

entries.title: The Voynich Experiment
entries.description:
* 26/04/2014: Unfortunately, the original game made in 48hrs does not work anymore in modern browsers. I only maintained the post-compo version - which has more levels and is compatible with Firefox.

_______________________
THE GAME

The Voynich Experiment is a game that takes place in the scientific manuscripts of a mysterious 1600s scientist. Resolve the puzzles made of cells & science as the truth of evolution is revealed to you...
Tip: finish the game to unlock an additional kitten-themed level!

_______________________
POST-COMPO VERSION

Since I couldn't fit in a lot of the ideas I had for the game, I'm continuing to make new content when I feel like it. Currently the post-compo version has:
* 8 new levels
* 2 new cell types
* A level selection screen
* Some bugs and unclear things fixed
If I eventually find that the gameplay has enough potential, maybe I'll turn this into a real game!

_______________________

Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jhjHe0FHlEg

entries.title: A Simple Evolution
entries.description: A very simple game, consisting of tricking pursuing dots into running into each other or evolving yourself to wiping out huge waves of them. Includes three difficulty settings, as well as a mode where the dots can genetically mutate into combo forms, making it both easier to wipe them out, but easier for them to increase in size as well. The graphics are basic because they don't need to be complex, and includes a decent soundtrack.

entries.title: Darwin Skirmish

This follows the theme of Evolution, because as time goes on, certain traits (such as superior accuracy or speed) become more necessary in certain situations, and this cloning with mutations allows soldiers to fit these given niches as necessary.

entries.title: Mina
entries.description:
An LD#48 Jam Entry 

To play: Extract the zip and run Mina.jar. Requires Java 7

Controls: Arrow Keys - Move, Z - Attack, X - Absorb. 

This is an arcade style survival game. The goal is to stay alive as long as possible.

Tribes of ink soldiers are fighting for control of a piece of paper. Each tribe has genetic traits that dictate its base attack power, defense power, speed, regeneration rate, and upgrade rate. So some tribes are innately better than others. 

You are an ink soldier like any other, with one additional ability. You have the ability to absorb the ink dropped from fallen ink soldiers around you. To do so, be over the corpse of a slain ink soldier and hold X. This ink makes up your gene pool, which is shown as a bar at the bottom of the screen. Each tribe has its own unique color of ink, and your gene pool is comprised of the colors of ink you have absorbed. The dominant color in your gene pool dictates what your genetic traits are, so you can join different tribes by absorbing the ink of their fallen soldiers.

Ink soldiers come in four classes:
Each soldier class can upgrade into the next one by killing enemies or being near
allies killing enemies.
Spear - These are the basic soldiers, and have a thrusting attack.
Sword - Melee soldiers with a cleaving sword slash attack.
Bow - Ranged soldiers that can shoot arrows from a distance.
Cannon - The ultimate soldier. Has a powerful ink cannonball attack.

The only goal of this game is to stay alive for as long as possible. The score is the number of seconds you've stayed alive. New tribes get stronger over time, so you will eventually need to switch tribes in order to be on par with other soldiers. Whenever you manage to switch tribes, you will lose all of your class upgrades, and your absorption power will also become less effective.

Tips:
- Ink soldiers in your current tribe will be striped to make them stand out more.
- Try to observe tribes fighting each other to figure out who the stronger tribes are. 
- Stick with your tribe to stay safe, but be ready to convert into a genetically superior tribe in case your current one becomes overwhelmed! You will want to upgrade into the cannon soldier as quickly as possible to have a fighting chance against stronger tribes. 
- Tribes will roam the map randomly. Try to avoid getting mobbed by really fast enemies.
- The more of your gene pool is comprised of the dominant color, the stronger your attack multiplier will be. Absorbing ink from fallen allies is a safe way to increase your damage.

entries.title: Rings of Evolution
entries.description:
Rings of Evolution, made by Gbell Games

F4 Toggles full-screen mode. All the info to play the game is into the game itself (Enter to start, arrows to move, Z attacks, space jumps. More controls check out the info screen in the game)

You can press enter in the intro to skip it.



The game is quite challenging, but the Easy mode gives you 99 continues. If you just want to check out the whole game, play on easy mode. (The difference between difficulty levels is just how many lives and continues you start with)

It was made inside the 48 hours of the Compo deadline, but we used the extra time for the Jam to test if everything was ok. All content, coding and resources for the game were made in the LD24 weekend.


Gbell Games is a team made of high-school students (and one teacher) from Colegio Graham Bell in Rio de Janeiro, Brasil. It begun as a "after class" project with students learning the basics of game development. This is not only their first attempt at Ludum Dare, but it's also the first attempt of making a game for most of them.

More stuff will come out from this team in the future!

Programming:
Rafael Lima
Caio Barberan

Additional Programming:
Maurucio Falbo
Nathalia Borges

Graphics:
Nathalia Borges
Luiza Fernandes
Luana Fernandes

Additional Graphics:
Lucas Cid
Caio Barberan

Music and Sound Effects:
Gabriel Gomes

Plot and Logistic:
Lucas Cid

Thanks to: Rosangela Gomes, Denise Vilardo, Claudio Lopes, Valeria Graca, Deise Nicacio, Paloma Cosentino, Alan Barreira, Katharine Akyer, Sandra de Lima, Cleber M. de Souza, Hannah Wong, Rachel Cid, Paulo Roberto, Cesar Goncalves, Celso Rocha, Claudia Ximenes, Renato Borges, Wilson Nunes
Potter the Dog :D
and
all staff from Colegio Graham Bell 

NOTE:

The game does have an issue with the Audio... you may hear cracks when the music loops, and when the music is loading an annoying sound may appear for a couple of seconds. This happens in some computers, but it doesn't happen in other computers. This is an issue with how GameMaker handles MP3s. We should had used an external library to handle the music of the game, but as we didn't state it before, it would break the rules, and there were no time to code one from scratch.

We really only noticed that when we begun testing the game in other computers and saw it happening.

It's a real shame, since the music is actually very good IMO, when it's not cracking :/

Porting the code to GameMaker Studio would probably solve the problem, but this would require some changing in the code, which I am not sure would break the rules.

If you want to skip levels, there's a cheat to do it: press enter+end at the same time. You can keep skipping levels up until you see the ending, though you will miss all the bosses of the game, which are all very cool I think :)

entries.title: Stevie Asteroid Rescues the Hovercredits
entries.description:
I made this game using tools I had basically no experience with at all other than going through a few tutorials. My idea here was to take a simple game premise (dodge red things and collect a green thing) and allow the player to see my progress as I kept learning and the game kept evolving.

So what I did was make a level, then make a bunch of improvements to everything (controls, features, drawings), then make another level displaying those improvements. I'm hoping that the effect this creates is interesting to others. I'm most happy with the animations and some of the drawings, because I'm not graphically inclined and this is not something I've really ever done.

Uses XNA and .Net 4.0. I wasn't sure of the best way to package it, but it worked on a few computers so I'm hoping there's no technical problems. I couldn't figure out how to distribute the game without an installer (it just kept crashing, probably some prerequisites thing).

Special note: you can duck under the horizontal bullets in stage 3, I suspect some people might miss that.
